I don't remember the bold guys name but jeeeeeez The worst attitude I got to experience in a restaurant
rudest servers in all of seattle. Dont waste your time. Go to McLeouds in Ballard.
Waited 50 mind for a table in a crowded bar, only to find this was nothong special after all
Great bartending. Too bad the server / door person was an epic ass hole. If you want to see the queen supreme of douchebaggery in seattle this is definitely the place to go.
it's ok, but nothing special
Ottimo ristorante, molto ben arredato. Il personale di sala è stato molto cortese e professionale, ha saputo guidarci magistralmente nella scelta dei piatti. Qui tanta qualità e serietà.
Food and cocktails we're good but the place was just so incredibly hot. It made eating there almost impossible we were sweating so much.

I truly like the topic of their eatery and the food's acceptable as well. They all have this in a sensible value that is an or more point and it is close to my quarters that makes it all well for me. This spot resembles a difference as a primary concern for me.love this café! the environment is great and the food is astonishing! I unquestionably suggest it!
Had a cool vibe. Not a lot of seating, but food was tasty.
Had a turkey leg to-go, I give 2/5. Dry, dry, dry.
Just kind of meh.
it's ok

Small place in Pike Place Mkt. Quite cozy but, a fun atmosphere and a bit loud. Quite a few small twists on BBQ dishes without going too far out of the box. The cornbread in particular was outrageously good! The cocktails were creative and excellent? They were a great selection and text... even for a power drinker. The service was great and suited our tempo. We'll be back.

The whiskeys were unbelievable. The atmosphere was very nice. I am knocking one point off because one of my drinks was served in a cracked snifter glass. It was a very visible. Prices are very reasonable.
Good food love the way they serve the food. server have good patient to listen to the guest
A gem located in the Pikes Place Market!Great ambiance and a large selection of whiskey. The service was incredible too!

Radiator Whiskey, located on the 2nd floor above Pike Place Market and accessed through an elevator, offers a hearty dining experience that earns it a solid 4/5 rating. Despite the crowded seating and full bar area, the ambiance is lively, bordering on loud, making it a bit challenging to hold a conversation. The portions here are generous, catering to those with hearty appetites or groups looking to share.The loaded tater tots is a great, easily shareable appetizer for 3-4 people. The toppings were generous especially the pulled pork. The smoked then fried chicken dish, accompanied by a substantial serving of Mac n cheese, and cornbread, comes with two sizable pieces of chicken and is perfect for those with larger appetites or can be shared by two, especially if paired with an appetizer or side dish.The fried pork shank, while tender, lacked balance. The collared greens were overly salty, highlighting the need for some form of carbs, like bread or potatoes, to counterbalance the dish's fattiness and saltiness. I see in the pictures that this was served with some form of pasta in the past, not sure what changed. We didn't try a drink here but will plan on doing so next time. Solid option for dining near downtown if you account for the noise level and lack of space.
Good food and good drinks. Highly recommended.

I hadn't been here in a while, but wanted to start an anniversary celebration with a couple of great drinks with a whiskey lover. They have an expanded menu of great dinners and appetizers, and we ended up staying and eating too. This place rules. Great selection, aged cocktails and good food? Awesome

Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

Came in for breakfast and was not frustrated. The food they serve is loaded with heavenly flavors and their refreshment was great. Can't fault the waiters as the spot was very occupied yet they gave a valiant effort to serve me quick as I was set out toward a gathering. A debt of gratitude is in order for your administration.

Very nice atmosphere, food is always amazing. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. The servers and Bar make this place worth going for. Great beer selection and a non-pretentious cocktail list. I had a great eating and drinking experience.

This place is straight out of the Hobbit haha. I love the food, love the drinks, love the atmosphere. Kind of hard to find to be honest, but the beef brisket I had made it worth it. We used Instapark around the corner, and it worked great!
Such a gem of a place. Great popcorn while you wait and such a unique menu. Great spot in the market. Would go back and bring friends visiting Seattle!
The music does not go well with the decors. The cocktails were fine but not so much to choose from.

Radiator Whiskey is gut!!! that have amazing pork and good options for big groups. Some of the bigger portions need to be pre-ordered and reservation is recommended. They also have good whiskey flights and a verity of local whiskeys. Great place for a date.

Great selection of bourbon and scotch. Pretty cozy and difficult to get a seat during peak times. But the bartenders are very friendly and very knowledgeable. A great place if you would like to learn about bourbon and scotch.
The staff was friendly and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the excellent cocktails. Though expensive, but worth it.
First time here, excellent food and drinks also the tots are great!! This is a very cozy place with excellent service and a great selection.
Like everyone says....Go for the tots! The beef brisket is to die for. I do love this place & the food, but it can be a bit loud.
The staff were friendly and the food was amazing. I highly recommend the excellent cocktails. Though expensive.

The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well.
Delicious food and drinks. A little hard to find though, but their website has decent directions.

I love this place. The view out the window looking at 1st Ave is super fun, and the cocktails and bourbon selection are fabulous. It can get really busy at times, but it's still worth visiting even when it is.

The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well.

The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well. Very limited seating.
Great food and wonderful staff. Will come againBrenda M
Excellent spots with excellent customer service! Related and inmate setting. A out of the ordinary dining experience but a memory maker meal for sure!
Love this place! :) bacon biscuit was delicious

The food at Radiator Whiskey is amazing! The menu items are original and unlike anything I've seen elsewhere, but everything was super yummy and reminded me a little strange comfort food. I'd never purchase chicken livers, but the fried chicken livers with franks hot sauce were astounding. As was the tater tots with gravy and fried egg, as well as the pork cheek stew with Fritos. (The Fritos actually make the dish). Next time, I'm purchasing the pig face, not only because it seemed tasty, but the left overs came wrapped in a foil swan. Not only is the food great, the staff were wonderful as well as the atmosphere is cosy and laid back.

Amazing new place that just opened right through the hallway from Matt's in the Industry. Adored the barrel aged manhattan and pork cheek stew! Service was prompt and friendly. The chalkboard food menu had many delicious seeming choices that I'll undoubtedly need to attempt later on!

Love the ambience of this place. The food is good-- the drinks are amazing. The only thing that was kind of weird is that we had to stand at a stand up table and eat our lunch. Wasn't a huge fan of that. They should reconfigure their seating somehow.

My boyfriend and I came here for NYE dinner. We called earlier in the day and they told us that reservations were full and we could dine here if we walk in and wait. We really wanted to try this place out since my boyfriend loves whiskey and the food here looks yummy. Upon arrival, we were surprised that the restaurant was only 3/4 full and was seated promptly. It made me wonder how many customers they turned down on the phone if they told everyone who called that day that reservations were full. It was a difficult for us to find this place but it is located between the Pike Place sign and the Starbucks across the street. You take the elevator up a few floors and walk down hallway to get here. It felt like walking in an office building which I never experienced or imagined a bar to be at.Service: We were seated promptly at a table that fits 4. After another party of two left, the waitress asked if we would like to move to the other table for two next to the window with a view. I thought this was nice of them and the view outside our window was the busy 1st Ave and of course, the strip club across the street. Food: I ordered a Turkey Drum Confit and my boyfriend ordered Fried pork shank. The Turkey Drum confit was big and cooked very well and was not dry at all! The sauce that was served with it was super delicious as well as the potatoes it came with. It was the perfect portion. The fried pork shank was juicy and meaty. Ambiance: I liked the tiny barrels around the restaurant. With the dim lighting and individual candle lighted up on each table, it gives a very classy feel.Overall, I would definitely come back. The food, drinks, and service is outstanding.

I really, really like this place. Perfect flavor combos, fantastic ambiance and doesn't break the bank. After several visits, I've tried out a pretty good portion of their meat-centric menu and everything so far has had very solid flavor. Will be back!
nice place to hangout with friends and have dinner. good foods and drinks. staff is very nice. They had good selection of whiskey.

Love the happy hour here. You can get a tall boy of rainier and a shot of whiskey for $5 - gets the job done. They give you popcorn to snack on, too. They also, expectedly, have a great list of whiskey and cocktails too. I have only seen other eat the food and it looks delicious. The downside is the size - pretty small so its often a tight squeeze for a drink after work.
Be sure to make a reservation. Great place.
The food is really good. Great service as well..
They have fresh and tasty food at good prices.

Shouldn't have to wait forever to eat. So annoying. Bar drinks are way overpriced and under served. Bad enough for the wait. Drinks were small and way too expensive Won't be back. Crazy. Waiting 1 hour 15 mind for our table.
Pretty amazing food, and the bartenderes are great.
Hidden gem.
Awesome meal, even better whiskey

Couple days ago wanted to relax and have some shots. I met my expectations by visiting the Radiator Whiskey. Cool cocktails and really good whiskey. The environment is really friendly and warm so you can relax easily. I would advice to visit this place for everybody.
Good atmosphere and even better drinks.

I recently visited this bar and I must say, it was a great experience. The atmosphere was lively and welcoming.Good selection of drinks. The food menu was also impressiveOverall, I had a fantastic time at this bar and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and relaxed place to hang out. I will definitely be returning in the future.

As a BBQ connoisseur, I have to say this place was actually pretty decent. The food was good, the service was great, and the drinks? Excellent! You have to like beer, bourbon, or whiskey--they really know how to pour here. You have to appreciate real rock music. The music selection was spot-on and added to the laid-back vibe. Lastly, you have to be real. If you're expecting some high-end, pretentious dining experience, this isn't the place for you.If you're looking for a casual spot with good BBQ, great drinks, and an awesome playlist, this place is worth checking out.

That place was great. We didn't eat, just had some whiskey and a glass of reisling. The service was awesome - super friendly and attentive. I'd totally recommend it for drinks. We didn't try the food since we already ate, but I heard it's good too. Not sure about parking, we walked from pier 55, took us about 10 mins. Oh, and don't miss it - the bar is upstairs and the sign isn't very obvious. But seriously, the service is top-notch! The vibe was really chill on a Wednesday night. If you're into whiskey, you should definitely check this place out.
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Nice place with good ambience there was super nice food. I love the place very beautiful under decoration is nice.
is it good place for dating? um planning to go there, as i read all review it seems good
It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing wines, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.
Everything was good. We will be returning customers for sure. Me & the husband both loved this place.
Had the Mac n Cheese and a Scotch! out of this world! what a combo! I'm going to come back to try more items on the menu!

Food was amazing, service was great. They really hold themself to a high standard. It felt like I was in someones dinning room and that really added to the ambiance. Got a great table by the window with a great view of the market.
Love the bar. The atmosphere and the service was top tier!

It might seem unusual to find BBQ in the northwest, yet I relish in discovering unique regional takes regardless of the city. On my visit, I opted for the smoked and fried chicken, complemented by mac and cheese. The experience was truly delightful. Although chicken isn't usually my go-to choice, this particular dish proved to be an excellent decision! We were served by Amanda, who was not only personable but also quite well-versed in her field.

It was absolutely great, unusual for a pike place restaurant which usually cater to tourists. Do not skip the pork belly appetizer or the cornbread! I had the brisket and it was lick the plate delicious.

Radiator Whiskey, with its relaxed but classy environment, provides something for everyone and is just what downtown Seattle has been missing! I had the corn chowder and apple salad, both of which were delicious! Everyone in our group chose something different but were equally thrilled with the chicken liver starter!

Always a great evening here, good drink selection and they have almost anything you could imagine (or they'll recommend something if you want). Never too overpacked but usually a pretty energetic and lively crowd. A good after-spot once you hit up Matt's in the Market too.

Friendly staff who actually knew about the bourbon they were selling. If you like whiskey,their chicken is out of this world, and it's the first place I've heard of getting deep fried beef lips... I know it sounds weird, but they were delicious! I really love this place and it's my go to celebration establishment.I would definitely recommend!

Super relaxed and chill atmosphere. I am totally in love with the pulled pork. This is a great place to get together for dinner and drinks with a group of people. I will defiantly be back, lol its almost like a staple to my diet already.

Our experience was good, and the highlight of the meal is the Braised brisket and Fried pork shank. Every dish has been the right portion, so we leave not feeling stuffed. The wait staff is great and always super hospitable.
My friend and I came here last night and we had a great time. The staff was so friendly and drinks were on point! I highly recommended this place!

Ordered Fried pork shank and it was a fantastic dish. In all fairness, their menu has a promising look. I think if we didn't order an appetizer, but I can come back for that. Service was fabulous! I'll probably try to go on a happy hour for more discounts.

Crowded bar setting with chic gourmet eats.The place was a little difficult to find, but well worth the search. We started with the watermelon tomato salad. This fresh and tasty dish was not a dish I was expecting to find this kind of bar scene, but it got me excited for the rest of the meal. For mains, I ordered the fried pork shank. I consider most things that are fried to be good, but this was excellent. The layers of texture below the crispy fried crust to the tender meat made this dish a delicious adventure to eat. Great place to wind down after tiring yourself out from site-seeing around Pike/Pine!
Great location to start off . It has a great happy hour . Would recommend this place to people visiting the area

Tried new scotch/single malt highlands' whiskey (Highland park and dalmore) and they weren't a disappointment!!! Perfect ambient and nice view from the corner edge bar seatings (by the entrance)!!! Perfect for a quick bite and snacks before the concert at showbox! Must try small plates! we ordered the tater tots w/ fried egg and gravy, and the burrata cheese!!!!!! They were BOMB!!! I dig this place!

SMOKED HALF PIG HEAD - Do it!!! We did and ended up sharing with folks from tables near us. It was amazing to see, even better to taste but the best part was how much fun it was sharing.The mushrooms....The old fashioned.....The service......It was just a wonderful experience all the way around!

Great spot. Atmosphere was fun and the place has a lot of interesting things to look at. This place feels like the ultimate man cave. Everything is rugged from the menu to the drinks to the decor. Its technically a bar with very limited food options.

The food and the atmosphere was great. I made reservations for a party of 4 two hours before opening and they were able to fit us in! The roasted half chicken was so delicious - it had a nice smoky flavor with a sweet glaze. The potato salad along with the shaved salad consisting of zucchini, yellow squash, and celery paired really nicely with the chicken. The picture doesn't do the dish justice - it was a generous portion but I managed to finish it all!
The drinks were amazing, bartenders super chill and friendly, my favorite part was the classic hip-hop playlist bumping the whole night.
Went here for the Beast Feast. It's was amazing!!
Best dinner spot in Seattle. They have amazing food, people are nice and everything is organized perfectly well. I would recommend this place if you're a foodie and you don't afraid of late dinners.

This place isn't very big but it is AMAZINGLY good. Located upstairs on the 3rd floor it felt pretty hot & stuffy but we quickly got over that with some YUMMY drinks. Staff was extremely friendly and the open kitchen allowed us to watch the chef work his magic! Before you order take a look at their specials. We had the Debris Sandwich and the fried pork shank. Then topped it all off with the pecan pie with rum ice cream. We left stuffed!
Pikes place is a wonderful place. I was told upon moving here it's a galore of interesting stuff. And it is! I stumbled upon this restaurant and was very pleased with it. Nice food, nice service.
The food was excellent, the drinks were delicious and the wait staff was outstanding. I will definitely be coming back the next time I have a craving for good whiskey drinks.
OMG! This place is awesome! The turkey leg is the bets I've ever had! Fast service.

As you'd expect with the name, this place has a fantastic selection of whiskeys and scotches from all over the world. Their food is on point as well. The space is a little small, so prepare for that, otherwise you're in for a real treat!
great food and drink. highly recommended .
Whiskey Pete would be proud!! This place does cocktails the right way. Happy hour was a blast, even though I was solo. I ordered the Skinny Girl Cocktail and a piper Sammie. Good stuff for sure.

Came here around 8 o'clock with a few buddies to grab a few drinks. We were looking for a laid back, chill environment and radiator whiskey is just the place. It was a bit crowded on a Friday night. Took us about half an hour to get a spot. My friends and I just wanted to chill and talk about life so we ordered a bunch of cocktails and drank it. Wasn't sure what it was but I believe it was probably tequila or vodka.After being there for a bit over an hour, we got hungry and ordered tater tots. It definitely hit the spot. It came wit a fried egg on the top and wow what a finishing touch.If you want to go here to drink, snack and eat light or full food. This is the perfect place with the perfect ambience. Could get extremely busy though.
Great food! Great service! Look out for the pig

The food here is awesome. We ordered the pig head (I know, sounds gross), but was pretty great. It was prepared perfectly and the sauces were good as well. The other dishes were great as well. I definitely recommend coming here early since we didn't have a reservation and had to wait. Will be coming back for more.
GREAT whiskey selection, food was awesome, atmosphere was super and I will be back!
Great place with nice cocktails. I will be back to this place for sure. Very nice atmosphere and professional service
Deliciousness galore! Brisket is so good! Even the gf likes it and she's super picky about her meat.Make sure to make reservations or you might have watch others enjoy their meals
I visited Radiator on my last trip to Seattle really enjoyed the Whiskey tasting and meat plate. Fantastic. Great waitstaff who clearly love what they do.
HOLY SMOKES THIS IS GREAT ! This is a tiny little spot that has some great whiskey. They offer free popcorn and kithcen closes at 11:30pm ENJOY !
Great service, food and strong drinks.
love this place, me and the wife come here at least once a month

Love, love, loved it here! The food, the ambiance and the service were top notch !am going to state the obvious and say that this place has a fine selection of whiskeys. We chose to taste one of their flights.It gives you a nice variety from smooth to smokey to dry, etc. We had a couple cocktails as well which were all really good. All the food and drinks were on point. This place is amazing.Great atmosphere. Not too loud. Great drink selections. Highly recommended this place !!!
Wow - this place is delicious. Service was really good and the food was out of this world. I'll be coming back for sure.

This place has unique spunky food items (Pig's Head!?) and offers a lot more cocktails than you would expect from a whiskey bar. Lots of creative interior, keeping with the Pike's Place vibe. Our table ordered a few different flights, all constructed tastefully, and we were pleased with the recommended fried eggs and tots. Our server, Rachel, was one of the best servers I've ever had and was happy to answer all of our questions. This spot is a gem, and I am planning on coming back soon to try their cocktails!
Great cocktails and very helpful service!
Micheladas here are bomb! And the prices here are great. Bartenders are very generous and always checking up on you unlike other bars out here. Can't wait to come back!
Great spot to go to for cocktails with friends. Very crowded and not a lot of space so get there early if you want a spot.

Excellent customer service.The food was absolutely amazing! It was busy on June 17th evening, but the cooks and servers managed the crowd well.The bartenders are really helpful with their drink selection.Thanks guys,I'll definitely come here again!
i freaking love whiskey! not much more american than that! other than using caplocks to show how much you love something! murrica!

I am a huge BBQ snob and had found nothing that compared to what is produced out of my backyard until I went to Radiator Whiskey. The Porchetta was magical. It was smokey and porky and fatty and everything you want out of porchetta. Their fried chicken livers are amazing too. I don't know anything about whiskey but the Bourbon Margarita was very good. I have had friends who do like whiskey swoon at their selection. Find out about the Beast Feast. For a group of people you get a whole pig for $300. I'm looking forward to my gang going in a few weeks!
This place is incredible! There were four of us and each of us ordered something different. Everything we ordered was delicious. Recommendation: order the pork meal.
Fantastic meal! Get the tots :)

What a great place. We came by it by chance while walking around looking for a place for dinner. Atmosphere was great, food was incredible and the selection of liquor is unbelievable. A+ place. Try the tots, turkey drum, and pecan pie!!!

I could write a long winded review, describing in detail every last thing that makes Radiator Whiskey so unbelievably epic. I'm not gonna do that though. All you need to know is that I can die happy now! Don't think. just do it!
you have to try the barrel aged cocktails. pretty amazing.
Amazing food and ambiance. Had a blast and will be back.
Delicious. Great atmosphere.

Great restaurant and great food, if you in the mood for an amazing place this is where you want to be. It is nice a quaint and the food is just perfect. The customer service is awesome and I will be going back as often as we can. Thank you again and see you soon.
Delicious food and wonderful service. This place is a great find for someone visiting downtown.
2nd floor
Such a fun atmosphere! And it smelled like BACON!
Oh yeah!  Awesome actually whiskey and beef tongue. Definitely an original.
OMG so great!

This dining experience for their tasting menu was a terrible disappointment. I can't exaggerate enough how unsatisfying and way too salty the dishes were. And the desserts were soaked in alcohol, like why? The owner and chefs there really need to taste the dishes they are serving. How can you serve something almost inedible and charge $700+ for two people. We have been to other tasting menus in Seattle and this is somewhere you should stay away. I would say the night went bad once we noticed it took 20+ minutes in between dishes. I've never experienced a tasting menu that took 3+ hours to finish. There was a foie gras pasta dish that should not be served to anyone for any reason.. it was really hard to chew and swallow. Mostly the dishes tasted like salt, sugar, and alcohol... This restaurant is inconsistent with their dishes: 1. We were celebrating a birthday and two others around us were also celebrating. Our birthday dish was the only one without a candle... odd. 2. My partner and I both did the non-alcoholic drink pairing and for some reason our drinks were not served the same level of liquid and ice.. a little weirdOverall I'm glad we got to experience this place and won't be recommending this place to anyone.
Overpriced and under delivered. $600 for 2 and the experience was a joke. What a mistake.
Food and wine was meh . Way over priced for what it is. Was not impressed with any of the dishes
Expect to pay 300 plus dollars to be held hostage for 3 hours before the tasting menu is complete, only to end the night with an upset stomach and violent diarrhea.
For$300 per person, I would have expected more. Nothing about the decor, ambiance or staff attire screamed fine dining.The food wasn't anything to be wowed about.

It was a good meal but overpriced. With food, tip, wine, e.t.c, you're spending more here than you would at Canlis or the Herbfarm, and the experience is not better or vastly different. A decent experience, definitely not to be repeated.
Thought this place was fairly good and worth a try, just a little over priced.

Me and my friends actually went to this place just to have drinks but then we realized that we should have some of their interesting pastas. We ordered their Papparedelle and it was pretty tasty and delightful. The spicy ragu was extremely mouthwatering and delightful and we definitely enjoyed it. I just hope that they could upgrade some of their drinks to make it more tasty and interesting.

Been hearing about this place for a long time and finally was able to try it. Very cozy atmosphere, pretty cute decorations and great service.Although I heard about this place so many times before, I still don't know what I was walking into, and I have no idea about the food they serve.But since I love food I was willing to try, and I was excited. The course meal started with oysters and caviar, followed by sliced beef tounge, and then the noodle pasta with anchovy flakes, with sorbet as intermission. At this point I'm already a bit full, but the pork and wagyu beef makes it difficult to stop.Everything was very tasty and delicious. This is a pricey restaurant, but we definitely get our money's worth.

Amazing meal! Was very impressed with the wine list and the sommelier's knowledge on wines. Food was prepare superbly, but the price tag... Oh boy, the price tag! Never have I been to a restaurant for dinner for 2, and the receipt shows over $600 ($500 + tips)  Of course, half of that went to the wine bottle but still...

I went when I had dietary restrictions due to allergy, and they prepared perfectly, delectable dishes that didn't skip a beat despite my multiple regulations. A perfect combination of satisfying flavors presented in a new light to delight all your senses. I will be back.

Took a friend here for a birthday dinner and we did the 8:30pm time slot. The food was pretty good, the ambiance and atmosphere is very chic and very much similar to other fine dinning establishments. The food was pretty different. I still don't know how I feel about pigeons for main protein course. I was hoping for something more for the price. And the additional truffle shavings on the pasta was pretty lack luster. My only complaint is that the service is very slow. By the end we ran out of the restaurant because we were there till 11:55pm. I get that they wanted to serve everyone at the same time with all our courses simultaneously but some people are very slow and we had to wait for them. I was just exhausted by the end. Food was 8.5/10 service was about 6/10 over all I'll say everything was about 7.5/10.

I don't attend fancy dinners, but decided to splurge once with another couple. Simply amazing! The food had layers of flavor that literally became the topic of conversation until the next dish. Drinks were endless and the atmosphere melted away as the focus was on food and company. Definitely considering making progressive dinners like this a regular thing.

Highly recommend this place! Food is delicious. It is modernized Italian food with a twist. What I love about the food is that the flavors are all very subtle yet they have a small kick of a unique ingredient. So if your not a fan of food with very strong flavors, or a not yet used to having powerful ingredients, this is a great place to start introducing your pallette to new and unique flavors(high end cuisine). Best part about the restaurant in my opinion is the open concept and how you can see how the chefs are preparing your food. It is very interesting and amusing to see how these types of meals are being prepared from start to finish. And how everyone in the kitchen seems to be creative with what they prepare. Overall had a great experience!

Calm, collected, high quality modern cuisine dining. It's Italian inspired. Definitely a special occasion place and call ahead and let them know about dietary restrictions. I enjoyed the experience quite a bit.

Altura is my new favorite restaurant. My husband and I came here for our 5th anniversary and cannot wait to come back again. Yes, it's pricey, but worth every penny. Not to compare apples and oranges but I used to think I couldn't find any restaurant that would beat Ruth Chris as far as quality and flavors goes but Altura blew them outta the water.
Terrific and delightful. Thank you!

I went here few weeks ago... Honestly I was really happy! Since Panevino closed a tear ago, I had no Italian restaurant satisfying me around here. I used to live in Rome for 8 years, and now so mad at myself that didn't check your restaurant for years. Thank you so much for making this area better to live!!!!
really good meal

Everything was solid, albeit sloooow.Food: Flavors we radical, Pasta courses were ridiculously small.Service: super friendly, pretty knowledgeableOverall: Gives Spinasse a run for it's money (just need to bolster the pasta portion). We were very impressed, should be 5 stars, but slow and pasta size.

I generally only want to give 5 star reviews (meaning I just don't review places I think suck)- but I thought the food here was FABULOUS. A new coworker brought me here last week. I didn't realize it had just opened, and I don't normally go to restaurants until they've been open for a month or two. I just like to let them iron out the kinks.Anyway, the food was too good to not mention. The rib-eye was cooked to perfection. The chicken was moist and tender-and was served with roasted grapes! Even the bread was divine.There is just ONE thing keeping me from giving Altura 5 stars-the room. It's just a bit "clunky" for lack of a better word. Our table was hard to get in and out of, and my elbow would hit the wall when cutting my food. I mentioned it to them, and they seemed appreciative. The service was also excellent!
First time back after four years of drought and it's just as fantastic as always. Love the new single seating format and the food is off the hook.

This represents the pinnacle of dining experiences I've had in Seattle. The ambiance of the restaurant is a blend of energetic and tranquil. I had previewed the sample menu prior to my visit, yet each dish still left me in awe. The meticulous attention to detail was simply remarkable. Opting for counter seating provided us with an exclusive view of the chefs crafting each inventive, refined, and delightful dish. I couldn't have enjoyed it more!

I had an incredible dining experience at this restaurant! The produce was incredibly fresh and prepared immediately upon ordering, which really made a difference in the taste and quality of the dishes. The highlight of the meal for me was the red sponge cake - it was absolutely amazing and I couldn't stop raving about it to my friends afterwards. The restaurant also impressed me with its creative use of ingredients, such as the wagyu fat candles, which added an interesting and unique flavor to the dishes.In addition to the delicious food, the cooks were extremely friendly and made the dining experience even more enjoyable. I also highly recommend sitting at the kitchen counter, as you get to watch the chefs in action and even receive free samples of dishes. Overall, I want to thank the team at this restaurant for a truly great experience and can't wait to come back and try more of their delicious creations.
Truly incredible... highly recommend!

Wonderful dining experience! We did the drinks pairing as well. I really liked that it was a mix of cocktails/wine and mocktails. Every course was well thought of. Altura is certainly on the expensive side but certainly worth a visit!
Very good restaurant with impeccable reception. The staff are very pleasant and very kind. We appreciated the time taken by the waiter to explain the dishes we did not know.

Altura is a gem. Incredible attention to detail from start to finish. Bites are meticulously plated and seasoned perfectly with the addition of heat in appropriate proportions. In terms of service, Chef prepares everything as you roll in. I was fortunate enough to sit in front of chef's counter, where we watched everything prepared as we sat down. Meaning, the second I walked in, our dishes six courses down were being freshly assembled. Canapés breaming with color and visually appealing juxtaposition, all adorn in front seat with beautiful fresh greens like red vein sorrel. The dishes rolled out seamlessly as service flowed with the kitchen. Everyone around us felt at home as the food continued to pour in. From the first few bites we got to witness one said plate our food for the next course, while the other side prepared our dishes for the following. Almost in unspoken synchronicity everything streamed onto our view. My friend, who had never witnessed pasta being freshly prepared, stared in awe as Chef rolled fresh raviolo without hesitation. As the drinks poured, and the dishes were consumed, we ended the night with a phenomenal series of dessert bites with minor table side service to finish. To sum everything altogether, I must say, this restaurant exceeded my expectations of what Seattle's fine dining scene had to offer. I'm thrilled to see this restaurant standing still after the coils of pandemic had ruined our restaurant industries left and right. If anything, last night stood as a testament and will to the determination this team has to delivering what really good food is to our beautiful Emerald City.
The food was really delicious. The staff are very attentive, even we don'tknow the rest of the dishes, they give us some advice, good customer service. Recommended!

Amazing meal as usual. Excellent service. Walked in shortly after opening and were seated without fuss or hesitation. Every bite created thoughtfully. Got the wagyu and didn't regret it. Appreciate the take home menu and truffles.

This restaurant isn't eligible for a Michelin star (or 3) as it's in the wrong city for that. But Altura is most certainly a contender for it when and if Michelin comes to Seattle. We sat at the counter tonight and had such an incredible experience! We sat by Bridget, who was working the sauté station. Also nearby was the head chef, Nathan Lockwood. So. Delicious. So unpretentious. Such depth to the flavors and such unusual combinations. Super fresh and seasonal ingredients, which were honored by their treatments. The crew works in an open kitchen with a calm and precision. It isn't stuffy, it isn't rigid but it is polished and clean. We're from chicago. We know good food. This isn't as fancy shmancy as Alinea, but it is just as delicious and honestly one of the best meals I've had. Thank you Altura!

If there was a piece of heaven on earth then part of it would definitely reside here - yes the food, service, ambiance, and overall experience was that good. My husband and I came in late December to celebrate our birthdays. Word to the wise show up hangry (hungry to the point that you are angry about it)- we made the mistake of only being hungry and towards the end became too full to finish the desserts. As others have mentioned the menu is predetermined so all you have to do is sit back and enjoy the experience. This place deserves some kind of michelin star - Bravo!

This one of the best tasting menu restaurants I've ever eaten at anywhere. The wine pairing really add to the experience and the small seating capacity lends to an intimate dining experience. A pricey dinner but par excellence and well worth the cost!!

This place is divine. I highly recommend sitting at the bar so you can catch all the action from the chef that runs an amazing tight ship. Sitting at the bar also allows you to ask the chef/sous chefs about the food, the ingredients and gives you that perk that they make you something special specifically for you. I went when I was having dietary restrictions due to allergy and they prepared amazing, delectable dishes that didn't skip a beat despite my multiple restrictions. If you are looking for special, romantic, small, quaint place with orgasmic food, this is the place. If you want to impress a foodie, take him/her there.
This is the BEST restaurant I have ever been to! Every dish is amazing and tasty~ love this restaurant

Fantastic service, extremely creative execution. Every time we come, even on the spur of a moment, we are welcomed and leave feeling that we just had the most amazing experience. A wonderful combination of having deeply familiar and satisfying flavors presented in a new light to delight all your senses. By far the best place to go for foodies.
A decent restaurant for fine dining. I came here with a dear friend. I just loved the food here. Its was very mild and tasty. Customer service is excellent. Will visit this place again.

The service was attentive and pleasant, the food was creative, light, and delicious, and the price was very reasonable. I'd definitely recommend it. Looking forward to many more meals here in the future. I took one star off for the atmosphere, feels like they're still settling in their ambiance

The chef has never disappointed me once. The price is on the high end but well deserved. The flavor is generally well balanced. Ingredients used are fresh and top notched. Top choice for special occasion.

I was lucky enough to eat at the counter at Altura while on business in Seattle my last night. This place was recommended to me by a friend back in NYC and I am glad I checked it out!Although I was still jet lagged and quite a bit tipsy I had an excellent meal. The chefs tasting menu is an excellent value and holds up to any michelin star equivalent in other cities I have been too. It was nice to just chill out and watch the chefs behind the counter prepare all the different courses with such precision. Also the wine pairing was great with the sommelier tailoring it to my preference of no white wine. There were some unusual wines and it was a nice experience to enjoy so many in one night. I rarely yelp but had to about this place!

We ate at Altura last weekend and the food, service and atmosphere were all wonderful! There are lots of inventive choices for each course and lots of options for tasting menus with and without wines. We sat at the "chef's table" overlooking the kitchen area and it was fascinating. Even if you think you know how a restaurant kitchen might run, you can learn something here!Thanks, Nathan, for a fabulous meal start to finish!

A beautifully repurposed space; attention to every detail, and gorgeous park views through the stunning windows -- elegant would be my word of choice if I had to describe this restaurant in a single word. Exquisite, knowledgeable yet friendly service by superb staff, from the cheerful receptionist to the engaging.
best dinner I've had in a long time in seattle.
My boyfriend and I went together with a couple of friends and we had a blast. The food was wonderful.
Exceptional food. We had the three course meal, and very much enjoyed it. Everything was delicious, full of flavor. The atmosphere feels cozy, while upscale at the same time.
Excellent! Elegant!
very good food. pricey but worth the money.
Fantastic service and food. Gnocchi was killer!
Simply AMAZING!!! Both atmosphere and food-
wonderful place, great food. great service and they are really italians:thank you altura! bravi! it is really small so make sure you have reservations otherwise...........there is always to wait!

The best Italian food in Seattle! We got the five course dinner, and it was excellent. The homemade pasta was just great. The courses were small, so you try lots of different stuff. Be sure and get bread when you arrive, the dipping sauce is amazing. The only complaint: hard to get in, it's so busy! I guess that happens when your good is so good....
I love you, Altura!
A little crowded, but I still give it five stars. The food was excellent, and the service even better.
Simply ... perfectly ... one of the finest restaurants I've ever experienced.
One of the best and most enjoyable dinners I've had in Seattle

Exceptional dinner. Fabulous service. Delicious food. Imaginative (venison ravioli with chocoate infused sauce!) and extremely well balanced taste and texture in every dish. Kudos to the chef. It was my husbands birthday, and it was most excellent. Especially loved the razor clams with semolina crust. Just outstanding. Tough to get a reservation, but worth doing so well in advance to have a special meal at this top notch seattle restaurant. Pricing was fair--$49 for three courses of your choice!Yummy.

A+ EXCEPTIONAL DINING EXPERIENCE!!Each time I go it gets better and it is hard to improve on fabulous.Altura equals brilliant state of the art cuisine sourced with the finest ingredients, coupled with gracious warm service and a delightful wine selection. This young chef, Nathan Lockwood, is a master and Seattle is very fortunate to have acquired this gem of fine and fun dining!Thank you Altura for another delightful evening!
Everything is amazing - must go

Our dinner was AMAZING. The homemade gnocchi just melted in my mouth. It reminded me of what my Italian grandmother used to make. My other favorite was the warm apple crostata. Everything was delicate and beautifully presented. Next time, I want to sit at the bar so I can watch the food being prepared. Two thumbs up!

This is review comes after numerous visits to this place that has lead me to update my previous review. Let's be clear that the food and cocktails here are great, the flavors and plating of various dishes are amazing. But I've seen the progression of decline in service that has lead to horrendous customer service. I don't think I've ever had a waiter tell me, "it's been 10mins and you haven't order anything, and we over booked reservations tonight and need the table in 30mins"I am very disappointed in any establishment that will approve of anyone with such unprofessionalism and disrespectful attitude towards patrons. We had just sat down and the menu wasn't pulling up on our phones. I also don't find it pleasing to hear restaurants are over booking reservations and rushing people to eat. That's so unpleasant to hear from a restaurant that I've dinned at many times before. After this experience I think I'm going to stay away from here for a while or just get Togo, becuase dealing with their rude staff and workers has made this place very irritating to dine at.
We loved the environment but the food was nothing special.
Mediocre food, music didnt match ambience

The atmosphere and service was great but my friends and I ended up with food poisoning the next day:( three of us ordered the chicken and it was delicious, but we all got super sick the next day (our friends who didn't order chicken were fine). Disappointed we spent so much just to be sick:(

Overpriced and overrated.We spent a Sunday in Seattle, and found ourselves later in the evening (is 9-10pm considered late now even in downtown Seattle?), and this place was still open (last call, must pick a dish in the next 5 10 minutes!).Smaller serving sizes and a taste that did not inspire. Surrounding tables with larger groups of friends were having fun with some cool looking cocktails, which may be a good enough reason to come here.

I was waiting to try their drinks but I didn't get it again.As for the food, they are very good about it. Mains fine and fine.Crab Friend's rice was also done and he expected more than $25 in demand from less crab. The fried egg is also good as is the presentation.
It took at least 45 mins even though we had a reservation here. Though the ambience is pretty nice here, reservations should be handled properly

Wonderful place, saw it a few times on Tiktok and finally got to check out. The prices of the entries were surprisingly cheaper than what I expected. Really enjoyed the crispy chicken and the curry. Crab fried rice is also really good. Must check out place in Seattle.

So, I finally hit up Di Fiona in Seattle, and let me just say, it's like stepping into a Pinterest board curated by a wine-drunk interior designer with taste. The vibe? Equal parts "your rich friend's remodel" and "Instagrammer's paradise." The food? Actually, shockingly good. The kind of Italian that makes you pause mid-bite to question every sad spaghetti night you've ever had.The staff? Friendly, but with that "cooler-than-you" Seattle edge--like, yeah, they know you're impressed, and they're totally fine with it. Prices? Let's just say your wallet might need a hug after, but honestly, worth it.In short: Di Fiona is annoyingly perfect, like Seattle itself. Pretentious, beautiful, and somehow irresistible. Damn it, I'll be back.

Went here while on vacation with family. The decorations on the interior were stunning! Made the atmosphere really cozy. The food was amazing. Most of us ordered steak, including myself, and it was cooked perfectly. Drinks were good as well. The staff was super attentive and friendly. Will definitely be back!

Di Fiora consistently knocks it out of the park with every visit! First and foremost, the atmosphere is simply stunning. They refresh the décor with the seasons, ensuring it's always a feast for the eyes--truly an Instagram-worthy haven.Our culinary adventure included dishes like Kow Soi, crab fried rice, steak, garlic pork over rice, crispy garlic chicken, duck avocado curry, seafood tom yum soup, and Vietnamese crunchy rolls, all beautifully plated. While everything we tried was delicious, the standout stars were undoubtedly the duck avocado curry and the crispy garlic chicken. The curry was, without a doubt, the finest I've encountered in any Thai restaurant--rivaling even some of the best Peking duck I've tasted! Though no one asked about my preferred spice level, the flavor and heat were perfectly balanced, leading me to dip nearly everything in that luscious avocado curry.The crispy garlic chicken is always cooked to perfection, with a garlic dressing that's downright addictive. I find myself craving this spot at least once a month, and we'll continue to return for a consistently enjoyable meal that never disappoints. Di Fiora truly knows how to curry favor with its patrons!
The best neighborhood Asian Fusion restaurant. Must try the calamari and the Malaysian Coconut soup- with shrimp- to die for.Actually- everything is good here!
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Warm, welcoming attentive staff. Excellent customer service. Beautifully decorated cafe. Delicious food and cocktails.

First off, Gui was incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful. He not only seated us but also served as our server throughout the meal. While everyone who assisted us was very kind, our primary interaction was with him, and he truly excelled in his role.As for the food, I'm perplexed by any previous reviews describing it as "bland." Unless they mean it's not as intensely spicy as vindaloo curry or ghost pepper level, I'm not sure where that criticism is coming from. Speaking as someone who has an extensive spice cabinet and is often critical of under-seasoned dishes, I can confidently say this place was outstanding. My partner and I dined here last night, and we were both thoroughly impressed. We ordered the crispy duck with green curry, the house carbonara, the ahi appetizer, the coconut soup, coconut crepe cake, and a total of three cocktails. Every dish was excellent; we were particularly enamored with the coconut soup, which we wished we could buy by the gallon. The duck and carbonara were also exceptional, bursting with full flavor, and impeccably prepared. While the ahi appetizer wasn't quite on the same level as the rest of the meal, it was still quite good--my partner especially enjoyed it. Overall, the dining experience was stellar, and we're already planning our next visit before we have to leave town. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town!
amazing food, people gave my family a nice service. drinks are good too, prices are ok, could be better to the given quality

The best food i have eaten in a while!! I'm very pleased. We ordered the steak and crab fried rice, which both turned out to be very delicious. The steak had unique Asian spices that blend very well together with the meat and salad on the side. The fried rice was soft and tasty and I kept wanting more. We will definitely come back to try other dishes :)Note: they have a reservation system and are usually fully booked. We didn't make a reservation beforehand but managed to get in after waiting for half an hour. So make your reservation.

Delicious food, stunning aesthetic, good service, pretty drinks, not too expensive. Highly recommend. We loved the flavor of all the dishes. Super flavorful Asian fusion dishes - especially that coconut soup. I'd order all of these again and come back to try the rest of the menu. Thank you!

TRY THE WINGS OMG TRY THE WINGS!!! I love their wings because when you eat them with the sauce, it taste amazing, and when you eat them without the sauce they taste EVEN BETTER. Its almost like magic. I swear I am not even lying because without the sauce it taste so refreshing, and their is a hint of a lemon lime taste at the end. Its amazing. I love this place so much. My cousins and I went for the first time for a galantines event we were doing and we all were mind blown. Its cozy, cute, comfy, yummy, and the service and drinks were bomb as well. Five stars all the way, they never let down.

I like it. Suggestions and Recommendations: The restaurant staff offered suggestions and recommendations based on their expertise and knowledge of the menu. Their insights helped me discover new and delicious dishes that I might not have tried otherwise.
I love there location I'm in love with there food I've eat there 4 times already And I would definitely recommend

On my second visit, I am delighted to confirm that Di Fiora is just as excellent as it was the first time. The fried calamari and crab fried rice were especially enjoyable. We also tried the Malaysian Coconut Soup with seafood and the rainbow salad. Although I typically consume white woodear mushrooms in sweet soups, I appreciated the texture of the mushrooms in the soup here. Additionally, the rainbow salad would be visually appealing on Instagram. This restaurant is an ideal location for a romantic date or a night out with friends.

Beautiful venue, consistently good food. I just love this place every time I came here. Highly recommend the roasted duck and the crab fried rice! Must order items every time. Also really love the scallops in sauce, and drinks were also creative and reasonable. My girlfriend adored the decoration here!

This might be my new favorite restaurant. Unique flavors, super high quality, and amazing decor. I never realized I liked caviar until I checked the menu after and realized they sprinkled some on all of our dishes.
Beautiful food and beautiful decor. I thought they put a lot of thought into everything. Highly recommended.
LOVE LOVE LOVE! From the food to the drinks, everything is amazingly presented.
Great service and delicious food. My daughter wanted to try this place and it was great.

Great Food and Great Service. Highly recommended for reservations during dinner time. I have been waited at other restaurants that has no reservations for over an hour so having the online reservation system is convenient. Best dishes I recommended are Crab Fried Rice, Curry and Chicken Wings. Kids love it so much.

I visited this restaurant again on Sunday but the line omg!! Crazy busy so I decided to come back again this Monday brunch ( with reservation) all the dishes that I ordered still delicious as before. Especially the crab fired rice which is my fav one. I love the Monday vibe with full house customer but not too crowded. The playlist was very interesting as well. Never disappointed every time I came here. Definitely and definitely recommend this Asian fusion restaurant.
I had a very good experience at this restaurant. The food was awesome. The decorations are very classy.
Great meal, service, and atmosphere! I will absolutely be coming here again. Such a good find!!
GROSSSEverything about this place was gross. I would never come back people where disrespectful
after you eat they let you keep the bones to build a cage

Why are they doing Togo orders with no mask and no gloves? Food is not worth my health. I will not be ordering from fogon anymore while in quarantine. Everyone should stay away from this place for safety. The gentleman working the front desk was really rude to me as well. My husband wanted to get down and confront him but we drove off. YOU NEED GLOVES AND MASK!

This place is a hot mess. There is absolutely no system in place for the Togo orders. They are definitely unable to keep up with the demand of business. There is no social distancing happening when you pick up your order! None of the employees are wearing mask. This place is a covid trap waiting to happen. Do not order food here as they are not prepared for the demand or have a safe system In place. On top of that, the guy GARY who works the front table is not friendly at all and completely stressed and unprofessional. He is RUDE AF! Sorry fogon, officially going down the street for safe Mexican food! Absolutely no excuse for the horrible customer service from GARY. I would like an explanation from the owners as why they are putting customers at risk but not following CDC guidelines to wear a mask. It went to affect April 3rd! Also, during a pandemic when people should be really be nice to each other you have the worst person GARY at the front helping customers who has the worst attitude ever. I am coming out of my house to support you as a restaurant and I'm treated like that is completely unprofessional. It says a lot about a restaurant when you see all the reviews and there is absolutely no response from the owners. Good or bad.
This place is really rude. Never coming here. Do not recommend this place. Paid for our food and drinks and made us wait outside.

BE AWARE!!!!! First time in Seattle. We stopped in for a bite and a drink and both drinks had glass in the drinks!!! One drink was a chard the size of an ice cube and the other one had tiny pieces at the bottom of the other glass. This absolutely unacceptable!!! The manager didn't bother to come to the table with an apology for the mishap. The waiter said simply said, "the manager is not going to charge you for your glass filled drinks." NO APOLOGY IF ACKNOWLEDGEMENT!!!
Not kid friendly. Ended up leaving right after arriving. Parking is horrible. We were looked down on because o brought my 7 and 2 year old. Food may be good but not good enough.
Only good thing is they have black beans ... they charge for chips and salsa and it's not even good ... I could go on but need I?

Keep moving....I definitely would suggest skipping the cocktail list. For example, "fresh lime juice" = margarita mix from Safeway. The service feels inexperienced and rather discombobulated. Maybe it was just an off night?

Food was good . Staff were dicks, I walked in with my mask on and sat down and took it off. When going to the bathroom I forgot to put it on, then a staff member yelled for me to put it on - way over the top. Trying to find the BR another staff member said in a condescending tone, "it's over there with the biggest door". Maybe I was disoriented with another douche staff member yelling at me, either way, the staff were dicks who acted with a rod up their ass
Workers seat their friends before customers that were there first. Cool vibe but friends should WAIT.

2nd time here. We loved the food and service the 1st time. This time service was horrible. The food was still good. What made me question if I want to return again was the service but the icing on the cake was we paid w 100 cash when we got our change it was 13 I was like excuse me I have the manager 100 and he said let me check and went in the back.  I saw the manager so I showed him what I was given and he followed the guy to the back and they both returned this time with the 20 I was shorted.  Not sure his name but he is tall, skinny Latino. Beware!

This is not Mexican food. This is a Honduran abomination. (Catrachos! Los olí a entrar no más. Mages! Dejen de inventar!) 4 stars on Yelp for this mediocrity says everything about Seattle's grasp of Mexican cuisine: hopelessly out of touch.

Price is great but the quality of the food is average at best. This place tends to get very crowded and sometimes the lines get long. They do have a lot of seating so it turn around pretty quick. Most of the staff members are friendly but you can tell that it does get a little overcrowded at times and things get missed. It's a good place to go if you are getting ready to go out and get hammered or are coming back from getting hammered. I just wouldn't think of going here for regular dinner or a date. There are just too many options to eat in Seattle for better quality (except you will pay more).
Really great lunch spot. I also hear their HH is great.
Delicious Mexican food. The Ultimate Margarita was great as well!

The serving sizes are huge! All of us were surprised how cheap it was for a big plate of food. The place has a good vibe and serves great Mexican dishes. I had a Chicken Fajita Burrito (pictured) and a Torta. Wasn't the best Mexican food I've had, but good enough.

Extremely good Mexican food, unbelievably delicious. Everything on their menu is top-notch, although the shrimp cocktail is served hot? It's usually a cold dish, but whatever, this restaurant deserves the spotlight. If anything, it's surprising it doesn't have an award by now. Stop by and have a fiesta full of fun and a margarita to complement, why not.

This place is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool but the staff is also really friendly. They know what they're doing and what they're talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is pretty good, some Mexican classics and some twists, and for their prices it's 100% worth it.
Easily some of the best mexican food Iv'e ever had, love their mole!

So much deliciousness! We are here at least once a week, I swear. They've got their take-out situation DOWN! Awesome margaritas to-go even! Check out their menu on-line, ring them up, and swing on by in 15-20. The pick-up station is right as you get in the door and you can see thru the glass door if you need to wait until someone else finished getting their goodies. Support this lovely, family-owned, local business in these nutty times, y'all!!!!!
I loved that they have happy hour and they are the best mexican resto in town!
Service could have been better but the food was really good! I had the ceviche and corona, super good!
Big portions, and really good! You don't get skimped, and the atmosphere is great!

They start you off with a delicious dish called tostada. We ordered tortilla soup and tacos. The tacos were so spicy we sent them back for another dish. Our waitress was wonderful. I would eat here again.

Great happy hour, pretty good food. I grew up close to the border and have pretty high standards for Mexican food and this place definitely satisfied. Drinks were delicious and reasonably priced (the sangria was good and strong too) the fresh tortillas reminded me of home and were very very good. When it isn't happy hour it's a little pricey but still worth it. It was very busy and loud which I don't mind but if it bothers you, go during an off time.
Best Mexican food I've ever had! I'm going to crave this place. Awesome ambience, excellent service!

One of the best places to get mexican food in town. Their tortillas are just amazing!!!I'm giving it a 4 instead of 5 only because their veg options are not great. My faves here - Guac and chips, margaritas, Polla a la Crema!
The complimentary appetizer tostada is worthy of ordering on its own! Delicious food, and a lot of great options that you don't always find at other Mexican restaurants. Definitely would recommend.
It's large and loud but good service and good authentic Mexican food. I'll be back!
This is the first real Mexican I have had in Seattle. Definitely worth a try!
good authentic mexican
Ceviche was great! High quality, not high prices.
Like it!
Opened today. Lively remake of the space and a delicious array of offerings on menu.

This was quite a nice surprise during our recent visit to Seattle. The service and atmosphere is great, but the food truly stole the show! This was one of the best meals and overall experiences I've had in a long time. I highly recommend!!!!

Best tortillas in town! Try their street tacos for sure. Their chicken fajitas is different from what you would usually find elsewhere. The chicken comes soaked a light tangy sauce. The Veggie tamales was surprisingly good.
Great food and great service! Parking was easy to find. I will definitely be back. The servings were plenty!

I recently visited fogón with my girlfriend, and we had an amazing time. The drinks were perfect, especially on a hot day, and the environment was inviting with great music playing in the background. We were particularly impressed by our server, Erick. He was exceptionally nice, helped us choose some fantastic drinks, and made sure our ice water was always refilled. Despite being busy, he managed everything efficiently and made our experience memorable. We'll definitely be coming back!
The service was fast. The servers answered my questions with courtesy. The chicken enchilada was so good I will be back and thank you.
Very very good food! Tostada was complimentary and it was delicious! Might go back for breakfast

Amazing food! So surprising. Very cool atmosphere, too. The complimentary appetizer is to die for. Had the enchilada & the street tacos. Definitely recommend the spiked horchata!!!!!!!! Also got lunch and brunch! So delicious for every meal

It's one of my favorite places to go to for Mexican food.Highly recommend the quesadilla as well as the fish tacos! The portions are pretty good for the price, and the flavors are on point. The fatty meat in the quesadilla is perfectly paired with fresh salsa and cheese. The fish taco was delicious as well. Crispy and light fish in a soft-shelled taco is so worth it. Another go-to is the burrito! Highly recommended if you want something more filling, as it has veggies and beans inside. There are also several sauces available that go well with your choice of food!Service was great as well, the order was served quickly too.

Visited on Halloween evening. The food was decent Mexican food. Ambiance was nice. Good options for happy hour. It took us 40 minutes to get the table. Highly recommend to book table before arriving. The restaurant has accessible entrance located in street level. Parking could be challenging since the location is in busy Capitol Hill area.
For as long as I've been here, this spot has stayed on the corner of Pine/Belmont the longest. If you can get in for their Happy Hour, it is worth the wait. Good food and good luck.

Great service!!! Went on a weeknight and we got to sit down quickly and the service was very fast too!Drinks are always FRESH! And the price is right for using fresh ingredients! (None of that sweet and sour mixer crap!)

Great Mexican place in seattle! From what I understand there aren't a lot but this one was amazing! I had the Arroz con Pollo which was delicious and everyone else loved their food as well. Service was super fast even though it was a Friday night and they were busy. I'd love to come back here.
Wanna share business reviews, service complaints and remain anonymous. Send us your videos at honestconsumereviewer@gm…
Great food and good service and pleasant atmosphere. Have been a few times and it hasn't disappointed yet.

Really enjoyed dining at Fogon. The mojito was fresh with the right amount of liquor, the Queso Fundido had a good amount of spicy chorizo and was truly really cheesy, and I'm glad I had enough room to have some of the flans. If you're looking for a lovely Mexican restaurant, check them out.
Amazing! Food and service were great. We had the Seafood enchilada and the fish tacos.
Delicious lunch options for a great price! Service is always so-so but not a big deal to me

Great service, food, and value! We popped by for an early dinner this weekend and the place was absolutely packed, but we were seated and served super quickly!The place was a bit hot even with the fans running, but not a big deal. They have happy hour everyday so it was great to try out some of the items. I got carne aside tacos subbed with flour tortillas and it was delicious!This place is probably one of the best Mexican restaurants I've had in Seattle. 5/5 would definitely recommend!
Awesome tacos and great atmosphere, can't wait to bring my wife to try some drinks and other food!
The burritos are great. The cream chicken is great too.
Tacos are amazing. 1/2 off Tequila on Taco Tuesday can't beat itStreet Tacos , margaritas
I go there for the crab enchiladas. That's the only thing I get. It hits the spot every time.

Excellent authentic Mexican food. The selection of mole sauces are outstanding. Menu choices are excellent. Our servers were lovely, attentive, and patiently answered all our questions whilst giving us great recommendations. The most creative and possibly authentic Mexican menu. Recipe, taste, presentation, and absolutely fabulous! We had Carne Asada Burrito and Tortilla Soup has an amazing presentation and looks so appetizing. The food is delicious and well seasoned. The timing was excellent and the service was second to none. If not enough the ambiance allows for a relaxed meal and great conversation.
Great service - fun and exciting atmosphere- food quality is great for the price - a great go to place
Yes! All thumbs up! Awesome burritos as you can see.
Food and drinks were really good! The staff are really friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this restaurant.
I come here to get my favorite carne asada burrito!
I would highly recommend trying the mole here, it's delicious!
I absolutely love the burritos here. Great price and delicious food!

It's one of my favorite places. Been here quite a few times. The vibe is always fab and the staff is generally very friendly, only this time one of the staff on the floor (Mexican descent) seemed so happy, and love the sharing smile. Lovely comeback!

Great spot with some good vibes. Great friendly service all the way around. Food tastes awesome, with some twists to dishes pre-Covid. I really enjoy the booth streets with the windows popped open. They added a great spot outdoors due to Covid. I've been coming here since they've opened. The drinks are so yummy and offer scratch in house drinks.

One of those hole-in-the-wall places you always hear about with fantastic food. Went there for lunch not expecting much but found the owners working the grill and extremely friendly and helpful. The food was great and prepared quickly. Overall, very good.

My favorite place for Mexican food. Everything I have tried was super delicious. Thank you for being often during this hard time. Me and my friends always order pick-up whenever we gather up together and they like it as well.
My favorite favorite place to eat! The ceviche and tacos are to die for, place is always packed and great vibe and atmosphere!

I'm glad that I'm writing this review. Location was absolutely beautiful and phenomenal customer service. I had truly a wonderful time here. Attentive staff, delicious food and friendly environment. For me, this place is on my top list. Preferably recommended!!

The food was literally a mouth-watering! I dined here recently and it was nice to experience to taste such delicious authentic Mexican food. The tacos dorados and carne asada were definitely the best for me. It was really fresh and taste so delicious. Excellent authentic food. The staff was nice. They have a great location. Service was a bit slow just because it is packed though.

Loved the place, you won't go wrong with their Mexican dishes, you'll surely get what you paid for and get filled with satisfaction. Portions were on point, it's a bit hard for me to finish a whole plate of carne asada burrito. It was so good, the meat and the sauce certainly gives this omph! in every bite.Service is also top notch, I had a great experience and the staff that took care of us was very friendly and welcoming. Gave us our orders quickly and we are very happy with it.We'll come back and highly recommend this place to others.
Very good Mexican food. Very good menu.
Ultimate margarita is everything.
Amazing food it was delicious..I also really enjoyed atmosphere.They also have a good choices for vegetarians
This is a place I regularly come to.They are very generous with their portions, food comes out quickly, and the service is great. ii loved it.

I went up to Seattle to visit a friend and this was my first meal there. I was happily satisfied! Despite the hour and a half wait (when we were told 45m-1h) and loud ambience, the chips, salsa, guac, and food were delicious.Everyone in the group got the entree with meat, rice, and beans so we got to try different dishes. I had the pollo asado and was surprised to see a large slab of chicken on my plate. But I didn't even need a knife it was that tender. And don't even get me started on the handmade corn tortillas! Best ever.At the end of the meal I was full but not feeling weighed down. 10/10 would return; maybe for happy hour next time!!!
Had dinner with a friend, we had a good time and great Mexican food.

Fire! Everything on their menu is a most have. This is one of the places that you have to visit several times in order to enjoy the full menu. Their guac is incredibly on point. I could kiss their cooks!
Delicious drinks! Delicious food! GREAT service! Oh, and they have an amazing HH menu! We need a Fogón in Los Angeles.

I went to Fogon Cocina a few weeks ago, and the food and drinks were both good. Nice atmosphere and nice interior. I will definitely go back again. One of the best restaurants in town, and I hardly recommended it. Everything in the menu is delicious and has great flavor. Nice ambience, polite waitress and nice music inside.Hubby and my favorite date night spot! We change up our order with each visit, and it is always AMAZING!
My favorite restaurant in Seattle. A must try! The food is great and all of the staff members are friendly. Anytime anyone comes to visit I tell them to go here.
Best Mexican Food spot in Seattle!
Love the little app they give you before you order. Best salsa verde as well. Service is good, a little slow but doesn't bother me. Great place to watch games too.

I love this place. What a great find. I am in love with the complimentary tostadas to start off the meal. Yum. The guacamole is delicious and the carne asada cooked perfectly. on my next cheat day, Im heading back there for that queso with chorizo. It looked incredible.
Awesome happy hour!

My family loves this place! The second you sit down, and sometimes before, your drink order is asked and hot chips and perfect salsa are at your table. The prices are right and the food is delicious. We especially enjoy their bean and cheese burritos. Our toddler loves their rice and chips and salsa.

This area is very good. Everything is newly made- chips, salsa, tortillas, salsa, guacamole, ceviche, etc... You name it. Food is tasty and genuine- not your typical texmex that's common around here. The staff is extremely friendly and keen to please. At first the cocktails look pricy but they're DELICIOUS and made with top quality tequilas. And they've wonderful happy hour specials!! No gripes here!!

This is my go to. Recommend it to someone daily. Was very upset it took me this long to find out about this place. Closets I have had to authentic Mexican food in Seattle. Torta and a beer and you'll be happy. See you tonight!
Very good food. I would highly recommend this place to anyone! Although my stop was quick, I really enjoyed the service, environment, and food.
Soooooooooo good they seriously have the best chicken tortilla soup! There happy hour is the best! And the free tostada!! Heck yes! You won't be disappointed!! Love the vibe in there
Delicious! Great service, great food, and a great happy hour!! Definitely going back!

Fogon is my favorite right in my neighborhood the best noon day margarita you will ever have! They will serve you fast and you can enjoy a cheap happy hour after three i tried it after seeing some other yelp reviews and now I can't stop going there!

The best happy hour place ever! I live couple feet away and the place is always crowded- in a good way. Owners are super nice and the food is delicious. Their tortilla soup is SO good, especially on a rainy day. Regular menu is reasonably priced and happy hour menu is hard to beat!
This place is amazing.  I will never go to Seattle and not visit it again.
Delicious. Well priced. Great service.
Great food and friendly service. Will definitely come back!

Food is mediocre. But the happy hour bar is awesome! U have to get the $8 Margaritas, they give u entire flask, it's 5 drinks! Bucket of beer is good too. Free chips and salsa. Chips r fresh, a little thick for my liking but some love.
Delicious authentic Mexican food! Definitely recommend!
This restaurant is excellent on all levels. I have made reservations for the last five years here and it is consistantly the best experience each time.
Fogon has great food, super friendly staff and a comfortable atmosphere! Love the drinks, the fresh-hand made tortillas and their authentic Mexican dishes!
Good food. Great happy hour!
The girl who works there is so sweet, that is why I go not for the food!
I love this place! amazing food and very reasonably priced. the staff always make me feel special.
They have Happy Hour 9pm to close. Great for late night munchies.
Highly recommend!
The food is fantastic. Lots of options. Amazing horchata!Love them.
Really great space, and the food looked as great as it tasted. Friendly staff!

the most racist place I have ever been to!!! the bartender with long braids and ugly green nails can't stand to see a black man with a white female/ wife that he's been with for 22 years! thus bartender is a bitch!! food was amazing you staff is horrible!!!!!!!!! never will be back! and this posted all over YouTube! we are big YouTube influencer and came to your establishment because if other YouTubets! this place is racist!!!! get new bartenders!!!

My recent dining experience at Communion in Seattle was nothing short of disappointing. From lackluster dishes to poor service, it fell far below expectations.Firstly, the gumbo was bland, lacking in flavor, and the seafood was overcooked, resulting in a less-than-pleasant texture. The Mac and cheese, while a classic favorite, was ruined by an excessive amount of smoky flavor.
