Even the cosmopolitan tasted more like watered-down Kool-Aid than a crafted beverage.To add to the disappointment, the service was subpar. Our waitress seemed disinterested and unfriendly, displaying an attitude that made us feel as though we should be grateful just to be dining there. Her lack of helpfulness only exacerbated our already tarnished experience.Overall, Communion failed to deliver on both the culinary and service fronts. For those seeking a memorable dining experience in Seattle, I would advise looking elsewhere.

I am definitely not at home here. Twice the hostess turned me away claiming the empty seats were for reservations only. I never expected such snobby behavior from a soul food joint. Evidently gentrification turned these Black folks bougy to where they turn away customers who aren't white hipsters living in the area. A decade ago East Union was a crime infested area with struggling Black owned businesses begging for customers. What a difference a decade makes. So I took my money to another business with much better customer service does not care about the social caste of the customer.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. However, the food was average, service was fine, and branding/marketing is corny (e.g., calling their sushi Hood Sushi - why?!) Based on their social media pictures, I thought I was going to take one bite of a dish, slam my hand down utensil tightly gripped and let out an expletive in joy. But, no, I took one bite of the hood sushi and could not discern the flavors of the catfish or other ingredients. I primarily tasted seaweed and rice and the watermelon sauce just added salt (a lot of it) to the mix. Overall, the food didn't live up to the hype. Though, I may give the food one more chance because the catfish and grits LOOKED amazing (all their food looks delicious on Instagram and in-person). All the food I ate was just okay. First, I tried the sushi which didn't offer the fusion flavor the chef intended. The shrimp toast would have been great if it wasn't over toasted. Also, the greens were too oily for me.
Overhyped restaurant. Food is mediocre at best. Totally not worth the wait. Won't dine here again.

My recent visit to Communion left me with mixed feelings. While there were some highlights, there were also areas that could use improvement.Food Quality: Everything we ate seemed overcooked and dry. It seemed as if it was reheated too many times, idk but it wasn't what I was hoping for cause almost every review I saw made it seem like it was gonna be some of the best food in the PNW. The drinks were good though. The best part of the meal was the watermelon salad. The flavored hot sauce just tasted like regular hot sauce to me so that was kinda disappointing. I saw some Nigerian and Carribean-inspired items, so I tried the akara; they were a miss for me personally. Service: The service was friendly and attentive. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered suggestions. However, there was a bit of a delay in getting our food, which was a downside, especially when you're hungry. (But the delay in food wasn't an issue in totality because it was busy so that's expected)Ambiance: It has a laid-back and casual atmosphere, which fits the cuisine. The décor and music were enjoyable. It was kinda weird that they picked and chose who to enforce their dress code with and not. Portion Size: The portion sizes were quite generous it was enough for two of us and more. Drinks: The drinks were really good and fit the theme. The names were unique and some were already premade so all you had to do was pour and enjoy.Overall Experience: While my visit had its share of ups and downs, there were some notable aspects. The flavors and ambiance created a pleasant atmosphere, but the food quality was inconsistent, and the wait times were slightly longer than expected. I would recommend giving this restaurant a try, but I hope they focus on improving the consistency of their dishes to make it a more reliable dining option. It's a three-star experience for now, but with some tweaks, it could certainly reach higher heights.

I came here for drinks with colleagues when staying at the hotel above. We stopped in to use some drink coupons. What a fun theme and great drinks at reasonable prices. We were the only guests and received excellent service in a unique, beautiful setting. It is a must-see! The design of the bar is stunning. The beautiful backlit stained glass murals throughout make for a relaxing environment. We will return!
They have really good soup and sandwich combinations here.

Excellent service. The ambiance of everyone sitting close to each other was a great idea. Everyone there was nice, friendly, & seem to enjoy the food. The customers were very diverse although restaurant is black owned. I enjoyed the creative menu. Hood Sushi is delicious. The dumplings hit the spot as well and tasted like a cabbage. I wish I had a dozen Hoe cakes. Fried okra without the slime left me in awe. The deviled eggs were so good.I'm definitely going back when I'm in Seattle again
Best experience ever! The service was spot on. Food was absolutely delicious and we can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu! What a wonderful local business, a must try!!
Very nice restaurant, with excellent food .Make sure you have reservations.Parking is not plentiful around this restaurant.
The food, service, and music was great. The owner was nice and welcoming. He made sure we had a great experience.
One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Great service and even better food. If you get a chance to eat here you have to take it.
amazing food and amazing ppl!!!!!

This place is gold. Sat outside in comfort with heaters and started with our server's suggestion of the salmon corn chowder, rich and smooth. And don't come here without trying the okra, crisp and just the lightest seasoning. For the entrees, the berbere smoked chicken was cut and presented to perfection. And the shrimp and grits are just another reason we'll come back. Service was impeccable.

The place smells AWFUL.Seriously, its super stinky and smells like someone farted in a bag and left it for 5 years to marinate. Put some incense in there y'all. Besides that, the waiter dropped my food and i had to wait like 2 hours for my food. Food was decent though, overpriced still for its mediocrity

We went back to Le Coin, this time I got the chicken sandwich. I have to admit I'm a Le Coin Burger fan, but my husband loved the chicken sandwich equally and so we switched. Jordan was super friendly and our waitress was so kind. Definitely recommend this place. Our guests also loved the apple fritters.
I was honestly a bit disappointed in the menu. The dishes were good but not really what I was hoping for.
Get the octopus and wagyu, it's super delicious!

Excellent selection of NW French fusion dishes. Gotta go back to try more of there sumptuous fare... Great wine selection and local brews. Katie was superb as our server & the entire staff are so helpful and friendly! Hip, fun & cozy, yet not pretentious. Highly recommend.

Absolutely my favorite location!Le Coin has a great vibe overall, and the food is excellent.Starting your meal with oysters and champagne mignonette is a terrific idea. Although there is always something new and fascinating to try on the seasonal menu, my all-time favorite dish is the steak frites. The dessert selection never lets you down, and the cocktails are creative and intriguing. Service were so fast.
fantastic food , drinks, serviceeverytime!

The staff were engaging, relaxed, and were genuinely happy to have us. We opted for the Chef's counter tasting menu and felt quite satiated by the fourth course. Not only were the staff engaging but the chefs and line cooks were equally interested in how we were doing, what dish stood out, etc. Not to mention the free beignets from Andrew, who was happy to share his newly mastered technique with us. The food was incredibly layered with wonderful ingredient selection, preparation and execution. The oysters with bacon were some of the best cooked oysters I ever had and don't sleep on the greens as presentation, they paired so well with sauce too. Highly recommend a visit if you like a dining experience to be engaging and each dish to be well designed and paired exquisitely with all ingredients. Next time, I'm opting for the wine pairing.
We had a great time. This is a local gem. The service and food could not have been any better.
We had a really pleasant experience here, there seafood is delcious!
The take out food still taste great and the best is it still have great presentation inside the to-go box. :)
Everything was great! Warm outdoor seating, awesome service and food!We will be back.
Great place for take out. They bring it right to your car. Loved the pandemic margarita.

We order here our take out dinner during this lockdown...The entire staff engaged with us, friendly, and so sweet while waiting to our orders. I ordered this sablefish. It was a powerhouse of flavor, it was incredibly tasty. Looking forward to returning.
Food was fantastic. Service was spot on. Great location. All in all it was a fun dinner with wonderful food.

I can't speak highly enough of the food and service we received on our visit to Le Coin. What brought me to the restaurant was the cool drink menu which was inspired by one of my favorite shows-The Wire. We were able to reserve a seat at the chefs counter and it was worth it. The chef and other kitchen staff were amazing. The interacted with us, answered with questions etc. The octopus is absolutely phenomenal and so was the pork chop and sablefish dish. We saw a lot of the burger coming out the kitchen so that's next on my list. This place is a must go and we will be returning soon

Excellent food! Good quality and diverse offerings. Best to go during HH to try a better variety. The location and interior were really nice too. Wonderful service from Leslie and Ray! We will certainly be back again!

Just had a fantastic time with friends at this pub! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the Steak Bites, Fries, and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. The menu offered a variety of options, and everything we tried was top-notch. The pub itself has a great atmosphere, with solid vibes that make it a nice spot to hang out.One of the highlights was the extensive drink options available. They had a wide selection of drinks to choose from, catering to various preferences. The service was quick and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making sure we had everything we needed.The prices were fair for the quality and quantity of food and drinks provided. It's always a relief when you get good value for your money. All in all, it was a great experience - good food, good drinks, good service, and good vibes. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you're in the mood for a enjoyable and satisfying pub experience.
Good food. Good service. Portions are big. So order mindfully. Was there for dinner a few weeks back.
Had a big team dinner there and they were able to accommodate us and had great food and drinks.
This is one of the best first date locations in all of South Lake Union in my opinion. Great ambiance and excellent food.

Great location and tasty cocktails and happy hour bites. They have a very nice outdoor patio that has a really nice vibe. The old fashioned was reasonably priced and tasted great. I liked their whiskey selection that I saw posted above the bar.
Was not sure what to expect, but it was very good. Thank you for the good food and the great service!
Perhaps the best carne asada fries I have had in a very long time!

It was a nice place and the restaurant has a great interior setting. The menu was incredible and has lots of good options. Everything was fresh, well-seasoned, and worth the wait. The restaurant has a great ambiance was pleasantly great. Very cozy to dine in and the food was well-presented. I got to taste the challah french toast and wild boar bolognese. Very wonderful taste, so delicious. The portion was a good and very reasonable price.
Good lunch spot. Sandwiches are great value and they have great cocktails too- doesn't disappoint but doesn't wow you either
Very cool Whiskey/Bourbon/scotch bar and restaurant. Only had the late night menu but food was delicious but portions are small. Beet salad and steak bites were delicious.
Cool little spot with pretty good food. I felt it was a little over priced, but for the ambiance we made it work.
This place was cool. It had a good happy hour, good food, and good service. I'd recommend if you are in the area.
I love this place. Such a cool vibe. The staff is friendly, the service is great, and the drinks are tasty. The olive appetizer is fantastic, as are the fries with the aioli sampler.

Strolled in for brunch midday on a Saturday, not really knowing what to expect. I had previewed a brunch menu online that looked like it was on point, but I was really sold by the fact that they take online reservations for brunch - unheard of in Seattle - and all I really wanted was some good food in a decent atmosphere without the hours long wait that generally trademark brunch in this city.While this is certainly one of the many dinner/bar locations that brunch offerings are clearly their second line of business, with "brunch" written on a chalkboard for diners to take notice while they are in for a drink on a Friday night, I was pleasantly surprised at the airiness of the place with the roll-up opened on a nice summer day.Service was great - timely, thoughtful, and kind. Mimosas were generous in the champagne department and were mixed with fresh oj. And the food - THE FOOD! I ordered the beef short rib chilaquiles and the hubs ordered the fried chicken/waffle. The chilaquiles were delicious! Topped with radish and cilantro, a side of black brand with cotija cheese, and served with crème fraîche, a lime wedge, and green "diablo salsa" - just the right amount of heat. The fried chicken and waffle were also amazing - the chicken was juicy on the inside and had perfectly crispy skin, and the waffle was sprinkled with pecans and bacon and topped with a cardamon butter that was to die for! The perfect sweet/savory brunch item.If you're looking for a fabulous brunch without the wait, re:public is now definitely on the top of my list.
Only been here from lunch and drinks.  Not bad, but not great.

i like this place a lot. a couple of weeks ago i wound up here twice in one week. i really like the bread and butter dish. i recommend asking for extra salt to bring the butter up to that special zing level. i think it's either $2 or $3.i met up with a friend to give him some water bottles for his future STP ride. they are massively late. parking is a hassle around there. i found a couple of douchey guys sitting in their douchey cars, talking on their douchey cell phones, taking up valuable free street parking spots. hope that doesn't turn into a hot new trend. i would go back again for the good beers and i'd try the food too.

Great decor. Great wine selection. Great food, except for the egg on the asparagus plate. My friend and I enjoyed being by the garage door. I'm a foodie, she's not. Good time had by both. Would come again.

SNARF!Re:Public is a new cute little cubby looking joint straight ILLIN' in the midst of SLU. The red letters on the sign make it that much more magical. Anywho, we had a private company event here and I definitely indulged. The ambiance was very romantic so I could definitely see myself cruising here for a nice glass of vino on a weekend or weekday with a sweet lil' thang.I had the crab puffs as an appetizer and they were quite scrumptious, some amazing lasagna and pasta for my entree. After I was almost all the way full I tried their rib eye and was immediately blown away. This place wasn't too pricey so definitely worth your time if you're in the area.Bonus info: This is about 1 notch up from Joey's in SLU. It's more expensive so I would recommend Joey's if you're just having drinks and/or a light appetizer and Re:Public if you want a higher class menu and ambiance.
I was happy to try this place. Great food. Everyone I was with enjoyed it.
Great happy hour menu for food and drinks. The service was fast and friendly. Lunch and dinner menu are great too.
Absolutely delicious and service was impeccable. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone.
Was in Seattle for 36 hours and wound up here twice. Delicious foods, one of the best Old fashioneds I've ever had, and AMAZING service from the bar staff.

The menu is excellently great and good quality meals. Great spot for dinner. We occasionally dined here and so far the food never disappoint us. The kurobuta Pork Chop and Risotto were on-point, well-cooked, and taste really delicious. The drinks selection made our night perfectly great, Cocktails are fantastic. The price is reasonable.
The carne asada fries here are to die for!
This is the best place to get some carne asada fries in my opinion!
The steak fries are absolutely phenomenal here!
Amazing service and delicious food selection, you can't go wrong with anything here! Food to service is spot on :)
Four words. Happy hour lamb burger. Do it.
i love food and staff here.for the great food and wonderful experience, i would give them 10 stars :)

Fantastic staff, great space and location in South Lake Union. I LOVE the bartender Rory. (Had been in the week before and really liked it so brought my team in for drinks after work, Rory remembered what I had the last time I was in and was a dream!) Everyone made us feel very welcome and will definitely be back. Seems like a lot of regulars with the staff greeting many by name.A really wonderful place and worth a visit if you're working near Amazon campus.
One of the best bars and restaurants in Seattle.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! This has become a monthly treat for me and a couple co-workers. Fantastic wine list, amazing food, small portions but worth every penny. You just have to get a little wine-drunk first and savor each bite. I wish I had done a review when this was still on the menu, but I am going to mention it anyway...foie gras creme brulee. Yep, most amazing thing I have ever had in my entire life. I couldn't tell if I was eating a meal or a dessert, omg, if you guys are reading this please, please bring it back! I have only sat at the bar, but service is always attentive even when its busy. Until last week I was only in on weekday nights, but I stopped by for a martini by myself on a friday and it was packed! Definitely a fun scene on the weekends if you are looking to meet people or come in with a group, probably not as good for a date seeing as it was super loud, but good for them for being busy. A+
Great food. Really cool ambiance. Love this place.

Went in on a friends recommendation last night. The place has a bigger city feel and a great whiskey selection. Started at the bar with manila clams and the pork belly...wow. Moved to a table after that and split some pastas and steak. Great food across the board. Solid ambiance and knowledgeable staff...I will head back soon
Went Back for drinks and those crab Agnolotti, EXCELLENT!
Performative staff, the quintessential passive-aggressive cool kids manager, speaks to Latino employees like they're dumb and have no senses. Yay, how liberal!

i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate i hate

I go to this place often to grab some oysters. Usually have a great experience. Whoever was the hostess tonight made me never want to return. I walk in at 10:25 to be seated and am told their kitchen closes at 10:30. Which is odd cause I've never been told this especially cause I only order oysters and a few drink around this time and day. Needless to say I won't be back.

I am still reeling from shock of how horribly myself and my family were treated. I, visibly pregnant, was seated at a table with a bench on one side and 2 chairs on the other. My 2yo and 5yo were both sitting with me on the bench side waiting for my husband to arrive. There were 3 other similar tables next to us, all still unseated. The hostess kindly brought us crayons for my children to color on the paper laid across the table. My daughter was coloring, never straying once from our table. My son was guardian of the crayons. On three occasions, my *near 2yo* screamed loudly "MINE!" when my daughter went for a crayon. I am well aware this is less than ideal. It is a phase he is in, screeching any time he is excited or mad or expressing emotions. Before and after each of those moments, he was calm and happy and just fine. Each time he did it, I did my best to get him to stop immediately. We had been there all but 10 minutes. The manager, Christopher Fischbach, approached me and said "You are going to have to reign this in." I asked "excuse me?" And he said "you are going to have to reign this in. We can't have your children running around and the screaming will have to stop." I replied that my daughter hadn't left the table once and then asked how he suggest I stop my not yet 2yo son from screaming?" He said he didn't know. I asked "and what if I can't? Will we be escorted out?" And he said "if it is excessive, maybe so. We have to seat these other tables."At this point I was so incredulous, I could not believe this was being said to a paying customer, let alone the fact that a child was being targeted. I asked if this was routine for them, he did not reply and he walked away. I still cannot believe this happened. I am appalled. I am ashamed to say that we stayed, but I refuse to be bullied. Yeah, they got my money, but I have my dignity. And I hope Christopher (who, no, does not have children of his own) treats families trying their absolute best with the respect they deserve moving forward. He was a pretty massive disappointment to humanity tonight.Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money here. The food was not remotely worth what they lack entirely in service.

Transphobic environment. As you've probably gathered, my partner is a transgender woman and I fully support/love her, we were eating at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Southcenter when my partner said she felt someone staring at her, I was going to assure her that kno one was staring, however, I was appalled to see this kid working there standing in the kitchen entrance pointing at her, I stared the kid down until he walked away. I immediately asked for the manager, the manager who came over to help us was completely drunk, he asked us if we were sure he was pointing at us, and he offered to pay for our food. This place is a whole bundle of bad memories for us now. Time to go to Cheesecake Factory instead.

No sign out front. Just a door painted pink. When we finally found it, it wasn't open yet but someone came to the door and said that if we wanted to wait until they opened in 20 minutes we probably couldn't get seated right away because we didn't have reservations. Kind of a snotty attitude as well. So we just walked away.

The food and service doesn't matter for this review. Our waitress wore a t-shirt that said "My Body, My Choice, My Abortion". I don't care what your beliefs on this topic are. Any establishment with such little class and decency that would allow an employee to dress like this isn't worthy of visiting. Shameful.
This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. I would give them negative stars if I could.
If I could give thus place zero stars I would. They are racist!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!
I went there and I noticed the door. IT WASN'T PINK! Why?! Please paint it pink! Never go here again if they don't paint this door!
The only restaurant I have ever walked out of-TWICE

This is my favorite restaurant and my family and I have spent a lot of time here. Tonight sept 15th 2018 we called and were told we couldn't make a reservation and to just come in. We arrived at 6:50 and were turned away saying that there is no space for us ( there was plenty of space as we could see) We were told there was a burlesque showing going on later in the evening in the back. The lack of communication makes me never want to come here again.

Arrived to the restaurant with reservations to find the menu so offensive with anti-Trump item names. Way to offend patrons who want to support your restaurant. Your employees are mandated to obey the owners political views - no thanks. Never will we support your business. Service was terrible once we expressed being offended.

We made reservations through open table and received excellent seating in the dining room. I have been to the pink door for many many years and for many occasions, however on this particular occasion we were celebrating 2 birthdays. We enjoyed a very nice lunch for two, linguine vongole and the squid ink pasta seafood special.The awkward moment arrived when the server brought us an empty plate with two birthday candles absent of anything except the two candles.We felt as though he presented an "empty" birthday wish. I am still dumbfounded by the gesture. Honestly I would have preferred no recognition rather than the empty plate presentation. That was the one star reception we received. My friend had flown in from San Francisco for this luncheon and it was immeasurably disappointing.
Rude Manager! Dont waste your time going there. Manager (blonde woman) was very rude to us.

Posting political views on your menu is completely unacceptable. The first thing I looked at was the drink menu, only to come across a drink called "Dump Trump" I find this offensive and arrogant. I will not be back nor will I recommend The Pink Door to others.

$20 per person for "Theatre Seating" for their Burlesque show means cramming chairs in around the dining tables. They wouldn't take a reservation for dinner, but made us prepay to sit next to the kitchen for the show. I feel like a pauper in the Kings court.

The place is cute! The trapeeze performer is great. The problem was the cost of the food for the quantity and quality. We really went to see the perfomace thinking it would be a fun way to spend dinner. Well the performace is five minutes at best, every 30-45 minutes so don't go for that. The food was way over priced. I spent $44.00 for a small bowl of (premade) gluten free pasta with a bland cream sauce, a butterscotch pudding (which was pretty good) and a glass of water-yes $44!!! . Since I had to eat GF I didn't get bread unless I wanted to pay $3 more for Udi's bread. There were no dinner salads, veggies, meat for my dish or anything else. I hate the Italian Denny's (Olive Garden) but have to say I have had better meals there and for a better price. Felt a bit duped by the allure of a cool performace which is the only reason I was willing to spend that kind of money on pasta only to find out it the performance wasn't really part of the ambiance. Very disappointing.
****worst food poisoning of my life****

We planned our meal two months in advance, reserved a table, and hoped to top off the last night of our Seattle vacation with an excellent view, meal and drinks.We were seated on the patio, jammed into a corner but jutting out into the walkway, where we were jostled by staff and other diners. We ordered sodas while taking a moment to look at the wine menu, and decided to share an order of the calamari with spinach. This was okay, a bit overcooked and chewy, but we had high hopes for the meal - I ordered linguine with clams, and my husband ordered clams and mussels.I had one bite of my pasta with clams, and couldn't eat anymore. The pasta was overcooked, but all of that was masked by the amount of sodium in the "broth" - you could taste nothing BUT salt, as though a cup of it had been poured into the cooking liquid. The acidity burned my tongue and scoured the inside of my mouth. I couldn't taste or eat properly for two days afterward. My husband's clams and mussels had no seasoning or taste, other than that of steamed and overcooked seafood. No garlic, wine, herbs or anything else. It was as if they'd steamed the shellfish and dumped them in the bowl. Also, no pasta or other sides were served with that dish: $26 or so for a bowl of flavorless steamed mussels and clams. We declined to order something else, and asked for our check. This was the only time in our lives that we've ever walked out of a restaurant. Although the manager comped our soda and calamari, we left a comparable amount on the table for the waitress and staff. We figured they shouldn't be left without the tip they'd have received had the chef and kitchen staff not put out such an embarassing "meal". We spent an hour trying to find another restaurant that was open in the area after 9 PM, which oddly enough is not easy to do, especially as we'd walked from our rental to The Pink Door.As far as ambience and staff: the greeter and our waitress were very nice. The place was okay, but other than some cute decoration and a good band, it wasn't exceptional - certainly not enough to balance out the mediocre starter and inedible meal. I can honestly say I'd not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

the food quality was not special to pay $115 for 2 people. the pasta tasted fresh but the chicken tasted like a box of sand which is very sand, dissappointing in my opinion. the desert wine tasted i literally yacked two. the desert was very decent but again over pricedthe ambiance was really extraordinary i would say that but other than not visiting seattle because of this

I recently visited Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle for the first time, and unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. While the ambiance and drink selection were noteworthy, my overall impression was tainted by uncomfortable seating, lackluster food, and an unpleasant aftermath.Let's start with the positives. The restaurant's ambiance and wine selection create a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere, making it a suitable spot for drinks and socializing. However, when it comes to the dining experience, there are considerable drawbacks.The seating arrangement was notably uncomfortable, detracting from what could have been an enjoyable evening. The chairs lacked ergonomic design, making it difficult to relax and fully savor the dining experience.Turning to the food, I ordered the chicken, expecting a premium dish given the prices. Regrettably, the reality fell short of expectations. The chicken was disappointingly dry, reminiscent of a budget BBQ chicken one might find at a grocery store. The lack of succulence and flavor left me questioning the value for the cost.Unfortunately, my disappointment did not end with the underwhelming meal. The next day, I experienced persistent gas and an upset stomach. While I'm not quick to attribute these symptoms solely to the restaurant, it does raise concerns about the quality of ingredients or food handling practices.In light of my overall dissatisfaction and the subsequent digestive discomfort, I believe the establishment should consider refunding my purchase. A dining experience should leave patrons satisfied and comfortable, and unfortunately, Purple Café and Wine Bar fell short of these expectations.

We got kicked out for not having our vaccine cards handy deapite having ample seating available outside. ironically we not only had the vaccine but also the booster AND are healthcare workers that take care of about 1,000 patients a day in Texas. So glad to get this amazing service after all we do to fight covid on a daily basis. Great way to treat the healthcare workers By kicking us out to the streets.
I wouldn't even rate this one star, they discriminated against me and my family. I will never return, I have never I my life been treated this way. Unbelievable!!!

Beautiful chic trendy downtown vibe restaurant, but...so disappointing, bad server she was unprofessional in a rush hurry forgetting things too abrupt @ table, so-so food from the over priced menu considering "What This Place Is"! Ordered 2 Wine Flights @ table server forget one card listing what we were drinking and finally brought the info wine description card half way after drinking the wine. We here just after 4p the place was not that busy! Terrible rock shrimp asparagus pizza dried out tasted like a unsalted cracker. Salads too small for the price and not that appealing looking or tasty!!!!! Parking was great only $5 after 4p underneath in garage.

One of the worst experiences. Waiter was rude and beligerant, and turned a celebration for our son's camp getaway into a miserable experience. It was so bad we walked out of the restaurant before ordering anything, even though we had no other place to go. Terrible, and sad. Management didn't care, and their fake empathy towards us was even more insulting, even as they realized the ridiculodness of the situation. Too bad, we have been there before and liked it. We will never set foot in that establishment.

I used to love this restaurant for their wonderful service and Sommeliers.  The last two times I have been there in the last two months, the servers just seemed to be checked out and going through the motions. There is no passion in their work, and they are no longer trying to create an ambiance or a dining experience, and when I drop 2-300 for a dinner for 2, I expect more. I went there this evening, and again the waitress comes over with a nice bottle of wine, but where is the sommelier? Have they gotten rid of this program where the Som comes over and decants your wine. I loved talking about wine with the Som, and thought it added a nice touch. Guess Harvest Vine and Luc will now get my business. Goodbye Purple Cafe. My filet mignon was not medium, and even though I told my server, she didn't really seem to care, and I am not one to send food back unless she felt it should return to the kitchen, and she didn't say anything. The filet came by itself, so I found myself hungry afterwards and ordered two cheese tastings which were nice as always. There just isn't anything special about Purple any longer........it's just get the customer in, and get them out...............I can feel a better energy and have a special dining experience elsewhere. Seattle has some great restaurants. Sorry Purple........won't be back. GC
Horrible place and the worst manager ever.

If you haven't noticed by now, I'm huge on customer service. This place had some of the rudest, most pretentious @$$holes I have ever met. So we went in late on a Tuesday night after a Mariners game, as my buddies sister and friend were in town from the East Coast. After ordering a shot and a drink, we were content for about 45 minutes. My buddy ordered a drink and about 20 minutes later hadn't received it. When he finally received his drink, I ordered another, and jokingly asked him if I could get it in less than a half hour. Turns out we didn't look like the crowd they prefer, so he decided that my joke meant I was intoxicated and didn't deserve to be served anymore. It was my 2nd drink in an hour, AND we had ordered food. After speaking with a manager, he agreed that I did not look intoxicated, but they don't undermine the "judgement of their staff". Maybe my joke was in poor taste, but I was trying to be lighthearted, not offensive, and if you work in a bar, you should be ready to deal with garbage from rude patrons, and a little banter at the bar shouldn't be handled like that. 0 stars is what they deserve,, and I guarantee I will never return to this place. I will say I was digging the atmosphere of the place before that whole thing happened.

Purple Cafe has been one of my favorites for the past few years and I have celebrated many birthdays and other special occasions there. Last night I came in excited but was very disappointed with the service. After waiting for some time to get our food, my table was finally served except for myself. Unfortunately, many of the pastas cold upon serving. I had ordered the purple chopped salad which was okay once I got it but that wasn't until 20-30 minutes after the rest of the table. By the time I was starting to eat the rest of the table was finished. Not even an acknowledgment from the waiter or an apology was given. I understand mishaps occur but I'd expect some sort of acknowledgment of it by the staff so I was not left waiting.
I thought that the food was pretty average. It was definitely over-priced for the quality of food. It was not bad, but it was not worth the price we paid.
Wines are over priced and list is not well put together.  Food ok but once again you can get better across the street
The food was so-so at best and our waiter had an attitude. Definitely won't go to this place again next time we're in Seattle. Thank God we were with good company!

This restaurant is a real deal! It is the place where you can find the real food at the real price. Worth paying for it trust me! See you soon! Highly recommended!! Prices are fair for most items and the food is delivered to your table in a reasonable time. They have the best service in town.I can't wait to come back here!

food is great. of course the wine is yummy but it is pretty loud. came in with a group of girls (7) and sat at a table and couldnt hear eachother talk. good for a casual meal but not if you want something more intimate i wouldnt recommend.

Ate here for dinner. Muslced the door open to a nice restaurant inside.The food was great, good selection of wines,had a great red, but don't expect me to remember what it was. Would be a a nicer atmosphere if it weren't so loud. Couldn't carry a conversation. Overall, satisfied.
Foods are ok, not sure this is American or Chinese, but it has many selections.
This is a nice place with a really nice atmosphere. If you make sure to order anything in particular, order the lobster mac and cheese. Very nice!
Good atmosphere but this place is definitely more style than substance.
This place was cool
The atmosphere was lovely, a GREAT wine list and amazing service. However, the food was a little salty. I will definitely give it another chance. Perfect location for a girls night out!
Outstanding selection of wine and a great atmosphere.

Like a model: gorgeous on the outside, vacuous inside. I adore this convertion of a bank's big windows to a chi-chi wine bar with a spiral wine column in the middle. But was I surrounded by celebs or something? I don't think I had spinach in my teeth!!!!! Pay attention to me, please. Nice full flavored cup of soup. Looks like great wine flight options. PUHLEASE though .... I am not invisible even though I wasn't showing cleavage.

Meh. That pretty much sums it up. The food was meh. The atmosphere was meh. The service was meh. Even some of the wine was meh.We had a few things off the tasting menu and a couple of that evenings specials. It was all so unremarkable that I really don't remember what any of them were.While parts of the interior are cool, it felt like a cafeteria in there (albeit a nice one). It's like they were going for European Courtyard and instead got Food Court At A Reasonably Nice Mall.My wine flight was good (I guess I chose well), but my husband's was not (I guess he didn't).It was a totally passable (if not far too pricey) evening, that I won't be hurrying back to repeat. But if I end up there again somehow? Whatever. I'll eat, I'll drink, I'm sure it will be fine. But..... meh.

Came for a date night, ambiance was among the best. Food was good although I think we got youelr typical dinner burgers & fries. Service was acceptable. Would go again for memorable nights. Pricing was fair.
Everything about this restaurant is very good. It's a large open space with comfortable seating and great service. The food is quite good.

We came here for dinner and made a reservation immediately. It's a huge cool place, and the decor is beautiful, however I think they could happily use more lighting when the sun goes down it feels really dark and difficult. I think they have an intimate feel but it's completely dark.We ordered appetizers, which came out quickly. However, it takes a long time for us to heal ourselves after being cleansed. The food was great; I enjoyed the burrata and calamari appetizer, but found the duck a bit dry.Overall would get it here but again due to cheap service.
Love this place! Large selection of wine and exquisite hand-crafted cocktails. Every appetizer we tried was fantastic, but the Gorgonzola dates are by far our favorite!
Food was delicious, service was great. Great date spot. Close walk from the water. Sit at the table or bar and you're in good hands.

The food was prepared well and everything was simply in the perfect spot. The lighting is sufficiently dim to set the disposition . My beau cherishes the spot, we come here consistently to have our dinner. The staff is warm, inviting as well and they got you covered for every one of your necessities.

I don't live in the city so when I do get to go to the city I have a list of restaurants I want to visit. This spot being one of them. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience - from the food, to the service to the atmosphere. Come here if you want a great time and great food.

I love the downtown Seattle location's atmosphere! The only issue is that it can be a little busy and sometimes the wait is long between check-ins from the server. The food is incredible and, of course, the wine is amazing. Would recommend for a nice date night!

I had lunch with my coworkers there for the first time. The atmosphere was good, really like their wine case. The food was good - I ordered the Spaghetti and meatballs - so so good. The only complaint I have is that the wait time was too long. I was there during the peak lunchtime, so I think this could be acceptable. Also, they have great dessert menu. I had the Creme Brulee. I definitely will be back to try them all haha.
We had a party of 6. Service was prompt and our server was very knowledgeable about menu items.
Pretty good food and a cute place.
Amazing pizza! The wine (of course) is amazing as well. I'll be back again soon.
Could have been a 5 except for the screaming kids. Don't go here for a quiet dining experience.
The food, wine, service and atmosphere were great. Had a great girls night out here. Will definitely be going back.
Pleasant place for weekend out! Parking is a little inconvenient though.
I love the sandwiches and salads but they are very expensive. Salads will run you close to $15 not including drink or anything else.
we really enjoyed this place. great food and great ambiance.
Ambiance is lovely. The food here is delicious! I'm a huge fan of the baked brie. Will come back for more!

This is always a restaurant that I get excited to go to. It can sometimes get a little loud, but the food always makes up for it! I had a special of theirs a while back that was a steak and risotto dish, and I still dream about it! The service is almost always good, and the food is amazing, but I'd highly recommend making a reservation!

This is the place to go for great wine sampling. Whether you try a flight or taste by the glass, the selection of wine here is extensive. They have really great small plates and happy hour prices as well.

I just had a 20 person party in one if the back rooms at The Purple and the staff, food and wine were amazing. The pairings were superb. Anna and Tyler did such a great job, I remember Anna from another very positive dining experience there. I so appreciate her style. She was attentive and handled the crowd with such professionalism. I would highly recommend The Purple!
The food was incredible, the staff was super sweet and the cocktails were perfect. If only I was wealthy, I'd go all the time..
Went there for dinner last night before a show. The service was excellent and the food was amazing!
Great place to visit.
Really good, nice ambiance.
Good food, good service and comfortable seating! Loved the layout and different options for dining and drinking here. Also a bit pricey.
Great food but service can be improved!!!

I always get something from the tasting bar including the wine pairing. I am never disappointed here; try the duck liver pate or the curry lamb empanada. The atmosphere at the purple in downtown is always good and waitresses are super nice. It is noisy, so get ready to have a loud conversation.
Great Happy Hour in Kirkland. I like the Beef carpaccio, not for the vegans, but I love it especially when it is washed with some Pinot Noir
I ordered the pesto pasta...delicious! My favorite dish we tried...goat cheese topped with cranberries appetizer. yes...yum!
Just amazinggg... Great service, nice cocktails..

I was contacted through Yelp, by the Manager, after I left my previous review. He offered apologies and wanted to try to make things right. His apologies were greatly appreciated. It says a lot. I will be back.
Fun wines and cheeses!

If you go to Purple, take your time and settle in. Enjoy a flight of wine and cheese pairing or something else before you order. I'm definitely not a wine buff and my wife is no expert, but we enjoy the ability to have a relaxing conversation and enjoy some new wines we normally wouldn't try. The staff is very helpful in recommending combinations and they don't make you feel out of place if you aren't a wine expert. The entrees have all been quite good and very reasonably priced, with the exception of the lobster mac' n cheese (although it is well worth the $27). My only complaint is how cold it sometimes feels. I would love to see a nice fireplace added to warm things up in the winter.
My favorite lunch spot downtown. One of the best wine lists in Seattle
Tha experience was amazing as always!
Coolest place ever!!!

This is such a cool place. I just found them for the first time. The decor is amazing and reminds me of something you would see in LA. The food was so good. For the prices they charge I thought they should have given you larger portions. It isn't a place I would go all the time due to the cost but it is really nice for once in a while.

Great environment to bring a friend and drink some wine! Don't go there if you want to have an intimate conversation because it's loud. All the hard surfaces make for a loud environment. Loved the food and enjoyed the Rafanelli 06 zin for $75.

Purple is a wonderful place. We did the cheese and wine pairing and it was delightful. They are only missing 5 stars because my customer service experience from the male bartender was not good. Everyone else was great though. Ill be back for sure.

Just had a group business lunch here and was impressed with the decor and the taste of the food. Service was solid and the wine list was very deep. We ate upstairs in the balcony the space is small but quite enough during the lunch hour to carry on conversations.

I love their lamb burger and sea salt caramel desserts. The pork sirloin was so-so. What was that they put over the meat? Caramelized sweet radish? It just doesn't go well with the meat. Service was good and the atmosphere was lively.

Great wine selection and a very cool decor. The wine markup isnt so bad, but that should be expected at a wine bar. They have a great wine list and good options for tastings of wine and cheeses by the flight. The bar doesnt know how to make a martini, but once again they are a wine bar. If anything, I would say they should simplify the food menu. I found it to be too many choices, found myself spending too much time reviewing the menu, but I went there for wine and appetizers, not for dinner, so I may be biased.
DInnerFood was good
Lobster Mac n' cheese. that's all i got to say.

Purple Cafe and Wine Bar is a fantastic spot that deserves five stars. The pasta was absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly prepared. The ambiance was lovely, creating an inviting and elegant atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. The service was standard but efficient, allowing the food and setting to shine. Overall, it's a wonderful place for a great dining experience. Highly recommend!

We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious as was the service. I ordered the grilled lamb chops and my wife had the dungeoness crab pasta. Both were amazing. We also ordered the spicy prawns which had a kick but were so tasty. And finished it off with the vanilla bean creme brulee.

Lovely service - the waitress was kind and accommodated a table of our choice. The place gets loud, so best to take a table or two away from the crowd if you can. Food was great - we had the calamari and pasta and both were great. Cocktails were top notch and no complaints.
Very very good indeed This is the perfect date or group dining spot.Absolutely fantastic little spot in downtown Seattle.

Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle truly delivers an exceptional experience. The ambiance instantly captures you, creating a perfect backdrop for the exquisite food. The wine and cocktail selection is top-notch, perfectly complementing the culinary delights. Highly recommended for those seeking an unparalleled dining journey

Food was great, and surprisingly they weren't busy at all for mothers day when we got there. No complaints except i wish they had checked on us a little more. I had to keep looking for someone when I needed water, or napkins or to order.Kid-friendliness: They do have a kids menu and were great to my kiddo for mothers day
Love it, amazing service, amazing ambiance, foods amazing don't know what else you could ask for.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Purple Cafe and Wine Bar and I have to say, it was an absolutely fantastic experience from start to finish! From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the elegant and inviting atmosphere. The decor is sophisticated and stylish, with plenty of seating options to suit any preference.The menu is full of delicious and creative dishes that are made with high-quality ingredients and cooked to perfection. I especially loved the cheese and charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and paired perfectly with the wine selection. Speaking of wine, the wine list is extensive and impressive, with a great selection of wines from around the world to choose from.The service was also top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff who were always available to answer questions and make recommendations. The attention to detail was evident in everything from the presentation of the dishes to the quality of the stemware used for the wine.One of the things that really stood out to me was the emphasis on sustainability and locally sourced ingredients. It's clear that the restaurant takes great care in selecting the best possible ingredients, which adds an extra layer of quality to every dish.Overall, I would highly recommend Purple Cafe and Wine Bar to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in an elegant and sophisticated setting. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a great night out, this place is sure to exceed your expectations. I can't wait to come back and try more of their amazing dishes and wines!
Good service, good food, highly recommend!
Beautiful atmosphere, delicious wine. Stopped in for a quick drink on our way to a show.

Wow-what a great time we had at Purple.There were 6 of us. We had drinks, apps, entrees and desert. All of the food was exceptional.The service was top notch too. The server was always there.One other positive is the restaurant was not loud and we could actually hear each other from the other side of the table. In some restaurants, its so loud you cant hear the person next to you when they are yelling in your ear. Not here!Highly recommended!
This was a great place. Great wine selection and food.  Service was very nice and informative.

I've been to this place two years ago for my husband's birthday. The interior has a cool vibe and there is an impressive wine display. The staff were friendly. I loved the bone marrow appetizer and the seared scallop main course. This place is on the quieter side for a wine bar. I'd recommend this place.

This place is perfect for a lunch date or dinner date. The atmosphere is calm and soothing and let's talk about their meals! They're well done and absolutely delicious! Dessert was a bit dry but I generally loved the whole experience. The décor is poetic from the choice of color and accessories in the establishment. The special service offered for a romantic date is just on another level. I think it would be had for any person to turn down an engagement  or wedding proposal that is made in this establishment. More to the service and the décor, the accommodation facilities befit loyalty. Spending a night at the establishment is an epic experience. I would definitely come back for a second date at this place and recommend it to my friends with a lot of confidence.

OK, so I am writing this about pre-COVID Purple, in the hopes that soon we will be back to normal post-COVID Purple.It's one of my favorite places for a date night, from the ambiance, to the amazing food, to the fabulous wine pairings.A wine flight at Purple was always a wonderful trip. I am holding the vision of doing more of them sometime soon....viva la Purple!
Amazing restaurant! Great staff and excellent communication
nice place, nice people, good prices

I always enjoy the service and food at Purple. I've been here before multiple times and liked it. The food and wine are always consistent. Our server was fabulous and made the whole dining experience remarkable.

I found this place by chance. I found the food excellent, and the wine list was impressive. We had the cranberry chicken salad and Lobster Mac & cheese. We enjoyed our meal so much.Everyone was incredibly friendly & helpful.
Yum yum yum! This is one of my favorite spots up north and the wine list is amazing! Try the lobster mac and cheese and you won't be disappointed :)

Delicious food and the wine selection is AWESOME. I don't know if they have it on the menu anymore but awhile back they had a lobster mac and cheese which was FANTASTIC. I hope they bring it back to the menu.
Love this place! Been back several times. Everything is great, but especially the cocktails. Delicious.
Located downtown seattle. Great food and ambience.  The service was amazing. Our server was on top of it and extremely helpful. High quality food. The place is beautifully decorated. Highly recommend

Wow, SUCH friendly service! And the view is great. I have nothing to complain about here at all, I'll be back for sure! I had a great cabernet that I forget the name of, I hope they remember what it is haha.
Fantastic place! Food was incredible coupled with excellent service. Very nice wine selection.
It was simply amazing. Everything was great. The Brie is amazing and the mushroom soup.
Good food and really great staff.

So good! We came on a Tuesday night around 7pm, and they were already packed! We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for some seats at the bar. The ambiance is great -- dim lighting that worked seamlessly with the high ceilings & impressive floor-to-ceiling wine tower. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and made great food recommendations! We tried:- the Riesling -- sweet and fruity!- baked brie -- no need to elaborate, just get it.- seafood stew -- recommended by our waiter, and it was so good! Will definitely be back if I'm ever in town again, but perhaps with a reservation next time.

I am not usually someone who leaves reviews but i was so impressed with Purple Cafe that I thought I should! The following was excellent 1.)Making a reservation over the phone2.Being welcomed at the door3.)Service 4.) FoodFood was off the charts. I impressed my entire family. Thank you for making a special night perfect!
Love, love, love this restaurant! I've never had a bad meal here. Our sommelier last night was so attentive, and helpful. He made our night.
Great service. Food is delicious. Very crowded. Make sure to make reservations before going in.

We went here for lunch, everyone at the table ordered a glass of wine and salmon with rice. Great atmosphere, business professional setting. Excellent waiter! I highly recommend this location and we will be back again.

We got a table for four almost immediately. The service was friendly and the staff very attentive. We REALLY Really enjoyed our meal here. Probably one of the best corned beef hash I've had. The corned beef was tender, flavorful; potatoes perfectly fried; delicious rye bread and two fried eggs on top. My friend had the fried egg sandwich (provolone, bacon, egg, greens) which he thought was great. We had a vegan with us as well and the server said the chefs are really good at accommodating food requests. They made the Espanola vegan by replacing the eggs with more veggies and avocados. Everyone was satisfied. Great service as well. Facility was clean including the bathrooms. I can confidently recommend Purple Cafe to others!
This place was amazing! The atmosphere was perfect and the food was unbelievable. The staff could not have been nicer!

Purple Cafe was highly recommended, and exceeded my expectations! The decor is elegant and modern with an interesting wine twist. The menu is varied and satisfying. However, the true highlight is the staff... They were warm, charming, and so knowledgeable about their products & features! Janice, the Sommelier is elegant with a fun spirit, and will guide your wine journey like a true professional. This place is legit!

Love so many things about this place. Great wine selection and lovely small plates. I also had one of the best soups I've ever had here--it was the soup of day so sadly it isn't there all the time. I've been here several times and it's always good. Even nice if you are flying solo and just want to sit at the bar.
One of my favorite downtown spots for wine. Vast selection and very good service. I also recommend the lamb sirloin or crab cakes here. They're ******* outrageous.
I work near by and decided to check it out after work. So good!!. Came back two days in a row because i was so in love! Definitely a new after work unwind spot. Love it!

Went to Purple café with my fiancé on our first anniversary and it was perfect date!!It was so beautiful inside(especially the wine tower) and the service was good, food was great.Everything was perfect and even our server gave me a wine for free when I told him that we are here to celebrate the anniversary. I would like to visit again!
Walked in based on yelp review and we're not disappointed. Amazing!! Every dish was a culinary delight.
Love love love this place!! Amazing food to die for and an even more wonderful wine list! This is a must go spot for everyone!
Great atmosphere/food/wine, easy parking

We just had tapas and drinks. Everything was very tasty. Decor is modern/eclectic. Service was very good and helpful with suggestions. Oh yeah, desserts were great... try the chocolate caramels with sea salt.
Great food, ambiance and service. Worth every penny!!!
YUM! The pizza special was soooo good! And, they have great wine too.
This is by far my favorite resturant, everything on the menu is absolutely fabulous! Great for happy hour!
Great, creative food. Loved the wine flights! Made me want to take a vacation to the vineyards! Waitstaff was very pleasant, patient and helpful. Cool ambiance too.
LOVE!!
Nice atmosphere...service is excellent...if your in downtown Seattle. You should definitely stop by and grab a drink...will not be disappointed..lots of attractive women around...
Everything was perfect. Food was amazing!!! Service was great. Price was right.
This place is SO good, and gets better every time!

I love Purple Cafe! Their baked Brie is to die for. And, I am in love with their lobster mac. Did I mention how much I love their baked Brie? Warm right out of the oven, melting all over the plate, fresh cut grapes on top with fresh baked rosemary flat bread. #mmm
Great small plate menu
Amazing, from start to finish!

I recently had the opportunity to take my girlfriend here for her birthday. I wanted to take her somewhere nice and make it memorable for her. She's a wine and cheese lover so I knew she'd appreciate this place but I also wanted to take her here so she could try something new as she doesn't have a very adventurous palate.First off, the ambiance was nice and romantic. She loved the tower of wine and spiral staircase in the middle of the restaurant. We started off upstairs in the lounge with a drink while we waited for our table and then headed to our table where we chose from the Tasting Bar menu.She was feeling a little adventurous so we had the the Duck Liver Pate and the Ahi Tuna Poke which were both spectacular. For our entrees, the lady chose Duck Confit and I had Filet Mignon. She LOVED the Duck and couldn't stop raving about it.After the numerous bottles of wine and all the delicious food, I'd say we had a pretty sexy evening.
Amazing!
Love it. Really nice place. Try their salty caramel chocolates :)
I went with my boyfriend last night for a "date night" very classy and ultra hip and modern.

Took my girl here for " date night" and they did not disappoint.The atmosphere is perfect for a nice semi classy date. They had great food options beautiful selection of wine choices.Try a few different wine flights, its a better bang for your buck kind of thing.You will not be disappointed. Oh and save room for desert!
Great Place great wines!
SO AMAZING! I had the lobster mac & cheese and it was to die for!
Great place for lunch or dinner. Definitely worth a try!

Five of us sat down Saturday for a last minute 10pm reservation and we started by asking the waiter for an exciting, well priced, bottle of Pinot. Naturally, we got the look one gets when asking for exciting pinot and a "Well, pinots are usually more mellow than exciting," yes we said, exciting but mellow will be fine.That interaction managed us the sommelier who came, chatted, and quickly returned with a few fist fulls of bottles and glasses and our dinner for 5 turned into a wine tasting for 5. We all learned something, and chose a bottle, which was great. We dared not ask its cost though we had asked for "value." A few "tasting" rounds of apps, some salads, and some great entrees, I had the pork, done nicely, and the to die for deserts..... we picked up another bottle. The check arrived and our new favorite was only $30, very nice Purple, very nice.But what blows me away about this place is the size of the space. It has got to be one of the biggest, openest venues in seattle with the giant wine rack spiraling up the middle. I think you just feel really good here, you feel out and alive as you look at the downtown buildings though the two story windows. Just go already.....
Do yourself a favor and get yourself a cheese plate with a wine pairing. DIVINE! Great Atmosphere and great booze. I'll be back

I'm usually not that big on salads, but theirs are fantastic. The roasted red pepper & goat cheese one is something I have cravings for from time to time, and the apple, walnut & stilton salad is great, too (it comes with a light, sweet, interesting champagne vinaigrette).Mondays are half-price bottle night. Recently, I was here with two friends and we shared a cheese flight to start, then we each had an entree and dessert, plus we shared a great bottle of pinot noir. It worked out to $33 each, including tip. You can't beat that!Their sorbets are always creative, fresh and delicious, and I love their sea salt caramels (you can now get an order of sea salt caramels to go, by the way! They make a great hostess gift).I love the decor here, too. Service is a tad slow, but knowledgable and friendly. When my husband and I went to lunch here as a little celebration on the day we picked up our marriage certificate, they brought us out champagne and sea salt caramels--on the house!We go here five or six times a year, and every single experience has been great!
If I could, I'd fly to Seattle just to have dinner here. J'tadore, Purple.
BEST wine bar hands down. Killer Filet Minion!
We were there for our anniversary and we love it! Our first time and certainly won't be our last!

What can I say. I loooove Purple. The General Manager (Stephanie) is wonderful and always makes sure we are well taken care of. Their spectacular daily Risotto specials rarely fall under 5 stars. And they have a few nice selections of wine..hahaha.
It is a great place, in my opinion the best overall restaurant in Seattle. The service is excellent, the food is good enough and the setting is just perfect.

Rude , racist waitress, anything I asked him he was saying idk , giving me bs and attitude, he asked my friend for their ID AND SAID THE ONLY ID WE ACCEPT IS FROM US AND CANADA NOTHING FROM EUROPE. Wth is that supposed to mean??? He asked us to leave just like that.
Not.Very good . Small portions .took a long time to get our food . Would not come back . Not good service

Damn our decision for choosing Damn the Weather. Terribly Disappointing. Please Note:1. They do not take reservations - 45 minute wait for a party of six. When we were told our table was ready, we were then sat at a 4 top. Yup!2. Food overpriced - $16 for a hamburger slightly larger than a slider. Very salty and undercooked. The side that came with it....pickled onion. 3. Why our two pasta dishes were served in a french onion soup crock.....no idea. Pasta was mushy, over salted and lackluster.4. The smell in the restaurant was very off pudding. I could go on. Save your self the disappointment and go elsewhere.

Usually try I keep reviews to myself in my collections. With the amount of travel I do I just use YELP as a reminder of where I've been and where to go in my quick layovers, but this one I feel I had to

The drinks were ok and the bar was nicely decorated. But while sitting at the bar i heard one bartender talking badly about another customer at the end of the bar.
We went fairly late at night just for a little to eat and some drinks. We liked the atmosphere, but thought the food was only OK. Go for drinks, not food.
Great Burger - Outstanding. Ate here with a group from work. Great place.

Positive: Very attentive service. Space came at a high price. No happy hour. Cocktails were good but very small, same for appetizers. 120 bucks for three cocktails and three appetizers, and not being particularly satisfied with the portions or the flavors I don't want to go back.

I kept on coming back for the oysters. The freshness, the plating, and the sides are amazing. The food is pulling me to come back. The service in addition will make your dining experience genuinely fine. All I can suggest is more spaces for the customers, it would be a step up.
Outstanding food...best salad we've ever had. Belgium Whit was awesome. And our Bartender, Emma was Outstanding! Great Customer service ! Would highly recommend this establishment

I kept on coming back for the oysters. The freshness, the plating and the sides are amazing. The food is really pulling me to come back. Though the location is a hole in the wall cause if it's the peak hour, you just have to wait for the costumers to be done with their meal, yet it is worth the wait I must say. With all that food? Why regret on waiting.The bar is gorgeous, I like it very much. The drinks they serve is exceptionally flavorful, you can tell that it is mixed well. The service in addition will make your dining experience genuinely fine.All I can suggest is more spaces for the costumers, it would be a step up.
Great cocktails. Beautiful space. Food was very tasty. Only complaint is price-- too high on the food.
Cozy little cocktail bar. I sat at the bar with my friend. Bartender suggested us a cool place to go. High end drinks. I feel it was over priced but good non the less.
Good food, cool space! Can get a little loud at night time but other than that, a good dinner spot! I wasn't impressed by the wine..
Love this place! The atmosphere and drinks are spot on.
This is a great little happy hour spot!
I had zucchini noodles and they were really good!
Make sure to get the fries!
Haven't been there, but that's 5 Stars for a hella cool name. I'm sure it's also a lovely spot.

A Cocktail Lover's Paradise: Damn the Weather Sets the Bar High!Damn the Weather is hands down the best cocktail bar in our local area, and it has never failed to impress me with its extraordinary libations and charming ambiance. From the moment you step inside this hidden gem, you know you're in for an exceptional experience.The atmosphere at Damn the Weather is nothing short of inviting, with its cozy and chic interior that strikes the perfect balance between elegance and comfort. The dim lighting sets the mood for an intimate evening, making it an ideal spot for catching up with friends or enjoying a date night.Now, let's get to the heart of the matter - the cocktails! The mixologists at Damn the Weather are true artists, and their creations are nothing short of magical. The cocktail menu is a carefully curated masterpiece, featuring a wide array of unique concoctions and classic favorites, all crafted with precision and creativity.Every cocktail I've tried at Damn the Weather has been a revelation of flavors. Each sip reveals a perfect fusion of ingredients, resulting in a symphony of tastes that dance on your palate. Whether you prefer a refreshing and fruity libation or a bold and spirit-forward cocktail, they have something to cater to every preference.One of my personal favorites is their signature cocktail, "Damn the Weather," which lives up to its name. The combination of spirits, fresh ingredients, and a touch of artisanal flair makes it a must-try for any cocktail enthusiast.The attention to detail in every aspect of Damn the Weather is commendable. The bar staff is not only incredibly knowledgeable about the cocktails they serve, but they are also friendly and attentive, always ensuring a seamless and enjoyable experience for patrons.Furthermore, the bar's commitment to using high-quality, locally-sourced ingredients is evident in the taste and presentation of each cocktail. It's clear that they take pride in their craft, and it shines through in every aspect of their offerings.In conclusion, Damn the Weather is a haven for cocktail lovers, and it's undoubtedly the crown jewel of our local area. If you're looking for an unforgettable evening filled with exceptional libations and impeccable service, this bar should be at the top of your list. I can't recommend Damn the Weather enough, and I'm already eagerly anticipating my next visit to explore more of their delightful cocktail creations. Bravo to the talented team behind this cocktail paradise!
Love it here. Always have good food. Definitely will be back for atmosphere, food and drinks

Another place with a fun name in town that I love. It's hugely popular, so be aware that if you don't make reservations you may have to wait for a while. The ambiance of this place is so nice and the food is amazing while the sauce had the perfect balance.

This place was amazing. The food, atmosphere, and wait staff were all incredible. We had about a half-hour wait before we could be seated, which is to be expected on a Saturday evening. Our waiter was fast, friendly, and very attentive. I had the Cacio e Pepe. It was amazing. I had everyone at the table try it because it was so delicious. I want to go back and eat it every day.

the food was delicious. Every item we ordered was flavorful and tasty. they made sure everything is in proportion. Enthusiastic service staff. The accompanying services are good. will come back here!!
Damn this restaurant is sooooo good! Everything was fresh and the wait wasn't too long!

the food was absolutely delicious. Every item we ordered was flavorful and tasty. they made sure everything is in proportion. Enthusiastic service staff . The accompanying services are good. will come back here
Good atmosphere!!!The food is good !!!We enjoy the evening!!!Will come again for sure !!!Will recommend to friends and family !!!
Wonderful. Wonderful. Wonderful. Environment, service team and just being there. Best that can be. Thanks.
Loved this place. Low key and trendy. Popped in for a dessert. Warm chocolate brownie topped with a peanut butter flavoed ice cream. Delicious! Good service too.
Great for meeting up with old friends over good cocktails. To get a good atmosphere, You will not be disappointed.

This place was amazing. The food, atmosphere, and wait staff were all incredible. We had about a half hour wait before we could be seated, which is to be expected on a Saturday evening. Our waiter was fast, friendly, and very attentive. I had the Cacio e Pepe. It was amazing. I had everyone at the table try it because it was so delicious. I want to go back and eat it every day. This place rocks.
I'm a big fan of their Fernet. Also beer.
Best drinks in the world. Truly.
Unimpressive meal. French toast was cold when served. Only one server for the entire indoor dining area during weekend brunch time. therefore sluggish service.

I was really looking forward to celebrating my mother's birthday at Musang, especially after highlighting the occasion on our reservation. Unfortunately, the experience fell short in several ways. Despite our clear instructions, the staff completely overlooked the birthday, even going so far as to bring a dessert for the birthday celebrant at the table next to us. To add to the mix, our leche flan was forgotten for about 15 minutes until we had to remind them.On a positive note, the ambience was quite nice and the setting is definitely inviting. However, the service needs a lot of work if they hope to match the quality of their decor. Overall, a decent spot with plenty of potential, but the service mishaps really detracted from what should have been a special celebration. Three stars.
Not open on 8/10. There wasn't a notice or anything on the window :c kinda disappointing

I finally snagged reservations for Musang at a decent hour for dining with friends on a weeknight after work (plan ahead folks!). I was super excited to try this "elevated" Filipino food, as my experience of Filipino food has been more limited and more casual. The interior was inviting and warm, design that has been considered but isn't fussy or pretentious. The waitstaff were friendly and informative, able to answer our questions about ingredients and portions to share everything family style. I started with an Ube Lemon Soda. Wow, don't miss this delicate, refreshing vanilla lemon drink! I knew I definitely wanted the lumpiang and pancit, my go-to Filipino choices. My dining companions had little to no exposure to Filipino food and one person doesn't eat anything with seafood, so family style eating limited what i would normally choose just a bit. I am not a huge beef fan, but l love short ribs and the wait person recommended them, so that was our main. We rounded out dinner with a Brussels sprouts dish and garlic rice. Lumpiang and pancit are definitely done deliciously here. We were all scraping the pancit sauce onto our rice (definitely get the garlic rice!). The lumpiang probably has one of the best wrappers I have ever tasted, and the filling was a perfect blend of minced pork and shrimp, with an excellent vinegar based dipping sauce (sawsawan). The major disappointment of the evening was the short rib Kare Kare. Impressively sized and beautifully presented with a pool of peanut sauce and perfectly cooked veg tucked to the side, our meat was tough, chewy and difficult to get off the bone. The sauce/meat combo was flat and one dimensional. I have read other reviews of this dish where the meat was clearly prepared better, and described as "fall off the bone." Sadly we did not get that version of the dish. At $52 this was a dish no one wanted to finish or eat much of. The most delicious sounding dessert on the menu (a spiced apple ice cream dish) was not available, so we tried the corn bibinka. This was like a chewy rice flour cornbread with warm honey butter. Tasty, but not something I would order again, especially for dessert. Every seat was full during our 7PM visit and we were notified ahead of arriving dining time would be limited to 1 hour 45 minutes for a party of 3 due to turnover, as well as 22% service charge (they are very good about letting you know you don't have to add gratuity, but you are prompted when paying to choose a percentage or "no tip". Eater Reader, I can't choose no tip.) I don't have a problem with any of this for an experience, but it's not a structure I am going to generally choose for my average dining out. If someone wanted to go to Musang and invited me, I would definitely say yes, but I don't think it will be on my list of go-to suggestions unless I am looking for a special occasion restaurant in that part of town due to price, turnover pressure (which they aren't overt about), and difficulty in getting a reservation. However, it is definitely worth having the experience, whether you already love Filipino food or need an introduction. P.S. No pics because this was a night for enjoying company with friends who don't photograph their food.
I really liked both their spring rolls and their squers

OMG the food was every bit as good as I had heard, and somehow even better. We were happy to get an 8:30 reservation and it was a really nice experience from the moment we walked in. The interior is perfectly nice and comfortable, but our server made the whole experience top notch. He recommended his favorite items on the menu and we followed his recommendations. Excellent. Can't wait to come back!
My family is addicted to the garlic rice and short rib kare kare. For dessert, the corn bibingka is also a must try!

From the moment I took my first bite of the Kare-Kare short ribs, my taste buds were treated to an symphony of flavors that left me in awe.The menu has an impressive array of options, each one crafted with evident care and attention to detail. Every dish was a masterpiece, blending ingredients in ways that showcased the chef's exceptional skill and creativity with Filipino dishes. And let's not forget the dessert the bibingka creation that balanced sweetness, texture, and visual appeal in a harmonious marriage.The service matched the quality of the food, with a staff that was attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about the culinary offerings. If you're seeking a dining experience that transcends the ordinary and elevates your appreciation for fine cuisine, this is the place to be. Without a doubt, I'll be returning to savor more of their exceptional offerings in the near future.

Absolutely amazing experience. Great staff all around! Highly recommend making reservations if you plan on dining in. Wait time about 90 minutes when we came in, but was absolutely worth the wait with their hospitality alone. Food was delicious! The sauce for the lumpia was really good.
