Sisig and fried chicken was good. The gravy for the chicken was good on the chicken and the rice! For dessert we had the tsokoleyt tibok-tibok, which is like a mousse and was absolutely delicious that we ordered a second one. Very friendly staff and even made our youngest some puréed squash. Thank you for the excellent dining experience!!!

The food is really authentic But the location is really the problem Really hard to find parkingReally bad neighborhoodThe store is really nice and organized The food is fantastic Not amazing but pretty goodService is very very good

After we were able to get a reservation almost 3 weeks in advance I was very excited to try this Filipino restaurant. I grew up with a lot of Filipino friends, and the food here brought back a lot of memories eating at their house. After dinner we noticed the Ube cheesecake wasn't on the menu. But the waiter was so amazing to get us some, off the secret menu and I was not let down. Go and try this place!

I can't say enough about Musang. It was the most incredible meal I've had in a long time. The smoked oysters are unlike anything I've ever had- if you like oysters try this dish! The short rib was so tender it fell off the bone (actually- no knife required), and the garlic rice was amazing.
Love the service and the food! Every dish we ordered were delicious. Highly recommend. I'd love to come back soon.

We are new CA transplants (please don't hate us) and not particularly familiar with the area. I wanted to take my Filipina wife somewhere special for her birthday. All the positive reviews here are spot on - trust them implicitly.Service. It abounds here. While we had an admittedly long wait because it was Friday night peak dinner hours the hostess was so gracious and polite throughout our time, and was so with all guests coming and going despite the pace; never once did she look flustered or less than cool (even when some expressed frustration when politely explained about the expected wait). She was also spot on with our wait estimate which to me also demonstrated she has her finger on the pulse of the place and knows her craft. This gracious humble knowledge permeated all staff. Our server was awesome, on top of things, aware of the menu and could explain about the dish nuances from a deep awareness that reflected passion not a disinterested standardized script being rattled off to get it over with. Patient and kind. She was also perfectly present - there at just the right moments without hovering. We met the sous chef later and I think she and my wife must have chatted for over a half hour and while much of it was in Tagalog so I only caught bits and pieces or when she intentionally shifted to English because she was intentionally including me - in any case it was warm and vulnerable filled with cheer and the joy present in hearing of my wife's experiences that night were evident (despite her being at the tail end of a 17hr on her feet bustling around day).Wow I can't believe I've written this much and haven't even gotten to the main attraction...THE FOOD!! I don't have the childhood memories to tie everything in emotionally but can say everything was delicious. Some uninformed or close minded purists might decry it's not authentic enough because various ingredients were swapped out. However they could not be more mistaken. Substitutions were the hallmarks of the dishes and epitomized Filipino traditions to use local use fresh and don't waste. Any changes were done with thought and care, creativity and artistry. You might notice a subtle difference but nothing "doesn't belong" and, at risk of heresy, manifest themselves as overall improvements to fix something not quite right in the original. From the very first bite my wife's eyes welled up with tears of joy and remembrance to days of her youth. This flood of thought and recollection permeated the evening as each new dish presented elicited a fresh cascade of memories and tears and left her feeling, really feeling, like her dearly missed and departed Momma had returned for her special birthday to cook her a treat.We look forward to many more evenings and special meals here and eager to see and experience what new seasonal flairs the talented chefs can come up with.Thank you again to all of the staff at Musang, for making a night to remember.(Sorry I didn't get into deep detail, but for reference we had: Lumpiang, Bola Bola, Sinigang, Steamed Rice, Beef Mechado, and then wrapped everything up with Flan Cake and Tibok Tibok -- there's nothing we had that I wouldn't recommend and the only thing that would prevent me from ordering each again would be wanting to try everything else on the menu)

This place is hellllaaaa bomb. I am one of the pickiest eaters that you could ever meet and the food here is AMAZING! I seriously ordered every item twice. This place has a warm feeling to it because the whole staff is super generous and nice.I seriously can't wait to go back!
very bad service and they take a long time to eat food i didn't have time to take my food and i left this store i waited there for 40 minutes
Closed 2 hours early on Halloween? Um, me definitely thinks not.
Came here for their oysters and geoduck although they were fresh the portions were small on top of that and automatic 19% tip was charged so the value just wasn't there
It was ok. Fresh tasty food. But very little amount of food. Still hungry after dinner. Lol.
Excellent seafood and great service. (Gratuity already included when the bill comes.)
Great oysters! A really cool local spot!
The oysters were very tasty and the chili mussels top notch. Our service was friendly and attentive. We tried a little of everything and it was all good
Dawn is a fantastic waitress! Food was good. My girlfriend loves oysters and he said they were the best he has had. It was a great visit.
Guess what I ate here? Guess? Oysters! And they were yummy. Fresh, and beautifully prepared.
I love this place! The food is fabulous as is the service. We make it a priority to visit whenever we are in town.
A must try when you find yourself in Seattle, the oysters are incredible and the service was so friendly and welcoming.
Meet some coworkers for a holiday happy hour. It's our go-place after work. The food and service are always on point!
As ostras sao maravilhosas. minha esposa e eu gostamos demais. Super bom, o lugars lindo pra caramba tmb. Achei o maximo, passamos um jantar muito bom em familia
This is my first time eating a fried oyster! And by golly it is scrumptious! I think I will eat fried oysters at every oyster bar from now on! Yum!
12/10 would recommend! What a great spot! Staff was friendly, location clean, everything was delicious!

Fabulous fresh seafood served by people who give a care about serving the best. Enjoy!We had dungeness crab, chowder, baked oysters, muscles and the bread. You DO want the bread... To eat the sauce they serve in the crab body!

Exceeded  my expectations, despite the price! Right down to food quality, presentation,  and instructions.   The meal has a lot of dishes to try . lucky for me, it was not as spicy as  I had thought it would be.   Definitely recommend & going to return .
Dawn was great! Oysters were incredible. Wine was awesome. Great atmosphere. Will be back!
Oysters on ice, steamed clams and mussels, fries with cheese and garlic aioli... this was an unforgettable meal. Shellfish so good I can't wait to go back.
Everything we ordered were fresh and delicious. The drinks were amazing. The staff was helpful in explaining the dishes. Highly recommended!

It was my first time to have geoduck, and I love the texture. Also I had never compared so many different types of oyster, and didnt even knew there were so many different types. It is great that you can see live oysters so closely.
Great restaurant! The food tasted great and was well prepared. Also received excellent service from the staff. To top it off the prices were great considering the quality of food you get.
Good oysters and good serviceAtmosphere was good too!
Came again, and we are very happy with the oysters and service.
Happy hour!!!
The service was ok, not the best. They want you to leave immediately after your dinner. The food was fine, not the best....
Just ok, definitely not the best sushi in the area, and not the place I would go back to
Wasn't there????I'm not adding anything to a review when I never went to the restaurant.
Had a bunch of great sushi and got drunk.
The best Japanese food i've had in a very long time!!!!! The customer service is always great and I always feel very welcomed!
Probably the best sushi I've had in Seattle.  Unique signature rolls that tasted fresh and the service was above and beyond. Strongly recommend.
Everyone was so friendly and so polite. The food was good and the price was reasonable.

I recently had an incredible dining experience at Katsu-ya Seattle! The sushi was simply amazing, with the crispy rice tuna roll stealing the show with its fresh, flavorful tuna and delightful crunchy texture. The recommended roll of 12 was also fantastic, featuring delicious tuna and salmon. The service was outstanding; our waiter was friendly and attentive, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable meal for my party of two. Overall, Katsu-ya Seattle exceeded my expectations with its exceptional sushi and impeccable service--I can't wait to return for more!

Exquisite Sushi Experience at Katsu-ya Seattle!Katsu-ya Seattle is a true gem for sushi enthusiasts! Sitting at the sushi bar offers a front-row seat to witness the mastery of the head sushi chef. It's a delight to watch as he skillfully crafts each piece of sushi with precision and care. What makes the experience even better is the wonderful conversation you can have with the chef, sharing insights about the ingredients and techniques. It adds a personal touch to the meal that is truly memorable.The marinated tuna at Katsu-ya Seattle is simply unparalleled. The flavors are perfectly balanced, making each bite a revelation. The freshness of the fish is evident in every piece, showcasing their commitment to using top-quality ingredients. Whether it's nigiri, sashimi, or specialty rolls, you can trust that the fish will always be impeccably fresh and delicious.The atmosphere at Katsu-ya Seattle is inviting and comfortable, with plenty of seating options. The team is exceptional, providing attentive and friendly service from the moment you step through the door. You are greeted warmly and made to feel welcome throughout your dining experience. Considering the quality of the food, the value offered is outstanding, especially considering the Seattle area's dining scene.Katsu-ya Seattle is a must-visit for sushi lovers seeking a remarkable dining experience. From the mesmerizing sushi preparation to the incredible flavors, this restaurant delivers on all fronts. With its great atmosphere, friendly team, and remarkable value, it's a place that will keep you coming back for more!

I celebrated my anniversary at this restaurant, and it was the perfect choice. The menu was filled with delicious options, and the presentation was beautiful. The staff went out of their way to make the night special, with personalized touches and attentive service. I highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion or romantic date night.
Awesome spot! Delicious and fun place for a date night.
I'm a huge fan of the fried-food options they have here.
Delicious food plus good environment. Especially impressed by the warm service; I was thirsty after jogging in the morning. The waitress was very thoughtful and poured tea for me whenever it ran out.
They have really good fried appetizers here!
Fresh, delicious, raw fish here. Some places you have to worry about, I was impressed here.

My husband and I have been hungry for Sushi, however, it is not easy for us as I need to be strictly Gluten Free. We decided to stop by this new location in Seattle South Lake Union and the manager and staff were very accommodating of my needs without any difficulty. Their willingness to work with customers won our business. Of course, we thoroughly enjoy the food! Definitely will go back!!!

Our hotel, CITIZENM, down the street recommended us this place when I asked for their best sushi restaurant in town. They weren't lying. This is my top 3 favorite sushi spot and it was my first time there! I ordered:Corn TempuraSeared Spicy Albacore w/ Crispy OnionJapanese CevicheSalmon w/ Black CaviarCreamy Popcorn Shrimp TempuraChili Edamame4 1/2 RollEverything was amazing. However, one SMALL complaint, although the flavor of the edamame was yummy, it was on the overcooked side. It felt mushy, I prefer for it to not be that soft. If it's your first visit, just order off their signature dish list. You won't be disappointed.

Got to be in town for the grand opening of the restaurant the food was fantastic given the difficult covid situation the event was small and only 2-4 people at each table. The food was amazing and the displays of sashimi was out of this world (check out the pictures)
I was extremely dissatisfied with my dining experience. After reading several reviews I expected more meal options. The food was a bit too salty. The service could have been better.
This american restaurant that sells premium pretend italian food is a disgrace to the italian culinary culture. This restaurant is an absolute insult to the great Piemonte region of italy.
Ugh ! Sinking like the Titanic and people flock here. What's with the fools on the hill
While I heard good reviews on this place, I found it to be mediocre and not very flavorful.very expensive and no value at all..not sure why so many good reviews!!!will not never go back
Portions too small and too expensive for the size. In Italy they are at least three times the size for less than half the price.
The space is nice, and the bartender was good. But the food portions were small and expensive, and the deconstructed tiramisu was so ridiculous I can't find words for it.

Great service but wildly overpriced meals. We each had a pasta since we wanted to get some variety. My friend had the "famous" butter and sage, and I had the pork and beef ragu. The food was okay, but to pay $28 for a bowl of pasta is just over the top. Again, service was great, but I just can't recommend anyone pay that much for a bowl of noodles. The waiter recommended we split a pasta because they said the portion was large...which might be true if the noodles were thicker. We both finished ours in under 10 minutes (without rushing!)

I had a wonderful meal with a friend here. The food was high quality, and we expected the prices are to be that expensive, knowing the location. The bits are large enough to share, and the roasted meat special was a fantastic choice. You can't go wrong here. We were looking forward to getting back to try more of their dishes.
not as good as id hoped.. menu was a bit limited.
the food was pretty good too expensive overcook pasta

Very delicious food! We ordered one dish from each section of the menu and were pleased with each one. Every single appetizer option is to die for. Unfortunately, the seating is a little awkward not sure why two tables would be placed in the center of the restaurant where servers and other patrons need to be walking by. Be prepared for extremely uncomfortable chairs and slow service. It was a 3 hour dining experience with a lot of wait time between each dish.

Very delicious food! We ordered one dish from each section of the menu and were pleased with each one. Every single appetizer option is to die for. Unfortunately, the seating is a little awkward not sure why two tables would be placed in the center of the restaurant where servers and other patrons need to be walking by. Be prepared for extremely uncomfortable chairs and slow service. It was a 3 hour dining experience with a lot of wait time between each dish.

Went for wine pairings lunch today at this high end Northern Italian restaurant that is well known for its handmade pasta. I always think good wine must be paired with good food which this place deserves. However, I didn't like the food being served in common plate to be shared with 2 other diners. I highlighted this to the waitress but my suggestion was not taken seriously. service

On the menu there's an option to order EVERYTHING. That's what we did. It was a great experience by itself. The food are mostly tasty. The fresh pasta taste so good - especially liked the mini ravioli with rabbit. The duck breast and the tuna mayo appetizer also stand out. The service was exceptional as well. Overall it was a great experience

We went with a group of 8 and did the family style Degustazione where they literally bring you everything on the menu over multiple courses. And it is not a small amount of food. Our waiter was fabulous and warned us that we should pace ourselves and he was right.

After being told repeatedly that we needed to try Spinasse we finally did. I would say that it largely lived up to its reputation. The staff were extremely professional but also friendly. The menu had enough variation to make it possible for several different experiences but we made the mistake of ordering a succession of incredibly rich dishes rather than something light and crisp between the rich items. That said, everything was exceptional, if a bit much, but we had a great dinner and would highly recommend Spinasse, not that they need our endorsement.

I was simply getting exhausted since morning and chosen to move out for lunch. This is probably the best spot I have gone to for lunch. Just improved my evening. On the off chance that you are searching for an incredible early lunch detect this is it. This place has some of the best Italian food, I can count on my hands how many times I've enjoyed a great meal!
Seriously delicious noodles and different/delicious parm cheese.
Incredibly unique food. The portions are fairly sized. I liked getting a bunch of appetizers, it was good to taste a bunch of their different styles.

The service and the homemade pasta are incredible. Prices are high, but worth the high quality food and atmosphere. Our server was fantastic and did a great job of helping us pick the best food and cocktails.

The service and the homemade pasta are INCREDIBLE. Prices are high, but worth the high quality food and atmosphere. Our server was fantastic and did a great job of helping us pick the best food and cocktails. Highly recommend the baby artichokes and the sage pasta.
Very nice and cozy room,food as excellent,service very attentive and professional.

Excellent food. Everything that they put in front of us was very tasty. The only negative was that even though we reserved a table a month in advance we were seated by the door. All in all a very good experience though.

Everything was good, but a little too rich for me, especially the fine.pasta in butter and sage which really was like eating pure butter! Appetizer plate is okay as is the pork belly, but the highlight for me was the coconut panna cotta which was very well balanced.
Solid menu of delicious dishes. They have fantastic pasta that is made fresh.
Good very good but not as good as altura. Enough said

Quite possibly the best medium price dining experience in WA . Quality of food and service is consistently OUTSTANDING....One of the few SoCal dining experiences that feels every bit like lower Manhattan...Pastries worthy of the Champs Lysee...and how cool are those totally clear ice cubes!
Exceptional Food and service
Loved the food. The gnocchi melted in my mouth.
The restaurant expanded twice its size!
I had dinner this evening with my old friends, very delicious food , friendly servers and convenient atmosphere , I feel like eating real Italian food in Italy .

Went for dinner. The atmosphere and decor is nice enough and gives a good neighborhood italian family spot to eat. Service is friendly, but slow. The value for what you get was off-par. The shrimp were less than fresh, the salad was too trendy to be friendly - I don't know who started this trend, but a half wedge of lettuce that you have to cut up yourself does not make a salad enjoyable, nor contribute to a "neighborhood" vibe. Too high-end of an idea there--which I find really isn't enjoyable at any restaurant. Lunch or bar use might be better time to visit. Would not go back for dinner.
This is the place to go if you are looking for Authentic Italian Food! Best food, services, atmosphere. The bread is fantastic!! The deserts are great...Everyone and everything is delicious!
Great food and service!

Went to the much hyped Spinasse for dinner last weekend. Overall an ok experience, but don't know if I agree with all the positive press it's getting. Pro's: Very good tasting food, simple and very nice atmosphere/ambience, good wine list and pleasant staff.Con's: Limited menu - especially the much talked about pasta dishes, nice waitress, but slow service,We'll give it another try, but I'm not in a hurry to get back anytime soon.
good food. a tad pricey. great atmosphere.
Good staff, great pasta- we tried most of the menu between the three of us and everything was good.
Incredible food and service however the place is SO loud.

Best advice: Just order the butter and sage pasta. Holy lord that is the best pasta I've ever and I mean EVER had in this town (the only close rival I can think of is Volterra in Ballard). Pair it with carrots, and you've got one perfect meal. We LOVE this place! Great atmosphere (although avoid sitting at the bar as it does seem to draw some poser-types, and you'll be subjected to their annoying conversations) ... and go early or make reservations as the space is a tad cramped. Service is okay, but you get the sense, sometimes, that they don't really like you and that they have better things to do or that they're more sophisticated than you (which is why I'm giving it 4 rather than 5 stars -- oh, and because it's a bit cramped) ... but the food is truly amazing. Promise.

Love this place, although it is very small and doesn't smell right. Food and Service is superb!! as far as price wise, it is pretty fair. their menu is very unique Italian dish, and it reminds me of me being in ItalyGreat Place!!!

It is going to be tough to tell y'all everything we ate because we almost had one of everything on the menu. Three letters- WOW! It was hard to get a reservation earlier than 8:30, but it was worth the wait. The staff was great, our waitress was so really knowledgable, helpful and funny. There was only one thing I didn't like, Campari and Soda is not my drink of choice. Now that's out of the way... everything that was delicious... the hand cut egg pasta with butter and sage, so simple... but it was my favorite thing. My favorite entree was the whole rainbow trout. Perfectly cooked. I suggest you let the waiter fillet it for you. And then finish the meal off with a pot of Herkimer coffee. We had friends in from out of town and this is a meal we'll always rememeber.
Great experience. Will be back.

We loved the food! WONDERFUL! The decore was a little ZzZzZz but it is very homey. The service was great. The shared tables was fun, we loved it. However, they have the most uncomfortable chairs on earth!
Always a delicious place! The butter and sage pasta is iconic and you can't go wrong with it (even if you're a strict carnivore!). Love this place so much! The halibut (pictured) is a star too!

If you're a pasta fanatic, Spinasse is an absolute must-visit. From the moment you walk in, the ambiance is inviting and it has the most welcoming staff.The star of the show is undeniably the pasta. I promise you which ever kind you order, won't disappoint.
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Excellent food & service. Enjoyed the portions. Nice and well done. Nice atmosphere. Large seating available for groups.

Lovely company we had and great food. From the wine to the dessert. Thoroughly enjoyed the food. We had the antipasto, risotto, tajarin, and tiramisu as dessert. It's so tasty and not pretentious like other fancy restaurants.Everything is perfect, the ambiance is intimate but not too formal. Their staff is also super attentive and friendly. We'll be going back soon!

Spinasse has firmly secured its place as our absolute favorite restaurant, and every visit here is nothing short of a gastronomic delight. If there were a way to give this place more than five stars, I would do so without hesitation.Our latest visit to Spinasse was a testament to why we keep returning. We couldn't resist ordering our all-time favorites - the Ragu and Short Rib.The Ragu at Spinasse is, in a word, perfection. It's the kind of dish that makes you wonder if the chefs have secretly discovered a portal to Italy to source their ingredients. Handcrafted with love, the pasta was the ideal canvas for the rich, meaty, and profoundly satisfying ragu sauce. Each bite was a revelation, a harmonious blend of flavors that danced on our taste buds. It's a dish that defines comfort food; every spoonful warms the soul.The Short Rib is a true showstopper. The succulent, tender meat practically melts in your mouth, and the depth of flavors is nothing short of mesmerizing. The presentation is a work of art, but the real masterpiece is the taste. The slightly sweet undertones complement the savory richness of the dish, creating a symphony of flavors that's nothing short of extraordinary.Now, onto the only downside - getting a reservation! It's no secret that Spinasse is a sought-after dining destination, and it's not surprising, given their exceptional experience. The only drawback is that it can be challenging to secure a table, especially for impromptu visits. But I suppose that's a testament to their well-deserved popularity.The ambiance at Spinasse is intimate and inviting, making it perfect for a romantic evening or a special celebration. The staff is knowledgeable and incredibly accommodating, which adds to the overall charm of the place.In conclusion, Spinasse is a culinary treasure in Seattle, and their Ragu and Short Rib dishes are the stuff of dreams. While getting a reservation might require some planning, the experience is more than worth it. If you're a fan of authentic Italian cuisine served with passion and precision, Spinasse is a must-visit. It's our go-to place for creating cherished memories over exceptional food, and we can't wait for our next visit!
Best pasta in Seattle. Love sitting at the counter. Love love love the pasta and the sides
What an amazing dinner with my girl. Pasta was so good. Will definitely be back here again.
The best food EVER! Our favorite spot in seattle. Could not recommend it enough

This Italian restaurant is a hidden gem, literally. Overall, great indoor and outdoor experience, pretty chic and romantic. The drinks are pretty good, but a bit strong. They have a wide selection of pizzas, portions of pasta, salads, and other small plates. The margarita pizza is pretty tasty, thin, and doughy. It could have been a bit crispier, but still good. I love how the portions of pasta are homemade. Overall good experience would recommend.
This place is amazing! Best pasta I've ever had.. I had the butter sage pasta.. highly recommend!

Food was awesome and service was great. The music entertainment was amazing. The piano player and drummer were both awesome. The sound with each song was great and made for a great dining experience. would highly recommend the musicians and the venue.

good lord, the food is amazing here. i only got to try the rabbit ravioli and butter/sage noodles, and both were spectacular. The service was a little disjointed, and i found the pace to be variable, but overall a great experience. I found the wine to be a bit overpriced, but everything else was on point.
one of the best meals i've had in a while. thanks for all of your suggestions. try all the pastas!
Very delicious Italian food, check it out!
The place are clean drinks, food and staff are great, I am pleasant to visit here.
We ordered from their menu with 10 dishes and they deliver quick this great food. Pasta was amazing with special seasoning and toppings. Plus the service is exemplary! Will recommend this place.
can't say enough. definitely would eat myself to harm here.
Thank you Sara for an amazing time . And the food was very Good . We will be going back .
YUM! Go during the week because the wait can be long
Incredible fresh pasta. Great service.

Delicious Northern Italian food...............We have eaten at Spinasse in the Capitol Hill neighborhood twice in the last two months and each time was thoroughly enjoyable. To start, we had the Antipasto Misto which was a taste of each of the appetizers. A great way to taste lots of their dishes. All of the pasta is homemade and I think we have tasted each of their pastas over two visits and have loved all of them. The lamb Agnolotti, which is a ravioli type pasta, is particularly good. Nice wine selection too. Highly recommend.
I think this is the best pasta I have ever eaten - spectacularly good.

Romantic. Come here if you know your food and have good taste. Amazing pasta, amazing wine list. Loved this place. And if you are lucky to get the marble round table in front, you will absolutely feel like are you in the movie, Lady and Tramp, sipping pasta together.
Not only excellent food but excellent customer service, it gets pretty busy, so try to make a reservation and be there on time, great wine selection also.

WOW! I was a little intimidated initially look at the menu and not knowing many of the words. When I found out what it was I was a little uneasy. My friend had been here before so she ordered everything for us. Despite my preconceived notions, the food was superb! We started with delicious prosciutto followed by the fried squash. The fried squash was very crispy and complimented the warm and dense ricotta cheese inside. Next we ate beef tongue which fell apart in my mouth. It was very delicious. We ordered the butter and sage pasta as well as the beef/pork ragu pasta. The butter and sage pasta just melted in my mouth. I could have eaten to servings of it. The beef ragu was equally delicious and reminded me of a more gourmet version of Skyline Chili. Lastly, we enjoyed the rabbit meatballs. They were well seasoned and tender. I would come back and order everything again!! Everything was very very good. I plan to bring out of towners/family here in the future!

WOW!!! I was blown away by this place. I was a little concerned when I looked at the menu because I didn't understand half the words and the ones that I did looked a little scary...(ground liver??). I was pleasantly surprised with everything I had. My friend did all the ordering for us and I couldn't say anything bad as each dish was better than the last! The ground liver paste on a cracker was surprisingly delectable. The butter and sage noddles melted in my mouth. Next time I want to try the rabbit meatballs!!

My favorite restaurant in Seattle! I was given this recommendation by a fellow wine lover and it over delivered. The menu is Piemonte inspired and the wine list is amazing. Loved every dish we ordered and the wine of course!
Great restaurant! It was our first time here. The food was wonderful, as well as the service. We will be back!

Great service, great food and great atmosphere. We moved to Seattle a year ago and while we have found a lot of great restaurants, Cascina Spinasse continues to be a favorite. The service is warm but professional and the setting is great. Regarding the food, just simple, fresh, amazing dishes. The pasta with butter is as great as everyone says but we've loved everything we've tried there. Great neighborhood spot (and we travel from Bellevue to dine there).

This was my favorite restaurant we visited while in Seattle! We were late arriving to our reservation due to traffic (like an hour late) and they couldn't have been more gracious and accommodating. We were greeted with an incredible amuse bouche that was out of this world. The restaurant is charming and quaint, the music is perfect, the dining room volume perfect, the lighting perfect, the table spacing perfect. It has an old world Italian cafe meets slightly Seattle industrial feel going on. The restaurant is not pretentious in the least! Their open kitchen offers peek a boo views into what looks like a movie set... pasta station with fresh ravioli being made, all with rustic mood lighting instead of sterile and fluorescent bulbs. The service was elegant, restrained, yet casual and personable. Everyone's food was incredible. Several decided it was the best Italian dish they'd ever had. The dessert was unreal.. Get the blackberry chocolate... It will rock your world with utterly perfect simplicity. The bar has 8 or so open seats... when we come back we'll head straight there for drinks and better views of the action. And of course more mind blowing food.
the food was definitely small portion but it was so worth it
egg & sage
Definitely go for one of the pastas -- the ragu is to die for!
Great food, inviting atmosphere.

Super friendly - a fun dining experience. It's great for both a group of friends or, better yet, a date. Everything is so fresh and well presented. Spinasse also has a great wine selection. Try the veal + pork!
Can't beat the house made pasta, charcuterie, great wine selection, and stellar service. This place is a real treat.
This restaurant is fantastic.
I dream of this place.
Seems to simple to be so good....but the sage butter pasta dish is soooo good!!!
So Good

Some of the best authentic italian food you can find in Seattle. My boyfriend and I were so pleased to finally find a place that knows how to make pasta! Every bite was delicious and since going the first time we have taken many family and friends. Just wonderful!
One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. You just cannot go wrong with their menu. Great service, great drinks and lovely attentive service.
Incredible food, outstanding waitstaff.
My fav italian joint in town..
Best appetizer I have ever had (seriously) the rabbit sausage stuffed cipolini onions at Cascina Spinasse. Never had anything like it. I would recommend this place to anyone, it's amazing.

Yum. My go-to place for romantic dinners with my boyfriend or fun good Seattle meals to impress out of town guests. The menu continues to get better and better without losing the sage pasta dish. And the people here are super friendly and nice every single time I go in. NO attitude. Fine dining isn't all about the food, it is about the entire experience. Spinasse has time and time again impressed me and pleased me. I absolutely love it here.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle beside La Spiga. The pasta is all fresh and made in the house, fun watching making pasta in front of you. Love the Russian Salad . Unfortunately is no longer on the menu:(Always satisfied when leave this restaurant.
sublime pasta. lardo :)with Cynthia and Louis. 14 yr ms anniversary
Best Italian in Seattle.Great drinks
rabbit meatballs.
What can you say it is the best. If you have some extra money and want to treat you and the wife out. This is the place. Great food great service. The best wine around.
Lives up to the hype! Love it

Don't know where to begin. Will be smiling about this meal for days. I have been bending my fiance's ear about this place since October. Finally got here tonight and it exceeded expectations. It's a Sunday and we got an 8:30 reservation- make sure to call ahead or use Open Table! Our waiter (Luis) was attentive and knowledgeable without being pretentious. He recommended a perfect wine to get us started. The anchovy topped buttered crostini set the tone- simple and spectacular! The little corner table by the window was so romantic. We started with a chickpea insalata with marinated rabbit and homemade mayo- amazing. It went perfectly with the wonderful bread. Next we had the famous butter and sage pasta and a new rabbit sausage pasta primi. For secondi we both had the pork shoulder- braised and slow cooked with anchovy and lemon- good God! There just aren't words. Our server got the rabbit sausage recipe from the chef for us (fiancé makes wild game sausage) and brought me an excellent grappa to finish things out. I could die happy!!! Will be back again and again- next time plan to try the extravagant tasting menu. Believe the hype- this place earns it's five stars in every way.
One of the best Italian experiences in Seattle. Amazing service.

Really love the food and atmosphere here. These guys are actually Americans which surprised me at first because the entries were unusually special. My expectations were high because of a friend's description. She was here with some friends during a girl night out and recently surprised me with her invitation. My expectations were met.I'm hooked! It's a little pricy but well worth it.

Very happy to see something finally open up in the former Broadway Grille location. Absolutely great location.The good:- Food is decent. Better than a diner, not too pretentious, priced reasonably. - Cocktails are great! Menu is a lot more interesting than I expected. Really diverse selection. - Service was fine - I'm sure they're still just getting sorted out.The not-so-great:- Fries could have been cooked a little longer (a tad soggy)- Hamburger bun was soggy-ish - needed to be pre-toasted- My their-take-on-a-Jungle-Bird-but-with-Calvados was a little too _dry_ for what the drink is, which was surprising (used to seeing tiki-ish drinks come out too sweet; this was actually the opposite.) Campari needs to be tamed; about a half teaspoon of simple syrup may have been in order.Overall, though, I'm optimistic about the food and service and think they'll dial it in. However, The bad:The place was barely remodeled from Broadway Grille days; they put some paint, paneling and wallpaper up and that's about it. So what this means is it is extremely loud in this restaurant. While not as bad as some places (I'm still looking at you, Union) I really hope this changes. It makes for an unpleasant dining experience.There are essentially no soft surfaces or acoustical panels at all in their front dining area which means it's mostly concrete and glass. I'm sure it'll be better in the summer when they can open the garage doors but that's only a few months out of the year.The back larger area by the bar has the advantage of height so it's likely less noisy (we didn't dine back there) but still going to be a problem especially if they plan on using the stage.There's a difference between "festive" noise levels and "I literally cannot hear the person three feet away from me on the other side of the table when he speaks at a normal volume" so I really, really hope you guys get this under control. I shouldn't have to be carrying earplugs with me to a restaurant just to get through my meal without feeling assaulted by the background noise.And yes, this is becoming a cause of mine - this city has a real problem with noise in bars and restaurants but _not everyone_ has the problem to the same degree. Some new restaurants do, in fact, get it right.Overall, though, on the right track and will check it out again in a few months.
Toasts were great. Nice to see a new promising spot in the old Broadway Grill spot.
Great food, great service, great drinks, great brunch, great neighborhood. Would recommend
Great service, awesome owner, and delicious food. The fried chicken sandwich, burger, and really everything else on the menu are great. The drinks are also excellent.
Lots the options and the choices we made. Love this quaint place with friendly service.
Excellent service and food! It's small so get there early! The decor is interesting and fun.

Earns my Mexican seal of approval for its authentic Mexican cuisine. Run by a family from Guadalajara, they infuse great care into their dishes. The Carne en su Jugo, Rajitas, and Caramelo are exceptional. They also present a plate of salsas that I truly enjoyed. The overall décor adds to the pleasant dining experience.
Their drinks are yummy and food is amazing. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.
Best food in town and the best service too  Can't wait to go back soon  Nice people who own it too

What's not to love about this place? Awesome food, drinks, and friendly service. Every month my wife and I go on a date night, and this was my date night pick. So happy we came here because it was amazing!

Gets my Mexican stamp for authentic Mexican food. It is run by a family from Guadalajara with great care. Carne en su jugo, rajitas and caramelo are great. They bring a plate with salsas which i really enjoyed. The overall décor is nice
Very great service and food, it was very filling!! For sure a great spot:) the food portions are very big as well good for sharing!

I ordered takeout at this restaurant. Good service, advice on dishes that suit each customer's needs. The food is carefully packed. The shipping process does not affect the dish. The food was still hot when we received it. I choose Picocitos and Guacamole. the food is very palatable. Good review of the service and quality of the food
The picture says it all, soo yummy!!!!

Came here for a Saturday evening date night. Ordered drinks, queso fundido, and the taco arte plate for two. Everything was delicious, and portions were large. The decor and ambiance was lovely, perfect for a nice date night with delicious food. The staff were all very friendly, and service was great. I would definitely recommend this place and will be coming back!

Coming from SoCal, this was the first restaurant we visited in Seattle and it did not disappoint!!We felt so welcome and had a great conversation with our awesome server Sthephanie - this is a family owned restaurant with top notch unique and beautiful decor! I'll be coming back here the next time I'm in Seattle!
Esta todo súper rico!!! Me encanto la margarita y la parrillada sin dula la mejor! Y el lugar es hermoso. mi familia y yo nos fuimos felices y esperamos regresar pronto!
Love, Love, Love!!! Everyone is so nice and the food is even better. Perfect location for date nights !
Excellent service, spectacular atmosphere and authentic delicious Mexican food. Undoubtedly the best Mexican food restaurant in Seattle.Totally recommended.
Excellent! The food is fantastic, the decoration is amazing. I will be back for sure.

Had a mimosa here for $6 (6.50 ish if counting tax). Good place to get your food and sit down for a drink in the middle of cravings. Honestly a little pricey for not a full glass (it was more half or 2/3s) I would've liked but overall it was fine.

We had reservations for dinner, but had to wait and the smoky smell was pretty overwhelming. The service was slow, and we waited a lot. The Octopus dish was too salty, but the Mushroom was great. The Seafood Jeon was good, and I really liked the Sujebi. The ribeye was okay, but nothing special for the price. Overall, it was a pleasant experience, but maybe a bit overpriced.

Paju is a high-end Korean fusion restaurant that aims to offer a unique dining experience by combining traditional Korean flavors with modern cooking techniques. While I enjoyed my meal at Paju, I have to say that I wasn't blown away by the flavors.The dishes at Paju are beautifully presented and prepared with care. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive, making sure that every guest feels welcome and taken care of. However, I have to admit that the flavors didn't seem to mesh together perfectly in my experience. For example, the squid ink kimchi fried rice was well-prepared and tasted good, but it didn't have that wow factor that I was hoping for. It essentially tasted like a squid ink pasta but with rice and some kimchi thrown in, which was good but not amazing.That being said, I would still recommend giving Paju another try. The restaurant clearly puts a lot of effort into their dishes, and it's possible that other menu items may be more to your liking. Additionally, the atmosphere of the restaurant is upscale and sophisticated, making it a great choice for a special occasion or a night out.Overall, while my experience at Paju was good, I didn't find the food to be amazing. However, I would be willing to give it another try in the future, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a high-end Korean fusion dining experience.

As soon as you approach, the inviting scent of a crackling wood-fire grill instantly brings to mind warm, joyful memories of campfire gatherings--a perfect prelude to the meal ahead. The menu showcases an exciting mix of flavors, and I couldn't help but marvel at the grilled branzino, which was cooked to perfection. Even more impressive was the duck, which arrived with beautifully crispy skin and a rich, succulent taste. The banchan, Paju-style, accompanying these grilled dishes were a delightful and refreshing complement, balancing the flavors perfectly.The bar offers some delicious cocktails. I can't wait to return!
Food was incredible. I enjoyed food I never thought I would! Unique! Service was perfect.

From the moment you step into Paju, you're embraced by an atmosphere that's both modern and welcoming, blending a touch of elegance with the ultimate comfort. It's the kind of place where you instantly feel at ease, yet excited for the culinary journey ahead.Let's dive into their menu, where each dish is a testament to Paju's commitment to quality and innovation. The hamachi crudo, paired with the tartness of granny Smith apples, is a refreshing start, balancing flavors with finesse. The oxtail tacos are a standout - the use of crispy seaweed shells is ingenious, enclosing tender, flavor-packed meat that's nothing short of a taste sensation. And the octopus? It's a triumph in tenderness, matched with a sauce that elevates it to a whole new level of deliciousness. In fact, every dish we tried was a hit, leaving no room for disappointment.Service at Paju is as impeccable as their food. The staff isn't just friendly; they're genuinely enthusiastic about their offerings, guiding you through each dish with knowledge and charm. It's the kind of service that makes a great meal unforgettable.A pro tip for fellow food enthusiasts: visit Paju with a group. Why? Because you'll want to order everything on the menu, and trust me, it's all worth trying. It's a gastronomic adventure that's best shared.

l love to eat at paju. it's so unique and savory. My favorite foods in there are yellowtail, bugak and, beef tartare nowadays.  Cozy place and nice service. I will keep going there and try other new dishes.
Food are absolutely delicious. We tried all the dishes on the menu during our last two visits & like them all.
Amazing! Was surprised at how great I found all the dishes.
Amazing food! Great staff! Compliments to the chef! Wonderful experience!
The food was perfect, thank you. We got fried pork (tang soo), and the chicken wings. Will be back!

Best meal I have ever had! Modern Korean. Chef relocated from a 2 star Michelin rated restaurant in NYC. Great food and atmosphere. Going to bring some other friends back later this week.3 days later....I have now officially tried everything on the menu and there I promise you every dish is over the top fantastic! Chef Jeong knew I was coming back with a friend for her birthday and he made a special dish and cake for her. My son made me promise to bring home the Truffle Bulgogi and Panna Cotta for him which he loved when he was in with me a few days ago. Chef Jeong even accommodated my daughter who is extremely difficult to please and she wanted seconds. My friends who I dined with tonight agree this is the best food they have ever had. I describe it as a party in my mouth one dish after another.

Wow, what a great addition to the neighborhood! This was a Korean food experience unlike anything I've ever had.I first took note of this place last week while it was still under construction. They had a sign posted in the window advertising "modern Korean food", and with Korean being one of my favorite cuisines, I was super intrigued and resolved to stop by next time I was visiting SIFF (it's right around the corner from the Uptown.)Last night was that night and seriously, the food here is unreal. There was only one other table of patrons during my visit so the chef (who's also the owner) came out and chatted with us for a while. He's SUPER nice and apparently he was the chef de cuisine for Jungsik (a 2 Michelin Star Korean restaurant in NYC) before moving out here a couple years ago to raise his kids. Color me impressed.Anyway, back to the food. The menu here is pretty small (there were about 8 dishes) so I think I tried about half of its contents.I started with the Sweet and Spicy Wings. Two things I want to emphasize: 1) the wings are very large and meaty (which more than justifies the $13 for 6 pieces price point), and 2) these are literally the best wings I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, impossibly crispy, and so so so flavorful with just the right amount of kick. This was absolutely the star of the show and I can't recommend it enough.Next up was the Endive Salad. I almost skipped this item because the menu literally just says "Endive" as the title of the dish and I didn't realize it was a salad, but the server suggested it and I'm SO glad I tried it. The ingredients were interesting: endive, burrata, sunflower seeds, orange, and a smoked vinaigrette. I've literally never tasted anything like it. It's smoky and citrusy and refreshing all at once. The flavor profile is so complex and I implore any adventurous eaters to give this a try. It's simply wonderful.For the entree, I went with the Truffle Bulgogi. I was hesitant because I think truffle is a little played out as a flavor and usually when a dish incorporates it, it overwhelms the entire dish. I wasn't thrilled about the prospect of having my beef drenched in truffle oil but the server highly recommended it so I figured what the hell? Once again, Paju won me over with this one. The bulgogi is pretty straightforward in terms of what you'd expect flavor-wise but with some nice touches to elevate the dish: rib eye for the beef; crispy quinoa to add a little crunch; beautifully sliced shitake mushrooms on top. It plays really nicely against the truffle, which is much more subtle (thankfully) than I was expecting. The rice was well seasoned (that's not to say it was salty) and much like the salad, all the flavors came together perfectly. My only complaint with this dish is I wanted something to give it a little kick (I like spicy!) I feel like some fresh chilis or spicy kimchi would've sufficed so hopefully they'll find a way to accommodate us fire chasers down the road as they establish themselves.I was stuffed by this point in the meal (which is saying something given my insatiable appetite) and was prepared to call it a night when the kitchen sent out a complimentary Panna Cotta for me to try. Hooooooooly shit it was good! It was served in a cup and topped with a citrusy syrup (grapefruit perhaps?), sliced grapefruit, sweetened granola, and fresh blackberries. You guys. This is the stuff dreams are made of, and I generally don't use hyperbole. It was absolutely unreal.A trip to Paju will cost you a bit more than a standard trip to your neighborhood takeout joint, but they're playing a whole different game over here. It's upscale dining in a casual atmosphere with a hospitable staff and ambitious chef. I've just never had Korean food quite like this. Rachel Yang, you're on notice -- there's a new player in town. If they can hang on long enough to establish themselves, Chef Jeong seems destined to shake the whole game up.
What a great new gem! Delicious Korean fusion.
Bartenders seemed nice but I wouldn't call this a craft bar. Not recommended, I know the industry is hurting still so maybe they can't find good bartenders right now. Cute place tho.

Absolutely Disgusting!!!I don't know where all these reviews are coming from because our experience Saturday night was beyond horrific!!Place is in a tight spot in Seattle you can walk right past it. Once inside its an amazing looking little space almost like old Seattle vibe. We ordered the chicken burger and it was pink in the middle twice, Fish tasted like old seaweed, not to mention the kitchen staff didn't even have hair nets!! One of em looked like an Irish butler with his 1940s hat, they must have one of those programs where they hire the homeless. drinks came out extremely odd tasting. When we asked the bartender what was some of the alcohols used were she said " idk it's my 1st day". The place doesn't have security so the homeless wonder in aimlessly. Our server told us that a homeless person came in with a Knife last week and cops had to be called while guests restrained him!!! Im not trying to get stabbed while I eat out. It's connected to another bar so the bathroom is shared, homeless people in the bathroom clogging up the toilets and overflowing into the hallway which made the place smell horrible. We asked for a manager but one was not on duty they said. There are better places to eat around town I'd stay far away from this place. -10/10 Dumpster Level

Came back in with the gals to get a few drinks and we were shocked to see that there has been a complete flip of employees. Don't know if ownership changed but it's definitely not tye same. Bartenders were not friendly at all, all our drinks were wrong. Hope this place can pull it together

Place is not what it used to be. Seems like they did a complete staff change. Moral of the staff seems very low, the bartenders seemed like they had no clue what they were doing. Way better places around to get a craft cocktail than this place. Will NOT be coming back
Absolutely disgusting. This place has gone down hill over the past few months. The ladies and I found out a lot about what's been going on from the locals
HORRIBLE AND Terrible place. Staff is extremely unfriendly and discriminative. Save your money and go to a place that has actual heart and soul.

This place, it's a mixed bag of flavors. The oversized empanadas are a force to be reckoned with, packed to the brim with goodness. The Brussels sprouts dish, on the other hand, is a real winner, a taste explosion. Sadly, the wings are forgettable, and the sangria won't make your day. The hot sauce selection sounds intriguing, even though I didn't get to dive into it. As for the black cod dish, it had potential, but it left room for improvement. It's a rollercoaster of tastes, and just when you thought it couldn't get more interesting, a fight breaks out outside - an unexpected twist in this culinary adventure.
The cocktails are smalls and honestly not very good, the ambient is ok.  Many the next time will be good.
Came here for a company event. We rented out the 2nd floor and we had a dedicated server/bartender. The service was great and the venue
Questo ristorante è gestito da professionisti con grande attenzione al cliente. Piatti molto buoni e molto belli, ottimo rapporto qualità e prezzo.

I visited Deadline Bar during happy hour and it was an okay experience. The atmosphere was pretty standard for a bar - dim lighting and loud music. The drinks weren't my favorite or anything. I wasn't a fan to be honest. They just taste like straight up alcohol, no flavor in the cocktails. The prices were a bit high.The food at Deadline Bar was also just okay. I tried the garlic parmesan fries and they were pretty standard - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They were served with a side of ketchup. Overall, the fries were nothing special.All in all, I would say that Deadline Bar is a decent spot if you're looking for a place to grab a drink with friends and have never been before. Worth a try. Would I go again? No. The atmosphere is pretty standard, the drinks are not the worst and the food is okay. It's not the best bar I've ever been to, but it's not the worst either. A plus is that the bathrooms are very clean.. lol.

Calvin and Martin were absolutely fantastic last night. Great service, great food, great cocktails. I'll be telling all my friends to come here. Id give more stars if I could. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back!

Great food. Great drinks. No disappointments except for the price some of their drinks were a bit higher. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. Every meal comes fresh and well flavored. I was lucky to be seated right away for a late dinner. All around I had a pleasant meal but I am into their drinks. The sacred spring cocktail was lit! Would I go back? Most definitely.

Great food. Great drinks. No disappointments except for the price some of their drinks were a bit higher. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. Every meal comes fresh and well flavored. I was lucky to be seated right away for a late dinner. All around I had a pleasant meal but I am into their drinks. The sacred spring cocktail was lit! Would I go back? Most definitely.
The cocktails were amazing and the bartenders were awesome. The food was average and not my favorite part.
Classy and hip spot in Pioneer Square. A perfect place to have dinner or a drink during or after the monthly first Thursday art walk.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Dead Line, and it exceeded all expectations! From the moment we walked in, the service was top-notch--attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.For our meal, I opted for the Carne asada tacos, and they were absolutely delicious. The flavors were vibrant, and each bite was a delight. My wife went for the crispy chicken sandwich, and she couldn't stop raving about how perfectly crispy and flavorful it was.To cap off our meal, we indulged in the habanero caramel cronuts, and wow, what a treat! The combination of sweet and spicy was simply divine, and it's definitely a must-have dessert at Dead Line.Overall, our experience at Dead Line was nothing short of phenomenal. The food was outstanding, the service was impeccable, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I wholeheartedly recommend Dead Line to anyone visiting Seattle--it's a true gem in the culinary scene. We'll definitely be back on our next trip to the city! 10/10, would highly recommend.
Recommended by a local so I gave it a try and I love it. The place gave an ambiance vibe which is matched with Seattle's vibe.
Drinks were ESPECTACULAR!!!! I drunk too much that night, my wife and I loved the place. Como falamos no Brasil, BOM PRA CARAMBA!!!! O servico muito bom, nao e barato mas vale muito a pena.
This is a hidden gem. They were busy but sat us quickly. The ambience is great. Such a fun place for a date night. Food was delicious. Service was great. Can't wait to come back here again.

I recently dined at Dead Line, and let me tell you, it was absolutely fantastic! The food there deserves a solid 5-star rating. The moment I stepped in, the cozy ambiance and friendly staff made me feel right at home. But it was the mouthwatering dishes that truly stole the show.The menu offered a delectable array of options that catered to every taste bud. From savory burgers to crispy fries, each dish was bursting with flavors that were simply irresistible. The burgers were juicy and perfectly cooked, accompanied by a generous portion of golden fries that were seasoned to perfection. The ingredients used were fresh, and the attention to detail in the presentation was commendable.

I was looking for a place with awesome food and an outdoor area to enjoy the nice weather and this was just perfect. I love the name, as I'm always dealing with deadlines, I loved the patio and the food was awesome. Really cool place. Beyond that the atmosphere and service was amazing.
What a great night out!!The drinks were really good w cute names. The food was awesome. So was the service.
Romantic atmosphere and delicious foods!we went there for my birthday. thank you so much!

Oh my god, the Chorizo Tacos and Pork Belli Cauliflower Tacos are to die for! The food is phenomenal. I went there with my husband a couple of weeks ago, and we loved it. Great service, friendly people, amazing location... we will be back for sure!
Great food, great drinks great setting and super friendly staff. Everything was awesome.
The cocktails were interesting and the ambiance was perfect! Excellent crowd and overall had a terrific experience. Would go again.
Cheese fries and chorizo tacos are great and the bar manager Dev is the man!
Drinks were good and and small menu was excellent. Great little find. Service was good to
This is a delightful place to grab a drink!
I found the Dead Line to be a lovely spot to grab a drink.
My favorite place to go to for a nice cocktail!

Where to start... I had popped into this place a few times on my way to a game or when at a show at the Central and service has always been amazing, and now if I'm near Pioneer Square I make a point to stop into this wonderful establishment. My husband and I even ended up doing a small court wedding and having our reception here in one of their private rooms, The Gold Room. Bar service wise; they had a server that seemed to be completely dedicated to our needs and was very timely on making sure everyone was satisfied. The bar staff even came up with custom cocktails for my husband and I that many of our guests fell in love with. Kitchen wise; I was blown way by the cuisine. My husband being from Mexico originally, it was very important to me to be able to have the most authentic South American cuisine I could get (even if it wasn't Mexican specifically). The kitchen staff far exceeded my expectations by not only being amazing chefs in columbian inspired cuisine but, by asking if there was anything in particular that my husband missed from home. To the point where one of them called their mom asking for a family recipe. Needless to say my husband had food that night that he had not had for 3+ years. The staff in both bar and kitchen made the night extremely easy and unforgettable by the service of phenomenal cocktails and food. For the record the staff members that created this amazing experience where Rich (Event Coordinator), Phillipè (Chef), Tanner (Chef), and Jim (Bartender that was handed our event), and Cody (Bartender)

Amazing food. Amazing wine. Good drinks. They have this quaint little back room to host small private parties. A girlfriend threw her birthday dinner party there and the service was just amazing. They made sure our wine glasses were never empty and provided excellent service. I started with the plantain chips. They were really good. Then I ordered the octopus and thought it was delicious, but not amazing. The brisket however was over-the-moon amazing! I highly recommend it! The plates are huge for tapas but small for entrees. I needed 1 a half plates to fill up, and din't feel like I overate at all. So try this place out and be ready to share. I'd go back here for sure!

Amazing food. Amazing wine. Good drinks. They have this quaint little back room to host small private parties. A girlfriend threw her birthday dinner party there and the service was just amazing. They made sure our wine glasses were never empty and provided excellent service. I started with the plantain chips. They were really good. Then I ordered the octopus and thought it was delicious, but not amazing. The brisket however was over-the-moon amazing! I highly recommend it! The plates are huge for tapas but small for entrees. I needed 1 a half plates to fill up, and didn't feel like I overate at all. So try this place out and be ready to share. I'd go back here for sure!

We accidentally ended up here when the bar next door wasn't opening for 15 more min. We tried Deadline's door and although they weren't actually open, the manager (I presume) graciously let us in! We were so happy! We stayed and ordered a few rounds of cocktails and enjoyed their FREE apps during happy hour. These weren't just bagged tortilla chips-they were legit delicious apps. We loved them all and had a blast! I'm pretty sure my drink was the Madame something and it was wonderful! We highly recommend! Excellent customer service, cocktails and appetizers!
Great drinks. Great service. Great decor. Looking forward to coming back for another.

Third day opened and very impressive. The cocktails were delicious, the octopus was delicious, the asparagus and a wonderfully fresh sauce perfect for summer, and the ceviche was good. The host had the chef bring us a sweet tamale for desert that blew my mind. The ambience is fantastic. That back room looks so fun. Can't wait to come back.
Food is good but they are overpriced. They are understaffed. This was our first time here and it wasn't a pleasant experience.

Service is good, but way over priced. No value here. Please read carefully. we ordered the Hot Pot with Chicken. It was $22.00 and we maybe got 7 pieces of chicken. It was mostly rice and and a few vegetables. Such a disappointment. Earlier they day we ate at another restaurant in the area and the bill came to the same. We were so impressed with the meal there. we should have known, seeing all the other restaurants in the area much busier than this one. Spend your money elsewhere.
I love Korean food but I didn't need the side of racism I experienced
We always Uber eats our food but is not like anything special tofu soup is ok and seafood pancake is average kabli beef is to normal Go as a last resort .
Stone Korean Restaurant is one of my favorite place the chicken is so tasty and delicious!
Solid Korean food, also love that they're on Uber Eats!

We had dinner there Saturday night around 7:30, no reservation and a 5 minute wait for 3 of us. Had bipmbop, fried rice and bulgogi, everything was delicious and fresh tasting. The hot pots were perfect, lots of veggies, meat, rice that got crispy and a raw egg to stir in.
Everything was so flavorful and delicious. Best meal I've had in a long time. Would definitely return if I lived here.
Great Korean Food! A must for good Korean food!

I just celebrated my 25th birthday in this Korean restaurant, and I love the food here. My family was enjoying the food, and the place was so great. It feels like we were in Korea. The staves were also approachable and accommodating. I will surely recommend this Korean restaurant to everyone.
Stopped by to get a take order for Korean friend chicken, kalbi rib, seafood pancake, this was my favorite food from this restaurant. Plus all the staff are great. Worth to come back again and again.
Authentic, delicious and great prices for the quality and quantity of their dishes. What's not to love?!
Everything was delicious. I will definitely return
Best korean restaurant in downtown Seattle.
One of the best Korean restaurants in all of seattle. Authentic home style Korean cooking in a modern setting. Make sure to order the fried chicken (preferably with Beer), you won't regret it!

I heard amazing things about this restaurant. I read all the stellar reviews of this place written by fellow yelpers. I saw all the pictures. I went with high expectations. Maybe it may have been different had we dined in. Who knows, but what I ordered vs what I paid...something doesn't seem right to me. First, the uni ikura bowl. As you can see, the amount of uni in this bowl is ridiculous. Granted, they said it's not uni season and that uni they have are quite small...ok.... but when you charge me $58 for this bowl, I expect a little better. Let me go back on the price of this item. This donburi is originally $38. That's what's listed on the menu. No where on their website or at the restaurant, does it say price will adjust depending on availability. No where does it say it will adjust as we'll be paying market price, but they said they'll have to charge us $58 because it's not uni season. We paid the price thinking we'd at least get what we paid for. What we got is actually not even worth $38. Sorry. I think you could have done a whole lot better Rondo. If this is all the uni you had, maybe you shouldn't be selling any uni dishes, rather than hiking up the price.  Bara chirashi - this was ok. Not as outrageous as the $58 bowl. Was it worth $22? Unsure. Maybe I would have justified it had it not been for the $58 mess. Don't get me wrong. I'm not ranting because I'm cheap. I'll gladly pay $58 ..80..100 IF my food matches what I pay for. But for an establishment that serves many uni dishes, you should have either 1) not sell any after explaining low stock/low availability/ 2) explain low stock/low availability and charge the normal price 3) OR charge $58 and give that much + add something else to the donburi to justify that price.

For lunch, we ate inside the restaurant, but our meal was served in a plastic to-go lunch box.For a lunch costing over $100 for 3, wouldn't it be normal to use proper tableware instead of a plastic to-go lunch box for an in-house meal? It was unpleasant and very disappointing.

For the prices, especially during happy hour, I was really expecting more. I was quite disappointed after having read all the yelp and Google reviews. Hopefully, we just ordered the wrong items during happy hour, at least the wait staff seemed helpful. Their daily menu included a blue fin tuna handroll. We opted for the additional uni since it sounded like it was fresh from Santa Monica. We tried some uni from Santa Monica from another Seattle Japanese restaurant, Kamonegi, and it was extremely fresh. Sadly, we were disappointed with the uni from Rondo as it was either not as fresh or was a bad batch since it apparently came from the same source. The bluefin tuna seemed decently fresh and the ikura seemed pretty fresh. The handroll overall was still decent, perhaps 4/5.The Yuzu Ebi Mayo was 5 pieces of shrimp covered in a mayo mixed sauce over some green spring mix (similar mix from grocery stores). Nothing too special about this one, tasted decent, 2/5.Tasty B.B. Noodle - Uni and IkuraThis dish reminded me of a creamy pasta dish with extra parmesan cheese. There was a bit of uni and ikura in the mix as well. The uni was the same Santa Monica uni from earlier and could be fresher, especially for the price. 2/5.Bara-Chirashi DonburiThis was the reason why we tried this place, and unfortunately, we were disappointed. There were two small thin pieces of wagyu in here which is understood since its not cheap, definitely on the well done side. The wagyu was pretty good, but it was drowned out by the over seasoned rice. The rest of the sashimi seemed to be decently fresh, however, the rice was overly seasoned which drowned out the flavor of the sashimi. The donburi was quite small for the price, especially during happy hour. 2/5.Overall, pretty high price tag for happy hour in Seattle. Was hoping to get swept off my feet as far as quality goes but was disappointed. Who knows, maybe I ordered all the wrong dishes which is why this place has glowing reviews. For now, I don't think I'd return as there are many other happy hour spots to try while in Seattle.
The all dishes were so tasty. and the ambiance was so good.

Rating: 4 out of 5 stars4 out of 5 Rating (maximum points = 5)Value for money: 4Cleanliness: 4Food Quality: 4Customer Service: 5Look and Feel (Ambiance): 5 Thank you, Come Again?: 4Rondo Restaurant in Seattle is a culinary destination that I had the pleasure of visiting recently in my work trip in Seattle. Rainbow Uni Shooter ($9): I loved the combination of uni, ikura, tobiko, quail egg, nori puree, and umami soy on sushi rice. It was like a little meal in a small sake cup. The balance was just right, making it a standout dish.Corn Kara-ge ($7): I'm not entirely sure what is basted in the corn, but it tasted like miso butter to me. It was lightly roasted and had a good savory flavor with the sweet corn kernels. Yum. Uni and Seafood Udon ($24): While a bit on the expensive side, this dish was delicious. My only feedback is that it needed a little more salt and cream sauce, as it was slightly dry.Soft Serve with Miso Caramel ($5): This dessert was delicious! The texture of the ice cream was perfect, and the sweetness level was spot on. My only feedback is that the miso flavor could have been stronger.Overall, I had a great dining experience at Rondo and would definitely return to try their chirashi and bento boxes, which look so tasty!
There are not many choices in the menu during lunch hours. The food quality was pretty good, though.

We opted for takeout from this restaurant. Our order included the ox tail soup, bluefin handroll, bara chirashi donburi, and uni maze-don. Everything was fresh and delicious. The uni maze-don was my favorite; I adore uni! The ox tail soup was good, although slightly salty on its own.I'd definitely consider visiting in person next time to try their desserts!

Pretty decent restaurant. Highly recommend their Bara Chirashi bowl and Tonkatsu, which was super crispy. The Mr. Pork also tasted great but was kind of heavy. Their fried chicken, however, was a little bit disappointing.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Rondo, a Japanese restaurant that left me thoroughly impressed. From the moment I laid eyes on the food, I knew it was going to be a delightful experience. And let me tell you, the taste lived up to the visual appeal.The dishes at Rondo were not only beautifully presented but also packed with flavor. Each bite was a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of the chefs. The freshness of the ingredients was evident, and the attention to detail in the preparation truly elevated the dining experience.Beyond the delicious food, the ambience of the restaurant was fantastic. The cozy yet elegant setting provided a welcoming atmosphere, and the attentive staff added to the overall positive experience. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends, Rondo offers a perfect environment to enjoy a memorable meal.I was so impressed by my visit to Rondo that I can confidently say I'll be returning the next time I find myself in Seattle. The combination of delectable dishes, inviting ambience, and top-notch service makes Rondo a standout among Japanese restaurants in the area.In conclusion, if you're in search of a Japanese dining experience that not only tantalizes your taste buds but also pleases your eyes, I highly recommend paying a visit to Rondo. The food is as delicious as it looks, the ambience is great, and the overall experience is truly enjoyable.
Worth it! Great service and food...the decadent shrimp uni pasta dish was nothing like I've ever had, WOW! Only downside is that it's a bit cramped.

Update: I went again with some friends and ordered a Donburi bowl, but found a hair in it... which was a bit unsettling but the food was still good! I was too scared to point out the hair but it did kind of disgust me a bit.

If you're looking for a place to try flavourful Japanese food, I think Rondo is the best spot. I ordered a spicy tuna bowl, and I could choose between chicken or ribs. How I was sort of hungry, I asked fried chicken. The food was very well prepared, the size of the portion was quite big, but the star of the dish was the sauce. It tastes like an authentic homemade Japanese sauce, and the fried chicken was crunch and tasty.Also, the waiter was courteous and pleasant with all of us.

Highly Recommended! This place serves so many tasty dishes it makes exploring the menu fun. Some standout favorites include Mr. Pork Rib, Chinese-style curry donuts, spicy red ramen (actually, all the ramen!), the curry, and the donburi. Every dish brings the flavor and soul, so satisfying!It's a fantastic spot for couples or larger groups to share and enjoy together. The staff is absolutely amazing--energetic, positive, and genuinely give a damn that you have a great time.The atmosphere is another highlight for me. It's cozy and relaxed, with a lively vibe from a restaurant full of happy folk super satisfied with everything Rondo dishes up. You can't help but feel the good energy here.Yeah I like this place :)
Super duper yummy!! I ordered the ribs and they were so tender and juicy! Been here a few times and have enjoyed everything I've gotten so far. Employees are friendly and quick!

Rondo is a gem nestled in Cap Hill, offering an izakaya experience very reminiscent of bars I visited in Japan years ago. I love the ambiance and variety of food and drink options... Slightly biased here because I'm a huge fan of their sister restaurant Tamari Bar, which has a very similar atmosphere and menu offerings.The Rainbow Uni Shooters are a must-try burst of umami, creamy butteriness in a single bite. I usually feel indifferent towards the taste of uni, but I would definitely get these shooters again.Also decided to try the Uni Seafood Creamy Udon. It's exactly what it sounds like: a comforting bowl of udon noodles bathed in a creamy white sauce and topped with uni. Adding this to my list of uni dishes I would order again.The Aburi Salmon Battera Sushi was another flavorful bite. The seared salmon melts in your mouth and the smoky flavor compliments well with the rice.For drinks (forgot to take a picture), my friend and I ordered a matcha gin & tonic and a fruity cocktail I'm forgetting the name of. I thought both were pretty good.Overall, solid food and drink flavors and presentation, inviting ambiance, and attentive service!

Where do I even start? No matter how many times I go to Rondo, I will never get tired of it. With constant new daily specials, a loaded happy hour menu, and impeccable menu staples, there is always delight to be found. My personal favorites are the spicy tuna donburi, the premium bento box, and the spicy tuna crispy sushi bites from the happy hour menu! The service is always fast and the presentation is superb. It's perfect for special outings and casual ones as well. Ordering from the happy hour menu makes it fairly affordable for the quality, but even apart from that, Rondo is worth it!!
Excellent food and service can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu!

We came here looking for a Japanese restaurant and we left happily satisfied. You can not leave without tasting the magnificent flavors of the "Mr. Pork Ribs", I guarantee that you will love them. Everything was tasteful and nicely presented. It is a 10/10!

Japanese fusion with special items on the menu that changes weekly. Everything is fresh and delicious! Highly recommend the Mr. Pork Ribs and Creamy Udon (with seafood). Tables are limited as space is not huge; visit during lunch hours to avoid peak hours. Fun fact: this restaurant is one group with Baiten and Tamari Bar.
Food especially happy hour options are great! Foods mostly are tasty and reasonable prices (i guess)

The food is very delicious, you feel like you're in Japan! All the ingredients were so fresh and it tasted so good. The service was good, they were speaking Japanese throughout to make you feel like you're at a foreign country! The atmosphere of the place is not the quietest but it is somewhat private!

My partner and I ate at Rondo last night and had an amazing time. It seem like they have a lot of regulars because they knew each other by name and they sat close to the bar. The service was really great!! The food was some of the best I've had. My partner loves curry so he had it along with an Oxtail Ramen. I had katsudon and Tokyo Shoyu Ramen. In my opinion, the bill was a bit pricey but so worth it. Next time we go we will definitely bring the rest of our family.
