Came here on a recommendation for having a great Happy Hour 2-530pm. It did not disappoint! They have a $10 special that includes a beer, 5oz Sake and a chef choice appetizer. We also got the spicy tuna crispy sushi bites and the rondo maze-men. Everything was delicious and the staff could not have been nicer!
This place has excellent lunch specials and a cool atmosphere. Will definitely be returning.
Food always looks as good as it tastes. One of my favorites
The food here is amazing, I'll definitley be coming again!
Good service! We enjoyed every item we ordered, I especially loved the raindrop cake which I had never seen on a menu or enjoyed before. It was so adorable! Definitely recommend.
Never had maze-men before but ordered the Amigo and it was delicious. Had a nice kick. Ocean salad was also generous and fresh. Service was great.
The food is great, though the eggs are bland. The restaurant can't manage its traffic, best to call ahead
It was a Wednesday lunch. Waited 45 mins in the line. Sat at the table for 20 mins before anyone came to take the order.

Food and service was ok. My dish of choice was the negi-goma chashu-men. Almost everything about the dish was good. The only issue I had was that the bowl had what seemed like half a bottle of sesame seeds. I'm familiar that they are a part of the dish but that was a lot!

One of the worst ramen shop experiences I've ever had. Service was slow, host rude, portions small, and wait way too long. We waited over two hours after trying to call to reserve beforehand but being told that they "did not do reservations". After arriving, we were told to join the wait list and would have to wait for at least an hour. By the time we sat down to eat our food, nothing but life-changing ramen could have made this experience better. Unfortunately, this was not life changing.

I heard a lot about this place but I don't get the excitement surrounding this ramen shop. I went here and got the Shio Rekka Ramen and it was very oily and salty. Was missing a lot and was not very impressed with the meal. There are many other ramen places in the area that I think are better and less wait. I don't know if I'll come back a second time.
Regular ramen with reasonable price! Not the best in Seattle and not worth for 1hr drive from north. Kinda salty!

I visited Ramen Danbo for lunch and found street parking nearby, which was easy enough to find, though it does cost. The wait outside was a bit long--about 40 minutes--but that's to be expected since the place is pretty popular. While you wait, you pre-order your food on a slip, which streamlines the process once you're seated.Once inside, the food came out surprisingly fast. I ordered the classic ramen with egg and extra chashu, it did not disappoint. The broth was incredibly rich, full of deep, savory flavors, and the noodles were cooked to the perfect texture. The tender, flavorful pork added the perfect touch.Service was excellent--waitstaff were attentive and friendly, making the dining experience enjoyable. The place is on the smaller side, so seating can be a bit tight, but it's definitely worth it for the food. I also noticed they have a stamp reward system, so you can earn free ramen over time, which is a nice bonus.Overall, a really tasty bowl of ramen, and I'd definitely return for another round in the future!

Expect a line because this place seems to be busy every time I pass by. We waited an hour on a Sunday night. Service was a bit slow but their friendliness makes up for it. The food was flavorful and hearty. Would come again.Curry Ramen + Soft Boiled Egg ($15.45) - This was a seasonal product so I'm glad we got to try it. Very flavorful.Classic Rekka Ramen + Soft Boiled Egg ($14.95) - Can't go wrong with this.Gyoza ($6.75)
Wonderful ramen! Not a special or interesting environment, but great food for a quick meal.
Authentic but sometimes a bit too crowded.

There's a reason there's always a line at this place, and I understand why now. I ordered Negi Chashu. The soup was not too salty or greasy. Super creamy and pretty mellow compared to other ramen I've had. Light but packed with lots of flavor. The noodles were soft and delicate and paired well with the broth. The chashu was soft and not too greasy so it tasted great with the spicy chutney. Usually a very balanced bowl of ramen that is almost perfect. It's a matter of preference, but I'm sure something like pickled ume would be a welcome addition to this bowl. If it was just the food, Denbo would be the closest to the 5, but like most popular spots around Seattle, you're usually pushed into a small corner and forgotten about because of the restaurant. . . How crowded it was. You might gasp at your neighbor at how full the tables are at this restaurant. There's really no room to walk, pass, or even get in or out of your seat without imposing. I had to flag down the wait staff for water, my order, and then my check. I would recommend Denbo if you want a solid bowl of ramen, just have time to wait for your table, and just want a loud time to hangout with friends.
It was good, not the best I've ever had but would definitely come again. No real complaints
Food is super delicious, especially the curry broth. Our server was the delicious but the host was kind of rude

I got the shiro with eggs and mushroom. The broth was light and the noodles were perfect! My boyfriend got the negi-goma and he said it was a bit too sesame for his liking. Also, he added a lot of toppings and the bowl was not big enough to hold the broth to match the toppings. His broth got shallow within a few bite. Compared to his ramen, mine would taste like water. However, since I ate mine instead of switching between ours I thought it was enough flavor. The food came out super fast! Service was great.
I like the noodles a lot I just feel like sometimes it's seems too salty like salt but I liked it since I can make it creamy
Very good ramen. Service is a bit slow but otherwise food is great. Bit of a wait though.

This place is so crazily crowded and wait times are ridiculous for a Sunday night.Ordered -Miso rekka ramen : went with medium spice, standard thin noodles with medium broth. They customize everything on the menu and make it vegan. Served under 10 mins are tasted great. Quantity is great for the price and it's a must try if you are a ramen lover.
I love all of the Japanese food. The ramen was not bad, enough size but nothing special at all. Same with other ramen house. Hope can get more different flavor.
solid ramen. get the pork and egg. fresh and inexpensive
great ramen, the egg was cooked perfectly and the noodles too

I recently visited Ramen DANBO and it was an exceptional dining experience from start to finish! The classic ramen with thick noodles was nothing short of perfection. The broth was rich and flavorful, enveloping the chewy, thick noodles in a warm embrace that felt like a hug for my taste buds.I paired my ramen with a lunch combo that included gyoza and a refreshing ginger ale. The gyoza were perfectly crispy on the outside and filled with juicy, savory goodness. The ginger ale added a nice, tangy touch to round off the meal.Every bite was a delight, and the service was top-notch. If you're looking for a comforting and delicious bowl of ramen, Ramen DANBO is the place to be. Highly recommend!

The noodles, the broth! Some of the best ramen!The best part of the place is we can choose the thickness of the broth, spice levels, and additional toppings. Highly recommend this place for everyone. Make sure you are hungry before you visit as the portion size is huge.
The Best Ramen in Town!! Cheap, Filling and Flavorfulllllllll! The only thing I wish they had on their menu is fried chicken.

Ramen Danbo: Your Personalized Noodle Playground! Calling all ramen enthusiasts and veggie heroes! Ramen Danbo isn't just about delicious, build-your-own bowls (though, oh boy, are they delicious!), it's about creating a ramen experience that sings to your soul.  Imagine: a fragrant, creamy tonkotsu broth or a vibrant miso masterpiece, your canvas. Then, the toppings parade begins! And the best part? You only pay for what tickles your taste buds. No ramen regret here! But guess what? Ramen Danbo doesn't discriminate against herbivores! Their dedicated vegetarian menu is a symphony of flavorful broths, fresh veggies, and crispy tofu that rivals any meat-eater's dream bowl. So gather your crew, vegan or not, and prepare for a slurp-tacular adventure! Here's what keeps us coming back for more:Endless customization: From broths to noodles, toppings to spice levels, it's your ramen, your way.Budget-friendly bliss: Pay only for what you crave, leaving mystery fees and ramen remorse in the dust.Seasonal surprises: New flavor journeys every few months? Yes, please! Vegetarian haven: Veggie friends, rejoice! Your ramen dreams have come true. So next time you're craving a soul-warming (or taste bud-exploding) ramen experience, ditch the boring chains and head to Ramen Danbo.

Ramen lovers, rejoice! let me tell you, this small little gem is an absolute haven for your taste buds. What truly impressed me was the dedication to cater to all types of diners. As a vegetarian, I often struggle to find flavorful options, but Ramen Danbo truly delivered with their veggie ramens. They have a number of veggie offerings.We tried their veggie miso ramen, seasonal tomato ramen and the sesame ramen, and I was blown away by the explosion of flavors in each bowl. you have the option of choosing noodle thickness, richness of broth and a number of other customization. The veggie miso ram had a velvety miso broth. The depth of the flavors was incredible, and the umami notes from the miso took this bowl to a whole new level. The noodles were perfectly cooked, and every bite had perfect texture and flavor. The tomato ramen was an interesting combination but I enjoyed the other two ramens more. It is a seasonal flavor they have. 3.5/5The sesame ramen, oh my goodness, was a revelation. If you like Sesame you will love this broth. The rich nuttiness of the sesame combined with the savory broth was a match made in ramen heaven. my favorite! 5/5Their veggie gyozas are decent too 4/5- had favorful filling and the dough to filling ratio was Pete! The portion sizes were generous. While there was a wait of 60 minutes to get a table, I can wholeheartedly say that the wait was absolutely worth it. However, I must mention that finding parking around the area was a bit challenging. It took some time to locate a suitable spot, but don't let that deter you from the wonderful dining experience that awaits inside.Highly recommend this place for veggie ramen lovers
Great food. Great service. Lively ambiance. Waited 40 min on a Saturday night at 8:45pm.
I walkways walk by this place and it's always packed, finally decided to try it and now I can see why it's so busy!!! Loved it

The restaurant is fairly large with quite large so it becomes quite hard when trying to pick something. Once we got a table and were seated, we were handed the menus and took a look. Aside from ramen they also have other items like gyoza and side dishes. After ordering it didn't take long to get the food. I tried the Miso Ramen and that was tasty. Delicious broth nice noodles and pork. I enjoyed the food and it was fairly cheap too.

Plan for a long wait time but I promise it's worth it. It's the best ramen I've ever had and now I can't get ramen anywhere else because nothing comes close to Danbo. Because of the high demand it's definitely an "eat it and beat it" kind of place, and not the right choice if you want to hang at the table for a while.
Best ramen in town, can't wait to try everything on their menu, amazing service as well
Food is good. Service is good. Ambiance is good. Price is good. Wait is long - not good. But food makes it worth it. So overall, good

One of the city's finest restaurants, with stunning interiors and exteriors. The staff is extremely friendly and provides excellent service. The food was delicious and authentic. If you're in the city, I highly recommend stopping by for a meal.
Sooo tasty. Best ramen I've had outside of Tokyo. You have to go back and try them all.
Good soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soupGood soup
Great ramen, best I've had in Seattle (if not ever)!Would definitely recommend, this!
Best ramen around! Get the added egg and mushrooms.
One of the best ramen places I've been to in Seattle! Expect a wait if you go during dinner but it's worth it imo.
The food was delicious and they have awesome lunch specials! I would definitely come back
Apart from the wait time, I really don't know why you would go somewhere other than danbo for ramen.
Perfect price. Quantity might be a little bit less for some people but perfect for me.
Best ramen in Seattle, the vegan ramen is particularly tasty. Will be visiting as often as possible. The wait line is extremely long though and usually is 2 hrs.
You know it's good when there's always a line outside.
Easily my favorite ramen around, I really like the quality of the beef and the noodles.
Small location, you're usually going to have a waiting list. Yet this is worth it. Food is great, service is awesome and the staff are supportive and kind. Going to be back again! Highly recommended.
The Foods are very wonderful the way they cooked. It's just right. I'm going to order it again to share it with my colleagues. It's highly recommended.
I'm going to the right place for the best meal. I liked the service right now. It's very informative and enjoyable. Definitely getting back. I don't have complaints at all. This is pretty cool
This is the BEST ramen in the hill. Sitting in the restaurant and take out both are A+ experiences.

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I go to this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The the cooking is fantastic and the stuff is very friendly and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we pass a delightful evening. highly recommended.
The ramen is very good, not too salty, and not too light
One of the best authentic restaurant that I'd ever had. I don't like it, but I love it.
Best ramen ever! Perfect broth, perfect noodles, sets a high standard!
Fantastic. Amazing vegetarian ramen broth.
Dank Ramen. I recommend this place.

Came here for an early Friday night dinner. We were seated, had our order taken and our food came out all in the span of ~5 minutes. Very fast and efficient service...but they weren't busy at all so we weren't rushed at all.I got the Classic Rekka ramen and my boyfriend got the Classic Chashu-men ramen with extra spice.I love all the options to customize and my thick noodles were cooked perfectly al dente (firm), which I enjoyed. I loved my broth, it was very rich and flavorful. It wasn't that spicy but had a nice flavor. The Chashu ramen broth had a cleaner, sweet flavor. My boyfriend mentioned that although he ordered extra spice his had zero spice, but it wasn't that big of a deal.The bowls/portions were rather small, which they work around by offering extra orders of noodles, but still a good sized meal. (Boiled eggs were also a add on).Overall, would recommend coming here if you want to get a quick tasty meal.

Lines were long most times I have been in but I did not mind the wait. It was and has always been worth it for me and my kid. The ramen is chewy, the broth savory umami, and the gyoza rounds up the meal. Wait service is really prompt and I enjoy sitting by the 'bar' so I can check out the cooks prepare the meal.
Really fast, good food. Love the miso ramen.
Probably the best ramen in Capitol Hill! Their broth is very distinct and their pork nearly melts in your mouth. I love the thick noodles in their shiro, particular, personally

If you haven't tried this ramen place yet you have to! I ordered the classic Rekka ramen, and the broth is probably the best I've had in Seattle. I really liked how you can customize everything too, like the thickness of noodles, which I ordered more soft. The staff here is also so friendly, multiple people came to check on our table which was really nice. Will definitely be back!

The spicy miso ramen is amazing. The service was excellent and the staff was super friendly. We kept on getting asked if everything was great and as we finished three staff members took our plates. The best ramen and staff in town! Don't forget to try the gyoza and add the pickled veg to your ramen.

I used to love this place but now I don't know what is going on with them. I ordered 2 item pork belly and sullung tang ( Uber eat )but I didn't receive sullung tang at all and pork belly was not even warm as well as missing stuff. I tried to call them but I wasn't able to contact them.

I live in the Eastlake area and have eaten here at least six times. But no more after this evening. My husband and daughter and I went in and this was our experience.  We tried to order the chicken dish which we had the last time we dined here. We were told that we needed to order two meals and we could not split them. So we ordered of the pancakes. Our daughter wanted the volcano egg. So here's where I'm going to give the math breakdown.The Chicken dish is $ 18.00The Volcano egg is   10.00The Kimichi Pancake 14.00Our server came back to the table and said we couldn't order that way because we had to order two of the 18.00 dinner items .I then asked if we could just do a take out order instead. She returned and said we could but that the Volcano Egg couldn't be a take out item. I then asked if we could just sit there and my daughter eat the egg dish while we waited. Now mind you this was at 4:30 and there was only one other table in use. We were told we couldn't do that. I then said fine were leaving. I then explained to the manager or who ever he was about why we were leaving. He wanted to explain to me that on the menu it says that there has to be two orders of the chicken dish. So here's the math again. Two Chicken dishes for 18.00 =   36.00One Chicken Dish and One Kimich Pancacke   18.00+14.00=32.00So it was worth him not at least trying to have us stay and eat at his restaurant for $4.00. He needs to learn about customer service. Also not to mention that his server who we would have tipped 20% missed out as well as we are local to this neighborhood and have been trying to support our local restaurants  But not to worry we walked down the street to HayMaker had a great dinner during their happy hour. The service was great they went out of there way to make sure we enjoyed our meal. I will not be returning to Son of a Butcher and will not be taking my family who we were going to go and eat this up coming week.

Decided to try takeout as I was craving Korean food....not sure if my food had been tampered with, literally looks like togo food someone ate out of. Poor presentation. Their in-dining experience was a lot better. There are better takeout Korean options in Seattle. Overall, I dont recommend.....H Mart food is sadly better quality and for a lesser price. Giving a two star for their effort.

If you're in Seattle and craving the best Korean BBQ experience, this place is an absolute must-visit. It's located in quiet neighborhoods in Eastlake like a hidden jewel box.The highlight of the meal is undoubtedly the Korean BBQ, which features some of the highest quality cuts of meat I've ever had. Their SOB cuts were tender and flavorful, while the pork belly was perfectly crispy on the edges and succulent in the middle. ( one of the best pork belly I ever had in Korean BBQ!! ) Each meat was grilled to perfection right at your table, adding to the interactive and fun dining experience. The quality of the meats is exceptional--tender, juicy, and full of authentic flavors.But the greatness doesn't stop at the BBQ. The seafood pancake (haemul pajeon) is hands down the best I've ever tasted ( everyone in my group agreed ). Crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside, with generous chunks of seafood. It's the perfect complement to the grilled meats.The side dishes (banchan) here are next level--each one is fresh, vibrant, and packed with flavor. From the crunchy kimchi to the savory pickled vegetables and silky steamed egg, every bite is a delight. The variety of banchan that comes with the meal elevates the entire experience, offering a great balance to the richness of the BBQ.If you're a fan of Korean cuisine, this place is by far one of the best in the Seattle area. Excellent service, top-notch quality, and an unforgettable meal. Highly recommended!

By far one of my favorite KBBQ spots in Seattle! The meat quality is top notch. I love their sauces and side dishes, they complement the meal perfectly. The servers were very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was lively, making it a great dining experience every time. The price is on the higher side, but it's definitely worth it for the quality. Highly recommend.

My favorite place to go - it never disappoints! The food quality is top-notch and the staff, especially the owner, Mr. Park, are so friendly. The only downside is that they open at 5pm. I wish they were open for lunch too. If they were, I'd definitely go there every day!
Best Korean in the city. Fun atmosphere. Lots of parking. Great value. Will be going back

Tried other Korean bbq in the cities but still the best have ever been to. We ordered brisket and pork belly and the pork belly were excellent that we had to order more. The combo comes with soup, steamed egg and they don't disappoint you.We were smart enough to make a reservation this time to avoid long wait so try to make a reservation. Also, keep in mind that they are short of staff so the service can be a little slow. However, the quality of food and side dishes was still amazing.
This is my go to spot for Korean bbq in Seattle. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about (Korean).

Summary: good food, good service, long wait but worth it.My girlfriend and I come here often! After living in downtown LA we wanted to find a good Korean bbq place we enjoyed just as much. And we have! Our waiters/waitresses are always so engaging and good at their job and the food is next level. This is a place we tell others about!

Son of a Butcher will now be my Korean BBQ place of choice in Seattle. Came here few times and definitely worth it. It's not AYCE but they serve quality meat so you get what you pay for. Food was amazing, great barchan selections.
This place has become my go-to place for Korean BBQ in Seattle. 5/5 stars for the food, you can really tell the quality of meats here. 4/5 stars for service.

First time ordering and it was quite a nice surprise.Great authentic Korean BBQ and Dak Gal Bi (Korean Spicy Chicken) place. I moved from LA and finally got to eat something I can say It's Real Dak Gal Bi. Portion was generous with side dishes with a good variety. The food is just "make your mouth water" and "make your stomach smile".
Delicious korean BBQ. I love the choices of sauces!

Awesome!!Wonderful!!There were five of us on Friday night and service was excellent, meat was delicious, and side dishes ( banchan)Was very good too!!I don't get why people write bad reviews for businesses that try so hard to survive....!??If you don't like it , don't go back. That's it.For all 5 of us~ we will definitely be regulars!!Can't wait to return!!
Only thing can say about this place is "I Love everything" good meat and good staff and good food. I'll recommend this place to anyone.
great name and great babes. Yelp won't let me post this yet so I will talk about my great time. I love the name
Great atmosphere and great food. People are super nice too!
Quality Taste Service Price GREAT!!!!Definitely will come back!!Must Try this place
My wife and I come here for dinner from time to time and we are always really impressed!

They don't have Nam Khao, but it doesn't even matter. The menu is consistently delish. Hot tunes, straight fire flavors. Can't wait for Covid to be over so this place can be everything it was ever meant to be. Three Cheers!
Excellent food. Friendly staff. Cool decor.
Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy. Very bitchy.
Total scam, used the QR code outside of one location and it created an order across the city
Their name is offensive, right off the bat unwelcoming. I understand that they want to give off an edgy image, but no need for profanity.
With this kinda name, how would you take kids there? Without them asking you what BITCH means??
It is not as good as i was told
Poor excuse for a biscuit! The bitch sauce sux
I get that the food might be good, but to have a 1 1/2 hour wait for to go orders is really unacceptable
Average biscuits and gravy. Insane people that work there. The most offensive customer service I've ever witnessed. I prefer Honest Biscuits.
efrrggh. Profanity. Did not like very muych
The ancestral home of every idiot born in Seattle.

Worst customer service EVER... We were waiting NOT in line looking at the menu in the restaurant for about 20 seconds and someone RAN to our table and yelled at us to get out because you can only sit if your eating (mention there's about 6 open seats) they truly are "bitches" they aren't lying! It's in the name! DO NOT eat here unless you would like to get yelled at too...
Worst experience ever very rude manager thief got my money and made my daughter cry Worst experience in my life

During the holidays I was went into this place with my kids. I did not know the name until I was at the counter ordering. I find the word Bitch in mixed company, especially with younger children offensive. Why don't you just name the place F@#$ Y!@ because that is what you are really saying. OBTW F@#$ Y*&^.

It is one thing to have a catchy name for a business, it is a completely different story when the employees are actually bitches and assholes. Plus the food was absolutely horrible. Never will I go there again!
I was not impressed with the food or service.
Just the name says "not my kind of place".
dahek iz wit da naym. it iz mucho dizguztngz.
Just being so ignorant of decorum will get a negative from me. Never had their food and never will due to the terrible, insensitive foul mouthed name they chose.
Not sure what all the rave is about from people, maybe its just the name?Don't waste your time or money on this place.
This name is rather offensive. who on earth would give it the name biscuit bit**? I don't think its appropriate or very kosher, or funny
just didn't have good experience
This place wasn't anything like I was so hoping for :( The service was very poor, rude and the food wasn't worth the wait or trip to Seattle.
Nasty Place, food was like dirty biscuit and gravy and no ventilation..I had this sausage with gravy and it was like store bought sausage grilled in panini grill and slimy gravynot going back
NIce workers, cute little place, bad biscuits and gravy!

Everything was just ok. We walked up and placed our order online per their instructions. We waited about half an hour for 2 combos. Everything was lukewarm (sandwich, grits and coffee). Maybe they were having an off day. We were excited for some southern flare, but were let down.
I found a dead rat outside the store and I had vomited in the washrooms without flushing.

Unless you like slow working hipsters and a passive-aggressive work culture, this place is a definite 2 out of 10. Each time I go I wait and consider the options of having something homemade vs. the lottery chance of goodness from these citizens.
The food was pretty good, don't get me wrong, but not good enough to stand in line for 45 minutes.

Not at all what I expect from a biscuit. Instead of being light, buttery and flaky it had the consistency of a muffin. It was not even remotely flaky and the moisture content was too high as a result :( If you want a bland muffin go here.

Ordered by scanning a QR code and waited for about 20min for my biscuit+gravy+over easy eggs to be ready. Staff was friendly and gave me two stickers after I said I'll share on social media. There was no seating so I had to eat it on the way walking around pike place market. I would say it's just regular biscuit and gravy. Probably good for friend/family hang out. If you're a tourist like I am it's definitely better to walk into the market and save your appetite for the local stores there.
Was okay. Take out only. One and done is food enough. No problems, just pricey for being take out.
Be prepared to wait a very long time. We waited 1.5 hours and were pretty disappointed by the quality of the food for the wait.

I felt like the food was 3 stars but 5 stars to the staff. We're all running on fumes here and they were so sweet and upbeat, even when people suck and act rude. We ordered at 9am online and checked at the window between walking around to stay occupied. Yes, we knew there was a wait so I was patient. Between 11am-Noon our food must have been sitting around. I walked up to the window and the gal saw it was sitting there and apologized. I got the text that it was ready *after* we got our food. Bit of a bummer because the food was okay, I got a bacon breakfast sandwich and my friend got a basic biscuit w/jam and honey. She thought it was going to be fresh jam but it was a Smuckers to-go one. Grits were....greasy. Coffee was disappointing. I'll try again on a better day.

I've came here multiple times to try some dishes out that everyone raves about. But it seems every time I come here they are out of this dish! I'm not sure if I just come at the wrong time or what, but I just want to try it at least once! Please make more!
While I am grateful they have a vegan option, the gravy was meh and the biscuit was stale.
They are obviously popular. The constant line of people waiting was longer than i would wait though. No Food No Rating (although i had to put something
so-so quality. too much salt in their food.
The hype on this place is just mind boggling. They give very large portions here, but I've definitely had better biscuits covered in gravy..
Quick breakfast, Tasty choices. Will be back!
The name attracted us to this cafe. Biscuits were great but there was a rather long waiting period. Overall we will most likely give them another shot.
I wish I like the food here more. The place is overhype. Staff was fun.
Pretty OK, good experience nonetheless.
Decent food, good service. Also the name of this establishment is quite hilarious!
I was only half impressed with the biscuits.

The basic biscuit is good but definitely it can be two meals for me because it's very greasy and heavy. The cost of the basic biscuit is kinda spendy for what you're getting but try it once to experience what they offer.
The food is ok, in my opinion it's not worth the wait on a weekend morning. I would go back if I was in the area but it's not my favorite place.
Just OK. Don't know what all the fuss is about =|
Eh ok place, interesting name for sure.
Too greasy and buttery. But if that's your thing, go for it.
The food is fantastic! The wait is insane, make sure you aren't on a time crunch!

Personally I am not sure what all the hype is about. There was no line when my husband and I arrived... Atleast no line to order. We waited 45 min for our food and it wasn't even that great. People that ordered after us got their food before us! The food wasn't bad just nothing amazing.
Not bad at all but super hyped up.
Good biscuits, great value!

The food here is fantastic. The biscuits are to die for. Not only that, but they serve great coffee. The people here are nice and the environment is festive and casual. I love stopping by whenever I'm in this area of downtown. Excited they have opened another location in Belltown so the odds of me walking past are increased.

I like the food but find the name to be offensive to women. Maybe change the name to "Biscuits with attitude" or "Bizzzzzz-kits" and have the mascot be a bumble bee. It would be cute and the kids would like it and if kids like it, you get bizzzzzzzness.
Not sure what the big deal is. It's okay, just a biscuit. Nothing special.
Definitely a must try if your in Seattle. Very Unique and yummy.
I had the bitchwitch. It was good, but not crazy over it.

Biscuit Bitch is a must-try spot in Seattle! The biscuits are absolutely divine--crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside. Paired with their locally sourced honey, it's a combo you can't miss. The honey adds the perfect touch of sweetness that takes the biscuits to another level.We also tried one of the plates, but I wasn't as big a fan of it. It felt like just regular scrambled eggs with gravy and grits on top, nothing too exciting. Still, the biscuits alone are worth the visit, and I'd definitely recommend stopping by just for those!
Always consistent and good service. Great biscuits as expected, sometimes other menu items are off but all in all a good place!
It was good very good... They take forever it was kinda cold but it was good. Overall Food: 5/10Service:5/10
Friendly and fast staff. I had the spam and egg biscuit and enjoyed it. I would have liked a little more sauce because the biscuit was a little dry. The London Fog was also tasty.

Great brunch spot in Seattle on 4th Ave. we went there Sunday morning and there was ample parking. I got the Cobb salad with avocado($6 extra) and my friend got the French toast. Both dishes were flavorful and delicious. Service was a bit pushy at times but overall good.The food came to around $30 a person with tips included. I would definitely come back and try the salmon with sourdough as they were out this morning.
Would have been nice to have somewhere to sit. Service was good. The food was okay. Also the menu has changed. They are more limited than what shows on Yelp.

What a fun place! This place was in walking distance from many local attractions. The food was easy to order and so tasty. One of the sweet workers personalized my birthday coffee! We enjoyed this stop!
This was our second trip to Seattle in the last few months and we made sure to go back. The food is so yummy with great flavours.
The food was good but the biscuits were waa too much. The veggie biscuit wasn't that good. The grits were amazing, and so was the staff.

I have voyaged from one side of the planet to the other and I need to say just a few cafés have the thing in them. The thing to like goes past what's moving on the lookout and making out your own incredible stuff in plans and this spot has it. Biscuit B**** was good and they had many things I loved! The service was tremendous!
Biscuit Bitch are a thing here in Seattle and I'm not complaining. Keep up the good work!

Due to COVID, you have to order online for takeout. We ordered the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit bitch. It was huge! The biscuit was a bit dry, but then again in order to have a structurally sound sandwich, that may be the best way to go. It was a hearty breakfast, and I'd order again! My favorite part of the experience was the dude at the front counter saying, "order for Kayla! Here's your biscuit, Bitch!" Next time I'm in Seattle, I'll be back!

My better half and I simply love this spot. We quarrel over nearly everything except for when we come here oh rapture we concur with our preferences and have a good time. It resembles our sentiment escort region. We simply have our amazing food here, we both love similar sort of food varieties.
I swear to God they put some kind of crack in those pancakes. They're so frik good! There's always a wait, but that's no surprise. This place is purely amazing...

Fantastic junk food! Could be a little cheaper for the product that you receive but if you want to get super full on carbs and gravy, this is one of the best spots in Seattle. Customer service was definitely good not great.
This place really amazing because of the food menu and the ambiance.
I do entertained with the name as well the food is interesting, Like it!Thanks!
Must get the nutty bitch. 'nuff said
The food here was awesome! The staff was very lively but the wait in line was well worth the wait! I recommend the breakfast sandwich
Great biscuits and gravy. Nice staff. Long line when we were there but worth it. Coffee is excellent.

The restaurant is cozy and the staff is very charming and friendly, The food was excellent and we had very interesting drinks. The customer service was on point. I loved the ambiance it was happy. I think prices were just tad too high other than that all good.
Im a fan of the vibes here! Food is outstanding, and not a long wait. Thank you!!
Quirky name, cool staff with delicious Southern eats! Glad I found this place! Get there early because the line wraps around the corner.
It's become an icon, but the food kinda makes you feel like shit. I mean, it's def a greasy spoon. And it's tastey. I'm just saying... it's good/not good. Know what I mean?

This has got to be the craziest place I gone to on my trip to Seattle. I loved the atmosphere but beware if you have small kids can get kinda crazy. But the biscuit are really good. The vibes is awesome. We had the Hot Mess B%tch, pretty tasty.

This spot is extraordinary. It is idiosyncratic that is without a doubt, yet it is a piece of the good times. The nourishment is high caliber and very filling. My significant other and I could scarcely complete off 1 plate. They play peppy music, nearly feels like you are in a club. Great espresso also.

I got to love this place !! Biscuit Bitch has some really good biscuits no doubt. The drinks are good as well. They have good coffee i had a few but my favorite is the mocha. I had their habanero hot sauce its called Callahan's. It was very hot.... The inside is very small only a few tables and is always crowded since is located in the downtown, I just wish they had room for more tables . The staff is awesome they are friendly and helpful . Plus, they give good food recommendations if is your first time.
Great food, nice place. We'll be back.
one of the best places for Biscuits definetely .

We got the hot mess bitch for the hot link, and it was worth it. We arrived in a Sunday morning around 10:15, got in line, ordered, and waited 20 minutes for our food to come out. By the time we got our food, the wait escalated to half an hour. This place doesn't have a full kitchen, so it may be worth checking out other biscuit bitches in the city if you don't want to wait.
Love the name of the place! I ordered the ham, egg and cheese biscuit. Very delicious. Will come back for more.
Delicious for what it is. Calorific, both the savory and sweet options. Friendly staff
One of the best breakfast sandwiches you'll ever have. Just don't expect to be productive after you finish it.

Great ingredients, lovingly prepared food. The menu selection has a variety of items that are sure to please. The food was delicious and the prices reasonable. I think we found a new favorite place to eat out.
delish. So yummy...Big fan. The service was great and food was fantastic!

They made us late but worth the wait! Had to go simply based on the name. Being called 'bitch' by staff was refreshingly new & fun. My son loved the Bacon Bitch. I will look forward to more GF options next time...yes we will b back.
Tons of calories. Worth the line. Tasty tasty tasty. Biscuit bitches unite! :-)...
Tons of fun totally enjoyed the experience! The people totally best.... completely weird made me feel right out at home. Great feel there, loved the gluten free experience. Totally recommend!
Hearty fare that sticks to your ribs

Delicious, delicious food!! One of the best breakfast places I've been to and their mocha was awesome too. People were incredibly social and made us feel welcoming. Great place and I'd highly recommend it.
Oysters were good with great selection but had shell bits in them. The food was totally worth the price. The service was excellent.

Most people don't know there is a another location#. It is over in Belltown. If you miss when it is open here you should definitely go there. There is a more touristy place that is similar over and Pike Place market but this is the one you want to hit! Your belt might take a hit so walk it off in lovely Seattle and head over to the sculpture garden on a sunny day or take first Avenue if it is cloudy. By first Avenue I mean just walking through Belltown. Lovely.
The food breakfast was great!! Wish they had more space to sit and eat. The place was packed and although I hated to eat standing up it was almost worth it

Cool spot for some hot breakfast foods.Located within the Café Lieto, the establishment has that hole-in-the-wall vibe. Limited seating and a overall small space so keep that in mind. The service was great. Everyone seemed like they wanted to be there and were overall friendly.Food was tasty! Fluffy biscuits, endless grits, and hot sausages. Prices aren't too bad. Portions are big. Overall: a good spot for some hot comfort food and coffee. I would recommend more as a grab-and-go because it really doesn't have that much seating.
Tons of fun totally enjoyed the experience! The people totally fun.... completely weird made me feel right out at home. Great feel there, loved the gluten free experience. Totally recommend!
Very satisfactory!So much to desire. Thanks for the fresh sandwich!!!!!
Really enjoyed this place. Fun and quirky and the experience is very interesting. Great southern style menu selection and I really enjoyed the savoury options
This place is awesome and the staff are lovely.
Excellent breakfast! Our whole party ordered something different and everyone loved what they ordered. It's a small place and be prepared to wait.

Haha, this name is awesome, that itself is hilariously fun. I really love how they are so original and brave. I have to say, the food here is great and I love coming here for breakfast or brunch even. They serve great sandwiches. Hungry thinking about it
Great for breakfast! Don't miss this.
nice and clean .Large and testy biscuit.
Definitely a must-stop breakfast spot while in Seattle. :)
I am such a fan of this place! Dont forget the biscuits and gravy!
Tasty! And good vegetarian options.

The wait? Hugely dissatisfying. But I guess that's what happens when you go to places that are #trendy, right? Lol. Anyway , the food's pretty good! Not exactly sure if they're 100% worth the wait, but I'm happy I tried it at least once. I got the Straight Up Bitch (with vegetarian gravy because I'm on a "diet") and it was delicious! The food here is amazing! Be prepared to wait in line though.
Very good! Gravy was full of flavor with a spicy kick. Biscuit could have come out of the oven a few minutes earlier but still tasty. Grits were flavorful.
I LOVE THEIR BURGERS.Its one of the best i have ever had and i love it how they are very generous with the quanitity

This place is awesome! It has the right amount of alt attitude while not overpowering. I got a breakfast sandwich, which I figured would come on bread or a roll. Place is great if you need hangover comfort food.

Came here this morning and did not like it very much, it was good but did not taste very fresh.
Delicious! Their breakfast was amazing! The staff was also super peppy!
Amazing size of dishes, the food was great, i cant wait till i can go back and try the next item on the Menu. Great for family's and everyone will leave stuffed.
amazing........amazing........amazing!! enough said
I'm not a fan of biscuits but i'm a fan of Biscuit bitch for sure

Pretty cool breakfast joint with greasy hangover food. I like the flare but have heard some friends get turned off. To each his own! I like the attitude. Food is good too, I've tried the smokin' hot beeyotch(!!) which is spice biscuit and gravy and liked it. If you're in the area give it a shot!

Stumbled upon this small spot one morning in search of breakfast. It was really crowded and had a long line but I decided to brave it. They have a small, eclectic menu. Add the jalapenos!!! So good. Fun vibe.

I went in on an off time so I avoided the lines other reviewers talk about. I had a biscuit sandwich with bacon, egg, and cheese. Wasn't a huge fan of the special sauce they put on it, but the biscuit itself was great. Will definitely try again.

A hangover remedy and an explosion of flavor in your mouth which makes your tastebuds dance! The decor is interesting, creative subject, adorable menu item names and interesting staff. I highly recommend going here. The hours are very convenient, particularly for late night snacks after the bar.

Visited this place today and it was good. I don't know if I would be eating this type of food all the time. It was a bit greasy and had lots of calories but I think once is okay to try. Biscuit bitch is everything you could want from a biscuit. There's gravy and grits and sausage and it's almost overwhelming, but not quite. If you're thirsty, be ready for tiny shots of water though. Definitely go hungry, because the portions are seriously ginormous!!

Must say interesting place to try out. Its a hipster type of a resturant. Food is pretty good. Wide variety of things to choose from. One thing I didnt like was how packed it was and there is no place for you to sit down and eat. You have to go down the block to go eat. Id come back again.
Will definitely be back
Pretty unique food. Food came out fast. Decent price, cool ambiance.
Ok i get it, it's cheap, satisfying, and quirky, Biscuits def delivered and the service was efficient and quick.
Very small and crowded but the food is worth the experience!
Food was hot and tasty. The service was quick and they got through the line quickly. The coffee was good.

2 million calories but very tasty. Closest thing you can come to finding southern gravy Pacific Northwest. Hard to get them when they are open. At the Belltown location is open more. And if you can spare putting on a pound or two totally worth it text me

not bad food

Spot was a good find for a quick morning pick. Coffee was good and the breakfast sandwich was as well. I would recommend if your close!

tasty tasty...yum yum spot

mmmm.... these bitches make great biscuit sandwiches lol. great late-night stop after the bars close.

Ecxellent food excellent service. I come here often for lunch and everything is amazing. Lots of different choices
Not sure this place even needs my review a this point, but know this place is a must have.
absolutely amazing. Great food. The best attitude in Seattle. Need this shit everywhere

If you're looking for a no-frills, down-to-earth breakfast spot, look no further than this gem. Despite their lack of indoor seating, ordering online and picking up at the door was a breeze. The long line outside was a testament to what was awaiting inside.We tried the hot mess bitch - and oh boy, it did not disappoint. The smothering of gravy was just the way I like it, and the portion size was more than enough for my wife and I to share. We were full before we even finished the whole thing!The staff, while unconventional, were an absolute delight. Expect a good-hearted cuss word or two, adding a unique and fun touch to the morning atmosphere. There's nothing quite like being talked dirty to in the early hours - it certainly set the tone for a fantastic day. We'll definitely be back for more.
Good food, good service what more can I ask for! It's take our only but we found a place to sit right next door.
Great food. Biscuits were soft and buttery. A must have if you come to downtown. I had the hotlink sandwich and it was the right level of spice. Definitely will be a go to when in town
The food was on point, they were busy but very attentive to us! It's a quaint little place!
Let's start with the amazing ladies and gentlemen preparing an insane amount of food quickly, deliciously and pleasantly bitchy when calling out orders

I take my food seriously and let me tell you this place is absolutely fantastic. The biscuits here are out of this world! They strike the perfect balance with a slight crunch on the outside and a soft, moist interior--no dry mouth here! The flavors are spot-on, and I adore the playful "attitude" that aligns with the restaurant's name. If you're in the mood for a delicious, quick bite that'll bring a smile to your face, this place is the perfect pick-me-up.
Really good biscuit. Really good biscuit. Really good biscuit. Really good biscuit.

This place is worth the hype. My husband and I both got the Sausage Biscuit Beach with Sausage Gravy and it was to die for. Their cold brew was also very good. It's very filling, kept me full for 6+ hours, so be hungry. For the shortest wait, order by phone at 8am. YUM
Best biscuits ever!! You will have to wait for your food, but the wait is well worth it!

I stumbled upon Biscuit Bitch during a leisurely walk through the streets of Seattle, and what a delightful surprise it was! From the moment I walked up to their storefront, I could feel the inviting and energetic vibes that this place exudes.The staff at Biscuit Bitch were quick to greet me with a smile and express genuine enthusiasm for their food. As a first-time visitor, I appreciated their helpfulness in guiding me through the menu and answering my questions.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the biscuits. Oh boy, these biscuits are out of this world! They are perfectly flaky and buttery, with just the right amount of crispness on the outside. Whether you prefer a classic egg and bacon combo or a more adventurous option like the Gravy Train with fried chicken, each bite is a taste bud-tingling experience.The quality and freshness of the ingredients are evident in every dish. Biscuit Bitch offers a range of choices, including vegetarian and vegan options, ensuring there's something for everyone. The portion sizes are generous, ensuring you leave feeling satisfied and content.One thing that stood out to me was the vibrant and eclectic atmosphere. From the street art that adorns the walls to the energetic music playing in the background, Biscuit Bitch creates a unique and fun ambiance that enhances the dining experience. It's the perfect spot to grab a delicious meal and soak in the local Seattle vibes.I must also mention the outstanding service. Despite the bustling nature of the place, the staff remained attentive and efficient, ensuring that every customer felt valued and well taken care of.In conclusion, stumbling upon Biscuit Bitch during my walk turned out to be a stroke of luck. The fantastic food, vibrant atmosphere, and exceptional service make this place a must-visit in Seattle. I highly recommend giving it a try - you won't be disappointed. A solid 5-star experience!
Loved the menu, service and location by the waterfront Highly recommended for breakfast or brunch
Good. Very good. Super good. Awesomely good. incredibly good. Deliciously good. Fantastically good.
Biscuits are solid. Signs around the establishment Are even better. I treated maself to the grits and I have no regrets.

I had a memorable experience at this restaurant's private room. The space was elegant and well-decorated, and the food was delicious. The staff went above and beyond to make our event special, with customized menus and excellent service. I highly recommend this restaurant for private events and celebrations
Im not a bitch but ill take a biscuit, togo.

The food was delicious. I had the vegetarian sandwich option which comes with a Morningstar sausage. I will say I wish they had more options for customization. I prefer to eat egg whites, but there are no sub options. Also, all orders are done online. They have a sign outside of the restaurant door which advises how long the wait is for food. There is no indoor sitting, but there a few tables located outdoors. I suggest for you to order online before you get there. You will receive a text and email when your order is ready.
There will be a wait but it is worth it. Everything I have tried here was amazing. Great people and great flavors.
So delicious. I wish I could have ordered everything. They were crowded but so fast. Loved it

Famous We sat in Biscuit Bitch for the first time and had a great dinner. Excellent service and got to say hi to owner. Hope all is well and hope to see you soon

always great food and polite service.

Great food- sassy staff.... love it!

Loved this place, they seem to know what they are doing here. I'll be back.

love the name, love the biscuits, love the location near Pioneer Square love love love

How can we come to Seattle and not come here? I heard so much about this place and we kept seeing the long lines every morning. Biscuits Bitch gives you a great vulgar experience starting from the name all the way to picking up your food. Want to party at 8am? Come on in. Twerk music to get playing to get your day started. Everyone is so friendly however, "bitchy" (lol) at the same time. The top seller, Gritty Scrambled Cheesy Bitch, included biscuit and gravy, eggs, cheese, and grits. I added the country sausage to help make things a little more groovier. The prices vary depending on what you want or what you want to add. There is not a lot of space to eat. You literally have to stand and eat or claim your table fast (we got lucky). Get there early for a good spot! PS: When you check in on yelp, you get a free sticker (if you know me, you know I love stickers!). [Review 94 for 2019. Review 536 overall]

A Seattle staple, this super hyped, but good cafe is definitely a must when you're in town! Of course as soon as they open, there's a line out of the door, but it goes by pretty quick. I love how everything is super "bitchy" themed. This sass filled cafe has a variety of biscuit dish options.We ended up getting a Smokin' Hot Bitch, which is a biscuit and gravysmothered in cheese and topped with a Grilled Louisiana hot link, eggs and jalapenos. Since the plate already seemed heavy enough, I opted for no cheese. Everything was sinfully delicious and the portions were so huge that I just couldn't finish it. Overall, if you live by YOLO and don't mind an early onset of clogged arteries then definitely come to this spot :-D

Super cool place, I found this gem based off the Yelp Reviews, and it did not disappoint! :-DIt's worth the wait because the food was awesome, I had the Hot Mess Bitch and as long as you're not on any sort of diet where you can only eat healthy foods like Kale come here and indulge in some amazing food!Def would recommend! :-D
Great atmosphere and great coffee. Can't really ask for more on a brisk Sunday morning.
So yummy! Worth the wait! Super busy place but it says a lot about the business! 10 stars!
I love this place. My morning go to. Keep up the great work.
A hole in the wall a few years ago, now, fortunately for them and unfortunately for me, this place is popping!Love stopping by here every time I'm in the city.
Biscuit bitch has bitchen breakfast.
The food is great! I had the biscuits with eggs, bacon and grits. It was amazing. The coffee is great too. Must try it. Staff is fun, energetic and friendly.

One of Seattles best kept secrets when i first found it. Fortunately for them, people have seemed to found this place and rightfully so. Great food, great coffee, but best of all, unbeatable atmosphere.
aweomse bidcuits! wow im so happy i cant even spell now. Bancon coma.
Awesome biscuits.. awesome place!
UMMMM yes please, best biscuits in the country, soooo delicious! GO NOW!
Worth. The. Wait.Seriously. So delicious.
So crazy amazing!! I could eat here three meals a day, seven days a week. Comfort food at its finest!!
What a spot. Love a menu with f*** and bi*** on the menu items. That to says the food speaks for itself. One of my regular brunch spots. you gotta try it out.
Best biscuits I have ever had! Could eat them every day if the scale would allow it! ;)
The food is amazing. The atmosphere is great. The line was long but went by really fast.
Umm, delish. A bit loud with limited seating but well worth it. Its a pretty fun experience. Entertaining!
Great food, great price, great people.
Great Coffee and espresso, good food
best biscuit sandwich!!! how did i just find out about this place
awesome food next to pike place and close to kels bar
this place has an offensive name and a great biscuit sandwichill eat their breakfast sandwiches till they shut it down
Awesome food!!! Great atmosphere!
So yummy! Great service! Great staff! Will come back!
fun, hip, tasty, and affordable
Damn good food. May take a minute when they are busy but we'll worth the wait. Only a couple 2 seat tables so maybe one day they will expand!!! Awesome atmosphere, Awesome Service!

This place is hilarious! Of course you have to try it because you simply can't ignore the name. They take it to the next level once you get inside and notice all the creative names on the menu...fantastic!The line was out the door so we figured it had to be good. I had the Smokin Hot Bitch and a coffee, both were delicious! The staff was really cool and helpful as well.Absolutely give this place a try!
Great dough very well made. Just like moms

Stopped in for the first time Friday 12/8 and OH MY GOODNESS am I glad I did. The music, the staff, the coffee.....it was everything. I wished I could have spent the rest of the day there with my new friends. But I was needed in the courthouse to defend all my loved ones from becoming the next victim of a drunk driver! Thanks guys. You really really really made my day!
I went here because of the name. It did not disappoint. So tasty.
I love you bitches... but bitches can we get some high chairs or more tables outside..
Great service, cool atmosphere. Great food & coffee. Awesome story behind the place.
God damn, I love biscuit bitch.
Amazing is the only word for it. Definitely a must visit if in the Seattle area
Great food and great coffee. I wish there was more seating, but the atmosphere/music made me forget about lack of seating!
Seattle Flowers loves that Bitch! Great comfort food, service and Staff.
It was really good... I like all their burgers!!!

If you are ever near Pikes Market this is a must stop. It's a short walk from the Market on 1st Avenue. Loved the biscuit sandwich with Bacon. The biscuit was the best I ever had. It's cooked warm and flaky you would think you are in biscuit heaven. The staff is very friendly though they may yell and call you names with a smile.
Drawn in by the name, haha loved the food, had a great time with the family!
indulgent and delicious. breakfast as it should be in a fun atmosphere.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff, the mushroom gravy is homemade, loved the long table to join and meet others. Oh yeah and the biscuits are good too!
The line is worth it, and it moves fast. Portions are so large and dense that you could easily share. This place is very "Seattle" in my opinion. A good place to bring a friend from out of town.
Excellent!! Very good and fast wait staff,,,really great biscuits
Long line but worth it! I had the biscwhich and it was amazing. A must have when in Seattle.
I've been here a few times for lunch (they're near my work) and the food is always amazing!
Love love love this place. The atmosphere is super fun and the food is really tasty. The service is great too. All the staff are super friendly, it's just a cool place.

I love biscuit bitch. It's a wonderful place with great bitches. The food is amazing and plan on returning every day. Coffee is also locally roasted from seven and they created there own bitch blend also you can say bitch as much as you please.
good food , good people, nice place
So good! If you're into spicy, definitely get the Hot Mess Bitch!
It was great! Very impressed with their service and staff!
This place is crazy. Very busy but unbelievably unique. Who does great coffee is great service is great very small but a great experience
Very tasty. Popular and tight quarters. Might visit one of the other locations for seating. The Pike Market location is small, but good food and quite reasonable.
Great customer service and yummy food! :)

I just had my first Biscuit Bitch over the weekend and I am already dreaming about what to order next time I visit. I had Nutty Witch and my boyfriend got Easy Bitch. They were both so good. I usually am not a huge fan of biscuit but this one was a total game changer. Flaky and buttery but it wasn't really heavy like the one makes you sick to your stomach. It was a bit of wait but very much understandable considering it was on the weekend and how amazing their food was!I cannot wait for my next Biscuit Bitch day!
If you get any one of their amazing biscuits and gravy, get ready for the most delicious gut bomb you'll have ever experienced. Definitely a must eat at place for people visiting the Seattle area.
Keep that Gravy coming! Jen was Awesome!
This place is on the list to hit every time I am in Seattle! The food is amazing and the Orange infused mocha is legit!!

Prepare to wait in line for at least 30 minutes. If you've never had this before, the wait is well worth it; it's a must try! The other stores inside this building are also worth checking in. You can't go wrong coming here.
Very good. Hot Mess had it all. Sausage had a good kick! The biscuits were very good!
We were visiting Seattle for the food and this is a MUST! Great people and great food!

biscuit bitch is sooooooooooooo good. it is fresh and hot and delicious. my girlfriend and i both have severe wheat issues and they have such incredibly fluffy and insane gf biscuits. their full gluten stuff is incredible too (i hear...and see and smell with my nose n eyes!) if you are looking for a GF treat -- dont be afraid of this place. march in with confidence cause you wont be dissapointed.
Loved the food, I have sent my friends to go check out this spot!!
Great food at a great price! I can't wait to go back!
The biscuits are absolutely the best I've had in Seattle!

Great food, fun service! Different vibe than most breakfast places, not for the faint of heart! Large servings that you can really customize! The staff environment was different than I was used to but hey, that comes with the vibe of the place!
Delicious breakfast! They were super busy but we got in and got our order extremely fast!
Sooo good! I go here for breakfast a lot, and it never dissapoints.
Ummmm more please! Good stuff and friendly staff.
They have great coffee and *amazing* biscuits and gravy.

Weirdest name for a store ever. The food names are even freakier. But the food was good. Stumbled on this place while looking for a coffee shop .The service is good despite the name and the food was excellent.
This place was so great, food was awesome and there was so much! Everyone who worked there was friendly and fun, great stop, will be back!
yummy
Great food for hangovers or for your day off. I highly recommend a nap afterwards. Unless you get their orange peel mocha. Then i recommend walking/shopping after your huge, messy, satisfying meal.
