Freaking delicious. Super nice staff.
Biscuit Bitch is my favorite spot to grab a coffee and indulge in a luscious biscuit
Bitch Please. This place is soooooo good!
sooooo good! heard from a friend and when i finaly tried it I couldnt believe it! went theere every morning for the next week after that!
This place is awesome. Best sandwiches around!
I usually love biscuits from chicken restaurants, here, it's just another level of love.

decided to try this out for the first time and make it my bitch lol...couldnt get over the name of the place and was one of the reasons why i came here. wait was long but well worth it just like the reviews said. so if you have some time to kill and are hungry come check this place out!!!
This place rocks!! Lol...the theme is pretty "IDGF" with a very chill, laid back atmosphere. the food is amazing, a lot of variety too...
one of the best restaurants ive had in seattle this is amazing i came with my wife and we tried the traditional chowder and left extreemyl satisfied.
This place is incredible. Very small space, but the food is sooooo worth it.
this is soo good oh my god i love the food,i love thsos palve i love the name i love the food i love everything about it
soooo gooooood. pork 'n' 8!tch is where it's at.
Great for breakfast- went their with visiting family from the South and they loved it.
The name can tell a lot ))) the food is delicious and the service is great! Came here after night shift and I was surprised there was no line and no people! Sweeeet
LOVE THIS PLACE! Amazing environment and bitchin' biscuits. The staff is always so happy and energetic too :D
This place cracks me up--and they have amazing coffee too!
Cool name ! Very crowded in the morning, so come early. I had the "Hot Mess B****" biscuit which was delicious
Excellent biscuits and the ingredients that go inside.
Love the food. I'm not in downtown often, but I like to stop here when I am.
this place is a go!nice place
Everything was delicious! We each had a different biscuit and they were all amazing!
Tasty, cheap, no frills biscuits. Delicious!
Love this place, love the biscuits, love the coffee and chai, love the bitches!

Best brunch in town. Even when there's a considerable wait, it's worth it. I recommend supporting this local business so they can hopefully grow to serve more patrons at a time.The food was so delicious. I ordered the Straigh-up bitch, and I was a little skeptical because I had never had gluten free anything. It was so tasty and it hit the spot just right. The customer service is some of the best I have experienced. They were so kind and family friendly. I think her name was Virginia, but she was super kind and it felt genuine. Will definitely go next time I am in Seattle. Overall, such a lovely atmosphere.
Yum yum for my tum tum!!!! That's all I have to say about that!!
So tasty - especially the smokin hot Seattle bitch. Best cure ever for a hangover.
Very crowded, long line but worth the wait.
Son of a bitch--- this place is good. Get a lot of everything when you go.
Simple and delicious. Not fancy, not pricey, not healthy. Simple. Delicious.
Best food by far. Have to visit this spot! There fast and the food was amazingly fun to order and even better tasting.
Very friendly and fun!I will recommend to my friends, great service Great business
So tasty and the service is amazing!
Amazing comfort food - definitely worth the wait.
perfectly satisfying
Sunday brunch here is amazing. Better get there early, otherwise you'll be in line waiting and the lines can get very long!
yum, yum and yuuuuuuuummmmmm....
Good food, many choices. Good service and great location. Would definitely come back.
Very good food! It's a must have while in Seattle!! Small space, but definitely worth it!

Best biscuit I've ever had from a restaurant and not home-made. Every time we go there, they never disappoint.  It's crazy as hell in there, but it's beyond worth it. Biscuits are not a health food. These people make it so good that you don't have to eat it every day but you always come back. That's the meaning of comfort food! Thank you for your awesome service, loud ass music and no-nonsense attitude towards the crowds of the Pike Market. You always treat us right and I eat super healthy for the most part! I make exceptions for exceptional biscuits ;)
awwwwwesome!!!!!! breakfast was everything :) love it
Mouth watering, delicious, amazing! That is all.
Yum these biscuits are so good a full meal too... And their sticker rocks! The customer service is always top notch too I am impressed.
The vegetarian gravy is the bomb, it is the best I have ever had. I love the atmosphere here as well. The staff is always super friendly.
Amazing
"Pork Bitch" is to die for. Bacon, sausage gravy, biscuits, cheese, and ask for an egg on top too.
amazing breakfast, if you're willing to wait
Delicious every time!! I always have to take out out of town visitors to experience the yummy goodness!!
Good food good service..good vibes.. I even bought a T-shirt.

Just the best late night after drinking food that you can get hands down. If you haven't tried it go the next time you find yourself out and about after midnight. Love this place and just want it opened more hours...
I never been to a restaurant that specialized in biscuits.
Awesome!
I am so full. So full. So good. Eat here. Yes.
Love it. Great food and coffee.
Good place.
Fantastic 2am food! Loved it!
deeeeeeeeelicious!
Best Breakfast EVER!
Hilarious menu board and great biscuits, relatively cheap and quick. Had a great time here with my girlfriend, the inside is a bit small though so make sure you go on a nice day to eat outside!
Food was great, staff was friendly, loved this place.
Great breakfast, fun environment, definitely a must!!!
great fun quirky place. good service and cheap eats
One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Nothing more to say.

Biscuit Bitch serves a really delicious late night breakfast! Good old fashioned southern-style cooking with modern twists (the vegetarian gravy option, made with shiitake mushrooms and smoked salt for example). The sausage gravy is rich and flavorful, and the biscuits have just the right balance between density and fluffiness. Take into account your other late night options (hot dogs) and Biscuit Bitch becomes the cream of the crop! And it looks like plenty of people agree: downtownseattle.komonews…

Never felt so discriminated in my life. This place is the absolute worst! Management you need to do better about your establishment! This place discriminates and for no reason We are visiting Seattle from SoCal. We are of Asian decent. Our family joining us were visiting Seattle for the first time. They are military and moving to Japan tomorrow. They are African American and they wanted to try Shaker + Spear as their last meal in America. We all walked in as you can see from outside that there were empty tables. We were a party of 6. The white hostess looked at us and basically said she doesn't have a table to accommodate us and that she won't have any for the rest of the night. My group consisted of 3 adults and 3 children. There was a table right in front of her that accommodated more than 6 people. She said I can recommend somewhere a bit more "casual". I didn't understand what she meant by that as we were just as casual as she was, along with other people in that restaurant. She then proceeds to call on another guy saying what's that one Mexican place that you recommend? The guy looked confused as he was like it's Italian. She then proceeds to name other places that we had no desire to eat at. We hear of this happening all the time to other people and today, this ignorant POS wanted to give us that experience. Does this establishment not accept kids? Is there a dress code to eat here?Do you have to be of a certain race to be allowed to eat here?Are we, as tourists, not allowed to dress casual in jeans, pea coats, and Nikes, to feel comfortable in the rainy Seattle weather as we are sightseeing? Is this attire just not acceptable to eat at this establishment?Do you just judge people as if we look like we can't afford to eat there? Whatever her ignorant reasons were, we all felt discriminated by this white chick. Then to top if off, as we were exiting, one of our kids was approached by another white ignorant idiot. My nephew had a boot on as he broke his leg in an accident. This idiot decides to ask my nephew hey kid what did you do to get that boot? Was it something stupid or smart? He's like there's only one right answer but I bet you that you did something stupid right?I was like wtf are you f-ing kidding me right now?! What kind of idiot talks like to this a child??!! Man this place sucks! F this POS racist place!

Host had to yell to ask if we had a reservation. We yelled back, yes!After being seated across from each other, we had to yell to hear each other. Food and service may be great, but acoustics are so bad we left before ordering.
SUCKED! Possible our worst Eatery experience in Seattle. Bad Bad Bad service and a totally not caring about the customer Experience. Really do not go here.
Portion was small, and didn't fill me up. The cook on the black cod was perfect though, and the flavors worked well together. Maybe they could add a puree of some type to make it more substantial.

Nice location and atmosphere. Service was good. Scotch Olives as appetizers, really no flavor. Wife had the braised short ribs and really like it, especially thought the sauce was very tasty. I had the Seafood Paella, which I thought didnt have much flavor.

Had a chance to dine at Shaker + Spear and it was quite the experience! I tried their Dungeness Crab and Shrimp along with the Steelhead. Each dish was a showcase of flavor and freshness - the seafood was cooked just right, bringing out its natural taste. The ambiance of the place adds a nice touch, creating a cozy yet upscale dining atmosphere. Service was attentive and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. A solid four-star spot for seafood lovers!

I visited this establishment for breakfast and opted for the shaker hangover, a dish featuring fried chicken perched atop a biscuit with gravy and crowned by a fried egg. It proved to be quite delightful. The biscuit had a rich, buttery taste, and the chicken was expertly fried. As you might expect, it's a hearty meal, and the name suits it perfectly.Securing a reservation for a 10 AM Saturday morning visit was a breeze, and it seemed like we could have easily walked in as well, as the restaurant was not overly crowded. The service we received was of good quality.While their breakfast menu is somewhat limited, I found myself intrigued by some of their seafood offerings, so I may return to explore the dinner options in the future.

Recently visited Shaker + Spear for both brunch and dinner on separate occasions. Tried a variety of dishes, and while everything was prepared well, I felt the flavors were standard for the price point. The ambiance is nice, and the service was attentive. It's a solid choice if you're in the Belltown area, though I was hoping for something a bit more unique in terms of taste. A respectable 4 stars for the overall experience.

Absolutely loved this restaurant. Excellent service and food. The staff were all friendly, helpful and attentive. The cocktails were amazing and the food was beautiful presented and delicious. We were looking for great wine, seafood and we were not disappointed! We'd go back for sure.
Food was fresh, creative, and tasty. Service was amazing from host, to server and kitchen.Terrific experience.

Very good food. Slightly overpriced. It's inside of a hotel, so you're paying a "we have you captive" tax. We came here for brunch. I had the trout Spread and homemade crackers and my husband had the crab cake Benedict which features the cakes as the muffins. This is a great idea! Yum. He had a cappuccino which ran $6, and I had a $4 tea. Both were alright, but definitely not worth those costs. If you're charging $6 for coffee it better be something to write about and not in the way that I'm currently doing it. The trout was awesome. In a city with so many options, this was good, but not worth the rating it currently has. The service was great. Hosts and servers super accommodating. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Their grilled octopus was indeed very fresh and fascinating. The salsa of it was extremely tasty and succulent. I did enjoyed it's chunkiness and marvelous quality of it. For my dessert, I always chose Warm pistachio crumble fr it was unique and one of a kind. Good job Shaker and spear!
Intricate flavors. No dish is simple. Great wine list. Reasonable pricing for quality and plating beauty. Delicious.

he wait and host staff, excellent. Food is a must have Seattle stop. Drinks prepared top notch, beer good and cold and of course fine selected wine. Desert a must have. Menu set up is starters, small plate, entrees, and to die for sides. Excellent selection or ports and sherry.
Love the food. I have been weekly since it opened almost 2.5yrs ago. Food and Beverage menus change regularly enough to keep you interested - they typically keep the fan favorites.
My friend likes this place better than me because she ordered the recommendations. So, go for what the server recommended; otherwise, it will be a little bit disappointed.

We visited Shaker + Spear while in Seattle, and I'm so glad we did! From the moment we walked in, the service was impeccable--attentive without being overbearing, and everyone made us feel right at home. We started with the octopus appetizer, and let me tell you--it was fantastic. Perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor, it had just the right balance of tenderness and char. Every bite was a delight. For our main course, we split the burger, and it did not disappoint. Juicy, perfectly seasoned, and accompanied by fresh toppings that elevated the dish. Even splitting it, we found it to be satisfying and well-portioned. The ambiance was also worth mentioning--modern yet cozy, with a great vibe that complements the stellar food and service. If you're in Seattle and looking for a spot with top-notch food and excellent service, Shaker + Spear should definitely be on your list. Highly recommend!

After eyeing this seafood restaurant for a while, I finally decided to give it a try-and what a delightful experience it turned out to be! I don't typically indulge in seafood, but every bite tonight was a revelation. The cauliflower steak was simply delicious, and the roasted pepitas added a fantastic crunch that elevated the dish. Despite my usual preference for fully cooked salmon, I thoroughly enjoyed the medium rare preparation, which paired perfectly with the squash and pickled watermelon. As a side, the brussels sprouts were a tad spicier than expected, but the combination of flavors was absolutely amazing. Overall, I can't praise the dishes I enjoyed tonight enough; the flavor profiles were outstanding and truly memorable.The dining area is small, so I would recommend making reservations to ensure you get a table. This restaurant exceeded my expectations in every way, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit to explore more of their enticing menu.

These noodz are delicious. Fresh. Yumm.The location is iconic. Easy to access. The interior is super attractive. There is a bar as well. I just loved being here. Fellow diners chatted with me, and my server was kind.I ordered so much food! And they offer the vegan option!! And I got tofu as well. So good. Just a happy belly.

I went during their soft opening. I loved their balsamic tomato with buratta cheese and their wine selection was great. We also had eggplant ragu and i highly recoomend it. Great place, great atmosphere for date night!
Delicious food, waiters are very attentive, and super nice atmosphere. Can totally recommend it and will definitely come back again.

We went to eat at the whiskey bar, but decided we wanted a little bit more food and came here what a delight! The atmosphere is wonderful. The sever was very kind and very friendly, and the food came quickly. I got the charred octopus which was divine. In addition, I go the steelhead, which was simply delicious. My husband got the scallops, which was very good too. Thank you so much for a wonderful time and great service.I can't say enough good things about the dishes. We enjoyed the night, where the flavor profiles were outstanding. It's a small dining area, so probably a good idea to make reservations.
I am a food lover, and I loved this place. It was a great spot for my and my family to go have a nice meal and a nice family moment. Place food and service were great.
Food was fantastic as well. So much detail with the presentation. I appreciated the quality of seafood and it was just what I was looking . loved it

I didn't expect to much but the food was surprisingly good. The place was cool and fantastic inside. Lively setting pleasant ambiance. Excellent menu and drinks were so cool and refreshing. Amazing quality of food. Entree was so delicious, well-presented, and speedy. The service was so nice and attentive. Pleasant experience and I enjoyed dining there. Customer service was beyond great.

Fantastic food here! We sat at the counter near the chef and they were all super friendly and gave us some free appetizers to try. My friends really like the lamb chop they got - super tender and not gamey at all. I will definitely come back here again!

The best mussels I ever had! Shaker and Spear's Penn Cove Mussel is one of my fave! It was just around $29. I'll definitely come back for it! We had no reservation when we came but was able to get a seat, their service crew was great!

Nice restaurant. Food was delicious and the service was friendly and warm. I would recommend to anyone and suggest making reservations.The menu is diverse and offers a wide range of options and tastes. Prices are reasonable for the food quality, portion size, presentation, and taste. I ordered the short rib entree, which came with a delicious sauce on the side.
Brunch is back!! If you haven't been, you should. What a great atmosphere!! Great chef and service!!

This restaurant is amazing. Dinner was outstanding such a real experience and a memorable moment. Service is top-notch and the atmosphere is well suited for the location with a good view outside. I will be back soon.
Great spot! Food was delicious and the staff was attentive, friendly and made excellent recommendations. 10/10 will eat here again.
Variety of menus and their seafood was reallygood.The staff was friendly and helpful. Recommended!
Great atmosphere, excellent food and fantastic service! First time here and I enjoyed it so much! Definately will be back to try other items on the menu!
Great food and best service. Recommended!
We are from out of town but this was a nice find. Great food, great wine, great dessert, and great service! Must try!

Ate here 2 nights in a row. Phenomenal. I rarely give 5 stars. Get here before they get their well-deserved Michelin stars and the secret gets out. Terrific food at fair prices, when do you get to say that? Additionally, the staff was terrific. If you can, sit at the chef's counter.Can't wait to for my next Seattle trip to come back here!
Great service, food, and amazing atmosphere.These servers are super kind, and the restaurant looks really nice

Ah, my mouth is watering remembering last night! This place is def worth trying and returning and recommending and inviting.I went with a friend of mine who ordered the cheese sandwich (sorry if I don't remember exactly how it was on the menu. It comes with fries and white souse and it was delish.I went with the octopus and broccolini along with the brown rise chicken bowl with a lot of goodies.Delicious. Absolutely amazing food.I don't usually do dessert, but because I liked the food so much, I had to give it a try, and that was my best decision ever.Their pistachio ice cream with biscuit and souse is mind blowing.

Fantastic fish!! I took my best friend out on a hot lady date here! We dressed up, had champagne, Mac and cheese, and the fresh fish option!!Oh mamma. This place is amazing!I didn't think you could find a fresher piece of fish that Matt's or Ivars, but with the way Shaker and Spear dresses up their entrees is pretty exquisite.One of the few places that stands out as worth the money with a great atmosphere. Gentleman, great date night spot. Get a reservation ! :)

My friends and I dined here last Friday and had the best time. The food was amazing and the waitress was so wonderful - so nice and attentive to our table and so helpful when choosing entrees. Love love loved it.

Brian and the rest of the cooking staff were nothing short of awsome. The wait and host staff, excellent. Food is a must have Seattle stop. Drinks prepared top notch, beer good and cold and of course fine selected wine. Desert a must have. Menu set up is starters, small plate, entrees, and to die for sides. Excellent selection or ports and sherry. Thanks for making a Seattle trip a great experience.
I love good food. This place is fantastic. I haven't left many reviews, but i felt i had to for this place. Favorite resturant in Seattle so far.

At first I thought I had made a mistake choosing to go here because the inside is decorated so particularly it feels pretentious. However, the wait staff was perfectly friendly and the food was exceptional.
Extremely nice staff. Food very well executed. Not overly priced for the quality of high end seafood.

Sitting at the counter is a great place for a date. The cooks make good small talk and explain the ingredients and really make for a great experience in addition to the excellent food. All the dishes have great presentation.

Sitting at the counter is a great place for a date. The cooks make good small talk and explain the ingredients and really make for a great experience in addition to the excellent food. All the dishes have great presentation.

I've been to Shaker and Spear three times now, and each time my experience there gets better and better. The servers are very attentive and friendly as well as knowledgeable. On all occasions, they were able to answer any questions I had about the menu. Morgan, the floor supervisor was very attentive and friendly and made sure that all my requests had been taken care of. The food is really fresh and flavorful, most of it bought from local vendors. It may seem like an expensive menu, but once you taste the quality of the food it's immediately justified. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who lives in the Seattle area or to anyone who is visiting.
LOVED this place! Benjamin was amazing as well!
Mitch was very knowledgeable and had a great sense of humor!
staffs are so stupid, having bad policy, cannot make reservation.
Was told there were two tables open but upon arrival they said there will be a 55 min wait.

The service you received from the Ishoni Yakiniku staff was subpar. The waitstaff were not attentive or friendly, and you were left feeling neglected and unimportant. It's important for any restaurant, particularly one that charges a premium price, to provide exceptional service to its customers.Firstly, the quality of the food provided was not up to your expectations. It's disappointing when you go to a barbecue restaurant and the meat isn't cooked to perfection or isn't of high quality. This is especially frustrating considering that you're paying a premium price for the food.Our experience at Ishoni Yakiniku was not a good one. The combination of mediocre food and poor service left you feeling dissatisfied and disappointed. While it's possible that others may have had a better experience, based on your own experience, it's hard to recommend this company to others.

I recently visited this restaurant and while it was a decent experience, it was not outstanding. The atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. However, given the price I honestly expected better quality of meat.The food itself was good, but not exceptional. Overall, it was a decent experience, but not one I would rush to repeat. If you're looking for a Japanese BBQ, there are probably better options in the area.
The service was great and the meat was so good! The small dish with melted butter changed the game, I will be coming back.

Overall I think the food is good and for the promotional price it was worth it but the normal price might be too expensive for what we had.The meat was well seasoned and the variety was good. I think the cuttlefish was the standout option.The only really weird thing I noticed was that the set salad that was using Costco salad mix. The dressing was good but could have been better.

Food is great! I've been this place for a few times now. Dish I must order thick cut beef tongue and of course the signature truffle sandwich w wagyu beef! I would avoid the clam soup though. Not impressive at all.
A bit of a wait, but food satisfying.Would be better if it were all you can eat like most yakiniku places. On the better side, the Beer was perfectly cold and our server was great! Ty Jackie!
The food quality was good but the size is relatively small portion. I recommend to order more. And the service attitude is great but a little bit slow
Awesome Japanese BBQ. Good place for dinner gathering. The service is good as well. Street parking is not easy, but has paid parking slots across the street available.
This upscale Japanese Yakiniku joint is a long-standing destination in the Seattle area, previously located in Bellevue.

Top quality waygu! Favorite dish is the A5 wagyu nigiri, which is the perfect balance of meat and white rice. The restaurant is busy and I would say a bit understaffed. It's not the best service but the quality of food definitely made up for it.

Top quality wagyu! Favorite dish is the A5 wagyu nigiri, which is the perfect balance of meat and white rice. The restaurant is busy and I would say a bit understaffed. It's not the best service but the quality of food definitely made up for it.
10 out of 10! One of the best restaurants in seattle. Please go visit. I suggest the Sammie's

We recently had dinner at this amazing Japanese barbecue restaurant with my partner and his mom, and it was an excellent experience from start to finish. The restaurant specializes in beef, and they really know how to do it right. The variety and quality of the cuts were impressive--from tender wagyu to flavorful short ribs, every bite was mouthwatering.The interactive experience of grilling your own meat at the table added a fun and engaging element to the meal, allowing us to cook the beef just how we like it. The marinated beef was packed with flavor, and the sauces provided complemented the meat perfectly.The atmosphere was lively but not too loud, which made it a perfect spot to enjoy with family. If you're a beef lover or just want to experience authentic Japanese barbecue, this is the place to go.
Great quality and service! We had the set which included beef, cuttlefish and pork jowl.

Best yakiniku in Seattle. Great taste, decent portion. Meat is fresh and they have lots of variety.The only thing was that this place was too busy. We had to wait more than 20 minutes even though we had a reservation.
Really good place for bbq! Meat quality is high and great service! Highly recommend for dinning places
Best yakiniku place in Seattle Good service and food is delicious Come here with friends

Ishoni Yakiniku is an absolute gem for anyone who loves authentic Japanese BBQ. The quality of the meat is outstanding, with every cut being perfectly tender and flavorful. The atmosphere is cozy yet modern, creating a great vibe for both casual dinners and special occasions. The service is top-notch--staff are attentive, knowledgeable, and quick to offer recommendations if you're unsure what to try. The grill-at-your-table experience adds a fun and interactive element to the meal, making it more than just dining, but an event. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy premium Japanese yakiniku!
Really good meat and marinades. The lychee beer is great too. Service is good, make a reservation ahead of time
"Amazing Japanese BBQ with top-quality cuts, fresh sides, and excellent service. Highly recommend!"

Our party of four came to Ishoni for a friend's birthday on a Thursday night. Every table was full and it was very lively with music playing but not excessively loud.We each got their Flash Deal meal set (disclosure: posting a review entitles you to a discount on the set) as well as a Mentaiko seafood udon (limited 20 servings a day on Tues/Wed/Thurs) and they were both awesome. The set comes with a large variety of meats with beef, pork, and calamari as well as side dishes like rice, salad, and kimchi. The meat was all fresh and well marinated and tasted great. I recommend the udon if you're a fan of mentaiko and it's still available. The servers were really nice and came by multiple times to change our grill grate and fill our waters. They also helped us store a birthday cake in the fridge and gave us plates and a cake slicer to celebrate.The grill itself is somewhat small so it may get cramped at times for four people but that just gave us more time to eat and chat. Overall we had a great experience and will come back in the future :)

The place is so chill and is easily one of the best Japanese BBQ spots l've had the pleasure of visiting. The experience here is all about quality and authenticity, from the premium cuts of meat to the attentive service.

I had the pleasure of dining at Ishoni on Mid-Autumn Festival, and it was an incredible experience. The quality of the meat is outstanding--fresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is also exceptional. The staff are attentive and welcoming, and the atmosphere is cozy and inviting. Every visit feels special, and I always leave looking forward to the next time. Highly recommend Ishoni to anyone looking for a top-tier dining experience!
We came in for holiday special combo, which has good variety and enough meat. All meat are very delicious
Fresh meat; good environment and friendly service. I love the condiment, and the salad sauce.
It was a good meal! We got good combinations of beef, pork, and seafood. The portions are decent too, more than enough for our group.

Beef tongue is a flavorful and tender cut of meat that, when cooked properly, offers a rich and unique taste experience. Whether grilled, braised, or simmered, it can be enjoyed in a variety of dishes, from tacos to hearty stews. The delicate texture and savory flavor make it a favorite for those looking to try something different. In addition to the delicious beef tongue, the excellent service enhances the dining experience. Attentive and friendly staff ensure that every meal is enjoyable, making it a must-try for any food lover seeking a memorable meal.
Great taste. The food is delicious and the service is good as well. I would recommend it.

Ishoni delivers a fantastic BBQ experience! The meat was tender and flavorful, and grilling it yourself makes it even more fun. The fresh sides and attentive service made the meal even better. Highly recommend!

This Japanese BBQ restaurant offers a vibrant experience with top-notch ingredients and exceptional flavors. The quality meats are perfectly grilled, and the variety of sides enhances the meal. Service is friendly and efficient, making it a memorable dining spot.
Been here multiple times, great yakiniku spot with delicious food, cozy atmosphere, and friendly service!

Great food and service. We got the Ishoni beef combo and the vegetable combo along with 1 appetizer and some rice, which was perfect for 3 people. Our servers were very kind and got us extra utensils quickly when we needed it
Taste: 5/5Value: 5/5Presentation: 5/5Service: 4/5Ambiance: 5/5Beef combo was a great value to try different cuts! Tongue is a must try!
Great food. Great service. Not easy to find parking. Price is at the high end. Overall great experience!

I had the pleasure of dining at Ishoni Yakiniku, and it truly transported me back to the nostalgic years I spent in Japan. From the moment I stepped in, the restaurant's authentic ambiance and decor created a warm and inviting atmosphere that set the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the outstanding quality of the meats. Each cut was of the highest standard, and grilling them at our table allowed us to savor the delicious flavors and aromas. The selection of meats provided a delightful variety, ensuring that every bite was a pure delight. The marbling and tenderness of the meat were superb, making it a true treat for any yakiniku enthusiast.Beyond the delectable cuisine, what made our visit even more special was the excellent service provided by our waitress. She was incredibly attentive and made sure our grill was always perfectly heated and ready for the next round of mouthwatering meats. Her passion for yakiniku was evident as she shared helpful grilling tips and suggestions for pairing the meats with various dipping sauces. Moreover, she was a fantastic conversationalist, making us feel like we were enjoying a meal with an old friend.Ishoni Yakiniku surpassed my expectations in every aspect. The authenticity of the restaurant's ambiance, the top-notch quality of the meats, and the impeccable service combined to create an unforgettable dining experience. Whether you're a seasoned yakiniku enthusiast or new to this style of dining, Ishoni Yakiniku is a must-visit destination. I can't wait to return and indulge in more delicious yakiniku delights!If you're looking for an authentic taste of Japan and a place where you can indulge in mouthwatering meats with exceptional service, look no further than Ishoni Yakiniku. It's a gem that I wholeheartedly recommend to anyone seeking an unforgettable yakiniku experience.
I love Japanese BBQ and this place hit the spot. Everything I asked for and more, I honestly have no complaints whatsoever. I'll most definitely be coming back for more.I recommend the BBQ Pork Buns.

I came here for a birthday celebration with some buddies, and they are excellent at social distancing. The service was excellent, and our server was delightful. Ishani rice, cucumber salads, kimchees, beef tongues, beef rib fingers, tofu salad, wagyu beef short ribs, miso soups, a5 shabu slice, corns, and a large amount of sake were among the dishes we had. Everything was fantastic!
Amazing. That's all I gotta say. Get the... EVERYTHING. Wagyu, kalbi. All amazing. Pick wisely. You will get full!
10/10 everything is amazing!!! We were all so surprised when we had our first bite. It's not cheap but definitely worth the price!

First time here at Seattle location, definitely a big step up from the previous location. Spacious, beautiful decorations. Paid street parking or public parking.Food is a little bit pricy but very good quality. Service is great as well.
Ordered the to-go lunch. Everything is delicious! Me and kids fight for food! Definitely will order again!

Poor service, we did call to reserve a table and, when we arrived the same person that answered the phone did threat us bad "saying that we had not reservation ready & we have to wait about 3 hours to have a table "
Absolutely unconscionable to not allow reservations during the pandemic!
Good food - too expensive.We had almost every item on the menu. Just get tacos and a beer.

I used to love this place, but it's changed quite a bit and isn't as close. No more salad bars, no more horchata, servers forcing you to get drinks. I guess this place just got popular and good about it and now they just provide an experience.

Food here was okay, but I wasn't super impressed. The burritos were too sloppy and more greasy than anything. We also ordered a few tacos and they were just okay. Overall it was not very flavorful and lower grade than what I was hoping for. The tortillas were too thin and chalky.
Good food, nice atmosphere! Waiter could've been a bit more attentive but overall good experience.

If there's one thing that can bring world peace, it's probably the union of high-end steak and Mexican cantina vibes - and that's exactly what you get at Asadero! When you walk in, you're greeted by a mariachi band playing "Beethoven's 5th," because nothing says "fiesta" like classical music! You would be remiss to live life without trying the Vacio and asking for a side of flour tortillas with their unique salsa sampler. Cocktails leave a little to be desired. Price:Value ratio = phenomenal
Outstanding, only downside was they were out of a wine we selected otherwise 5 stars.

Absolutely spectacular. Small restaurant with all the right vibes and INCREDIBLE steak. They have a huge selection of Wagyu beef and it was some of the best steak I've ever had. The price ranges well for this nice of a steakhouse! HIGHLY recommend the filet flight.

Amazing meats in their mains. Appetizers, especially the bone marrow, were not too great. However the mains made up for it, and more. The Wagyu stake and Carne Asada are a must try. The place is cozy so try to get reservations beforehand as it gets packed. They also have a bar and the cocktails are good. Tried the Mangojito.

We went there to celebrate my birthday. We ordered Wylarah wagyu and Japanese A5 filet. They are the most expensive wagyu on the menu(not sure if there's any hidden menu for better choice) The meat is great. I saw from the review from others saying it's overcooked and IT IS! Luckily I ordered rare for the fillet and it's great! Try to order with one lower level of doneness. This restaurant is not for fine dining, smoky(from the steak cooking board) and noisy. Those are fine for me.One thing I dislike: the cooking board is very hot and cooking the meat so oil splash everywhere.... I have it on my clothes and my hands and arms... it last for like 5 minutes before we couldn't stand it and asked for a players remove the meat from the hot stone board.

Really good food and service. The seating was way too tight for us and there weren't a lot of booths. We got rib eye tacos, guaccomole, stuffed jalapenos. Portions were perfect and food was really good! Tables were tiny and cramped

Went with a coworker. Yeah I know could be worse but really wanted to get home.  So we decided we needed a good meal. Service was fantastic. Seated right away and really felt welcomed.  Has oysters as app and they were perfect.Filet and lamb chops is what we got and both were as good as any steakhouse I have been.  I have been to many. The service made the place it was outstanding.  Only reason not 5 stars is slightly pricey.  But compared to other steakhouses it is a bit more reasonable. I can handle paying as long as it is good. This place was worth it.
If you're reading reviews to see whether or not you should come here, drop your phone and come here. You will wait. It's worth the wait. Order the Zabouton steak and you'll be happy

It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant worth raving about, but this is definitely one. We arrived for lunch and had prompt seating and service. We ordered appetizers including their homemade flour tortilla chips and guacamole, along with a baked potato covered with fixings and strips of savory steak. Both were phenomenal. For my main dish I had the ribeye tacos topped off with selections from the salsa bar. I honestly can't wait to go back.

The carne asada is perfect to share with another person. The meat was tender and delicious! The fish tacos were also well cooked and flavorful. We'll definitely be going back to try more dishes at Asadero!
The best steak ever.  I come from California just to eat here.  Cam is the best host.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Asadero Ballard, and it was hands down the best steak I've ever had. The steak was a perfectly cooked and juicy Australian wagyu MS9+ served on a hot stone, allowing me to keep it at my desired temperature. The bone marrow appetizer was also a standout from the night. The atmosphere and service were equally as great and I recommend this place for anyone looking for a fantastic steak dinner.
Amazing experience! Have taken two friends here for their birthdays and it's been a hit!

If you're looking for a true meat-lover's paradise, Asadero Ballard is the place to be. Their selection of perfectly grilled meats is nothing short of exceptional--every bite is tender, juicy, and packed with flavor.But the real surprise? Their baked potatoes. These aren't your average side dish--they're massive, perfectly cooked, and loaded with toppings that complement the meats beautifully.Whether you're craving a hearty steak or a side that steals the show, Asadero Ballard delivers an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommend!
Amazing food and great service in a perfect atmosphere. I had the carne con chile and it was amazing. Comes with tortillas on the side too.
Everything is always amazing, tasty & great customer service. One of my favorite restaurants hands down.
Was great! The food was fresh! They were very helpful with the menu. The places was new and very clean
Truly great. Had lunch here with some friends and must have had at least 5 different things, bill was surprisingly not bad. Great service too.
Everything was spectacular, the food was amazing , the bartender, very friendly, total team

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Asadero, and while the food and ambiance were remarkable, what stood out was the outstanding service provided by the team.Brandon was incredibly polite and courteous. He greeted us with a friendly smile every time he approached our table. It's clear that he takes great pride in his work, and it shows through his attentiveness and care. He is eager to take responsibility for customer care and committed to providing quality service.Damien was well educated on the steaks and provided fantastic recommendations on both drinks and food. He really made us feel at home in Asadero. If you are interested in spice, definitely get the jalapeño appetizer!Thank you, Brandon and Damien, for your outstanding service. You have made our evening special, and we look forward to returning to Asadero soon.
Absolutely amazing!!! The steak tacos were so delicious and our waiter was very nice. A must-try! We will definitely come again!
Great food and wonderful service! They were very attentive and took great care to cook my steak to my liking.
Best restaurant in Ballard period. This is my go to steak fix. Zabuton is my favorite and wines, appetizers are really good. Staff friendly too.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant and I must say that it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. The ambiance of the restaurant was elegant and inviting, with dim lighting and tasteful decor. It was the perfect setting for a memorable dining experience.The service at the restaurant was amazing! The waitstaff was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations. They were prompt in taking my order and made sure that I had everything I needed throughout the meal.Overall, I would highly recommend this steak restaurant to anyone who appreciates a good steak. The combination of excellent food, elegant ambiance, and exceptional service truly makes it a standout dining destination. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply looking to indulge in a delicious meal, this steak restaurant is sure to exceed your expectations.

Great restaurant for small and large groups. Anniversary, potential client, or just want to impress the in-laws. The steaks are to die for. The staff was amazing, very attentive, and accommodating. Drinks were spot on.
Amazing service, excellent food and wonderful atmosphere! Will be back for sure, you will not be disappointed.

From the moment I walked into Asadero Ballard, I was met with the inviting aroma of grilled meat that immediately transported me to a world where culinary craftsmanship and tradition come together in harmony. The pièce de résistance of the night was, without a doubt, the ribeye steak.Every bite of the ribeye promised an explosion of flavors - a symphony of smokiness that was neither overpowering nor understated, perfectly complementing the inherent richness of the meat. The tantalizing smoky flavor, reminiscent of age-old grilling techniques, brought forth memories of rustic barbecues, and yet, it was served with an elegance that is befitting of a fine dining experience.Accompanying the steak was a baked potato that deserves its own accolade. Fluffy on the inside, with a crisped, golden exterior, it was the ideal counterpart to the hearty steak. It was as if the potato had been baked to perfection, capturing the essence of earthiness and comfort in every morsel.
Best wagyu steaks Definitely a must try Bone marrow is a must get Would not regret if you know what amazing food is.
There was no vegan stake, so I took the boneless cabbage steak instead. Service was good, great ambiance.
Great food and service. A good local Ballard restaurant. Try the carne asada - you will not be disappointed!
Amazing! Came in for my wife's birthday; steaks were amazing, portions were generous, and the service was top notch.
Good beef quality, very friendly service. Will definitely recommend my family and friends here!
My go to steak place in Seattle. The prices are reasonable and the steak is delicious! Recommend getting the vacio
Best food, amazing service. I highly recommend the stuffed baked potatoes, they are unreal. Been here several times and will go again and again

Overall, this Latin steakhouse provided a phenomenal dining experience. The cuts of meat were some of the best I have ever seen. The restaurant had a quaint outside setting, and we were seated right away. Our server, Samuel, was fantastic and attentive to our drink and food requests.To start, we ordered the guacamole, which was super fresh and served with crispy house-made tostadas and bread. The fire-roasted jalapeño stuffed with cheese and bacon was delicious, but the standout was the chorizo cheese dip, which was the best of the three appetizers.The salsa they provided was fantastic and had a spicy kick to it. It added an extra layer of flavor to the meal.Since there were seven of us, we decided to share the Australian Wagyu tomahawk and the World of Filet Wagyu, which included American Wagyu, full-blood Australian Wagyu, and Miyazaki Japanese A5. The combination of these different types of Wagyu beef couldn't get much better.As for the sides, the fire-roasted poblano peppers with corn were fantastic, and the charred broccoli was exceptional as well.We were so full from the main course that we decided not to order dessert, but overall, the dining experience at this Latin steakhouse was outstanding.
Had lunch here as usual everything was good the server was very attentive definitely will come back for dinner
Really yummy! Great presentation wish that there were more side options but a really nice option to bring out of town guests.
Loved this place!, came with my wife for a date night food was amazing, drinks were amazing. service was amazing would definitely come back.
Best steaks in the north Seattle area
First time here. Came for lunch on a quiet Saturday afternoon and had a very pleasant lunch. Will definitely be back for a steak dinner sometime.

Wow! This was so good. The Filet Mignon Flight was a juicy flavor explosion that melted in my mouth. We also tried the Guacamole and Tuetanos, both excellent. The service was perfect and fun, with lots of table service on food and drinks.
Very good food and very good customer service. We will surely come back but It's hard to find parking though.
Super delicious and the perfect price. Better bang for your buck than even top end restaurants that charge more.
Wow. Stop reading and just make a reservation and see for yourself. Hands down the best steak of my life (Australian Wagyu Ribeye).
They have the Best fish tacos in town!

I recently visited Asadero Ballard and was thoroughly impressed. The food was incredible, with the best wagyu tacos I've ever had. The atmosphere was inviting and usually very packed, so make sure to arrive early to get a seat. The service was good, but can be slow at times. Prices were very reasonable, especially for the quality of the food. I'd highly recommend Asadero Ballard as a great spot for dates or friend nights. Overall, 5/5 stars for this place!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at a fantastic restaurant and I wanted to share my amazing experience with others. On Monday, I gathered with some friends for a goodbye dinner and I couldn't have asked for a better dining experience.The restaurant was warm and inviting, and the atmosphere was perfect for catching up with old friends. From the moment we sat down, the service was top-notch and our waiter was incredibly attentive. But the real star of the show was the food!When the steak arrived at the table, it was sizzling on a hot plate and the aroma was simply mouth-watering. I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first bite, as the steak was cooked to perfection and was one of the best I've ever had. The flavors were bold and rich, and it was a real treat for the taste buds.Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience. The combination of great food, excellent service, and a cozy atmosphere make it a top choice in my book. If you're looking for a delicious meal, look no further than this fantastic restaurant. You won't be disappointed!

I go to this place twice a month.Armando takes good care of us,lot of tequila shots..The Rib-eye is so delicious.I highly recommend this place they have the best service and ambiance and surely if looking for the best This is the go place
The food was amazing, the service was fantastic. We had a great anniversary dinner here. Recommend!
Amazing food and staff in so friendly! Great spot for lunch and/or dinner, highly recommend!
Amazing restaurant and even better if you're lucky enough to have Armando as your server!
Omg their dishes are so worth it. We would go back anytime we are craving for some meat dishes
Hands down the best place for steak in Seattle. The quality of the beef is second to none. Incredible flavors, great prices and good food all around. A+++.
I had been looking for a good steakhouse in Seattle for some time. Asadero did not disappoint. My family and I were impressed by how good everything was. Hands down the best steak we have ever had.
Everything is so so good. I'd leave it at that but there's a minimum character requirement.
Why go anywhere else when you can wagyu here?!El Zabuton Wagyu and Wagyu Tacos will never disappointed.
The carne asada is to die for! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

We decided to give this place a try after reading the reviews online and they did not disappoint. Food was unique and delicious. Everything was high quality from the meats to the drinks and the staff working. Highly recommended.
The food was amazing as well as the service. I can't wait to go back. 10/10 would recommend!

The most flavorful and was surprisingly tender, and if you're looking for meat but not looking for a stuffy steakhouse. This is the place to go! It was nothing short of delicious!!I highly recommend you go to this location instead. Way shorter wait at a fraction of the cost.
Great experience and great food! The waiter recommended us trying the bone marrow and it was delicious! Will be back again
This is my family's favorite place to eat. The food is consistently good as is the service.
Love love love Asadero, the meats, the margaritas, the service, all perfection! Can't wait to go back!
Omar, the owner is always supervising the daily activities and ensuring the customer service is at it's best. Wait staff and cooks are always friendly and attentive.
Asadero ballard has a very yummy steak sandwich, high quality steak for sure!
Absolutely amazing! The steak was cooked to perfection and the customer service was top notch! Probably the best steaks and sides combination in Seattle.
Fantastic food. Great customer service too !
So delicious! Wonderful service and the Waygu tacos were FIRE! The mollettas could not be more perfect as well.
They have some of the best steak sandwiches here!
Asadero is great. From steak sandwiches to classic cuts of steak, it can't be beat!

Fantastic atmosphere and terrific food. Wagyu very nicely marbled with rich flavor. Very good original cocktails and was a perfect spot for a table for 2. Really enjoyed the experience here, high quality food and I'll be sure to return.
I love this restaurant!! The best steakhouse ever. After couple rounds I've done. The service was great, we celebrated my brother birthday and they made us really happy,Thanks guys!
Food was great, steak was so good. Great services very attentive. Recommended!
Amazing... Got the burrito for lunch and hands down was the best burrito I've ever had.
The food was amazing and the serving sizes are very reasonable for their pricing. The staff provide a great service. Absolutely recommended.
Probably my favorite restaurant of all time. Always clean, always tasty and always fair priced
The most amazing toritos. I ordered some to-go the next day. Our server/bartender was super nice. The restaurant was very clean. The food was delicious. Will definitely go back soon.
Best Mexican Steak house in all of Seattle!

Came here for dinner on a weekday. Got a torta and carne asada and both were fabulous. Loved having carne aside made with a high quality cut of beef. Service was excellent, too. Glad it was more casual than expected.
One of the best places I've ever been to. The wait is worth it. The wait staff is super nice and the food is excellent.

One of my favorite bbq places in Seattle -- probably make it out here once a month. Food is tasty (spicy chicken sandwich is my fav) and the servings are plentiful. I'll admit that the menu isn't as broad as you'd expect of normal bbq joints but the stuff they do serve is pretty damn good.
If you like tacos, and you have a taste for the finest meats, there is no other choice.
Amazing food and great service. Even when busy, they take excellent care of you.
One of my top restaurants of all time. Amazingly good meat and salsa.
I love tacos and these are the best tacos I have ever ate. I am full and still want to find room for 1 more.

This joint is great. For the price it's hard to beat. Party of 4 with drinks, appetizers and entrees (1 shared) was just over a hundred dollars. The service was good as was the food and left full and satisfied. One tip however is to get there early as in like right when they open we happened to get the last large table and in the time a line had formed. I see this place becoming insanely more popular. Was a great dining experience and I highly recommend it. For the best experience, like I said arrive early
Amazing flavors, first class quality cuts of meats ! Get there early or you will be waiting and if you're not there at 5-PM when they open you will be waiting .

I'm surprised to find out that this establishment it's a second location of the Kents beloved Asadero , Ballardites should be proud to have this family opening a location in their neighborhood this is true Sonoran style food only found in Arizona now becoming the "thing" in L.A and trust me this is better than the LA places been there done that , salsas are excellent guacamole is included in the salsa bar which is a nice touch and portions are great no skimping on the beef , the best Mexican food in Seattle Period ....

Asadero Asadero ... I had been your fan for a long time back from your beginning in Kent where most of your clientele was Mexicans and a few people knew about your great carne Asada tacos hence even back in those days they had only like 5 items .. all great though but i decided to visit your new location in Ballard , it was a nice experience it was like watching your kids go to college or something like that I don't have kids lol but that most be the feeling about seeing a business and grow up to bigger leagues , well on the food I tried the tenderloin tacos my friend got the already traditional carne Asada great as always service needs a little work , my check took longer than normal to get but it's all good it's a new restaurant and we understand that they have stuff to work out overall a great experience.

This is the best Mexican place in Seattle period ... The weird thing is the location though the family that runs this place are super nice and friendly I don't know why they decided to expand to Ballard ? When most of their customers are Latinos looking for the real thing and not hipsters looking for trendy rip off places that sell organic water and weird stuff like that ... This is as real as it gets its like eating in a asadero from Hermosillo Sonora lovely ! The rib eye tacos cooked to order and the massive carne Asada they don't mess around with portions and we north Mexicans love that ! I just wish them the best in such a difficult location open a place where your people appreciate your food I just don't see them cutting it in Ballard but I still wish them a good business and will support them as much as we can but remember that it's us Norteños that love your food !!! .

Great Place , at first I was a little worried I tought asadero was going to become a hipster trap in Ballard ... but no the same kind family runs this place , they were very busy and understaffed but they told us before waiting for table , they have a couple of different items than their kent location , they have tenderloin tacos which are excellent also zabuton wagyu for those looking for something more fancy in their tacos , plus a full bar I will give them a couple of weeks to work their kinks out in terms of service , food is top notch and their salsas are unmatched .

I go to this place often to grab some oysters. Usually have a great experience. Whoever was the hostess tonight made me never want to return. I walk in at 10:25 to be seated and am told their kitchen closes at 10:30. Which is odd cause I've never been told this especially cause I only order oysters and a few drink around this time and day. Needless to say I won't be back.

I am still reeling from shock of how horribly myself and my family were treated. I, visibly pregnant, was seated at a table with a bench on one side and 2 chairs on the other. My 2yo and 5yo were both sitting with me on the bench side waiting for my husband to arrive. There were 3 other similar tables next to us, all still unseated. The hostess kindly brought us crayons for my children to color on the paper laid across the table. My daughter was coloring, never straying once from our table. My son was guardian of the crayons. On three occasions, my *near 2yo* screamed loudly "MINE!" when my daughter went for a crayon. I am well aware this is less than ideal. It is a phase he is in, screeching any time he is excited or mad or expressing emotions. Before and after each of those moments, he was calm and happy and just fine. Each time he did it, I did my best to get him to stop immediately. We had been there all but 10 minutes. The manager, Christopher Fischbach, approached me and said "You are going to have to reign this in." I asked "excuse me?" And he said "you are going to have to reign this in. We can't have your children running around and the screaming will have to stop." I replied that my daughter hadn't left the table once and then asked how he suggest I stop my not yet 2yo son from screaming?" He said he didn't know. I asked "and what if I can't? Will we be escorted out?" And he said "if it is excessive, maybe so. We have to seat these other tables."At this point I was so incredulous, I could not believe this was being said to a paying customer, let alone the fact that a child was being targeted. I asked if this was routine for them, he did not reply and he walked away. I still cannot believe this happened. I am appalled. I am ashamed to say that we stayed, but I refuse to be bullied. Yeah, they got my money, but I have my dignity. And I hope Christopher (who, no, does not have children of his own) treats families trying their absolute best with the respect they deserve moving forward. He was a pretty massive disappointment to humanity tonight.Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money here. The food was not remotely worth what they lack entirely in service.

Transphobic environment. As you've probably gathered, my partner is a transgender woman and I fully support/love her, we were eating at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Southcenter when my partner said she felt someone staring at her, I was going to assure her that kno one was staring, however, I was appalled to see this kid working there standing in the kitchen entrance pointing at her, I stared the kid down until he walked away. I immediately asked for the manager, the manager who came over to help us was completely drunk, he asked us if we were sure he was pointing at us, and he offered to pay for our food. This place is a whole bundle of bad memories for us now. Time to go to Cheesecake Factory instead.

No sign out front. Just a door painted pink. When we finally found it, it wasn't open yet but someone came to the door and said that if we wanted to wait until they opened in 20 minutes we probably couldn't get seated right away because we didn't have reservations. Kind of a snotty attitude as well. So we just walked away.

The food and service doesn't matter for this review. Our waitress wore a t-shirt that said "My Body, My Choice, My Abortion". I don't care what your beliefs on this topic are. Any establishment with such little class and decency that would allow an employee to dress like this isn't worthy of visiting. Shameful.
This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. I would give them negative stars if I could.
If I could give thus place zero stars I would. They are racist!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!
I went there and I noticed the door. IT WASN'T PINK! Why?! Please paint it pink! Never go here again if they don't paint this door!
The only restaurant I have ever walked out of-TWICE

This is my favorite restaurant and my family and I have spent a lot of time here. Tonight sept 15th 2018 we called and were told we couldn't make a reservation and to just come in. We arrived at 6:50 and were turned away saying that there is no space for us ( there was plenty of space as we could see) We were told there was a burlesque showing going on later in the evening in the back. The lack of communication makes me never want to come here again.

Arrived to the restaurant with reservations to find the menu so offensive with anti-Trump item names. Way to offend patrons who want to support your restaurant. Your employees are mandated to obey the owners political views - no thanks. Never will we support your business. Service was terrible once we expressed being offended.

We made reservations through open table and received excellent seating in the dining room. I have been to the pink door for many many years and for many occasions, however on this particular occasion we were celebrating 2 birthdays. We enjoyed a very nice lunch for two, linguine vongole and the squid ink pasta seafood special.The awkward moment arrived when the server brought us an empty plate with two birthday candles absent of anything except the two candles.We felt as though he presented an "empty" birthday wish. I am still dumbfounded by the gesture. Honestly I would have preferred no recognition rather than the empty plate presentation. That was the one star reception we received. My friend had flown in from San Francisco for this luncheon and it was immeasurably disappointing.
Rude Manager! Dont waste your time going there. Manager (blonde woman) was very rude to us.

Posting political views on your menu is completely unacceptable. The first thing I looked at was the drink menu, only to come across a drink called "Dump Trump" I find this offensive and arrogant. I will not be back nor will I recommend The Pink Door to others.

$20 per person for "Theatre Seating" for their Burlesque show means cramming chairs in around the dining tables. They wouldn't take a reservation for dinner, but made us prepay to sit next to the kitchen for the show. I feel like a pauper in the Kings court.

The place is cute! The trapeeze performer is great. The problem was the cost of the food for the quantity and quality. We really went to see the perfomace thinking it would be a fun way to spend dinner. Well the performace is five minutes at best, every 30-45 minutes so don't go for that. The food was way over priced. I spent $44.00 for a small bowl of (premade) gluten free pasta with a bland cream sauce, a butterscotch pudding (which was pretty good) and a glass of water-yes $44!!! . Since I had to eat GF I didn't get bread unless I wanted to pay $3 more for Udi's bread. There were no dinner salads, veggies, meat for my dish or anything else. I hate the Italian Denny's (Olive Garden) but have to say I have had better meals there and for a better price. Felt a bit duped by the allure of a cool performace which is the only reason I was willing to spend that kind of money on pasta only to find out it the performance wasn't really part of the ambiance. Very disappointing.
****worst food poisoning of my life****

We planned our meal two months in advance, reserved a table, and hoped to top off the last night of our Seattle vacation with an excellent view, meal and drinks.We were seated on the patio, jammed into a corner but jutting out into the walkway, where we were jostled by staff and other diners. We ordered sodas while taking a moment to look at the wine menu, and decided to share an order of the calamari with spinach. This was okay, a bit overcooked and chewy, but we had high hopes for the meal - I ordered linguine with clams, and my husband ordered clams and mussels.I had one bite of my pasta with clams, and couldn't eat anymore. The pasta was overcooked, but all of that was masked by the amount of sodium in the "broth" - you could taste nothing BUT salt, as though a cup of it had been poured into the cooking liquid. The acidity burned my tongue and scoured the inside of my mouth. I couldn't taste or eat properly for two days afterward. My husband's clams and mussels had no seasoning or taste, other than that of steamed and overcooked seafood. No garlic, wine, herbs or anything else. It was as if they'd steamed the shellfish and dumped them in the bowl. Also, no pasta or other sides were served with that dish: $26 or so for a bowl of flavorless steamed mussels and clams. We declined to order something else, and asked for our check. This was the only time in our lives that we've ever walked out of a restaurant. Although the manager comped our soda and calamari, we left a comparable amount on the table for the waitress and staff. We figured they shouldn't be left without the tip they'd have received had the chef and kitchen staff not put out such an embarassing "meal". We spent an hour trying to find another restaurant that was open in the area after 9 PM, which oddly enough is not easy to do, especially as we'd walked from our rental to The Pink Door.As far as ambience and staff: the greeter and our waitress were very nice. The place was okay, but other than some cute decoration and a good band, it wasn't exceptional - certainly not enough to balance out the mediocre starter and inedible meal. I can honestly say I'd not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Poor form to not warn people about the trapeze act that will take place right over their table.
Mediocre Tiramisu

The first time I went to Seattle, my coworker suggested I try The Pink Door. After reading the rave reviews, I was excited to check it out. I ordered the seasonal Love Fest drink and the spinach pasta lasagna. Both were absolutely delicious--the best lasagna and cocktail I've ever had. Despite it being pretty packed and not having a reservation, the host kindly offered me a seat at the bar. I didn't mind since I was dining solo. The bartender was very friendly and made me laugh as we chatted about San Francisco, my hometown. The ambiance was charming, with a dark yet cozy interior and live music, which was a lovely bonus.Fast forward to my second visit, which was during my birthday weekend on a solo trip to Seattle. I decided to have my birthday dinner at The Pink Door. Unfortunately, this experience was vastly different. I arrived around 8 PM, close to the last call for dinner, so the restaurant was quite empty. Despite this, the host insisted I sit at the bar again, which felt odd since there were plenty of empty tables and I wanted a more traditional dining experience for my birthday. I ordered an orange cocktail (can't remember the name), and while the waitress carded me, she didn't acknowledge my birthday at all. Additionally, my water cup was only refilled by a passing busser rather than my waitress, who seemed inattentive. The lasagna was just as delicious as before, but the service this time was extremely disappointing. It felt like they weren't interested in providing good service during the last call.The food at The Pink Door is amazing, but the service can be hit or miss. They definitely need to improve their service, especially for customers who dine during quieter times.
Have eaten here before and it really good food but the service is terrible.
It's awesome! The food and the atmosphere are so good. Definitely will be there again!
Too pricey for food. Good for decor, waterfront view and live music

The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the food was excellent. Our server and the overall service on the other hand was less than subpar and rude at times. I came here with my girlfriend knowing I was going to spend a few hundred dollars and we were taken to our seat and immediately told by our young male server that when he is in our presence we have to put our masks on which I am 100% on board with preventative measures regarding covid however when im in a restaurant sat across from one person while our server is 6ft apart it didn't make sense but we went with it. Putting his unapproachable attitude to one side, we literally had to wait close to 20 minutes to even order our first drink which again showed either his lack of understanding in the customer service industry or lack of respect to his patrons. I know he isn't a true representation of this establishment because of the many other great reviews but when youre spending hundred of dollars on a meal, the environment and service should be a solid part of the package and this was lacking. I have been to nearly 8 restaurants over my vacation here in Seattle and this guy ruined what would be an amazing 5 star place. Would not recommend to friends or family.

To be honest, I wasn't that impressed with The Pink Door. My wife and I were really looking forward to going and we thought it was a bit of a classy place, judging by the website. Turns out, it's not. Luckily for us, we got to sit inside, but the tables outside all had plastic picnic type table cloths. The restaurant is located in an alley and it fits in with the Public Market scene, but definitely not with the classy scene that it portrays on the website. The food wasn't that great either, ESPECIALLY for the price we paid. I had the spaghetti, which came with no garlic bread or anything and my wife had the steak, which was more bone than actual meat. The main reason we wanted to go was for the trapeze artist, which was supposed to be performing from 6:30-9PM, so I made our reservation for 6:30PM. The whole hour and a half that we were there, she performed for 2 songs. That's it! The trapeze artist isn't something that should be advertised if she isn't going to perform. Overall, I definitely won't be returning to The Pink Door. It's just not worth the money. It's nothing spectacular.

The servers are pretty rude and mostly nonexistent and heaven forbid you have a question on the menu. The food was adequate and terribly overpriced. I would have enjoyed Olive Garden more for 1/2 the price. Don't waste your money on this pretentious "destination" restaurant.

the back with some nice views (of the Ferris wheel from one side). While on the other

The Pink Door is a decent restaurant with some hits and misses. The lasagna was enjoyable, offering a good flavor. On the other hand, the fish of the day dish didn't live up to expectations, lacking execution on flavors. Additionally, it was disappointing that there were no enticing non-alcoholic dessert options to choose from. Overall, it was an average dining experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Pink Door, an Italian restaurant nestled in a charming corner of the city. While my experience had its highlights, there were a few aspects that left me wanting more.Let's start with the positives. The service at The Pink Door was exemplary. From the moment I stepped through the pink-hued entrance, the staff greeted me with warm smiles and made me feel welcome. They were attentive, knowledgeable, and ensured that my dining experience was smooth and enjoyable. Kudos to the staff for their exceptional service!The drink selection at The Pink Door was a true delight. The bar is well-stocked and the mixologists behind it know their craft. I tried a couple of their signature cocktails, and each one was expertly crafted, bursting with unique flavors and beautifully presented. If you're a fan of creative libations, The Pink Door will not disappoint.Now, onto the food. While the dishes at The Pink Door were undeniably well-prepared, I found them to be on the pricier side. It's true that quality ingredients and a skilled culinary team come at a cost, but I couldn't help but feel that the prices were a tad steep for what was served.Specifically, the pasta, often hailed as an Italian staple, left me somewhat underwhelmed. While it was cooked to a perfect al dente texture, the flavors fell slightly short of my expectations. The dishes lacked that extra oomph that elevates a good pasta to a memorable one. Perhaps a bit more attention to seasoning and innovative flavor combinations would enhance the overall dining experience.Despite these shortcomings, The Pink Door does possess its fair share of merits. The attentive service and the remarkable drinks are definite highlights that shouldn't be overlooked. However, I would encourage the restaurant to refine their flavors and consider adjusting their pricing to offer better value for the culinary experience they aim to provide.In summary, The Pink Door is a decent Italian restaurant with good service and amazing drinks. While the food may be a bit expensive and the pasta lacks a little bit of flavor, it's still a place worth visiting if you're in the mood for a charming atmosphere and attentive service.

The ambiance is amazing and so is the service. I feel like they need to up their game with vegan stuff especially being this upscale restaurant in Seattle. I tried their only vegan spaghetti and I hate to say that it was tasteless I have been to the pink door before when I wasn't vegan and loved it. I would love to see if they up their Vegan game and pull us, vegans, toward them

Can't ever get into this crazy place- there is ALWAYS a line and a wait. When I finally got to try it, it was just okay. The food was to be expected, and our server seemed too busy to really pay attention.

We were really looking forward to this restaurant based on recommendations we'd received and Yelp reviews we'd read.There is no sign, just a pink door. The interior is fun and whimsical.The reception we received at the front desk was lukewarm. Our server seemed to be having a bad day. Not bad service, just no warmth or personality. I think if the hostess had seemed happy we were there, it would have started us on a better track. We wouldn't go back, but I guess it's worth one visit.

Its' a pretty good place to stop in if you're into live music. The live music they have is fairly nice and the lasagna is also pretty good. All in all it's a nice place I would mind going back to every now and then.
I met a group of friends here for lunch on a Friday. Everything about it was a thumbs up except the parking. That was a nightmare. Lesson learned, choose a less popular day at the market.

Nestled in the heart of Seattle, The Pink Door is a true gem among Italian restaurants. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with the comforting aroma of fresh herbs and garlic, instantly transporting you to a cozy yet elegant, restaurant with perfect setting for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends.The menu is a culinary journey through Italy, featuring authentic dishes bursting with flavor and made with the finest ingredients. Start your meal with the three meatballs or a delightful selection of cured meats, cheeses, and marinated vegetables. For the main course, the homemade pasta dishes are a must-try, especially the Pink Door lasagna. Each bite is a revelation, showcasing the skill and passion of the chefs.Pair your meal with a glass of wine from their extensive selection, expertly curated to complement the flavors of the food. Our waiter kept bringing us endless amounts of fresh bread with basil infused olive oil and balsamic. Don't forget to save room for dessert! I had the grapefruit marmalade cake with ginger whipped cream.But what truly sets The Pink Door apart is the impeccable service. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure that every guest feels welcome and cared for, adding a personal touch to the dining experience. Thank you Dan for being our waiter this afternoon!In conclusion, The Pink Door is a culinary masterpiece, offering an unforgettable taste of Italy right in the heart of Seattle. Whether you're a seasoned foodie or simply craving authentic Italian cuisine, this restaurant is sure to exceed your expectations. Buon appetito!
Great good and great service. I really like this place. One of my favorite places for dining.
Very good food and service! However, there was a bit wait time . I recommended this place
