So excited that I finally got to try this restaurant and it definitely lived up to the hype! Hidden in an alley near Pike Market and only identifiable by their signature pink door, this restaurant feels like stepping into an old vaudeville theater. When we went, there was a live band with an amazing vocalist playing blues/Americana music. The pasta was good but the dishes could've used more sauce that was a consensus from all. The prices are affordable that's for sure. We stayed for a few hours, enjoyed the food, atmosphere, jazz band and company. The service could've been quicker but the waitress was extremely nice and knowledgeable. There's no reason why I wouldn't go back.

Highly recommend. Great location. Solid bar program. Menu with great options. The space with outdoor seating was elegant. The table cloths on the patio are low-end beyond being kitschy or campy. Otherwise would go back! I would love to return.
Great first date place! Great view. Great people! The food is just okay.

The gnocchi was kind of a weird mushy texture, the Bolognase was probably the best out of all the dishes we tried, it's definitely a beautiful place to have lunch/ dinner because of the views on the pier. Lots of windows by where we ate which was nice

Highly recommend. Great location. Solid bar program. Menu with great options. The space with outdoor seating was elegant. The table cloths on the patio are low-end beyond being kitschy or campy. Otherwise would go back! I would love to return.

My friends and I came here for dinner. The inside looks classy, very clean, and the lightning brings the area look more elegant! Our server was very accommodating and talkative. Everything was delicious, and the meals were pretty unique! We will try this place again!

I got a little incredulous about the eatery, the food showed up before long. I was amazed and believed that it should be old however it was new at my stun. So I am down here cause this place looked nice to me and this was the best decision I made today. Great place to have lunch in peace. I was in stress all day but came here down and it calmed me a lot. Try as much as you can. The service was top notch, I will be back!

I've come here for the past three months and ordered the same dish over and over again. It reminds me of my mother's cooking, and she passed away last year. This place literally reminds me of a restaurant in my hometown my mother and I used to visit often. Whenever I start to miss my mom, I just come here.

At the end of every meal, I like to wind down my night with a coffee. Surprisingly, this place always brews my coffee fresh. Which a lot of places don't do. And I get a desert to pair with it nicely. I'd just like to say thank you for always providing great and consistent service. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I tried this place for the first-time last month. I've been here twice within the last week. My mission is to try everything on the menu here. This is my fifth time here and so far everything has been a hit. I recommend everybody to this place. I will come here once a month for the rest of my life. I'm not joking.

This is my go-to spot on late nights after the kid's games. After their games the kids are hangry and tired. So, the fact that they know my kids and make them feel so welcome is great. The food is consistent and tasty and comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I get my favorite drink and we all have a great time

I ordered take out from this place for my coworkers and I for lunch. We only have an hour to eat so I was hoping that everything would be ready so that we would have enough time to eat. Everything was ready, hot and they put extra condiments in. Will make this a regular thing.
The interior was nice and had a great ambiance. Our server was awesome and very attentive! The food was ok. I would go again for the right occasion.
Decent place to eat. I love pasta and wine and this is the place for it if you love both. Fresh ingredients and friendly staff.
Really good food outstanding service. The wine was the bomb diggity. No doubt.
Thanks The Pink Door I got the best experience here I like the food!
The place are do great I often to visit here because of food of course and the service!
Like the place and the food is delicious, I am grateful thanks!
I think the place is beautiful and the food as well are all good!
Great outdoor seating and nice music for drinks on weeknd nights.

We could not have been more delighted with our experience at The Pink Door. We found it by chance and it really does have a nondescript pink door. But when you walk inside, you get the feeling of warmth, history and elegance. The food was fantastic and they easily accommodated my no grain eating challenges. Their house infused olive oil was out of this world. We had filet of sole and a butternut squash risotto with shrimp. Could not have been better. We wanted to keep eating because it was so good but were full! Wait staff was friendly and attentive. Live music was fun on a Saturday night. We will be back!
Money super worth it! Very different and memorable experience. No review can give this place the justice is deserves. I highly recommend to try it for yourself.
had dinner there great restaurant
The food is just ok, but the service tends to be good and it has a good ambiance. It is good for a late night drink.
Cool old Seattle spot, classic food.

Always a great time out here!! But staff can be a little snooty. Thats the only downfall. Food is good and atmosphere is awesome. Especially on the patio that they have. Can be crowded so must prepare to wait.
Boom! I went on a Wed night and flavors were spot on.Service could improve though!
Love this place. You'll never get a bad meal here!

The squid ink pasta is amazing here !!! But parking is a pain in this area, so just beware. I would plan accordingly. Pay for parking as if you were planning on visiting the market as well as eat dinner.

My first time to come at the Pink door and I had great experiences. Delicious food, drinks and the ambience were wonderful and intimate. One of the best Italian menus I've ever seen and everything's looks delicious and well presented at a reasonable price. The service was good as well as the staff. Looking forward to coming back again.

Was a little intimidated to try the Pink Door. No signage. Entry weird. The service here was amazing. Our server was very accommodating and helpful. Interior neat, clean. Comfortable. Prices reasonable. Will definitely try again.

Always a great time and the family loves the lasagna. Great way to escape for a night out.Can be hard to make dining arrangements and have had hit and miss experiences with hosts, but worth the effort.

This spot is flavorful! The lasagna is beyond words. I additionally had shellfish, the fish tartar and some different applications. All stunning. The view is extremely lovely and notwithstanding discovering this spot is an adorable ordeal - locate the pink entryway in the rear way. One of a kind within and great nourishment and administration.
Good food. Great service. Fun place.

I love that how this place effortlessly makes someone feel at home. The environment was so good with delicious aromas of foods spread all over. Our ordered food was served so well and it was so appealing to my taste buds. Our server was very friendly. He gave us the details of all the dishes and so it was easy to decide then.

A significant fascinating section to this spot, we went hunting down a pink entryway with no sign. Had the lobster ravioli and the eggplant pasta for course. The administration was brisk, the server helped us pick sustenance. We finished supper on olive oil cake with orange and pomegranate sauce - it was immaculate! Provincial old fashioned feel, the unrecorded music after some time just develops the air! PS: Ask for the seat by the window, you may very well get it as we did ! :)
Good menu. Good Service. Good food. good location. What more is there to say?
Good food and good atmosphere. Good service. What more is there to say?
Great food and service I was here three times and will come again

Although a bit expensive because it is located in a touristy area, the food is delicious and so are the cocktails. The service was very friendly and the restaurant has great views. We did not need a reservation for a Friday afternoon. I would go back to try more dishes.
Although I didn't polish my plate, the lasagna was soft and cheesy.
the muscles the muscles and the sauce ...MMMM tastsy
Loved the lasagna! Tried a couple of the drinks and wasn't very impressed with either

Go to the Pink Door on a warm evening. These are pretty rare, but it's definitely worth spending one on the Pink Door's elevated patio. In fact, make an evening of it by putting on that swooshy little dress you paid too much for and a spritz of expensive perfume. I love their wild mushroom risotto and they make a damn good caesar too. Of course you will enjoy a glass of wine or other pretty drink, and your companion will find you enchanting.
So Good!That's all that i really want to add. So suck it up.
Great place for a nice date night. Wonderful staff.
Great food, a lot of fun, is a little slow. Give yourself plenty of time if you're planning on attending a show after dinner.
Great show! A great date night event
Really amazing food. Fun atmosphere, great live music. The service was amazing and we all enjoyed our meal.
It is a cozy place and the foods are very delicious！
Super fun atmosphere and AMAZING food!
Loved it! Great food and entertainment. Highly recommend
One of my all time favorite restaurants. Fantastic ambiance, we were seated on a table with a waterfront view. Wonderful food. The cheese board was a great start to our meal.
This place a good food at a good price and it's interestingly fun. I'm not sure if it's for all people but for us we had a good time and left happy.

Got a gift card for a present, so the wifey and I checked it out on a Sunday to see the trapeze artist. Good show in great ambience, the space is awesome and unique. The food was good but nothing special compared to the hundreds of other Italian places in town. Since it's been over a month ago, I can't even remember what we ordered, which means while it was good it also isn't especially rememberable. Still, you should go check out this historic Seattle restaurant. You won't be disappointed and is you go on a show night all the better.
I went here for Valentines Day. The service was great and the food was delicious!
Its been a while since I've been to the Pink Door. It hasn't changed a bit. I did have a pleasant meal, but the service was the star outstanding staff in every way!
A great location doesn't hurt this wonderful local business. Recently they relocated their kitchen or rather renovated their kitchen and I think that certainly helps. Friday night spot on fun.

I came here at about almost closing time and still got served. I had one of their vegetarian dishes and it was delicious, I can only imagine how good the ones with meat taste. It wasn't busy at all but then again it was a weeknight. Love the place, the feel and the service with such great food.
A bit pricey but great atmosphere
super busy but love the vibe and environment
Really, go for the tapenade, the lemonade, and the summer deck seating.
Such a Seattle Staple.If you are there for me I am there or you!!Super good food!!!!!!!!!!

One of most vintage and collectively put together restaurants I have been to in Seattle. The simple but elegant aesthetic adds a nice touch to the vibe and provided my time there with relaxing energy. I indulged in the spaghetti with meatballs and enjoyed the simplicity in the flavors.Everything blended well and gave my palled a sweet but organic dance. The pricing is far and if you have dessert you're only coming out of your pocket about 40$. HIGHLY recommended!!!!
Amazing experience. Delicious food. Great service. Long wait(didn't have a reservation), WORTH THE WAIT.

Great overall experience. We started with the cheeseboard and it was the perfect start to the meal. I had the Linguine alle Vongole and the clams were so fresh it was one of the best linguine's I've had. My partner had the Lasagna, which he said was amazing. We were really pleased with this restaurant and definitely plan to come back on our next trip to Seattle.
If it wasn't for the Seattle traffic it would be 5 stars!!

Great atmosphere! Small jazz band trio was play on a Tuesday night. Loved the food and creative drink menu. We went back on another night since we liked this place so much. I also learned that they have acrobats that work the indoor swings on some evenings for added entertainment.

Love this place! Food is awesome and they provide decent service. I have had a few instances where the wait for food was a little long but besides that, I have had no issues. The food seems fresh and tastes delicious

Best Italian restaurant I have been to in Seattle! I came here and had the grilled Caesar salad and it's hands down the most delicious plate I've ever had. It was so good I couldn't even wait to take a picture. I also ordered the tuna tartare and shared the red sauce pasta! I'm so pleased with the quality of the food here. We also bought a bottle of Sangiovese and it was on point. Classy feel, classy restaurant! Such a great experience!!
Loved the cabaret with dinner, Fantastic, talented woman

I ordered the cioppino and my god, the broth was delicious. I eagerly asked our waitress for more bread so I can lap it all up. My girlfriend ordered the risotto which was so craftily made and had such exquisite flavor and wasn't overcooked nor undercooked but just right. For dessert we got the apricot and strawberry crumble which was too sweet, but thank god we had some ice cream to tone it down.

Excellent spot for a cocktail and a great atmospheres. Traveled here with some friends and this place was recommended by the hotel concierge and once we got there we knew why. Excellent selection and the bartenders knew what they were doing. They were very knowledgable and didn't have to stick to the menu, they offered to make anything with any individual ingredients that you like. Step right in and enjoy
great atmosphere, live music & shows some nights. super cool 'speakeasy' vibe though it's just down the alley from Pike Place

The Pink Door. I 'd been here once before, and had an excellent experience, so I convinced the group to check it out. As before, there was an accordion group, which totally rocked (we lucked out and got a table close to the stage). I went with the chilly dungeness crab dish, and between the four of us, we killed two bottles of wine, and totally enjoyed ourselves. Everyone adored their plates too, and the desserts were divine. Highly recommended.
so much funmust go at least once :)duhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh
Good food. GREAT atmosphere. Perfect for a date night.

One of a kind surroundings, as well as the vegetarian/pescatarian food collection is varied and delightful. Undoubtedly one of these areas which makes you feel as if you have finally found the city and broken out of the tourist routine, regardless of the closeness to Pike's Place I could not decide between 4 and 5 stars, but it gets five to counter all the whinging.

Burlesque, Italian food... what is not to like?!The patio in the back is where all the real action is (weather permitting). Decent views of the water and downtown.They have some vegan options here, which was a nice surprise (I am not Vegas but when going with friends). I am a big fan of the puttanesca.I have only seen the "show" once, and it was entertaining but the real star is the food.Its called the Pink door because, other than the pink door, you wouldn't know how to find the joint.The bar across the alley was a great place to go after to continue the celebrations. I am drawing a blank on the name.
Went there once, the entrance is literally a pink door and sit by the stage. The ambience is very cosy and the host is very friendly. Will come back for sure.

Visit the Pink Door on a warm evening. All these are quite uncommon, but it is definitely worth spending one on the Pink Door's raised veranda. Actually, make an evening of it by putting on that swooshy small clothing you paid too much for and a spritz of expensive cologne. I really like their wild mushroom risotto and they make a bloody great caesar also. Of course you may appreciate a glass of wine or another pretty beverage, as well as your company will see you enchanting.

Coming to this place was an interesting experience with the rustic pink door entrance. Plus knowing it was more of a pub it sort of threw the feel off. All the art on the walls and building was a please surprise and was excited about the whole place.The lasagna was fantastic and given the reviews from everyone else it's no suprise as well. Lasagna with some tabasco sauce makes it even better. Especailly with some heat makes the pallet just open up to bring the favor in that much more.

Really good food, great for a night out, can get pricey but the food is definitely worth it, in the summer you can sit on the balcony which is a huge plus, parking can be hard to find sometimes due to the prime location.
great food options. go there for happy hour! it is the best. some great shows are placed here too
Love Pink door. Jude is amazing!

I have lived in the Seattle area for quite some time yet had never been to the Pink Door. It was my birthday and my friends wanted something different than the usual so we tried it. Overall the food was good, all of our different wines were wonderful and we liked the atmosphere. We went on a Saturday evening so were able to watch the trapeze act. I'm told that they have 3 different trapeze acts a night but we only saw the first one. A little disappointing but still a unique experience. On Sundays they have a Vaudeville type of show that we haven't seen and may go back for that sometime. One note to others who have not been....there is no sign to indicate where the restaurant is outside. You enter from Post Alley and you must look for a kinda pink door to enter the Pink Door. Guess we should have read the yelp reviews before going :)
The veg lasagnas were great and surprising light!
Beautiful decor - my girlfriend and I loved this place. Everything was exceptionally good, from the food to the service. Very happy with my experience here.

DL: This place has consistently great pasta (not as great as Barolo, but pretty close). The entertainment can be fun. Their appetizers tend to be on the spot. They have nice hours (good for people who work late and whatnot).Pink Door has been a consistently good spot. The particular highlights have been the pasta and the appetizers. Their pappardelle ragu is great! Most often Pink Door has been delivered via Postmates. It's one of the most solid bets for Italian we've found for delivery.

It's been two months since my friends and I visited The Pink Door and my mouth is still watering whenever I think about how amazing the pesto lasagna was. I never thought a simple looking dish could taste that incredible. It's a must-order. The calamari was excellent as well. We assumed it was the usual deep fried dish but it wasn't. It was a nicely sauteed dish with garlic, tomatoes, spinach and white wine. When you enter through the pink door, you'll be mesmerized by how pretty the place is. It's an ambiance I'd imagine my reception to have if I had a small wedding party. The setting was whimsical, elegant and romantic.The back part of the restaurant has a more laid-back feel and is also where the bar is located! There's also an outdoor seating area - perfect to enjoy a meal with your S/O or friends.

You Gotta Go Once... this is one of those places that is the complete experience. Right from the start, the whole idea that there is no sign, just a pink door on an alley, gets you in the theme. It's not that hard to find if you pay attention, and look over the wall and see all the people dining on the deck that hangs over the water with an amazing view. Once inside, it's got that old Seattle brothel décor, and if you time it right, a trapeze artist twirling around for her 5 minute performance every 30 minutes. If you book online, it's for seating outside. We were there during a rare heatwave, so outside at night was great. Perfect view of the water, the Great Wheel, and a cool statue on the neighbor's balcony next door.The service was good, friendly, attentive, informative. The food was tasty, but my two teenaged sons reported it was not enough food. They both ordered the Pappardelle, which was only that on a plate. I ordered a really juicy piece of freshly caught king salmon, and my husband ordered cioppino. My plate was the tastiest, simple and fresh. The cioppino was good, but neither a brothy soup or a plated dinner, it was somewhere in between.If you somehow book a table inside, it's more crowded, intimate, and entertaining for sure. On Saturdays they have a cabaret show, which is separate from the meal.
Great surprise. Ambiance was awesome glad we got in at the right time. Seafood was great and authentic.
Goto place when I'm in downtown... it never disappoints!
Great Italian food with classy ambiance!
Yup! It's good!
Fun, eclectic environment. Quite delicious

Service great, plenty of choices of wine (Italian and West Coast focused), and the food is always good (Some new items Every time). Their Cesar sounds so simple but its so good either add the shrimp or the crab. We tried the fish of the day and cioppino. Let me just say Seattle gets down with their see food. This place is always busy and they have live music almost everyday of the week. The entrance in an alley way so its fun to find. Close to Pike Market and Downtown. Very Romantic and from now on will make it a point to dine here every time I come to Seattle.
A must stop for me whenever I am in the area. Don't missed the Trapeze show. Great service, delicious food and an overall fun experience. Recommeneded for dates and birthdays

Took my wife here for our night out. Had an amazing time. The menu could of have a few more options, however all the food was good quality. I will for sure take my wife back in the summer for the out door seating our waiter mentioned to us. Slightly over priced so it is more of a special occasion restaurant. Parking around there was hard to find but I guess I have to expect that by pike place.
It was a great little out of the way place for lunch. Food was delicious and the server was very friendly. Will definitely come back.
I don't get this place. I mean the food wasn't bad, but I didn't see anything special. Definitely did enjoy the performance. I would give it a try one more time.
Huge servings and the food was really delicious.
Lobe the Pink Door! Went there for the first time in 5 years last week and it was still fantastic! What a unique and wonderful place to go and drink and eat. One of the very best in Seattle!
Been dining at The Pink Door from the time it opened. Consistently superb food, ambiance and staff. Always perfect for a special evening.
Very nice, cute and romantic... the food is awesome too!

We came here over the weekend with some out-of-towners, and wanted to give them a great dinner experience. This place delivered. We ended up splitting two appetizers, and I personally ordered the lasagna, and it was great. My wife really enjoyed her linguini and we all had a great time.The meal was a little pricey, but the atmosphere and the staff were wonderful. The performance was very entertaining as well, and it was worth the cost for such a great meal, and such a great time.
The pasta is divine!
love it the food. Very fresh seafood.
This place has great food and good entertainment. The price was a little high, even with a trapeze artist.
The short show is not bad. The food is not bad. But the cocktail is diluted.
Love the environment but the food is so so.
I've only been once and already remembered the address! It's just that good.

DELICIOUS! Everyone says this is a great date place, and it is, but it's also a great GNO (girl's night out) place! My bestie and I LOVED our experience. The waitstaff was attentive, the food was amazing. I highly recommend the pasta with bolognese sauce! YUM! And the trapeze artist....AMAZING!
The clams and mussels are amazing.
I always go back for their prosciutto, the best in town.
The art of burlesque dancing.
The food was very good and the ambiance was great, they had live music playing while I was thereThe service was good and I would go back again.
had an amazing experience
Great Italian food. You must try the rib-eye steak w/ black olive vinaigrette on a bed of arugula ~ smashed yukon gold potatoes & fresh herbs. YUMMY !!!!!!
Good food, good service, chic and cool atmosphere. I'd totally go back!
not the fanciest of settings, but a wonderful dining experience.
Excellent atmosphere and roasted garlic!
Get that Lasagna, yes it's vegetarian but just get it.
A Seattle gem. Too bad everyone knows about it. =T

I fell in love the first time I came here for lunch: summer, seated on the deck, Wine, caprese, beautiful view! I always take colleagues from out of town here, make sure you have reservations for a group. Saturday nights are super fun
Great patio with a great view.
really cute and comfortable atmosphere. great server (Denny) and great lasagna.

this place is awesome... i should give them 5 stars for the food and the environment.... but some of the waitresses there are not very polite. i took one star back. yes this is place is a place to eat and hang out if you have a chance to go Seattle...
This is still one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle with great food and ambiance and their outdoor deck is one of the best places to savor a sunny Seattle day.
All the great reviews say it well.....great spot with very good food
Good food, and nice atmosphere - what else could you ask for?
Really yummy food. Fun show. Great with friends. Just go! :)
Good stuff. Nice atmosphere.

The Pink Door is just glorious. It is beautiful in the summer and elegant in the winter. The bread is good to start with and their expresso is divine to end with. Try out the Lazagne-it is world famous and rightfully so-perfectly cooked, soft yet firm, creamy yet tangy. They have delicious daily specials and very friendly staff!
Hands down the best lasagna i've ever had in my entire life. I can't wait to come back!
Amazing food and atmosphere. Service was wonderful. First time there will definitely go again

My family really enjoy the food and the vibe of the restaurant. My dining companion opted for the classic spaghetti carbonara, and it was delightfully creamy and savory, with just the right amount of pancetta. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. Our server provided excellent recommendations and checked in on us regularly without being intrusive. It's evident that they take pride in their food and service.

The Pink Door is an absolute gem in Seattle! From the moment we walked in, we were met with a warm and inviting atmosphere. Every dish was exquisite, made with high-quality ingredients and perfectly balanced flavors. The attention to detail in both the food and service made the experience truly special.To top it all off, the view was breathtaking--overlooking the ocean and the iconic Seattle Ferris wheel, creating the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable meal. If you're looking for exceptional Italian cuisine with a stunning ambiance, The Pink Door is a must!

The food here is nothing short of incredible. My friend ordered the lasagna, and I had to try it. We both agreed that it was, without a doubt, the best lasagna we've ever had--perfectly layered, flavorful, and just the right balance of textures. I ordered the pork chop dinner with cherry sauce, arugula, and potatoes, and I can honestly say it was the best pork chop I've ever had. The meat was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy, and the cherry sauce was a delightful addition that brought the dish together. Every bite was perfection.The restaurant itself is decorated beautifully--cute and elegant, which just adds to the overall experience. We also found the prices to be quite reasonable, especially considering it's an upscale restaurant. Overall, this was an unforgettable dining experience, and I highly recommend it!
What a lovely place. Everything from the food, ambience , live music and service was special. I can't wait to come back.
So cute and great food! I loved the whole experience. I will be going back as soon as i can!
Wonderful meal (pasta!) and great service. We had a great view of the bay down below. It's worth the wait in line.
Haven't been back in years but we just made a reservation. I've been dreaming about their Branzino! Can't wait to get there!!
I love the food, and the place has a very relaxing vibe. It's always one of my top choices when dining with family.

What a wonderful experience. This place was recommended by several different people and it was definitely a great recommendation. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. The location has a great vibe and beautiful decor. Definitely recommend when visit g the area.

My garlic bread needs to come grilled for the rest of my life now. Everything was great. But I got the lasagna which was delicious but small and I was still hungry after. The rigatoni with mamas meatballs was delicious but more on the Al dente side than we wanted. The meatball I thought it was just ok. But it's a popular dish. And the rose hips to my lips was really sweet but tasty.
wow Such a good food. Honestly the best restaurant in Seattle.The yellowtail tuna is my favorite dish over there and then you have the lasagna that you have to try. Highly recommended.
An excellent location, especially sitting by the windows. More expensive than we were set out to spend. But, the food and the service were excellent.

I was told about Pink Door by several people and decided to give it a try, it did not disappoint. Pink Door impresses with its thoughtfully crafted dishes and inviting atmosphere. The Ahi Tuna Crudo was fresh and bright and was complemented by fried capers and microgreens, creating a balanced plate with delightful textures and flavors. The Lasagna Pink Door, rich with spinach and perfectly melted cheese, exceeded my expectations despite not being a huge lasagna fan. The Lemon Risotto with Prawns had a bright, lemony taste that wasn't overpowering. The creamy risotto was decadent yet light, while the prawns were large, flavorful, and juicy. For dessert, the Tiramisu was creamy with soft, spongey ladyfingers and a pleasant coffee taste. The Espresso Martini, though smooth and potent, left me wishing for a creamier texture, but that's personal preference. Reservations can be hard to come by, but walk-ups are an option if you're willing to wait. The beautifully decorated interior and attentive, friendly service make Pink Door a charming spot worth the effort to visit.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Pink Door in Seattle, and it was an exceptional experience. Our waitress, Krista, did an excellent job recommending meals, appetizers, and drinks. She was attentive, ensuring our waters were always filled, which added to the overall positive experience.The ambiance was wonderfully relaxing, enhanced by a beautiful view of The Sound and West Seattle. The setting alone makes this place worth visiting.Now, onto the food. The lemon risotto is a must-try; it's perfectly balanced and flavorful. The crab and corn salad appetizer is another standout, bringing the freshness of Northwest crab right to your table. However, the oil served with the bread could be improved; it's a bit lacking for dipping six pieces of bread. A little more oil would go a long way.Despite this minor detail, Pink Door is a must-go destination. Just be sure to look for the huge line, as the entrance can be easy to miss.---
I've never been to Seattle WA or this restaurant 5 stars yippy Kaya yippyly doo I love food

I was told about this restaurant from a colleague and it was just as good as he said it would be! The atmosphere is fabulous, the food is delicious and fresh and the staff is both knowledgeable and friendly. This is a place to go if you'd like to relax and enjoy a great meal!
Great food, great music, great service while the place looked great inside. Loved this place!
He completes his work very well and I have also got a lot of comfort through him. I really satisfied with the service.

Food:The Pink Door is renowned for its authentic Italian cuisine, featuring a diverse menu that celebrates fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Highlights include handmade pasta dishes like the signature lasagna and fettuccine with wild mushrooms as well as hearty meat and seafood entres. The food is expertly prepared with attention to flavors and presentation, appealing to both traditional Italian cuisine enthusiasts and adventurous foodies alike.Service:The service at The Pink Door is attentive and friendly, reflecting a genuine passion for the hospitality. Staff members are knowledgeable about the menu offerings and are quick to offer recommendations or accommodate special requests. The overall atmosphere is relaxed yet professional, contributing to a pleasant dining experience.Conclusion:For a taste of Italy in heart of Seattle.The Pink Door exceeds expectations with its delightful ambiance and delectable cuisine. Whether you're a local or a visitor, dining at The Pink Door is a culinary experience not to be missed.

The ambience, food, service, everything was amazing!!! My fiancé got the bolognese and it was so flavorful and I got the beef rib which was the best thing I ate in Seattle! I definitely recommend this spot if you visit Seattle because this place alone made the trip worth it!
Customer service was excellent and food was delicious. Little hard to find but overall highly recommend

Everything about this place was great. Our server was very kind. They did forget the appetizer that we ordered but they apologized after and had it be on the house. The lamb chops were to die for. So good. It is so moist and tender. Their cocktails were balanced and attention to detail was noticed. An Italian soda is also recommended! You will have a pleasant experience dining here!
Thank you Mike. The service was amazing. The price was excellent. Very highly recommend thank you

Title: A DeliciousNestled in the heart of downtown Seattle, this pasta haven is a true gem for any culinary enthusiast. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.The service here is impeccable, with attentive staff members who go above and beyond to ensure your satisfaction. Whether it's recommending the perfect wine pairing or accommodating dietary restrictions, they handle every request with grace and professionalism.Now, let's talk about the star of the show: the famous Pink Door lasagna. It's not just a dish; it's a masterpiece. Each layer is lovingly crafted with the finest ingredients, creating a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate with every bite. From the rich tomato sauce to the creamy ricotta cheese,spinach in every element is perfectly balanced, leaving you craving more with each forkful.But the excellence doesn't stop there. Every dish on the menu is a testament to the chef's skill and dedication to authentic Italian cuisine. Whether you opt for the classic spaghetti carbonara or indulge in the decadent fettuccine Alfredo, you're guaranteed a culinary journey that will transport you straight to the streets of Italy.In conclusion, if you find yourself craving a taste of Italy in the heart of Seattle, look no further than this pasta paradise. With its welcoming ambiance, top-notch service, and mouthwatering dishes, it's a dining experience that will linger in your memory long after the last bite. Highly recommended for pasta aficionados and foodies alike!
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Great place! Amazing food. Excellent service. Will be back. Highly recommend if you're on the area.
Never disappoints! I've been here multiple times and the food and service is always on point!
The most amazing food ever! And also the staff is so nice to everyone. I highly recommend buying food from here...
Love this place Great food always fresh Amazing atmosphere Perfect customer service

cant find anything negative really to say everything is nice from the food the service and the vibe of the place! prices are reasonable also especially for Seattle. sometimes there is waiting but totally worth it to be honest!

Great lemon drop martini and great space after a long day of wine tasting. Did not want any more wine and pasta was perfect - we were here 10 years ago and they have made a bigger space. Less romantic but very fun

A Culinary Extravaganza at Pink Door: A Gem Near Pike Place MarketRating: Nestled near Pike Place Market in Seattle, the Pink Door restaurant stands as a shining gem in the city's culinary landscape. Boasting delicious Italian fare, impeccable service, and a delightful array of drinks, the Pink Door provides a dining experience that is nothing short of exceptional.The heart of any restaurant is its cuisine, and the Pink Door excels in delivering an Italian culinary experience that is second to none. From the moment you take your first bite, you are transported to the rustic kitchens of Italy, where flavors are bold, ingredients are fresh, and each dish tells a story. The menu showcases a thoughtful selection of traditional Italian favorites, expertly crafted with a modern twist. Whether it's the velvety pasta dishes, flavorful antipasti, or the mouthwatering desserts, every item on the menu is a testament to the culinary artistry of the chefs.Complementing the delectable cuisine is the outstanding service that the Pink Door is renowned for. The staff is not only attentive and professional but also exudes a genuine warmth that adds to the overall charm of the dining experience. From recommendations tailored to your preferences to a seamless flow of service, the team at Pink Door ensures that every guest feels pampered and valued.The libations at Pink Door deserve special mention, as they add an extra layer of sophistication to the dining affair. The drink menu is a carefully curated selection of wines, cocktails, and spirits that perfectly complement the flavors of the cuisine. Whether you're a wine enthusiast or prefer a craft cocktail, the Pink Door has a libation to suit every palate.Beyond the culinary delights, the Pink Door also offers a captivating atmosphere. The restaurant's interior is a blend of classic Italian charm and artistic flair, with live performances ranging from cabaret to trapeze acts adding an extra layer of entertainment. The ambiance is vibrant and inviting, creating an unforgettable dining experience that lingers in your memory.The Pink Door near Pike Place Market in Seattle is more than just a restaurant; it's a culinary gem that sparkles with authenticity, flavor, and warmth. From the mouthwatering Italian dishes to the impeccable service and captivating atmosphere, the Pink Door captures the essence of an extraordinary dining experience. If you're in search of a place where delicious food, great service, and wonderful drinks converge, the Pink Door is a must-visit destination.

This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, wide wine list and wonderful dessert. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again.

The ambiance is truly elegant and upscale. With stunning views overlooking the "fish cleaning area" near Pike Place Market, the scenery is simply breathtaking. Additionally, the forthcoming park being constructed across the street promises to enhance the already picturesque environment even further. The food was delicious, and the service was impeccable. I highly recommend requesting a window table to fully enjoy the magnificent views.

The Pink Door: A Seattle GemNestled in the heart of Seattle, The Pink Door is a culinary gem. From the lively cabaret-style atmosphere to the delectable Italian fare, every aspect is a testament to the restaurant's charm. Pasta Perfection: 5/5The handmade pasta stole the show--cooked al dente and adorned with rich, flavorful sauces. The signature lasagna was a highlight, showcasing a perfect blend of textures and tastes. Entertainment Extravaganza: 4.5/5The live cabaret performances added a unique touch, enhancing the overall dining experience. A delightful blend of music, comedy, and skilled acrobatics created an entertaining backdrop. Wine Wonderland: 4/5The extensive wine list complements the Italian menu splendidly. A diverse selection of reds and whites caters to varied preferences, though a few more affordable options would be appreciated. Ambiance and Views: 5/5The enchanting decor, coupled with views of Pike Place Market and Elliott Bay, creates a magical setting. Ideal for both intimate dinners and celebratory gatherings.In a nutshell, The Pink Door offers a quintessential Seattle dining experience--a perfect fusion of exceptional cuisine, vibrant entertainment, and captivating views. A must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable taste of Italy in the heart of the Emerald City.

The ambiance here is the BEST! An old speakeasy (or so the story goes) turned restaurant. It's in an alley and there's no sign, just literally a pink door. You walk in and you're at the top of a staircase overlooking the restaurant. There's often live music and one time I saw an aerial artist performing during our dinner. The food is mostly Italian fare. I usually get a fish dish like Ahi tuna or halibut and a Caesar or kale salad. Having lived in Japan, I'm very picky about my fish, and the fish I've had here has always been fresh. Tables in the back have a great view of the water. On sunny summer days you can eat on the patio. I recommend for a romantic dinner, a business lunch or a gathering of adult friends or family.
I love this place! One of the best food places I have been to in Seattle! Great customer service.

My family and I recently visited The Pink Door and had an incredible dining experience. We ordered two dishes, the Squid Ink Tonnarelli and the Lasagna Pink Door, and both were outstanding. The Squid Ink Tonnarelli was perfectly cooked and had a deliciously unique flavor. The pasta was infused with squid ink, which gave it a slightly briny taste that complemented the breadcrumbs in the dish. The Lasagna Pink Door was equally impressive. It was layered with rich, Bolognese sauce and creamy, making every bite melt in my mouth. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts side dish, which was a standout in its own right. The sprouts were roasted to perfection with a slightly crispy exterior, and the addition of bacon and balsamic vinegar added a wonderful depth of flavor. It was the perfect side dish to accompany our mains. To accompany our meal, we ordered the It Feels Right cocktail and The Pink Door mocktail, both of which were delicious and complemented our dishes perfectly. The It Feels Right cocktail was a refreshing blend of spirits and fruit juices, while The Pink Door mocktail was light and refreshing, making them the perfect complement to our rich and flavorful dishes.The atmosphere of the restaurant was charming and cozy, with the decor adding to the ambiance. Service was impeccable too - our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Overall, I highly recommend The Pink Door for a special dining experience. The food is exceptional, and the atmosphere is perfect for a romantic date or a night out with friends.
Everything was delicious. Encouraged me to move out to Seattle. Service was absolutely amazing.

FOOD: really really good! Everything we ordered was spot on. Here's a few we especially loved:1. Pink Door Caesar- this had fresh Dungeness Crab and their dressing was slightly different from the usual which we really loved! 2. Pink Door Lasagna- definitely not your typical lasagna - this one is vegan. The pasta layers are thinner than usual, probably using homemade pasta and we're living for those thin layers!! The flavors on here were also bomb. I just wished the pasta was a bit more al dente or firm but still, really good.3. Ahi Crudo- you really can't go wrong with fresh tuna!! We ended up dipping our bread in the sauce afterwards too cause it was so refreshing. Wish it came in a bigger serving for the price paid, but still good.4. White Chocolate Pound Cake Panini- it looks like a savory dish, but this actually makes use of pound cake as the slices with marshmallow and some crunchy things in between. This was my first time seeing dessert made this way, and I loved it. It was quite sweet though, so get this to share! 5. Squid Ink Tonnarelli- generous serving of pasta and shrimp! The pasta was perfectly al dente and the flavors were spot on.SERVICE: their servers were not very welcoming - they never smiled, never made small talk but they were very much efficient. Our glasses of water were never empty.

Wow. One of a kind. If you're in Seattle, you have to go!! Not sure how we've lived here a few years and are just discovering it.

Celebrated our anniversary here and cannot recommend more! Just wait for COVID to be over and enjoy the meal with a show package. You will not be disappointed. We had the cheese plate and gnocchi with tiramisu dessert. Absolutely phenomenal!

Heard about this restaurant through the grapevine. I went the first chance I got. We were promptly greeted by the host. We sat down and were greeted by the waitress within the first two minutes. She told me all the daily specials with great detail. It made me want to order all of them. I ordered the most popular one, and I almost licked the plate clean. I love this place
Incredible!!! The atmosphere and service was amazing! Will definitely come back time and time again!
Great place. Will come again. Had a great lunch.
Yum yum yum! Literally a hidden gem, but worth the trek to find.
Risotto as well as tiramisu were tasty. You have to reserve wayyyy in advance, there was a long list. Not sure how it looks like now post pandemic.
We chose Pink Door over the weekend. Food was exceptional. Everything was ready for pickup at the time stated. Thank you Pink Door for remaining open and serving so many people...
I had a really good experience ordering fish here.
The pink door has always been among the great Seattle restaurants and I live it every time I go! Love it
I have not been here for ages. The memory of that night is still strong in my head. Good times. I can not wait till this COVID thing is over! Hang in there, I'll be back.
I hope I can get back here once COVID clears great food, wonderful atmosphere
Service was excellent. We tried thisCrab risotto, Spinach Pasta and Oysters! As we've seen this is the most recommended dish here, taste amazing. Recommended!
Wonderful drinks and lasagna. Great atmosphere

Love this restaurant, a bit expensive, still never disappoints. They take the safety of Covid-19 very seriously. Hope to be back in healthier conditions! Food has been excellent. If you like high quality Italian, you're going to be in this area. It's the kind of place that's ideal for a party, and there's enough for everybody. Highly recommended.
It's the Pink Door...'nuff said. Seriously. If you haven't been, you should go...really.
The best place all foods are nice and delicious
this place has the best food and service.
Nice food great taste so satisfying, I do like this place, I'm sure I'll come back here again! It's highly recommended.
I was in town with my dad, and we wanted to visit this place for dinner. We really enjoyed this place, and it's a restaurant that never disappoints you. I've never expected Piroshky to be so sweet.
it is a great restaurant that's wonderful and it has all the brake stuff in the world
Still one of my favorite places after all these years. The spinach lasagne is magical, the tiramisu floats sings in your mouth, the atmosphere is heavenly. Pink Door will always have my undying love.
Nice place the food is delicious!

The first time I ate here, and it has been my favorite ever since. I always crave their menus. Not a single time we didn't drop by in this place. It's like our morning routine to spend our breakfast, sometimes dinner, here. Their staff was very welcoming, and it was the perfect place for your family occasions as they have a party place.

I've been visiting the Pink Door for a couple of years and I've always had a nice experience. This place has some of the tastiest, most special, most exciting and delicious food I've ever had, and it was just a wonderful experience to end. The workers are nice, the bartenders mix some delicious drinks, and the food is delicious. It's recommended!

Last week's celebration was memorable, thanks to Pink's Door service and food! Awesome! Such an amazing place. Fantastic food. Portions were massive, but of course, we had to get delicious sides. Great vegan and vegetarian options too (which they could add more). The staff was lovely, which I did find rare to find in most restaurants in Seattle. A must go to place!!

Fantastic place, guy. We arrived at the end of July at about 2:00 p.m. during Covid and were able to stroll in without a reservation. That made us so excited about it. If you're looking to enjoy yourself a little bit at the time of COVID, certainly look at this highly recommended spot.

Lovely freshly cooked and prepared, delicious food. I had lentil soup and black pudding salad. Artisan bread with the soup would be better than sliced bread. The egg yolk with the black pudding would be better soft. The staff was attentive and the restaurant is lovely, I'll definitely be back it can be difficult to find good soups and salads, especially at a decent price.
Best Food i have ever tried . We will come back here again soon . The atmosphere was great.Clean place and friendly staff

One of the best places to eat in the city, I can't praise the food and service here enough. It's the best Italian restaurant I've ever eaten at, I'm glad that they are still open for delivery, though the experience of dining in is so much better - the lighting and décor make the food taste even better.
Their lasagne is my special birthday treat. Great atmosphere. A little cramped but when you are a beloved institution what can you expect.
Can't find a better place with good atmosphere as the pink door! Lots of great memories and great staff!

Authenticity lives here. Right out the fire delicious food. Recommend it to anyone. You pay for what you eat! Meaning that it's price well.Will be eating you again soon. Thanks for the good time and great food. Highly recommended!

I am glad Pink Door finally opened! We had the great experience. The food was superb and our server Jack made our experience so enjoyable. Also the aerialist who entertained us with her beautiful performances throughout our Monday night meal! Iconic Seattle favorite for sure!
I'm beginning to love this place. The food was delicious and the services were good. I enjoyed my dinner here, I had a great time, although pricey, it is totally worth it.
Staple of Seattle, never had a bad meal or experience here. Would highly recommend the patio on the summer too!
Great food and service. Seafood was excellent!

We had to reserve a table to be seated here. But, the food was delicious. We orderedthis food. The food was flavorful, the protein was seasoned pretty well, the drinks were great and the service was top notch.
Cute restaurant with tasty food! beautiful patio seating! Great for a date!

I was craving with lasagna last week so my son brought me there to oder their famous Lasagna Pink Door! It was awesome! Craving satisfied! The pasta texture was perfect, the combination of spinach, pesto and marinara sauce are balanced, it blew my mind! I also try more dish but lasagna and Caberet cake were the best!Also I would like to commend the staff in this resto, they were very accommodating and so friendly.I want to go back again to try their Linguini Clams. Highly recommended!
Their remodel is amazing. The food over the top!
first time trying it for pickup...defintiely suprised. Would definitely come back here again

This place is awesome! Like many who have been there will know that this place is hard to find, but well worth the look. The vibe is amazing and the staff always checks in on you. food and drinks is always on point.
Love the place and the food! Cute for date night as well.

Never lets me down - been coming here for years now. Dinner is always top-notch (make sure to call ahead for a reservation) and lunch during the summer outside is a real treat. Always busy, good energy and the service/food is great!
Can I give it 5.5 stars. It's one of the best places to take a date. It has a really cool vibe. The decor is awesome, nice view, great service. Strongly recommend.
Lovely. Haven't been back since the remodel. Came for lunch and had a great table with view. Limited selection of menu items.  The server was very sweet, and the food was delicious.
Loved the service, the food is great. If you can't get a table the bar is great. Many great appetizers, Nice views
I have love to go there for years. It's a great atmosphere with great food and music. Whenever people are visiting me from out of town I always take them there.

I just ate here last night with my uncle for his birthday! The seafood here is absolutely spot on. I had the server's recommendation for the Linguine Alle Vongole and it was 5 stars delicious! The server was well-informed and the place was clean. Will be back!
I love this place! Pastas was delicious. If I'm ever in Seattle again,this place will be a must.

My friend and I went to the Pink Door for dinner last Friday and the experience was fabulous! The owner of the restaurant, Jackie, was extremely kind and friendly, accommodating us by seating us in their new elegant dining room despite the fact that we were two hours late for our reservation (flight delays on a Friday). The food was absolutely delicious and the service was perfect. I've been going to the Pink Door when I visit Seattle, for the last 15 years. It's a place where you must go and enjoy the ambience as well as the wonderful food. I am so happy that they are still around. Treat yourself!

One of the best cafe that i've been tried, great place and ambiance and the people are very nice i'm gonna recommend this cafe because it's instagramable and the prices are very affordable and it's a great place for meetings, date and chill. The taste of the coffee it's perfect, and place is field with the aroma of coffee and the desserts and other food that they serve is also perfect!
Best Lasagna i have ever had. Returning to this restaurant next time i am in Seattle.
I just went the other day and it was great. I loved the food and the people was very attentive to me. Will definitely go back.
Beat SERVICE EVER! Food amazing, hostess amazing, server AMAZING! Thank you for a great experience!
Really good food! I came in and had a surprisingly good customer service experience.

The food was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing,We especially enjoyed drinks, and it's a very good place to gather with your family and friends and it has a very great ambiance, and i do recommend it
We are from California and everytime we are in town this is MUST GO. The mussels and clams, cheese board, "occo bucco" lamb. All so delicious. It really is a treat everytime we are in Seattle

this is a fun place! great food and drinks with fantastic water views. during the warmer months they have a very private patio. the decor is over the top and they have a nice bar area. they also have cabaret shows on the weekends. we have always had great food and service! there is no signs on the building so find the grey building with a pink door and you are in!
The Pink Door is my favorite place to eat and dine. very recommending to everyone.

This place will give you a great experience make sure you booking your reservation at least few days in advance some waiters are acting kind of rudely but the food is amazing and the restaurant and design is very very very nice I will definitely come back for more absolutely love this place

this is a fun place! great food and drinks with fantastic water views. during the warmer months they have a very private patio. the decor is over the top and they have a nice bar area. they also have cabaret shows on the weekends. we have always had great food and service! there is no signs on the building so find the grey building with a pink door and you are in!
Great restaurant with fun ambiance! The food is classic and the service is impeccable! It is definitely a Seattle treasure for sure.
Fantastic and quirky ambiance and delicious food!

A restaurant that not only been around for 30 plus years they also almost the top restaurant on yelp in the all Seattle area.I like the idea that even if they very famous they still keep it very classic and Very old fashion.They atmosphere is very nice a the food is nothing but great.
Great atmosphere and excellent service. The food is delicious too. definitely recommend this place.

I took my God daughter to the Pink Door for her 18th birthday lunch and "tourist in your own city" day at Pike Place Market. I was a little worried because it was so crowded when we walked in, but they were able to seat us almost right away. We both had clam linguine for our meals and it was divine. She was very pleased with the whole experience and has thanked me several times for having taken her to the Pink Door. I have been a regular customer for years, but this experience was especially memorable thanks to the wait staff, and the awesome food. We will both be back soon!
A must see when visiting or living in Seattle!
What more can you say than...Yummmmmm!
Hidden gem for sure! I love this spot for it's indoor and outdoor seating options. Would recommend to people who are looking for a little more upscale experience. It's quirky and fun!
One of the best Italian restaurants in town. I try to take out of town guests here if I can get a reservation.
Great atmosphere, and great food, love their menu
I always been a good swimmer and friendly. I would never befriend a xlam or oysters that talk. And nest for the music!. I love to eat all shelfish with butter and with farlic added.
Pasta are so good, light but flavorful!
Amazing food and Service. Reservation will be the best way not to wait so long but it was worth the wait
Very Seattle spot. Amazing atmosphere and fantastic food and service. Make sure you have reservations. It got quite crowded on a Thursday night
We had to wait quite long time to get seated but everything was great! Lovely atmosphere, food, servers, outdoor seating!

Love the decor at PD. Great date spot as long as you can get a table, make sure you call for a reservation or get your name on the list early. Bar is a great place to hang out while you wait for a table.
Love this place! Great vibes and food! It's a regular hotspot for me and my hubby! Make sure to try and get a table early because it's constantly busy.

Very cool hidden gem in Seattle. You walk down a dark alley to find a random pink door! Once you step inside it is elegant and classy. They have amazing food and even have trapeze entertainment on certain nights. When in Seattle give this place a try!
The atmosphere and our waitress was amazing!!! The food is so good a must try if in Seattle!!
Always a winner, excellent service and outstanding food, every single time

I m very found of sea food, and after ages i found a best place for sea food lover.Its a very rushy place, First you need to confirm your reservation then you can visit this place. There Seared Sea Scallops tenders and stater was divine. Must do visit..!
The restaurant is very popular and I highly recommend making reservations. We were in Seattle for an Alaskan cruise and I was able to get a 2:30 pm reservation for a late lunch on disembark day.
Always amazing food, drinks and service!
Love this place! I once went there on New Year's eve and they had an accordion player there :).

Booked through Open Table a few weeks before our trip to Seattle and glad we did. The restuarant is located directly across from Wine Bar with a patio down a busy alley with lots of other restaurants. You can't miss it. Seated at a window table overlooking the Public Market and the harbor.Also ordered the Arancini with fontina cheese. Both of these were delicious. Scallops mussels clams and the cioppino- everything was good. My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs, her favorite meal, and she said the sauce and meatballs were some of the best she has had. Overall, we were very happy with our meal, atmosphere was perfect on a warm summer evening. Even the interior of the restaurant was fun.
Best food ever. The Lasagna is to die for!!!!I can't believe I had never been here before
Very fun and worth every penny! I will be taking friends here in the future!
Always a great meal and fab service
Fantastic lasagna! It might have been the best I've ever had! And the entertainment was amazing as well!
Loved everything about this place from decor, to the amazing food, to our server, Brad!! A must see!!
Super fun experience in a lovely location with wonderful food and wine
Not to be missed! The ambiance, food, service were great! I recommend the bolognese!

The aerial acrobatic show is not to be missed, nor are the scallops. The restaurant is tricky to find so have a little patience. I've been there 6 times. For me it's a must-stop whenever I'm in Seattle.
It's now a tourist trap so hard to get a sit on patio but still love it on a sunny day. We
We have eaten here twice. Good both times. Nice setting too.
The food here was great. The ambiance here was great. It was a great experience for us here. Price for their food was reasonable. The quality of the service was superb. I'll be back for more.
Came with my hubby. It's romantic, and great service. Would come back again, maybe next anniversary...?
Loved this little place with soothing ambiance
Great food with awesome staff !!

Obsessed! I am a vegetarian and the pesto lasagna is my favorite with a flirty cocktail, sign me up! I was lucky to sit on the patio on the sunny day in seattle which everyone tells me is not normal but I just moved here so I love it here!
Love this place, I had my first date here with my wife. The food is good and music or atmosphere is always good.
great foods love it best place in town will be back for sure
Great food Great service. THANKS.
Loved it! Pink Door has an excellent atmosphere, great bartenders and some solid interior decor
Amazing food as always! I always go when it's a special outing and I'm never disappointed.
Best restaurant, romantic and exquisite with fancy décor and yummy food. Must visit for special occasion.

I love interior design and this place is simply magical! We only snacked, but what we ate was fabulous too! I really enjoyed the bartenders and other staff. I only wish we had a place like this in Austin!
Great Show and food! Service is also pretty good. Not had any problems.
Awesome restaurant to have your family here .
Great food and excellent customer service

Long wait times are a regular part of of this restaurant, but hello! That's because it's always busy! The wait is more than worth it. I've been taking the wife to the same place for date night for like two years and we decided to switch it up! Loved the food and the atmosphere. Ideal for dates.
Great food, awesome experience. I'd highly recommend and I'll definitely be going back.
Great spot! Everything is amazing and service is always great. Recommend making a reservation as it can be hard to get in without it.
good place for family. Great food.
Pike Place Market classic. Been here since i was a kid, hope they stay in business forever.
out of the box. great show. very unique
Top 3 fav venues in Seattle for a night out.
Amazing food! I always bring my friends here who visits me and they all love the food, the place, the staff. Everything is just simply amazing. I won't get tired of going back here.
Love the atmosphere, service is amazing, food is to die for. The meatballs are some of the best I have ever had!
Never disappointed, worth the wait during busy times
¿Devine. Expensive, but Devine?
love everything about this place!
The lasagna is delicious. Most everything else looked great too but I ordered the lasagna so I can say with full certainty that it is delicious.

The pink door has excellent Italian food. Or so I hear. I haven't been there yet but I hear a great recommendations. If you're visiting Pike Place market you should definitely check it out. They even have some jazz sometimes. Italian food in Seattle is hard to come by and so this is definitely on my list and I am bookmarking it.
The Pink Door retained all of its personality and charm while increasing its square footage. It still feels cozy but now with a spectacular view.

This is by far one of my favorite places for a show and dinner in Seattle. Super hard to find but once you find the literal Pink Door you know you're in the right spot. Perfect pasta meal and service is great. Definitely get there early if you want a good table.
Great food here. The show was not my thing but service and food were fantastic. Great job.

What better way to spend a snow day than in a nearly deserted Pike Place Market and a fabulous three course lunch at the Pink Door! I walked in at 11:25 (yes, they opened early!) and was seated by the window, at my favorite spot. I started with a glass of the house white, served in a little green bottle and small tumbler. The bread arrived almost immediately, along with a little bottle of olive oil. I ordered the 1/2 antipasto, roasted beet salad and rigatoni with grilled sausage. Now that is some good Italian comfort food, served in the most beautiful setting imaginable. Thanks Pink Door for being my "go to" spot for ANY occasion!
Delicious food and great atmosphere!
I love this place. Great service. The aesthetics more than the food but the food is good too

Will never forget their lasagna. It was so flavorful. Stellar!I also tried Caesars salad topped with crab and that was good as well. Loved the atmosphere, the interior is pleasing.People are respectful, very good service!
Unique beautiful environment, and nice service. Taste is not perfect but still very nice to have.
Have always loved the Pink Door. Best lasagne in town. Best atmosphere. Love the fountain mid restaurant.
My group and I had an amazing experience here. The ambience, service, and food were all 10/10.My recommendations:- garlic gargonzola appetizer - Bolognese pasta - signature pink door lasagna
Absolutely unique spot in Post Alley. Recommended!
Great food and great people, we really enjoyed our dinner. We would recommend to other :)

What a romantic place! Perfect place for date night or even a girls night out. The service was great- our server took her time to answer our questions about their wine selections and some of the dishes, and she knew what she was talking about. The food was awesome. It reminded me of the time I lived in Italy and that's always a plus.
Great experience from start to finish!
The atmosphere here is amazing. Getting to see the trapeze when you're dining is super cool! The lasagna is to die for!

Unfortunately, I did not make it here for one of the shows, but still found the food and the experience to be outstanding. Everything from the appetizers to the cocktails to the entrees was extremely tasty, and the staff was very friendly and attentive. The wait can get long, but it's well worth it.
everything we had was delicious. The service was spot on, very quick to fill up waters or get us anything we needed. Would come back for sure.
The food here is perfection! The lasagna is to die for! Not to mention the that there are frequently acrobats swinging above you when you're dining. Super cool!
Always enjoy my time here. Friendly staff and environment. Highly recommend. Won't be disappointed.
The best restaurant to take out of town guests after visiting Pike Place. It is located behind a pink door on Post Alley. The prices are reasonable. The food is very good. The view is divine.
It's awesome place. We visited this place on my wife's birthday and I like it! Super friendly staff, very delicious!I really like this place !

Got a reservation on a Thursday evening at 5:45 PM. We were seated immediately in the back room and decided on a bottle of The Dissident from the Mark Ryan Winery (priced at $65). It was delicious and an amazing red blend. Worth it - plus it was date night, so why not! We split the Caesar salad with fennel dusted croutons and it tasted amazing. We also got Mama's Meatballs which were delicious and was accompanied by a super flavorful marinara. For our main courses we both decided on their two specials. The NW Fish of the Day was a pan-seared halibut with black lentils, roasted carrots, and an arugula and shaved fennel salad. \The other special was squid ink pasta cioppino style with a spicy marina. IT WAS FANTASTIC. The noodles tasted fresh and soaked in all of the well-developed spicy sauce and the seafood was cooked perfectly. It was a bit pricey with the bottle of the wine and two appetizers, but it was well worth it and I will definitely be back again. Highly recommend it!
always a fun place to take a date or friends from out of town.
Great décor and ambiance. Was quite impressed. Food was amazing. Service was good and staff are friendly. This is a must try especially if you are visiting and happen to be in the area
The interior here is probably one of the nicest, coolest places I've ever eaten. Would recommend, especially for a mid-high end lunch.
Great atmosphere and even better food! Their shows are amazing and very cool. Their bar is so nice too, just my style. Love it here,love it!!

Best wine I've ever had, best food I've ever had, I love this location and the people here. I definitely would come back and bring other enthusiasts with me.Parking can be difficult and so I usually Uber or Lyft it here all the time. It's cheap and located pretty close to my house. Thanks again guys
I love this place. My son works there. HE is awesome. great professional manners.
I was told about it from a good friend of mine and she said i had to try there seafood so i did. Great food drinks and service would recommend to my friends and family.

amazing food, wonderful staff. Great location and highly recommended
My favorite restaurant in town!!!
Phenomenal dinner and show!!! love love love!!!
Simple and delicious :) I can't believe I tried it finally.
Great food, music and waitstaff.
If you havent been here, you really need to try it. Its better than people say
I love this place. I have been coming here for over 22 years. This is as good as it gets.
I enjoy the gluten-free menu here, and the service is excellent!
Beautiful view, amazing food, and great service. Need I say more?
Amazing Energy, Food, and Drinks!!! Perfect Girls Night Spot!!!!

This Italian place is one notch higher than any other place I have ever been to.Super cool ambience, less waiting times (we had a reservation..lol)Ordered -Spaghetti con corciofi : I really dunno how to pronounce this but tasted really great. Meal perfect quantity, artichokes were perfectly cooked. Goes good with wine.House white wine : nothing spectacular about this. Tasted like a sparkling chardonnay. Menu prices is on higher side, ambience is total upscale.Desserts waitress recommended were mind blowing. Would totally visit this place again and again. Post Alley vibes

I have been here multiple times and will continue to come back!I always make a reservation ahead of time, just in case, and every time i come in, my table is ready and there is absolutely no wait. The staff and kind and attentive as well.
Great new design and view, fantastic menu!
A Seattle institution and go-to birthday location the Pink Door has excellent food, service and atmosphere.Highly recommend!
Went there for a night out with my wife. We ordered a truffle risotto and it was perfect. Very romantic place.
Just wonderful. We've been going here for years. Recommend it to everyone.

Amazing!!!This is one of the best Italian restaurants we have been to in Seattle. They have very good ambiance and bar. The food is delicious, specially Lasagna is one of the best if not the best. Must go if you are looking for food quality Italian food in a cozy restaurant on a date. Be aware that you might have to reserve the place way before as it gets very crowdy on the weekends.
First time at the Pink Door. Love the atmosphere, the employees, and the food!! Will be back!!!
Amazing food and atmosphere! Love their lasagna!
Great vibe, great food, great atmosphere!Loved it. Been there twice and it never disappoints!

Great food. Always recommend this place for tourists looking for a nice meal. Make reservations!
The tortellini here is absolutely off the hook.!
Always a great, intimate, underground experience with excellent food and service. Located in the heart of the pike place market, surrounded by people and vibrancy.
we came here the service was so great and the food was awesome will recomend
This was our second visit. Staff made me feel like home, dishes were great, everything was fresh and the music was awesome!
Favorite place in all Seattle!
Love the Pink Door, been coming here for years and never disappoint!
High quality ingredients and romantic atmosphere with sometimes a live band and live burlesque. Bendelacreme!
I loved the show here. It was a great place to take a date too. Located in Post alley it was a bit hard to find parking but other than that it was a great place to go and the food was yummy!
I think the pink door has the best burlesque show in Seattle. Truly talented performers have musicality down to a fine art. Very pleasant and entertaining, I would highly recommend catching a show ;)

This is the best place to go in Seattle for multiple reasons. Everything on the menu is top notch. The ambience, the second you step inside, it's like you've been teleported to a different realm of mystery, romance and warmth. The staff is friendly, they provide amazing service and make The Pink Door an iconic Seattle restaurant that keeps me coming back for more!
My husband appreciates the gluten-free options. I love the pomengranite martini!! The grilled cheese, spaghetti, and everything else is delicious! We would definitely go back.
The food is delicious, service is phenominal. I always love this place
i loved everything i got here. and the atmosphere/service were great too. will come back again
The food was delicious, the waiter Joe m was great and knowledgeable about the menu. Will come back
One of the most romantic restaurants in Seattle. The food is delicious, great wines by the glass, and a very fun bar. LOVE this place.
Nice food. Good service. Our cocktail waitress was very pleasing to the eye as well.
The girls are sexy here! so flexible and fun to watch. Also some amazing food. Everyone should try!
This is an excellent restaurant!
Amazing food, great service, and the location can't be beat!
Great customer service. The food was great, loved the live band.
Everything here is yummy!! I will come back again and again!!
A MUST see on any Seattle visit! Make reservations, this is NOT a pop in place. Entertainment while you eat is amazing.
Love this great, great place for a bite to eat and happy hour drinks!!
I absolutely loved the Pink Door! It was classy, unique and unusual! The vibe was amazing! The design was very beautiful! There was artwork everywhere! Their seafood pasta and lasagna was delicious!
Excellent menu of food and drinks, great atmosphere. One of my favorite places. Their food is one of the best in the city.
Great experience from start to finish! Delicious and well run. Just go!!!
Food great and the shows are also very intertaining.

They have an entertainment menu so make note that if you are interested in any of the entertainment, specify that while making your reservation on the phone because it is accessible/ visible only from certain sections of the restaurant. We got lucky to get a glimpse of the show on our way in.
the best veg lasagna enjoyed on a summer afternoon with the best view.

Food was fantastic with perfect portions and flavors. The service was friendly, down-to-earth, and fun. The outside patio was a fun area to eat, although it may get a little cold because the restaurant is near the waterfront.
GREAT happy hour. Really good food and ambiance. You might miss it the first time you try to find it, but be patient and get there because it's my standby and it's good and I promise you'll love it!
Not outrageously expensive and was delicious, great experience.
O M G so good! Love this place.

It was our first time, & it was a big WOW! The salsa was the best we have ever had, just delicious. The food was off the charts, & the staff just super! What a great experience, we will be back. Even bought salsa to take home. Again, can't say enough good about our visit!
This place was wonderful once we finally found it there's no real sign outside in the alley where the entrance is, just the pink door.
so good! the food was outstanding
Incredible - fabulous food, wait staff & ambiance! Highly recommend!
Perfect. Every time. Love everything here.
Best lasagna I have ever had. The atmosphere is very cute and romantic.
Ok this is a great place to go especially when there's entertainment!!!

My wife and I dined at The Pink Door recently and it was quite possibly the best meal I have had this year. The food and service were excellent. For our appetizer, we had the Ahi Tuna Crudo (lemon, fried capers, smoked castelvetrano olives). For our entree's, I had the Cioppino (prawns, mussels, clams and calamari in a spicy tomato and white wine broth) and my wife had the Lasagna (fresh spinach pasta layered with besciamella, pesto and topped with marinara sauce). Both were excellent. Highly recommended.
