I just wanted to post about our recent experience at The Pink Door. Its our wedding anniversary. I checked out a bunch of restaurants ahead of time and decided on The Pink Door due to it's combination of romantic decor, reasonable price and great food reviews.I was mildly worried about some of the comments regarding rude servers and such but figured it was still the best bet in town.After a long day running all over the Pike Place market, we arrived for dinner at 6:30. We were promptly seated and for the life of me can't remember our waiters name. He was extremely polite and had the specials down pat. I ended up ordering the spinach lasagna while my husband had the spaghetti and meatballs. Our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and we began to enjoy our meal.After just a few bites, a busser working near our table dropped a water glass which shattered all over the floor. As far as we could tell, none of it hit us or the table next to us so we continued our meal. Almost immediately another female employee came up and asked us if we were ok and if any glass had gotten in our food. We told her that it didn't but she insisted on having the food remade just in case. We told her we understood and she removed the old food. Our waiter showed up at the same time and was also concerned about our welfare.A short while later our new food arrived and everything was great. When we went to pay, our waiter brought the check and explained that both our entrees were on the house due to the accident. I told him that wasn't necessary but was greatly appreciated.I just wanted to say a special thanks to all the employees who helped us for making a memorable anniversary. We will definitely be back to The Pink Door on our next anniversary...
Great food and Great service. I recommend the Pink Door to anyone who loves Italian food.

I LOVE THE PINK DOOR. Can I say it any louder? The perfect balance of good food and good entertainment. Ahhhhhh the Pink Door. How I miss this place. I discovered it four years ago when looking for a good Italian place near work (I was at Macy's at the time) and found this place on yelp. I called ahead and they weren't busy so I thought I would stop by. Boy was I impressed. To this day, not even a home cooked lasagna by mom could satisfy my craving for what they make. I also promised myself that night that someday I would have a boyfriend who would take me there on a date. We've been together for two years now, have a five month old daughter, and are now engaged. Service was quick and firm, but leave a lot to eat. Dry mix mala noodles come out hot and watery, it's funny to call it "mala". Popcorn Chicken with Honey Mustard... All in all, this was the top seller among the many Biang Biang-style noodle joints across the country.(original)The service was quick and good, but the food left much to be desired. The dry mix mala noodle turns out to be lukewarm water, and it is called "mala" and spoken. The popcorn chicken was served with martyr's heads... Overall, these are the highest-grossing of all Biang-style noodle joints to visit across the country.

My visit to Biang Biang Noodle left me with mixed feelings. Unfortunately, the Popcorn Chicken didn't live up to expectations; it's definitely not recommended as it didn't taste like it was supposed to.To add to the disappointments, my Mike tea never arrived, but the server promptly addressed it by removing it from the bill. Getting water refilled proved challenging, possibly due to a busy time and a shortage of servers during the shift. Despite these drawbacks, the server's attentiveness in handling issues and the acceptable noodle taste make me consider giving Biang Biang Noodle another chance, hoping for improvements. Three stars for now.

Biang Biang gave me a solid noodle experience that was a bit more than the usual fare. The service was impressively fast - my order arrived almost as soon as I sat down, which was great! The pork options, especially in the noodles, were really flavorful and tender, adding a nice savory depth to the dish.The soup, though, could have used a bit more kick. I was hoping for a little more spice to balance the richness of the broth. And while the noodles were delicious and freshly made, the prices felt a bit on the higher side for a casual spot. Still, Biang Biang left me satisfied, and I'd happily return for another round - maybe next time I'll ask for extra spice!

#### Rewritten Text:The quality of the noodles is exceptional. They are delightfully chewy, clearly hand-pulled, and fresh. The mala flavor is executed perfectly, making these dishes truly outstanding. While I would pass on the dumplings, I personally lean towards the soup dishes over the dry ones, as the latter can sometimes be a bit too dry. Nonetheless, it's quite a challenge to find a noodle place with a better texture than this.

Couldn't be happier with our visit! The noodles were a real highlight - super fresh and the portions were so generous. You could tell they were made right there on the spot. The Pork rib noodles and popcorn chicken were a delightful combo, both solid choices. The food overall was not only delicious but truly authentic, giving a real taste of the cuisine. The atmosphere was unmatched, creating the perfect backdrop for a satisfying meal. Kudos to the attentive waitstaff, their service added that extra touch to our dining experience. No doubt, we're already planning our next visit.
Noodles where fresh, I would give it a try if you never had pulled noodles. Good service .

Noodles and sauce are bomb!! I was surprised the Spicy Beef Dry Mix wasn't very spicy, but amazing flavor! Pork belly dry mix was delicious as well. Chive & Pork Dumplings also hit the spot. Excited to try their drinks and other items! Service was solid.
The pork dumplings were good, tasted fresh and handmade.The taste and quality was there, but price to size ratio wasn't what I was expecting it to be. Overall good place to check out at least once.
The Pork and Beef noodles were great. I'm definitely coming back when I'm in the area!

Hands down the best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly, every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great flavor and is on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend it! I enjoyed my experience and will be trying something new on their menu next time I'm in Cap Hill.

I really enjoyed my experience and will be trying something new on their menu next time I'm in Cap Hill.

Honestly, I came here with my friends as a quick noodle stop (when I mean quick, I mean like 30 mins before closing oops) and so all I ordered was a fried tofu bao, which was actually super good! Honestly the price point wasn't my favorite part of trying this lil bao, but in all honesty, I'd come back to try the noodles rather than the bao. I think it would be more worth it, after seeing my friends eating their noodle dishes while I was eating a bao... Anyways, that's besides the point-- I'd come here for the nice atmosphere and good food, but not really if I was on a budget.

The workers are patient and professional. The food was hot and fresh. Not good for people on a low-sodium diet.

Being a 5 mins walk from here is pretty dangerous, we do here for dinner a lot when dinner is hard to decide because there are so many yummy options for every taste. The appetizers there are probably my favorite over the hand pulled noodle dishes. The service is very simplistic order first, then sit down and food is brought to you. Checking in on an iPad thru Yelp. Gets pretty busy during rush dinner hours, but it moves pretty quickly. Definitely a must try at least once.
excellent noodles love the flavors and spiceyness cant wait to go back

This has recently become one of my favorite lunch spots on Capitol Hill. I'm also going to go out on a limb and say it has some of the best soft serve ice cream in Seattle.Not only are the tasty treats good but the food itself.You get a lot of food for the price as well. There isn't much area to sit I didn't mind at all enjoying my food on one of their outside tables.I've been back a few times already and will be going back again!
great food and ambiance, the waitress i got was amazing and helped me with our digital menu.
This place is so good! Will definitely recommend and want to go back over and over again, cool place to hang out, great atmosphere superb service and everything is delicious !
Appreciated the presence of traditional Chinese food in the area. The staffs were really friendly and delivered a great customer experience.

The food here is very delicious, and it has a different feeling. It has been a long time since I last had Chinese food, especially during this time in the United States. I really miss those Chinese dishes.

Biang Biang Noodles: A Must-Try for Noodle LoversBiang Biang Noodles has quickly become my go-to spot for satisfying Chinese cuisine. The noodles are simply incredible - thick, chewy, and full of flavor. The scallion pancakes are another highlight, light and crispy with a subtle savory taste.The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who made me feel welcome. I highly recommend Biang Biang Noodles to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Chinese meal.

Ordered the Pork Rib Dry Mix and the Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix. The meat is super tender, the sauce is a flavor bomb, and the noodles have a perfect bouncy and chewy texture. Sichuan Honey Wings are crispy and sweet!Definitely coming back!

Biang Biang Noodles in Seattle is a gem that never disappoints, even after years of visits. The food is consistently incredible--hand-pulled noodles with bold, authentic flavors that transport you straight to Xi'an. The service is always friendly and efficient, adding to the welcoming atmosphere. The ambiance strikes the perfect balance between casual and lively, making it a go-to spot for a satisfying meal every time. Highly recommended!

I'm really impressed with [Fast Food Restaurant]! The service is quick and efficient, and the food is always fresh and tasty. Great value for the money and consistently satisfying. Definitely a go-to spot for a fast and delicious meal!

I stopped by for dinner around 8 PM. The place was bustling, with only two servers handling the crowd. I had to wait between 5 to 10 minutes before being seated. Having done my research, I promptly ordered the Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix, a popular choice among Yelpers. Biang Biang specializes in hand-pulled noodles, known as lamian in Chinese. These noodles are made by repeatedly stretching and folding a piece of soft wheat dough to align the gluten and warm it up. The dough is then rolled out to a workable thickness and cut into portions.The food arrived quickly. Despite being called "dry," the dish wasn't completely dry like Hakka noodles, which is something to keep in mind if you're new to the restaurant. Unlike some Chinese/Vietnamese dishes that might include broth with animal bone marrow or blood, this dry order didn't contain any such elements.The Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix was delicious and perfectly spiced (I ordered medium spicy). The portion was generous. Despite needing to ask for a fork (I know, sacrilege), I wasted no time digging in.The table service was adequate but not proactive. I had to flag down my server once for the fork and later for a glass of water, both of which were brought promptly.Finding parking in the area can be difficult and expensive. It cost me $6 for an hour of street parking several blocks away from the restaurant.The seating area is not huge, but the tables more closely spaced than in a traditional American restaurant. There appeared to be a flight of stairs leading to an upper level, but I didn't see anyone using it.The prices are competitive, reflecting Seattle's pricey food scene. Overall, I'd not hesitate to return.
The food here is SO good! I loved the home made noodles and the passion fruit margarita was also very smooth and nice!
The spicy chicken dry noodles were amazing. Great environment and experience overall. I would drive very far to eat food this good, some of the best noodles I've had in my life.
Food is great. Service is just as good the only thing is it's hard to get a seat during the winter.

I Ordered a noddle's from "Biang Biang Noodles" for the whole family. The noddles was delicious and my family love it.Delivery was right on time, and everything arrived intact. It made for a stress-free family dinner. Will definitely order again for our next family gathering!
Food and service is too good. The venue was very nice. The staff were friendly, I will go back for sure.

Absolutely stellar experience at Bang Bang Noodles in Seattle during my recent out-of-town visit! From the moment I stepped in, the vibrant atmosphere and the warm welcome made me feel right at home, miles away from it. The noodles are simply out of this world - each bite was a perfect blend of flavors, textures, and the kind of homemade quality you can't find just anywhere.The drink selection was equally impressive. Not only were the drinks pretty, but they were delicious. The service at Bang Bang Noodles is just as remarkable as the food and drinks. The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely cared about making our dining experience memorable. Bang Bang Noodles truly stands out not just for its incredible food and drinks, but for the passion and love they pour into every dish and beverage. A must-visit spot in Seattle for any noodle lover or anyone looking to indulge in a culinary adventure. This place made my trip even more special, and I can't wait to return and try everything else on the menu!

Delicious and Authentic Sichuan food! The same taste as you get in Sichuan. First time I went there and it was very good!We recommend this place to have a nice dinner, plates are very abundant and tasty. It's nice to try something different, the waiter was friendly and very respectful.

I've been going to Biang Biang noodles for years. I was super excited to try their new cocktail bar. The ambiance beautifully captures the Hong Kong aesthetic of the 60s, creating a unique and inviting atmosphere. The price is actually reasonable given the ingredient cost and labor cost now days. The drinks are thoughtful made and tasted complex. I could pick up the nuances of ingredients. Over all I had a good time with my partner.

Hand-Pulled Happiness: A Biang Biang Noodles ReviewSeattle's Capitol Hill boasts a vibrant culinary scene, and Biang Biang Noodles stands out as a must-try for anyone seeking an explosion of flavor and texture. Tucked away on 12th Avenue, this gem offers a unique experience, starting with the mesmerizing spectacle of watching their chefs hand-pull the namesake noodles. These wide, chewy ribbons are the foundation for a symphony of deliciousness.My personal favorite is the Spicy Dry Beef Noodles. The perfectly cooked beef melds with the chili oil-infused sauce, creating a dance of heat and savoriness. Each bite is a revelation, showcasing the skill of the chefs and the quality of the ingredients. The accompanying side dishes, like the refreshing cucumber salad, perfectly balance the richness of the main course. Biang Biang Noodles is more than just a meal; it's an adventure for your taste buds. So, if you're looking for an authentic and exciting culinary journey, head to Capitol Hill and discover the magic of Biang Biang Noodles!

I had my first experience with hand-pulled noodles here, and I'm delighted with my choice! The noodles had a delightful chewiness, and the sauce harmonized perfectly with them. I was pleased to find numerous vegetarian options on the menu.Despite the initial appearance of smaller portions, the servings are quite generous - be assured, it is very filling.The restaurant is charmingly decorated, and they even have adorable tote bags available for purchase!
First time tried this place. Food was delicious! Service was great. Will come back next time

Such a delicious spot in cap hill for hand pulled noodles!! I believe they're known for their dry mix noodles, but my favorite has to be the pork rib soup noodles. The spice level is perfect too, I normally go for medium and it's a great balance. Service is prompt, food comes out super fast. The restaurant is also casual, a perfect spot for a chill dinner. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait during busy times, but the line goes by decently fast. Overall a great spot for a cheap dinner in cap hill!

I love that the noodles cook up perfectly, the veggies stay crispy, and the sauce is perfect. You can add spices as well. I love cucumber salad and Biang's salad is one of my favorites and no order is complete without it.
Biang Biang is definitely legit - and spicy!I temped the fates by going as spicy as possible - worth it, but definitely felt the heat. Make sure to go for the pork as well!

Biang Biang Noodles is a gem in Seattle! The ambiance is cozy, and the aroma of hand-pulled noodles fills the air. I ordered the signature Biang Biang noodles, and they were a revelation--wide, chewy strands drenched in a savory, perfectly spiced sauce. The menu offers a delightful variety, but these noodles stole the show. The staff was friendly, and the service was prompt. If you're a noodle enthusiast, this spot is a must-visit. I can't wait to return and explore more of their delectable offerings!
pasta is amaziiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii­iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiinnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn­nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggggggggggggggggg!!!!
Delicious hand pulled noodles. I ordered the Cumin Lamp Soup Noodles. I was afraid of it being gamey, but it was actually really pleasant. Has a kick, but not overpowering.
The food was amazing! The service was great and my order was served very promptly. Will definitely go back.

Wow, great. Great vegetarian/vegan strength and the noodles taste so fresh. Service very fast. Great value for what model you have, well worth it elsewhere.Vegetarian Uses: A number of vegetarians can prepare vegan by applying weights, sites and admissions. Vegetarian food is plentiful.
These noodles are so delicious make sure to add the grated cucumbers on the side, it's a great addition to the noodles. The service was also very good.

Heard good things about this place so we had to try it. Everything we had was delicious. My favorite was the honey wings and mala spicy beef dry mix. The noodle texture was just perfect. I wish it was more noodles though. The service was good and fast. Very attentive.

If you have been to China and liked teh food tehre, you'll love the food here. The first meals in a UK Chinese restaurant that took me back in flavour and atmosphere, staff were colol as well. Quick service and realky great flavours.

First time I went to a Szechuan restaurant and I was not disapointed. Great cuisine, with multiple flavor and very nice presentation. The meal set was pretty cheap for the quantity and quality. The staff were super friendly, the portions were big, and the atmosphere was fantastic. My partner and I left the place full and happy. I will go back to taste more dishes. Can't wait to come back!

My family and I popped in here on a whim and HOLY COW ! No joke the best place we've eaten at in years. Food was incredible and not over priced - service was fantastic they even boxed our left overs. Not to mention the food was at our table minutes after we ordered, hot n fresh. You must try the the signature six piece wings, popcorn chicken and signature pork noodle soup (sorry I forgot the exact names). My son really liked checking out the fish tank too. If it wasn't 30 mins away from us we would be here once a week no doubt. Thank you!!!
So delicious and such a great price. I'll definitely be going back. Would definitely recommend!

I have yet to dine in at this place, but the amount of times I've ordered takeout from here is telling about the amazing food. We've tried their veg and beef dry noodles, as well as their chicken sandwich. Consistently delicious! The spot is really cute so eventually we'd like to dine in, but for us the issue is parking and we aren't close enough to walk. Highly recommend though!
DELICIOUS food -- If you can find it! I have found the food here to be excellent.
Fantastic.Amazing atmosphere.Great food.Stupendous service.It checks all the boxes truly amazing.
It was a lovely experience I got my food and I definitely would still love more ordersIt was my first awesome experience with Biang and I love it

A super great experience. I know I was lucky with the street parking and was seated right away. The service was attentive and helpful. The noodles were good and satisfying - long and chewy. I picked the curry dry and loved the flavor. Three of us ordered our own bowls which was a massive amount of food. Next time, I think we will share. We tried the green onion pancake and popcorn chicken. The highlights were the noodle dishes so I'll just stick with those. Especially the tofu or veggie bowl.I really enjoyed my visit and already looking forward to going back. :)
this place is amazing. I will go back for sure
Excellent noodles and the chicken bao is to die for.
Biang BiangBiang BiangBiang Biang Biang BiangBiang BiangBiang BiangBiang BiangBiang BiangBiang BiangBiang Biang

Hands down the best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly, every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend it!

Hands down the best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly, every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend it!

Hands down the best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly, every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great flavor and on time. I'd definitely order from here again. I highly recommend it!
A very crowded place. Have a bite to eat and go or go further, the most it is, if there is not much time.

Food is rather delicious. Wide noodles are genuinely unique, with just the right amount of chewiness. The pork belly is really delicate. A half egg with the proper egg yolk consistency and soy sauce taste is included with the entrees. The noodle meals taste similar to dan dan noodles and feature Szechuan tastes.

My favorite place for Noodles! Staffs are so nice! And appetizers are good! Love everything about here! Good for casual dinners and lunch! I am so happy to have found Biang Biang Noodles. Highly recommended!

Hands down the best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly, every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend it!

I've been craving Biang Biang style noodles and was excited to know that there was a restaurant that specializes in this divine dish in Downtown Seattle. The food did not disappoint and the service was fast. I ordered the wet style noodles with lamb. I am salivating as I think about the delicious meal. I can't wait to return!
Amazing food and servers were polite and friendly and attentive. Will be back again soon!
Today was my first attempt at lunch! The staff is friendly, and the cuisine is excellent! I'd come back here again in a heartbeat!
best biang biang noodles and chicken wangs in Seattle bitchesssss !!!!  AnnamamanabablazkkzhzhANSNBSBANXCJHXNSMSMDNBDNSBFB­BD
Awesome! Delicious, and good sized noodles!
I was super impressed with the wings when I tried the food here!
Greet food !!!We Enjoy the food !!!Price is good !!!VWill recommend!!!I enjoy it !!!
They have some of the most delicious noodles that I have ever had here!
Tastiest food ever and fresh noodle was delight to eat. Best service. I would love to go again and again. I would definitely recommend to everyone!!

Hands down best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend!

My favorite place for Noodles! Staffs are so nice!And appetizers are good! Love the everything about here!   Good for casual dinners and lunch! I am so happy to have found Biang Biang Noodles. Highly recommended!

Hands down best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend!

Was walking around Cap Hill when I came across this place. I wasn't sure what to order and what the different noodle styles meant. The customer service was great as the cashier explained the different option and the style of the restaurant. It looks really nice. I ordered the cumin lamb dry mix and a crispy chicken bao. My order was done in the time frame I had been given, about 15 minutes. I also really liked how there were chairs outside the restaurant for me to sit and wait since not many places have that right now. The lamb lamb was well portioned and was very flavorful. The crispy chicken boa was delicious. I really enjoyed my experience and will be trying something new off their menu next time I'm in Cap Hill.
Went here for lunch and one of the staff was being rude to my friend. Would never come back again. There are so many ways to deal with customers but that was definitely not the one.
Worst service ever. This place is good only for their food but not their service. Come here if you want to order to go only.
We ordered the chicken wings and it was rawwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww­wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww
Me and my friends we're very disappointed at their menu because we thought they have a lot of menu that we can choose but they didn't. We expected that they have soup either for lunch.

We were a party of three including my one year old son, and we were asked to move tables to accommodate a party of 10 during our meal as we were in between eating our food. We had pushed the food out of our sons reach and were probably taking up one extra seating. Plain simple rude to ask a customer to change seats while in the middle of a meal, completely ruined my appetite and my $70 down the drain!! Addressed issue with manager only to be told that a lie, that the party had a reservation. Never going back again!
The food was tasty, but not worth the high prices. Service was friendly but not very attentive.

I was really excited to come here after hearing from the a coworker about their food. I came here one night and knew I had to get the spicy jumbo wings, they good, but just drenched in fish sauce and it was just so heavily breaded that it wasn't much meat underneath. Now don't get me wrong, I can handle my fish suave being that I'm Vietnamese, but this was just too much for me. We also got the shrimp paste grilled on lemongrass stalks and that too was just way too over powering and made it almost too bitter to eat. Over all the decorations were fun and interesting to look at. The cocktails were mediocre. And the wait is always so long, there are better Thai restaurants in the area with no wait and food you can actually enjoy.

Ok the taste was pretty good but the food seemed to be not that fresh. Considering the allure of the restaurant I believe these things matter a lot. The food seems to be a bit uncooked and that made me notice the staleness of the food upon observation. I'll give it a 3/5.

Okay, don't take this review into account if you not a vegetarian.I really admire the ambience, vibes around this place. Totally loved it.But why 3 starts?Ordered -Cambodian Salor Kari Sap Curry : isn't exciting as it sounds. This is a Thai food. I could get this at a thai place for much cheaper price. Tastes great though.Price on this item was $20. Yes, you get less than half the portion you expect. Totally overpriced. Im still surprised about the ratings they have on yelp.If you still wanna try, go for it.

Nue offers a delightful dining experience with its creative and diverse menu. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it a great spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The dishes are flavorful and well-presented, showcasing a variety of global influences that make each visit unique. Service is generally attentive, though there can be a bit of a wait during busy times. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food you receive. Overall, Nue is a fantastic choice for anyone looking to enjoy a fun and flavorful meal in a lively setting.
Good drinks, delicious spicy food and all for a good price. Plenty of seating, bring a friend!
Really great had a bunch of dishes, everyone was fantastic! Peri Peri chicken, the dahl, brussel sprouts were stand out and the World tour of butter plate was fun!

Nue offers incredibly flavorful food that will leave your taste buds satisfied. However, one major challenge is finding parking in the area. With only parallel parking spots available, and very few at that, it can be a frustrating experience. Another aspect to note is the communal dining setup, where you may find yourself sharing a table with multiple parties, leaving little elbow room. This can make it difficult to fully enjoy the delicious food without being cautious of bumping into other patrons or accidentally knocking something over. That being said, the fried chicken wings are a standout item on the menu, with a delightful fish sauce that adds an extra layer of flavor. On the other hand, the Vietnamese iced coffee may be a bit too sweet for some tastes. While the portions at Nue are satisfying, it's worth mentioning that the menu prices are on the higher side for the area and ambiance. Lastly, the staff's service is decent, but nothing particularly noteworthy.

Great place! Went back home to visit for thanksgiving this past year, and was so grateful of how convenient it was to make reservations (through Yelp). You absolutely have to have their fried rice. I am Filipino myself, and their fried rice is amazing.

A eclectic restaurant is a gem in Seattle. They have food from all over the world and even some wacky Thai Water Beetles! Not for me but my friends have them a try and stated they were simply salty. The cocktails weren't that great: the food the strong-suite of this place in my opinion. I couldn't really taste the lime or star anise in my drink, it was just like spiked pineapple juice.

I love the diversity of foods on the menu. The tosilog and the shakshuka were so good! Your receipt is brought to you in traveling books. Found that cool too. It sucks that they no longer do bottomless brunch. I personally don't like how the OJ is pre-mixed in the champagne. However, the experience was still great.

It's like a study abroad themed restaurant. I actually wanted to dislike this place but the food is excellent. I always get the Bunny Chow. Its one of my favorite dishes anywhere in Seattle. Good drinks too.

Lovely atmosphere and a good place in an area full of life. We really appreciated the food. The two starters were fantastic!The goat curry was missing a bit of salt, I think. But it can happen when cooking constantly, and it is subjective taste. Very easy to resolve. Service was quick. Most of the staff was friendly and polite. Very positive experience.

We came here to celebrate my birthday some month ago and we were not disappointed. Delicious and fresh tapas as it can get. Delicious that is all. It gets busy pretty quickly at dinner time but overall the crowd is well managed for a comfortable seafood fest with your companionsFour stars just because I found it a bit overpriced.
Very thing taste good. The fry chicken wings is definitely not chengdu but they are good.
The food here is amazing. I've never been so surprised by each dish being so entirely distinct from each other.

Always a pleasure dining here. There is always a wait for breakfast and brunch, but well worth it! Friendly service and great prices. A must for us whenever we are in the city. Their Chengdu fried chicken and Jamaican Jerk are out of this-world delicious!

This place is great to go with a few people as you can share everything and portions are big.It was just two of us and we ordered 3 dishes but there were so many more items on the menu and being served that looked amazing. Highly recommend the chicken wings and South African Bunny Chow!Went back again last week.Tried their ribs which were fantastic along with the usual suspects but finished the meal with their coconut cake which was marvelous. Love this place !

A beautiful place with elegant decorations!My friend and I came here for dinner. It's our first time here, and we're confused about what to order. There's a lot to choose from on the menu! The area was clean and packed with people around 7 pm, and we waited for a while to be seated.Their menu consists of food from other countries. The ambiance was unique, and the wall decorations were beautiful and trendy! It catches your attention, and they also have good drinks selections!We will be back soon! Thank you!

Our order arrived 5 minutes before quoted time in less than an hour of order placed. So convenient and will definitely use again. Good job. Will be calling again real soon. However consider creating a website or an app that will make contacting you guys much more convenient as compared to calling in order to place an order. An app will go in getting more customers for the premises since the app will be available on several platforms and hence easy for the people to download it. Similarly a website will help to advertise the business as well as the services that are offered as well as any other information that might be considered relevant to the customer.
Nice interesting, spicy food. It would be great if the menu changed more often, but most things we've had here have been great.

Special air with dishes that go from bands the world over. It's a decent spot to sit outside on a pleasant day or inside on a stormy one, attempting one of the yummy mixed drinks from the menu. The proposal is the Sunny Bunny for early lunch or the Bunny Chow for supper.

This place was so fetch. Really great spot for getting a quick bite before heading to bars and I'm kicking myself for not having enough time to get a full meal. We got their more tapas style foods and you absolutely have to order the brussel sprouts. They were amazing and fully loaded. Great food
Many choice of food with great decor Friendly staff and good drink selection. The pric is not expensive.
Should be 4.5. Great atmosphere, service, and creative food.
everything was cooked brilliantly.

The food was excellent and they have lots of options. Excellent place and they have great setting. One of the popular place in the city. Great vibe inside and outside. The staff were very helpful and provided great service. They were attentive to our orders and request.The menu was beyond great.The appetizer was so good and delicious. I like the Balinese Barbecued Spare Ribs, Chengdu wings, and Shaskshuka. It was all well-cooked and decent flavor. The drinks were so good and fresh too. Nice customer service.
Food is delicious and service is amazing! Love that they keep changing out some items on the menu!

Our initial experience at NUE was fantastic. The diverse menu offered a culinary journey through various flavors. I couldn't help but smile when I spotted Tocilog on their menu, and naturally, I had to order it.The Filipino Tocilog was accompanied by a delightful dipping sauce. The tocino slices were tender, and the egg was perfectly fried to a crisp. The Israeli Shakshuka was expertly cooked and seasoned. Lastly, the Tower of Chengdu Wings provided a satisfying crunch and a hint of spice. The distinct flavors of fish sauce, lime, and peppercorn were unmistakable. The presentation was impressive. All of this was complemented by a glass of "Less Mosa."The ambiance of the place is cozy and eclectic, and the service was outstanding. Without a doubt, NUE is a restaurant I'd consider for brunch or dinner when in Capitol Hill.

I was looking for a bite to eat when I landed in Seattle and boy did I find one! Von's 1000 Spirits is an American restaurant with an all scratch kitchen specializing in Seattle Sourdough & the largest collection of fine spirits in the cityWe each ordered a burger and were highly impressed. The bun was soft and fluffy, patties homemade, and reminded me of mom & pop shop burgers I would eat as a kid in Pasadena (Lucky Burgers, anyone?) The waiters were all extremely nice and the place was packed! However the vibe still felt intimate. Here are the two types of sandwiches we orderedDouble Smashed American Burger - two prime beef patties, American cheese, caramelized onions, packed dills, lettuce, and some magical sauce
The food was great! Service was amazing as well. The ambience is vibey and they give your check to you in a book which I think is a nice touch!

This is one of my favourite brunch places in Seattle. The food really tasty and innovative. My favourite is their South African Sunny bunny. Do try their tower of wings as well. The staff were really friendly and I highly recommend this place.
Great flavors and unique dishes! Cannot wait to taste all the robust flavors still to come.

I've been to this place at least 15 times in the last year and I would eat there every day if I could. It's my go to answer whenever anyone asks me where I want to eat. It's also a great date spot. ;)The flavors here are incredible. I can't get enough of the hummus, kale & carrot salad, fresh potato frites, and roti. I generally don't like brussels sprouts but they're my favorite item on Nue's menu. I usually ask them to bring out the pineapple cornbread near the end since it's best when warm, and all their desserts are delicious too.

This restaurant lives up to the eclectic vibe. It's unique in every aspect. Their take on fried chicken is like none you've ever had. The barbecue ribs are a must, slow-cooked to perfection. The meat fell off the bone with every bite. All in all, it was a solid experience.

I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended!
Very delicious !! I think I would Definitely recommend this to anyone who is out and about visiting the city.

I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended.
Delicious. The decor is pretty cool and the servers are really friendly. They had a great selection of drinks and we all had an overall good experience!

I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended!
Very yummy fries, I was very impressed!
Amazing brunch spot!!! Highly recommended!! Perfect blend between authentic and comfort food!!
This was a new experience for me, and I'm pleased I tried it! a nice serving size with a lot of flavor However, I would definitely have a side of rice with the wings. I'd go back!
Food was really good! Seating not great but food was worth it.

The restaurant has the finest cuisine. Beautiful plating and excellent taste are two components for a memorable dish and it delivers both. The service was perfectly synchronized with the staff on point for every little dining detail and the food was impeccable. I highly recommend this place.
I had a great dinner here, food was excellent, and the service was awesome.
I 'm going to this place to have the best meal. Yeah, I liked the service. This is really informative and enjoyable. Definitely back. I don't have any complaints. That's pretty cool,
The decor and the food in this place are to die for!

Thumbs up to this restaurant!! The place is very relaxing and very instagramable, this is where you can satisfy your cravings because the food here really tastes good, and the crew workers they are really approachable. This restaurant is a fun place when you have a date or a meeting or you can also bring your whole family, you and your love ones may feel the satisfying taste of each meal that this restaurant serves, in this restaurant you may feel like there's no place that could ever satisfy you only this restaurant, try to taste and feel home, better late than never.
This is a wonderful place full of atmosphere and wonderful food. great place to go with family and friends with lots of different options and easy to share.
I had a blast at Nue! Their food brought my travel memories back while eating there. A must try place if you are in Seattle.
Awesome food in an environment that transports you to another continent. Delicious and creative without being weird or over self indulgent.

Inventive food. Warm, community-creating environment. Honest, work-their-a**es-off owners and staff. One of my favorite Nue memories has been joining their One-World dinner featuring Syria. Not only were we exposed to delicious food (which, of course, we'd never tried before), but we dined with several Syrians, many of whom were recent refugees. It felt more like someone's home than a restaurant. Thanks, Nue, for enabling me to break (damn good) bread with people I never would have otherwise had the chance to meet.

Nue is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. It's vibey, and the food is delicious, unique, and colorful. The cocktail menu is fun too. Also, don't forget to try the Thai water beetles!

I love Nue and I really mean it. The food is amazing and of awesome quality but, most importantly, it's such a cozy place! On the other note, we had a first date with my future husband there so it will always have a special place in my heart

Nue is a unique restaurant in Seattle, and it's worth a trip to Capitol Hill from the 'burbs if you haven't already tried it. It's a small, locally-owned business and the owners travel the world to find new and delicious international street food dishes for their menu, so there's often something new to discover. I'm not an adventurous eater but my husband is, and there's always something there for both of us.The dining room is an intimate setting with decor sourced from all over. Great date-night place in a classy, relaxed setting with international flair. It's also been fun to see it featured on several food TV shows!

This place has such a great variety of food from all cultures! I recommend doing family style so that you can try a bunch of different things because everything is delicious! Don't forget to get the tower of wings!!!
One of the few restaurants where you will not be disappointed when you are adventurous

Even though one of the things I tasted was a giant bug, this is one of the best places to eat in Seattle! It's like taking a round-the-world tour with someone who's crazy about food. The laphet toke and the Chengdu wings remain favorites of ours. The UN skewers were awesome, especially accompanied by the pineapple cornbread. Their house made ice creams are mind blowing too. The water bugs...well, there was a crazy story that goes along with them, that we were lucky enough to hear firsthand from Chris.

I've dined now at Nue twice, and was floored by everything I tried. Having been to many of the countries represented on the menu, I was ready to be disappointed but was impressed by the combination of authenticity and creative spin placed on the food. While I agree it helps to be adventurous (part of the fun eating here), the food is surprisingly accessible. Somewhat randomly, I ended up on a rafting trip on a 4 day rafting trip with Chris Cvetkovich, who owns Nue along with his wife Uyen. We somehow conned Chris to cook for us the entire trip - it was incredible to see him come up with exquisite meals riverside, often improvising with random ingredients from various coolers. More impressive was hearing Chris talk passionately about the people, places, and food he has encountered across the world. Inspiring. I'll be heading back to Nue for the food, but will enjoy it in a new light after spending time with Chris

I don't eat a lot of meat but when I have a fried chicken craving this is the spot for the best wings I have ever had. The presentation on the wings is awe-striking as you are served a massive tower of perfectly golden brown wings. The wings have the perfect amount of flavor and a mouth watering crunch when you bite into them. If you're looking for a lighter accompaniment to your wings, the Brussel sprouts with coconut are delightful. The negative to the restaurant is it is smaller so it can feel cramped. I wish the tables were a little more spread out and there was better sound dampening. That said it's in Seattle, and I'm sure they've done they best they can in order to make a profit. I highly recommend this place as the top spot for wings in the state. Not only that but they also have a really unique menu with other delicious items.
Went for brunch and was blown away. Was absolutely delicious. Will come back again and again.

Visiting from the Bay Area, I have to say this was the most tasty meal I've had in a long time. The whole vibe is just incredible. It's community seating and that was very different for us but we enjoyed it so much. Thanks for a bomb meal !

I was skeptical because I thought the menu looked like a mess. Nothing seemed connected to me, everything felt like it had a million ingredients. But the food was absolutely delicious. We had the mofongo, Brussels sprouts, and the Syrian kale salad, and pineapple cornbread, and all four were phenomenal. The seating is mostly communal and it's tiny and loud so don't expect ambiance. Other than that, it's fab!
Love this place, go hungry be sure to get the chicken wings!

Excellent, unique foods. A sampler of the best food around the world. It is highly unlikely that you have eaten anything that is on the menu. Come willing to try new things. We suggest ordering multiple items and sharing them family style.

My wife and I came to Nue for dinner on Monday night and had our minds blown. The food was so good! We were dying at each bite, gobbling things up, and so happily full afterwards. Our waiter was so attentive and kind! He kept our water refilled, gave excellent suggestions, and had this kind, friendly air that made it seem like he genuinely cared about our experience. It is so hard to find that kind of warmth in restaurants these days and we were super impressed. I cannot wait for the next time I go to Nue, so that I can try their lunch menu.I give Nue 5 stars because everything was great. When you walk in you get that small business family owned feeling and you just know they do their best to give you a great time.

I was looking for a good breakfast place near my home. Found this on Yelp and it became our official breakfast diner! Went three morning in a row and enjoyed each on of them. The servings are large, the price reasonable and the service efficient. This is not gourmet fare but filling and quick. Line ups each morning but never waited more than 10 minutes. The servers were pleasant and responsive to requests and often constantly moving. Everything we ate was good!
So good! The goat curry was so good. Must order McNguyen drink so so yummy! Will be back!

I gave new five stars because their service and their staff were excellent. They are gracious and professional. I have the Cuban sandwich which was outstanding. The Mofongo was underwhelming. The communal dining was unexpected but kitschy. I plan to go back.
The goat curry is great! The Dutch pancakes are great! So many unique dishes!

Really like the concept this place has going. Not an extensive menu, but a very diverse one that emulates international street food. I really enjoyed the Bunny Chow and Jamaican Jerk Chicken, along with the pineapple cornbread. Relatively young crowd gives the place a lively vibe that reflects many Capitol Hill restaurants.
Super super good. The pay for parking is totally worth this small menu. The people are A+ nice and friendly
The jerk chicken is to die for. We also split the bunny chow and octopus skewers--both were full of flavors. We went on a Tues night and was able to get seated right away.
Fresh, inventive dishes. The wings are top notch.

I'm not exactly what you'd call a "Professional Yelper" (this is my first review) but this was seriously the BEST meal I've had in years!I started with the Syrian Kale Salad and Tostilocos. The salad was dressed perfectly and the crunch of the toasted almonds and sweetness of the 'shattered dates' (I still need to figure out how they cut them so damn small) were the perfect textural and flavor counterbalance to the dressing.The Tostilocos were really cool and from what I was told, a pretty common Street Food in Mexico. They consisted of a bag of Mexican, Salsa Verde Tostitos, slit open and stuffed with all kinds of flavors and textures that just worked. Hot sauce, crunchy jicama and cucumber, Tamarind candy, nuts, pickled pork skins, etc. Super fun.I then, based on everyone's suggestions on Yelp, had the goat curry. This dish was over the top, or is it 'off the hook'? I can never keep up with these things. Anyway, super complex dish, just the perfect amount of spicy heat and the sweetness of the coconut cornbread on the side was the bomb (or is it the 'shit'?) I had the McNguyen cocktail which was Vietnamese coffee and Irish Jameson Whiskey shaken over ice. This was one of those drinks that could get a pass just for the clever name but OMG the flavor combo was amazeballs. I'd never tried Vietnamese coffee before, and now need to without whiskey, just to taste the pure flavor of it. After that I need to move back to the one with Jameson though because the combo was fantastic.......and I love whiskeyI was totally full by now but wanted to try their liquid nitrogen ice cream I'd heard about and ordered the French Toast and Bacon Flavor. Without going into too much detail let's just say I'm stopping by after work tomorrow just for another scoop.The service was fantastic and the decor super unique and kitschy but didn't feel contrived. I've been to a lot of bars and restaurants that just hang a couple of taxidermy pieces on the wall wearing hats and call it cool but this place definitely has its own character but still feels real (esp for Capitol Hill)I got a chance to chat a lot with one of the owners (he was my waiter) who mentioned that a lot of stuff on the menu changes all the time. Can't wait to come back and see what's new!!

The rating says as good as it gets and indeed our dining experience at Nue was just that. There were four of us that shared this wonderful food, starting off with unusual and very refreshing non-alcoholic drinks. Than we got down to the real event - beautiful food tastes from around the worlds starting off with what became one of my favorites, a yellow pea salad (Theng Manga Pattani Sundal) -nutty crunchy yellow peas served on grilled romaine and finished with lemon oil. Yum! We then slowly shared and array of dishes from the Grilled Barbados Pig tails that had crispy skin and tender juicy meat with a yummy dipping sauce, Jamacian Jerk Chicken that was tender, juicy and just exploding with flavor to the very satisfying sandwich-The Maracas Shark and Bake.  We ate slow and enjoyed each bite as it arrived one at a time. Great service and good tastes. that's as good as it gets.

Service was fantastic, atmosphere was good .Friendly and attentive staff and excellent food selections. It was a little spicy but all the flavors worked well together.I would tell everyone to come eat here. I loved everything about this place. If you're ready for something new come to NUE!!!
Eclectic and delicious collection of food and drinks.

Fantastic food and really friendly staff. Heard about this place from a friend so I came here with my colleague during our trip to Seattle. I like the small plates -- gave me a chance to sample many flavors & dishes -- sort of like an international version of tapas! The dirty diplomat cocktail was also really awesome.
What an amazing and unique menu. Been twice already and working my way through everything on the menu.
Take one look at this places Facebook page and the unhinged owner and it will tell you everything you need to know to go anywhere else.
The food is okay, the service fair to good, but the management is racist and unhinged.
Has rats and health code violations. Owner is a narc who incites violence on his Facebook business page.

Worst restaurant experience ever. Owner goes to social media to insult, berate and harass customers. They can't take ANY criticism whatsoever and treats customers and employees like dogshit. Wouldn't eat here if you paid me.
Food poisoning. Nuff said

My mother (who is an older woman and no longer has a job) ordered a gift card from here for me and my wife's anniversary. I called to ask them to refund it because it was more money than she should be spending.When I spoke with Lauren to have the gift card refunded back to my mother, she seemed more concerned with keeping her money because they refused to refund it.
Upscale restaurant, decent food and prices but like many other restaurants in Seattle the environment is anti Black!
Didn't enjoy the over priced food with a little less than okay hospitality. I wouldn't recommend it around the area there are some cheaper restaurants with much better food and portions.
The service took forever, they forgot items, and it took an hour to get a check
Food was fine, however I refuse to support a business that has an douche as an owner and doesn't take the safety of others seriously.

Used to love the restaurant, now I am fully aware that the guy that owns it is a complete douche. I will NEVER eat at any of his restaurants and neither will my clients or groups I bring to Seattle. He is exactly what this world doesn't need....close the place down...move to another city, you do not belong here!
No call back , 2 years later. Apparantley, they do not black people,

HORRIFIC OWNERSHIP AND STAFF!! Do NOT go here. Just look at their food review outside the door. It's a BIG sad face :( because they have rats and cockroaches. Everyone who's local knows not to ever come here to Pesos next door.. awful places. The staff is what makes it the worst of all. Me and my friends refuse to enter either of these establishments.
Bad service and food. Took us fifteen minutes to get the attention of waiter to get a menu. The food was terrible.
Came here last Monday night (3/5) and definitely got food poisoning from the Pan Seared Petit Half Chicken. Never coming back.

I will never eat here. There are nasty roaches roaming around in the kitchen where they cook and prepare the food. They also allow underage drinking at their lounge. Also, the owner of the restaurant is known to have sex with Seattle strippers on the dining table where customers eat.Bon appetit!

My family and I used to go there A LOT and we've spend A LOT of money on that place, until we had JENNIFER as a waitress and she was a total BITCH, REALLY RUDE, TALKED the customer back with an attitude and OVER CHARGES for extra drinks that we didn't order, REALLY UNPROFESSIONAL...WORSE COSTUMER SERVICE EVER. I spoke to the manager on duty and he was a completely an asshole. He didn't apologize for the worse customer service or not even offered anything, which I wasn't expecting anything back except their waitresses to be more professional and friendly. But it seems that all the waitresses there have an attitude, well how can they not if it comes from management in that place. I will NEVER go back and I will NOT recommend this place to anyone.
One of the best ambiances of any restaurant I've ever seen - destroyed by TV programming. Barf!

Came in for the late night happy hour. Sexy atmosphere; candles everywhere. Good looking staff to compliment the interior design, but are they super unprofessional!! They were all ripping shots at the bar, including the manager! My waitress was beyond inebriated and slammed everything down that she gave us. Food was honestly good, except the mussels were past their prime. Crumbled inside of my mouth, so I had to spit it out. I expressed my opinion to the drunken waitress as she responded "eew, gross" and ran away. Manager came over to smooth things over, but he just made excuses instead of apologizing- probably thinking about his next shot choice. To make matters worse the FOH employees:A) all were talking about us- they're drunk so they can't control the volume of their voices, again the manager is ring leader in this conversation- so inappropriate and unprofessional. B) sent us out another mussel dish, but I was scarred from the first one so I turned it away.I guess I insulted the line cook? Table was in prime view of the kitchen so I could see him looking at the plate, running his mouth and then he gives me a nasty look. Word of advice to him: don't serve anything you wouldn't eat yourself and don't be in denial of when you send out shitty plates. Beautiful place, some dishes great and some sub par, but they need to pay attention to their daily operations, look at the management more and get a new service team before this place goes downhill! Sorry, just saying! I manage in casual fine dining and this behavior/treatment towards guests, I simply would not stand for.
Not
Not even close to French food. Don't even bother with this one.
Didn't like the taste of the items ordered... Will never try this place again

Waitress was unprofessional. She was eating and drinking on the job. Wtf and where the hella is her boss?? I would of fired her on the spot. What is this place turning into. Trashie is all I can say. Trash!!! Won't come back or recommend. Trash

Worst restaurant I've ever been to. I normally enjoy myself here a lot, drinking with friends, but the service and food arrival sucks. We all ordered at the exact same time and two of our plates came out first. I didn't want to eat because I felt so awkward. Then the rest of the food came out later after leaving my food in the middle of the table because I felt so awkward. I then asked how long it would take for a bowl of soup to come out so I could eat with them. He said it was only a couple minutes... 20 minutes later I was sitting with no food and the rest of my friends were done eating. I cancelled my soup because if I wanted to eat alone awkwardly I would have done it with the first dish that arrived way too early.

Actually, the response to Jeffrey G's review is enough to cause me to give a place like this wide berth. He drove home Mr. G's point about the pretentiousness and pomposity. I, too, notice everyone is a hipster in black---not my kind of crowd, and I enjoy good food, but ambiance is just as important. This, "I'm from Everett and therefore cannot be pretentious" is as laughable as the fact that he bothered to respond to the review in the first place! I'll save my bucks for a place that doesn't look down on the more colourful among us, thanks.

Eek is right !!! I really can't figure out why this place is so busy or has good reviews. We have been here three times and boy it just does not get any better. The staff seem to be able to drink on the job and our server had way to much , She was wasted. The Food NASTY really why do people like it ?? Are they so wasted or hung over that anything will do ? Come on Queen Anne you deserve way better than this joint. Fried food out of bags ??? This place is just plain old GROSS !!!! You can get way better food at Trader Joe's for less than half of what you spend here, And you don't have to smell the nasty breath of a drunk ass server..
Not worth it. Poor service.
It should be better based on the reviews. My experience though is so below average, it cannot be explained.
Very small portions and waitresses are not very attentive.

I miss my hometown Creole. Miss my grandmas creole. What this place tho? This is not creole. What is this fusion stuff? I aint feelin it. There be some mad ladies here on the weekend tho. The music be lowkey poppin too. But I still aint gettin full off the food. Moral of the story. Get your hunger fixed elsewhere. Get your thirst fixed here.
Mediocre food. Wasnt impressed with staff - they seemed to be too busy for me.
It ain't Toulousaine. May not be French.
This place is dirty and overrated. Why does everyone love this place so much. Pretty disappointing.
If you're vegetarian (or even pescetarian), there are very few options here.

We live in the Queen Anne neighborhood, so we keep going back to this place, hoping against hope that it will get better. But is doesn't!Something always goes wrong. Two weeks ago it was a breakfast that came so late that we had to inhale it to get to work on time. And the music was full of tunes that only could be handled with a scotch on the rocks. At 8 in the morning? NOT!Tonight it was two steaks, one so tough that it ruined what was a good flavor. But my wife's medium well steak came with the cow still mooing, and by the time they delivered the overly well done substitute back after we complained, appetite be gone. Evening ruined while she watched the rest of us eat our entries. This place is fine if you're looking for some good looking babes and don't mind the poor service and hit-and-miss food so you can enjoy the eye candy. But the price isn't cheap. So go there for drinks, check out the latest tatoos on the butt of some hard-belly, then get the hell out of there for a burger at Dicks, just a block away. At least you'll get what you expect.
the grits were not grits!!!! very disappointed! weirdest grits ever!

Food is delicious! compliments to the chef. the service however is AWFUL. the servers act like they're doing you a favor when taking your order. A tip is for good service, not it is expected and definitely NOT earned by this team.
Great food! ... but the service has really dropped off a cliff. Staff can be rude and dismssive.

Came here with my daughter and she's a very picky eater but there were plenty of choices for the both of us. We got two different dishes and they were both pretty good. Only thing that could've been better was mine was lukewarm instead of hot. She actually ended up eating most of mine. All in all, we had a great experience, looking forward to coming back soon.
this place is always consistent love the menulove the staffgreat part of town

Would say that this place was only alright. I came here for brunch and had beignets and eggs benedicts, and have to admit I was expecting more considering how long the wait was and the price. Nothing particularly special, and can't really say I'll be back.
Le petit tolouse. thats all my french allows. but seriously good food here if you havnt checked it out. I would recommend.
It's a nice cozy place to go. The food quality (had salmon and halibut) and taste does not live up to the other finer points of this establishment. Service was good but felt a little rushed.

My chicken sandwich the chicken was not marinated at all this place I heard is # 10 in the world or something when I walked by to go have lunch they did not even have a sign with their name on it so I was like walking around for a minute or 2 but I figured it out the number one place in America everyone should know it no sign needed Lol :) .... if I come back to Seattle I will give them another try they might have some other dishes that are good you know what I mean
Great Happy Hour. Slammed at night.

food was great. the service was fine and the soup was great. Food is a little pricey but the atmostpher was fun. It took a while for us to get our water and our drink wasn't very strong. Their benights were good though. It wasn't like cafe du monde but the chocolate dip was awesome.
Food was totally mediocre but the service was amazing!!!
it was really nice atmosphere, but we found somebody's stuff under the table and had a wrong bill twice. the prices are a little bit high
I like all their foods but the place was too noisy. Can't even hear each other talk in there.

My boyfriend has wanted to try this place for some time. We went in on a Wednesday after work and.Great food and decor (love the mosaic floor). We were seated and it took a little while for our server to get to us. She seemed a little stressed as she took our drink orders, I tried the Madame Toulouse cocktail (excellent) and Joe had a Guinness. For dinner he ordered the Gulf prawns in red basil and was not disappointed. I had the Dungeness Crab with fried green tomatoes. All in all a very good experience and I will try it again. Our server was not having a good night which, of course, can happen to anyone, but she was slow and forget to ask for our second round of drinks. Also, no smile all night. On another night the food and decor would probably have been enough to rate it a four or five, but service led me to rate it 3 stars.
the only good thing for me was dessert. lots of people, though

Came here for a quick drink and an appetizer with a friend. I got a glass of their sangria and it was very solid. Not the best sangria I have ever had, but it was what I was in the mood for. My friend also ordered an appetizer and I had a bite of it. I cannot remember for the life of me what the dish was, but it was fried, a little spicy and again, pretty solid.Definitely wouldn't be a go-to if I lived in Seattle, but it was a fun experience for a late-night adventure.
Didn't have anything against this place, it was good, but I haven't been back, so that says something.
The food here is always impressive. The staff can be a bit sub par. Long waits on drinks and if you need something once your food is dropped off it is hard to flag someone down.

Lamb burger is awesome. Lunch hour is very busy, the place is usually fully packed. The drinks are the same as everywhere else in town, not bad. The food and servers are good. Sometimes the wait for your food is slow especially around lunch.

We came in on a pretty busy day and waited about 20 minutes before being seated. The waiting area is very small and most people (including ourselves) had to stand for the duration of our wait. The restaurant has a New Orleans Mardi Gras decor. We ordered scallops and a shrimp dish. Both were just OK. Our waitress wasn't very attentive, but the atmosphere was fun if you like places that are a bit noisy.

Beignet's and a Creole Bloody Mary for breakfast. Cannot go wrong with anything on their menu. Service is not so good almost all the time. The last time I went with my sister and we sat for 15 minutes before we even got water. It was kind of a bummer. But then the food came and I was reminded why I keep going.
review is for last call only. not for the food.

The place is alright. It was very hard to find, didn't even have the name on the building, we drove around the block a few times until we saw the address. The waiting area has a horrible setup and if it's busy people will crowd in front of the host booth. I was skipped twice while trying to get a table.The waiters were all very friendly. I went for breakfast on a Sunday and I think the food is over priced and with a small portion size, tastes good though.The inside is pretty tacky. It looks like they have sheets stapled to the ceiling to hide the insulation. The ceiling lights look like they were held up by those plant hooks that screw into the ceiling, then plugged into a regular outlet just exposed on the ceiling.I honestly don't know how this place ended up on the Food Network. I'd rather go to ihop for breakfast

This restaurant definitely has an enormous menu, so if you are someone who appreciates having many options then this is your place. However, the food isn't really fitting to my palate. Nonetheless, the atmosphere and drinks are great. If you're looking for a good place to start your night Toulouse is a good option
Overrated and lacks subtlety of flavor, not to mention overpriced.

Food is good, a bit high priced but if you eat during happy hour it's a better deal. I discovered a caprese sandwich during happy hour one night and returned specifically for that a month or so later and they refused to serve it since it wasn't happy hour, no matter what the price. That irritated me a bit but I got something else and it was pretty good. (Not as good as the sandwich, but still tasty enough)

Beautiful place - terrible service - pretty good food - terrible service - awesome drink menu - oh, but terrible service. I say try it out, because the ambiance is amazing, and the food and drinks are pretty good - hopefully you will have better service (and much faster) service than us.
The food was excellent, ambiance was simple and beautiful. The service was excellent.
Been several times for dinner. Always a great experience with delicious food and cocktails.

I am not kidding when EVERY single one of the 6 of us agreed that this was the BEST food we have ever had, and would travel to Seattle again just to eat here.Every part of every dish was delicious, the service was wonderful, and atmosphere was great!!We all got something different for lunch and for dessert, and everything was just to die for.
Omg food here is amazing! I tried the gnocchi pasta w/ mushrooms and prosciutto and it was to die for..Beware of a huge menu! The choice is impressive for fish eaters! Very nice, great service.
The Cajun foods are not very good as I thought. But still tasty though. Hahahahahahahah

Toulouse Petit is a Louisiana restaurant that offers a unique brunch experience with delicious southern flavors incorporated into its food. The food is consistently tasty, and you can tell that a lot of care and attention is put into the preparation of each dish. The menu is varied, and there are plenty of options to choose from, including some creative twists on classic brunch items.However, one downside is that the coffee leaves much to be desired. If you're a coffee lover, you might be disappointed with the quality of the coffee here. Nevertheless, the quality of the food more than makes up for this minor drawback.Overall, if you're looking for a unique brunch experience that incorporates delicious southern flavors, Toulouse Petit is an excellent choice. The only downside is the wait time, but that's just a testament to how popular and beloved this spot is.

This place is recommended if you are going on a date. Most candles I saw at one place were here and that's the unique artifact about this place. The food was great, although they don't serve anything unique on the menu. I just love the decor of this place.

Had a lunch at Toulouse Petit. Food quality and taste was kind a all over the place. The Dungeness crab over fried green tomatoes was very good and I'd highly recommend it. Fried half chicken over gravy was also seasoned well and very tasty. The seafood gumbo tasted a little under seasoned, peppery enough, but lacking something. The kurobota pork/gnocchi was the saltiest food I've ever had at a restaurant. It paired well with the gumbo though. The beignets also may not be what people expect. Ours tasted slightly overcooked on the outside but extremely doughy and pasty on the inside. I've heard that's the New Orleans style though. I'd normally give it a lower rating, but it had a very nice vibe and solid service. Presentation was decent, price wasn't too high, and they seemed to be accommodating of groups without reservations. I'd like to try their brunch next time. Overall, the entire covid situation hasn't been particularly great for any restaurant, so it's good to see them still working.

First time visiting the place with a group of friends on a Saturday night. The ambiance was great, our server was friendly and wasn't too impressed with the food. Overall, we all had a great experience!

first off I am two fifths italian so I think I know what I'm talking about when it comes to cajun food. this is basically the uppity city people version of cajun classics. pretty good though delicate and airy sauces and surprising spice level on the andoulie which is there signature dish. Overall good but Caused a bit of a seen. Bastard door boy asked for my vax card so I hollered at him and floored it and bowled through a bunch of tables. Gotta let these vaxMaxxers im not to be messed with.

I've yet to have a bad experience with Toulouse Petit either from dining in or to-go. To drive a specific review though, I took my partner here for birthday brunch. We were told it would be about 45 minutes and it was, in fact, exactly about 45 minutes. The hostess was friendly and set the right expectations, so kudos there. Once seated, our server greeted us and got us on our way. Everything came out quickly and well prepared and was just delicious. Like, seriously good. Everytime. Only negatives are that the parking sucks (that's seattle for you) and that to get to the bathroom, you need to go through the kitchen which honestly weirds me out, but love love love this place.

Kayla was outstanding! First two courses were delicious, dessert was average (wait until you can get to Cafe du Monde for benigets). Meal ended on a low note. LIVING WAGE TAX?!?!?? Really? Why do I have to pay for my meal, a tip, and subsidize the living wage that the owner of this establishment should be paying. Stop trying to drain your customers for every cent they have. They're working off of a living wage also trying to have a nice night out.

wonderful breakfast here. great ambiance and social distancing. I had two cocktails: the Florentine Brunch Cocktail and the Storm Spritzer and both were fantastic. I also loved the beignets. I had the Toulouse Breakfast Sandwich. The restaurant itself is rather relaxed

I come here and get something different every time. Sometimes I want to get the same thing but there is just so much to try. Every time I'm surprised at how great the dish was. It has such great depth from the flavors to the ingredients. Each dish is unique in its own way. If you want spontaneity and delicious food, come here!
I really like the pastries here. They have a cute nice sitting area too.

Been coming here for many many years! Birthday events, anniversary dinners, happy hours. The food is still amazing and I love the atmosphere, but the service was a bit lacking today. The sweet beignets are always a good finish to a great dinner!
Great if not amazing food. Really enjoyed the selection of choices. Service was decent not my surly then you would expect from Seattle. Overall a great dining experience.
Eating here is always a wonderful experience! Make sure to make reservations as they are always busy.
Good food. good staff. Ok menu. Why do i keep going back?

Toulouse remains to be one of the best places in the city for happy hour food, variety, and price for their small plates!It's noisy and cramped in the bar, but if you sit at a table it's much more intimate and comfortable--in any case, you're here to enjoy the bustle and people-watching of downtown!We love the fried chicken, grits, spicy prawns, lamb sliders, and the breakfast. Everything I've had at Toulouse is excellent.They're a great spot for brunch, lunch, dinner, or late night. The wait time can be long, but this is a good place for locals and visitors both. If you take out of town guests here, they will be impressed!
Food was good, lots of variety to choose fromService and staff are prompt and attentivePrice is reasonableI enjoy the atmosphereGreat place for breakfast and brunch
I don't get around to posting reviews until weeks later or whenever but i knew everyone needed to hear about this place. Or at least people like to know the place. It is one of my fav places.
Love the beignets here, and most of the breakfast food is quite good, but the dinner menu could offer a little more variety. Still a fan!
I've been there to have some dessert. It was so good. Nice server and nice atmosphere.

I ate here last night (finally!) for the first time. It was delicious and the atmosphere with all the candles made for a great date night. we were seated pretty promptly for how busy it was so that made us happy. Definitely recommend!!

I love the food here. The flavors are excellent and I have yet to have something I did not really enjoy. The atmosphere is great as well and the whole experience makes me want to come back again and again.
Some of the best breakfast and brunch food around, I have been coming here for years and never had a problem.

An amazingly large menu and we've loved everything we've tried. The bartenders are top-notch as well. I love to go old-school with some spicy Gumbo, but we also recommend the BBQ prawns with creamy grits, and the crawfish beignet.

The food was great. The service was great. What really makes the first two exemplary was the general hospitality this Restaurant offers its guests. If you have never been Go. if you have been go again.

I give Toulouse 4 stars for an amazing breakfast fare. Their lunch and dinner menus have not been my favorite. Usually the dishes are too salty. They take pride in having the best happy hour menu, but the dishes are tiny and you get what you pay for.
Everything here is top notch.....Brandon is awesome

Love their food. This location comprises of open seating which means you are not assigned a designated server who seats you at a table. First come first serve where you hover over patrons, wait for them to leave their seats for any reason and take advantage of the opportunity to steal their seats.Service was great and our meal was served to us on time with no delays. Try to come when it's not busy or overcrowded. Towards the end of meal, other patiently waiting patrons are shameless to ask how much longer you're going to take to finish your meal and if they can come grab your tables soon or after?
Good food - good service. A great spot for brunch or dinner.
Great food for breakfast on a Sunday, but very busy and somewhat slow service.
Very good, I love happy hour! The prices are very cheap and affordable.
whether its french toast or cajun food, it is all amazing. Pacific seafood mixed with Louisiana flavors.
Breakfast is phenomenal and the beignets are an absolute must!
The space is lovely, warm & bustling. The menu is huge (a little overwhelming) & diverse.
Great breakfast place. Service was fabulous and the food unique and delicious.

I recently went here, but didn't love the food. It was okay, but not great in my opinion. The southern inspired meals aren't really authentic, but the staff are so great and accommodating that as a whole I give the place 4 stars. It's hard to notice from the street, but once inside it's quite nice décor.

Had a nice dinner here a while ago. Can't remember what we ate, but I just remember it was good food and a good experience.
