The waitress was attentive, and the host accommodated us with last-minute walk-in and no reservation. Only had to wait 10 min or so and it was dinner time on a Sat night with a full restaurant. Much appreciated!
Wonderful food and wonderful service. We had an amazing night!
Wrong check, 2 times. Loudly but nice interior.

From step one, you will appreciate all the idea that was set into the creation of the eatery. The window panes, feel from the 5,000 pounds of plaster on the wall, mosaic tiles and the blownglass fixtures are amazing. The service was hands down fantastic. Fortunate for me, my buddy who joined me works next door , therefore I sort of felt like portion of an entourage, but regardless the food was yummy, particularly for them only lately opening. I had the halibut, cooked perfectly and my buddy had the pork plate
Really good happy hour pricing.
Been here for brunch and dinner a few times; extensive brunch and dinner menu. Good food!

Feels like it's been an elegant area destination for years... great attention to detail - mosaic tiles, exquisite blown glass and steel art. And it is comfy, with candles over all of the walls that warm up the space. Excellent food, excellent drinks, extremely fine for a date. And they serve Bakon Vodka! Bartender Jason Crume created a delightful holiday eggnog choice when we were there called the "Bakon flip" - A whole egg, 1.5oz Bakon vodka, 1ounce Irish cream, .5ounce maple syrup. Serve in flip glass (or wine glass), grate Fresh nutmeg on top.
Very interesting creations at this fun, exciting, great-spot-for-a-date-night. Their happy hour is A+ too.
i came with my wife in this restaurent for diner, i enjoy my night and the food was good but the serveur was agressif
The toulouse petit is very great Restaurant with strong customer service and outstanding staff. the food was amazing from appetizers to desert. very peaceful atmosphere
Amazing breakfast happy hour! LOVE this place. Parking can be tricky, though.

Used to be my favorite happy hour, but ever since they raised their prices I have not been able to go as often. Best creole french food in Seattle. Service is okay, LOVE LOVE their breakfast happy hour (crab meat benedict is the best thing). If you get a chance, try the new orleans prawns (dinner version). meaty prawns, creamy butter/cheddar grits, heaven.
Great place for brunch!
Food is great. Ton of food options. Get in for brunch...

Two of us were here for a Sunday late morning, no reservations, place was packed with people standing outside. They said a 20-minute wait and got us in even sooner. The food was delicious--beignets were the star of the show. French press coffee was OK. Service was attentive and friendly. Atmosphere is great, gorgeous wood inlay tables, colorful glass tiles, creative lighting, loved it. One star off because it was super noisy--lots of hard surfaces that bounced sound around plus they play music. But we will totally be back again.
It was amazing brunch. I got a good time with my wife
A true highlight while visiting Seattle. Quaint with a divine, delectable, delicious cuisine! Much love from Birmingham, Al.
Good food; crowded though :(

Amazing food! Of course I had to get the fried chicken and it was so juicy. The cocktails are on point too. I had a bourbon and honey cocktail which asked the server to keep them coming... Love the low lighting and all the candles. Host was super nice and sat us in a really nice booth for hour date night. Coming back for sure. If you are looking for something away from down town and yummy this is it! A real Seattle experience.

Excellent selection of Cajun cuisine that makes me want to return very soon. The menu offers a great selection of appetizers and main courses --- almost too many. The specialty cocktails are fun and offer great variety. The only downside is the parking which is a problem near Queen Anne. I cannot wait to return so I can sample more of the menu offerings.

This place is on a level with the Carnelian Room in San Francisco with regards to the food. Outstanding. The "Cajun Meatloaf" featured a powerful floral aroma of black pepper without the expected kick in the teeth from overseasoning. The butterscotch and banana pie was to die for, and yet barely sweet enough to qualify as desert. Food is served very late, so if you find yourself hungry in Seattle late at night you would do well to check this spot out.

Recently took my friend for her birthday. I expected excellent...and got it. Service, food, atmosphere. All great. So rare to find cajun anything in Seattle. And, the prices weren't crazy. A little noisy with the bar in the same space but it was a weekend night. I can't fault them for that. Worthwhile visit.

The restaurant is beautiful! The lighting us dim at night, but creates ambiance.The food is the real star here! On our first visit my girlfriends and I were there for happy hour. (word to the wise, their happy hour is insanely busy so get there early) I had the crab ravigote over fried green tomatoes and creole shrimp and both were absolutely amazing.I've come back for dinner several times and never been disappointed. They have a great wine list and a very well stocked bar. I brought my boyfriend here once or twice, he's more a casual beer guy so this place isn't really for him. More for me and my girls!
The food was very good. Really enjoyed the jumbalaya. Arugula salad didn't impress. Service was good, a little slow... could've been more attentive. Nice place, but the music was a bit loud.
Perfect place to go with a lot of friends, and just order everything on the appetizer menu and share. great cocktails too.

Went two consecutive nights. 2 people, averaged $75/person with tip. Food was amazing!!!! First night, service was fantastic. 2nd night, we cancelled our last drink order (that was almost 10 minutes old), paid our bill and left. If you go, hope you get the good staff, and definitely start with the 'fried chicken gumbo'!!!

There are a few things that keeps me from giving this 5 stars, but over all I'm a fan and I'll continue to eat here just because there are delicious items on this menu. I love the shrimp and grits combo and the jambalaya is really good. A tad salty....but good. I have been here twice so far, once for my anniversary. I did find that the cocktails I ordered were a little bitter and sometimes lacked sweetness that you expect from a cocktail. But the overall flavor was delicious. Just add a little more sweet and it would be perfect. We ordered the Pastini risotto and the corn and sweet onion Macque Choux which was absolutely delish. I would order those again. They were plentiful in size as well. So my husband and I split those while waiting for our entrees. We also ordered the braised and fried bacon which was delicate and cooked perfectly. I just wished there was more. The entrees are a little on the small side and we ordered a half chicken and a ribeye. I had to send the ribeye back because it was way overcooked. But they brought us a new one and didn't charge us for either. Which was awesome. The ribeye they brought us was laid on top of a delicious mash with a blue cheese on the steak. It was so good. My half chicken was also good, but a little lacking in size. Had I only ate the entrees, I would have been left very hungry. I suggest you get sides to go with your meal. It's a little on the expensive side, but it is good. Of course there are some imperfections that could use a little tweaking but overall, I love this place. At the end of our anniversary dinner, the waitress brought us some free beignets in a chicory sauce. The sauce itself was so good and so were the beignets if you've never had one. Granted I've had better at another establishment, but the thought was really nice. They have a huge wine list as well. The atmosphere is lovely and I think you should at least try it once.
They have amazing beignets and whatever spices they use on their potatoes is delicious!
Good place over all. The table bread was a little dry but over all it's was good. Would go back.

This is a restaurant with great atmosphere and decor. This place is unique with the candles lit on the wall and that itself made it a great experience for me. It's priced well and the food is great (not amazing but eating it in this pretty little place made it ten times better!) From out of town and would definitely go back!
I LOVE the happy hour here! Especially the snails. :)

5 stars for ambiance and food but I hade to take off a stars because We got food poisoning from the gumbo. But I like this place so much we STILL come back. Heck it only happened once and who doesn't need a deep internal cleansing every few years?This has got to be my favorite romantic spot to dine in Seattle. All the candles flickering could make anyone appear more attractive!
Yummmmmmmy food and sweet ambiance!
Good food. Spicy and open late. Fun spot
Great breakfast in a beautiful restaurant. Can't miss here.
I prefer going here for breakfast. I tried going here for dinner once and wasn't impressed. Try the beignets...yum!
beignet! in loving memory of lillian

Went here recently with some friends and am very pleased. They have a drink called the Honeybadger (and it was amazing). Everyones food was amazing and tasty and the prices were slightly high but well worth it. The red velvet cake nearly started Armageddon at our table (HANDS OFF MAH CAKE!)

On caveat, you should know that the place is sort of Louisiana style/Cajun food, not Toulouse as in southern France. The place is known for brunch, which is when I went. The place is busy so you may have to wait. The place is crowded a bit noisy. The service is fairly quick, slow enough to talk but not slow. The food is tasty and hot. The other person that I was with had a crab omelet which actually had chunks of crab, not imitation crab or tiny bits. The portion size is average to slightly large.They have no parking so street parking is what you have to find. On Sundays, it's easy. On other days, if you go for brunch, it's probably ok.
Soooooo good. The coffee is so delicious with the Begnets. The decor and atmosphere is vibrant and fun. Generally I like the breakfast better than the dinner, but that's just my pick

Oh the wonderful goodness of fluffy and light beignets! Ate here for breakfast on a weekday with a friend, so the wait wan't too long ~5 minLove the drinks too! Had the Katie-mae which has st. germain which I absolutely LOOOVE! The french press coffee which was served so beautifully tasted amazing as well- I like it dark and strong!. We had a pork cheek sandwich and mussels. The mussels were great but the sandwich tasted like a salt lick. Not good. If it weren't for that sandwich I would've given 5 stars. The beignets alone are worth coming here for.
delicious Foie gras!
Good food. Good drinks. Good atmosphere.

Be sure to make reservations ahead of time--even on a Saturday morning, this place is packed! With the reservations we made ahead of time though, it was no problem at all to get a table.$6 Happy Hour BREAKFAST was a unique treat. I had an heirloom tomato scramble with spicy red potatoes and a grapefruit mimosa.French food with a spicy Cajun twist!

Surprised to see negative reviews on this place because my experience was pretty good. A noisy restauarant that is a bit slow with service, I thought my food was better than most busy packed popular places. Appreciated the large menu because there were so many things that looked good, although a lot of it is fried so beware. I like french onion soup and theirs is very good. Seafood is good too--try the oysters.I asked for recommendations the first time I came but there were so many things recommended that I had to come back a few times to taste everything. This is one of my favorite spots due to the Happy Hour menu, too.
Awesome happy hour with great prices.
The decor is a little bit weird during the day but the food is really good!
Great happy hour and lots of choices. The food was delicious. Not to mention how great of an atmosphere it is.
Beignets!
Happy hour in the morning? You must try it - the breakfast is awesome.

I've been here for breakfast a few times... Everything I've ordered I loved. One was a chickpea English pea something-a-rather that was absolutely amazing. Bloody Marys are decent and you never have to wait too long for a table. The only thing I don't recommend featured on "the best thing I've ever eaten" show... Pork cheek hash or something. It must have been missing because neither myself or my BF thought it was that good but everything else we've tried there has been amazing... Sometimes the service takes a while but it is a very large restaurant.

Arry pretty much said everything there is to say. it's a VERY nice dining room. my companion had the Duck Confit and i had the easy jambalaya. both dishes were extremely flavorful and delicious. my friend said that the restaurant was mentioned as one of the top 10 restaurants in the nation. i didn't understand how that could be determined, but then on the top of their receipt it states "one of the top 10 resturants in the nation as determined by blah-blah and msn.com" (i can't remember the other source). there you go then! try it out.

Went here for happy hour with friends and had a great time! The manager was extremely helpful and went out of his way to help one of my friends. The food was great, but the drinks were better!Highly recommended!
Happy Hour Portions are delicious and cheap. And Small.
fun dinner with great food and service...we'll be back!!

Just went to this place for the first time the Saturday after xmas. I had a friend in town and I wanted to take him somewhere new. The place was busy but we found a table in the bar area. The beer selection was different, it forced me to try some new beers. We were pretty much just drinking, but did order a half dozen raw oysters in a half shell. Very good. The staff was super friendly. We spent some time at a table and the server was great, and then we moved to the bar and the bartenders took really good care of us. I recommend checking this place out, I want to try more of the menu.
Beautiful.Delicious.Go there.Now.Did I mention delicious?

Great place. Beautiful, well-designed space with an interesting assortment of options...We stumbled onto it after eating some Thai in Queen Anne and wished we had eaten at Toulouse. We finally got there the other night and got to have a great dinner. Both of my companions enjoyed their food (a ton of really amazing meat, fish, poultry options). I, however, got a great salad and some sides--much to the weird grumbling behavior of my waiter who (every time I asked for something) looked at me like I was from Mars. Hello--high end does great wonders for us vegan/veg--esp when our companions order a butt load from your menu!Everything else was grand--from the setting to the beautiful people eating there. Ok, maybe I am wrong...maybe it wasn't that my waiter was less than stellar because I am veg. We have two theories: 1) (my companions' version) you, pierced waiter, had a crush on me and were jealous that i was two hunky guys or 2) (my version) you, pierced waiter, were jealous that I was coming between you and my two sexxxy male companions would have loved to have eaten you for desert.Go there. Eat. Drink. Enjoy. Maybe you will bed him...?

As a Seattle foodie with a penchant for bold flavors, I recently had the pleasure of dining at Toulouse Petite, and let me tell you, this place is nothing short of incredible. Serving some of the best Cajun Creole food I've ever had, Toulouse Petite is a true gem.Culinary Highlights:Crab Eggs Benedict: The crab eggs benedict was a revelation. Perfectly poached eggs atop fresh, succulent crab, all smothered in a silky hollandaise sauce. Every bite was a symphony of flavors that transported me straight to New Orleans.Seafood Jambalaya: The seafood jambalaya was spot on. The rice was perfectly cooked, and the medley of seafood--shrimp, crawfish, andouille sausage--was seasoned to perfection. It had just the right amount of spice to leave a lasting impression without overwhelming the palate.The atmosphere at Toulouse Petite is warm and inviting, with a cozy, yet vibrant vibe that makes you feel right at home. The attention to detail in both the decor and the service is impeccable. Whether it's a quick lunch or a leisurely dinner, I always leave feeling well taken care of.

I can't say enough good things about Toulouse Petite and their incredible server, Kathy! I come here often, and every single visit is a delight. The food is always exceptional, but what truly makes this place stand out is the outstanding service. Kathy is amazing--attentive, friendly, and always goes above and beyond to make sure my dining experience is perfect. She really made me feel like a valued guest!The atmosphere at Toulouse Petite is warm and inviting, and the attention to detail is impeccable. Whether it's a quick lunch or a leisurely dinner, I always leave feeling well taken care of. Thank you, Kathy, and the entire team at Toulouse Petite, for consistently making my visits so enjoyable. I'll definitely be back soon! Probably next Sunday
The food was excellent as was the service. Our waiter Chris was exceptional, as was everyone else.
We love the food and service. Always spotOn , it was our first date and our anniversary = 9 years Thank you

Embarking on a culinary journey in Seattle, I stumbled upon a charming gem that forever changed my perception of French toast. Nestled in a quaint corner, this establishment not only boasts exquisite antique decor but also exudes a warm, inviting ambiance. The staff, with their impeccable service, further elevated my dining experience.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the Crème Caramel French Toast. This divine creation, adorned with succulent strawberries and luscious pecan butter, is a symphony of flavors. The marriage of crème and caramel is a delight to the senses, but it's the pecan butter that truly steals the show. Its heavenly blend of sweetness and nuttiness leaves you craving for more.As I relish every bite, I must also commend the perfectly crispy strips of bacon that accompany this masterpiece. Each element on the plate harmonizes beautifully, creating a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate.In conclusion, this enchanting spot has captured not just my taste buds but also my heart. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to embark on a culinary adventure in Seattle.

Toulhouse Petit has been a staple go to for brunch when I am in Uptown (formerly Lower Queen Anne). However, I recently visited for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the meal. I enjoyed a Cajun Shrimp Po' Boy with a small salad and side of fries. The Po' Boy was delicious and had a generous amount of shrimp. The salad was well dressed, and the fries were nice and crispy. Although I have been several times it never gets old the New Orleans style atmosphere that breaks up the Seattle Contemporary style that most restaurants fall back on for decoration. The staff was polite and quick to respond before I could ask. All in all, Toulouse should be on your list whether a visitor from out of town or a long-time resident. Thank you for the great lunch and will be dining here again soon. P.S. This is one of, if not the, best brunch spots in Seattle if you like Cajun style foods.

I love southern food, and I was blown away by the menu here. There are so many things to choose from it'll take you a good 15 minutes just to read through it at best! I had the mufalletta sandwich and it was unbelievably good. My buddy had a fried shrimp po boy sandwich and he couldn't get enough of it! He also had a bloody Mary which was a little on the small side but still tasted great. The atmosphere is really nice and it's not too loud inside as they have good acoustic fabric on the ceiling so it doesn't echo at all. Very clean bathroom. And plenty of seating in the restaurant. The decor is really cool too with all the candles on the wall, and the building really stands out among all the other buildings on lower Queen Anne. I have to go back here at least another 10 times to try enough stuff on the menu to feel like I've actually done a good job of trying dishes here!

Oh my god. I can't say enough good things. I have been coming here for years. This place never fails to provide an absolutely delicious eye rolling meal. I have trouble deciding what to eat. The brunch is phenomenal. By far the best. The beignets!!! The drinks!!! Not only this, I have received outstanding service. Our food took longer than usual to come out. Manager comped all of our drinks. I was very grateful and didn't mind the wait. They very much care about your experience. We will be back again many times more.

Popped in for lunch before hitting up the tattoo convention. The food was AMAZING! If you've eaten in nolo and liked it you're going to love this place. Pro tip- despite GPS it's a little hard to find since as far as we could find, there's not really much for signs!!

I recently had an outstanding dining experience at this French restaurant. The ambiance was inviting, and the standout was Hadley's exceptional service. She expertly guided me through the menu and ensured every aspect of my meal was perfect. The dishes were a delightful fusion of flavors, with the muscles and gumbo being fantastic Hadley's attentiveness and warmth truly elevated the evening. If you're seeking a memorable culinary adventure with exceptional service, this restaurant is a must-visit. :)

The food is fresh, flavorful and tasty Service was Great this rime, last couple of times it took a while for us to get our order in and the food. The Sunday brunch menu has a wide selection and portions are of nice size. In the Seattle area it s a good value.
Everything my friends and I have ordered has been delicious - and everything is off a vast menu.
Ambience, food and service is unlike any other in lower QA. Miss the days Pesos was around but this vibe is v similar.

I had been searching for a place to celebrate a birthday dinner with my family, and this place had come highly recommended by many food blogs, friends, and social media accounts. I was skeptical of the legitimacy of a French-Creole restaurant in Seattle, since we unfortunately don't have many restaurants serving that type of cuisine, but I held out hope that this one would prevail, since I love French-Creole food!I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Sunday night, and upon arrival, we were seated immediately. The restaurant was packed to the brim, and the atmosphere was buzzy, but not overly loud. The dining room itself is dark and dimly lit - a perfect ambience for a romantic date. You can tell the painstaking labor put into creating this restaurant, from the thousands of hand-laid tiles to the hundreds of candles the restaurant's staff lights each night (detailed in the back part of the menu, if you want to know more). Service was friendly and helpful, if a bit slow (though I totally understand, since it was a weekend). After getting seated, our waitress asked us if we wanted bread ($7, comes with butter), and it came out a couple minutes later, piping hot and fresh from the oven. It was a pretty authentic French baguette (coming from someone who has had some of Paris's best), though I will say that it is a bit bland, so eat it with the salted butter! The sommelier came out, and my dad ordered an Alsatian red that he was curious about. The somm seemed extremely knowledgeable and was more than happy to talk about the extensive wine list! The wine itself was very fairly priced with minimal markup for a restaurant, and there's really something for everyone on the 16-page list. We ended up ordering four entrees, which we split among the four of us. My entree, the Grimaud Farms Muscovy Duck Confit over Lentils de Puy with Local Butternut Squash ($34), was delicious - the duck was crispy and flavorful, and the lentils were hearty and well-spiced without being heavy. I will say that the portion of my entree was relatively small (the duck leg was small and there wasn't much butternut squash at all), but there was a good amount of lentils. My brother ordered the Big Easy Jambalaya ($33), which comes in a sizzling skillet piled high with prawns, chicken, house-made andouille sausage, and tasso ham. The rice on the bottom was perfectly cooked (not hard, but not mushy at all), and had absorbed the rich, deep Creole flavors of the spice mix and meats on top. It was slightly spicy, but we actually wished it were a little spicier! My mom ordered the Jumbo Wild 'Barbecue Shrimp' New Orleans ($36). The shrimp was well-seasoned, with some sort of Creole seasoning (cayenne pepper and paprika being some standout flavor notes), and they were quite large, as the name suggested. The grits were so rich and creamy (complimented amazingly by the chives/scallions served on top), but we couldn't finish the whole portion for that reason. Finally, my dad ordered the Puget Sound Pacific Mussels with Roasted Shallot-Coriander Paste/Red Basil Nuoc Cham and Pommes Frites and Aioli ($21, $9 extra for frites). This surprised us by being our favorite dish of the night; apart from getting a very generous portion of both mussels and pommes frites, both were perfectly cooked, and we loved the Vietnamese-style sauce that the mussels came in (and we especially loved dipping the baguette in it!). We were so full by the end of the meal that we couldn't even think about getting dessert, but all of the desserts we saw other tables ordering looked amazing, and we would definitely go back to try them another time. Ultimately, I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a romantic date night or a celebratory dinner. No, the prices are by no means cheap, but I think that the portions are fairly generous here, and it's no more expensive than Seattle's other high-end, classy date-night restaurants. The food and ambience couldn't be better, the restaurant itself is beautiful, and the service is great - we'll definitely be going back!

Something special about Toulouse. I ended up googling some stuff myself, just because I rarely eat Creole food. But in the best way, and trying something new. It was cheerful, but cozy, with a velvet banquette of small candles. After ordering custom from the impressive, yet overwhelming, menu, we had prawns, chori and grits.
Good experience.I would recommend this to others also...Great service and good food....
The food, drinks, atmosphere, and customer service were all wonderful. Not much more you could ask for!
Wow! Great food and service. The staff was great, and so was the service! Prices for the quality definitely evens out!
Amazing food, love the atmosphere and the food was just delicious! Great service and so many options on the menu!
Great happy hour and service! Super cool and cute spot for date or dinner with friends. Happy hour is where it is at! Everything was yummy!
They have delicious dessert like breakfast!
Food was so delicious, it had lots of options.Very well prepared dishes. Staff were very accommodating. Recommended!
This is my favorite restaurant of all time! Never once been disappointed with a meal. I would recommend it time and time again.
The food is so fabulous. Every time we come, we leave with huge smiles on our faces, full bellies, luxurious ones. I probably have to eat here again. Greatly recommended!

My wife/fiancée (wedding ceremony delayed due to Covid) went to Toulouse for Halloween, and it was the best restaurant experience we have ever had in Seattle. The restaurant itself was beautiful and atmospheric, and the food was absolutely delicious. They had a wide array of selections for different price ranges, which was appreciated. We had Sea Scallop Coins, the Seafood Gumbo, and an arrangement of 3 of their cheeses. Every dish blew us away, and the service provided by our waiter, Harrison, made this an incredibly memorable experience. He was perceptive, friendly, and good-humored; he even noticed my wife's ring and congratulated us. He even went as far as giving as a plate of beignets as a congratulations--above and beyond service, and I only wish I could have tipped more. After our first night there, we already know we want to come here again as often as we can. I have no complaints about my experience at Toulouse!
Second time here, both time's the food was great along with the service. Short and sweet
One of our favorite places in Seattle. They never disappoint!Love the food and ambiance

Five stars for fantastic food and outstanding, attentive service. It was the first time here, and it met my standards. Good to make the choice! Recommend it for sure! They're open during the Covid 19, and I enjoyed it so much that I had to get it again next week. It's really a lot of fun to try. Friendly, competent employees.
This spot is one of the few great places in Queen Anne for a nice fine dining experience, we ordered chicken gumbo and the house special burger both were delish and the flavors were robust.
I like here.Hard to find parking sometime.The environment is so good.They have happyy hOur small plate as well.

This is really a great place to eat and grab a few drinks. I've spent a lot of my time working in the South and this place brought me right back to that time. It was pretty packed which is always a great sign for a business. The atmosphere was beautiful with candles everywhere. The service was friendly and fast. My duck confit was cooked crispy and moist. Oh, and I can't forget the creme brule because it was cooked to perfection. I'm only in town for the next two days, but I might just have to eat here tomorrow again.
delish. loved itdefinitely coming back
Good food great atmosphere and the drinks were made perfectly. What else can you ask for?
Fried chicken is awesome! Definitely recommend everyone to try!!!
Love it here! Maybe one of my favorite restaurant in the city! I go there every time I stop by Seattle! Great drinks. Amazing shrimp and grits and the bacon! And always good service.

I must admit, I've never been here. However, there is a review here posted within a day by someone posing as me that is absolutely false. My account has been active since 2011, the account below was created yesterday. That account and the person behind that account have been reported. PLEASE SUPPORT NEIGHBORHOOD BARS. Next time I'm in Queen Anne, I'm stopping here. See you soon, Toulouse.

Breakfast is not to be missed! Beignets and chickroot coffee are fantastic. My family ate 3 meals in 3 days here and everyone raved about it. It's a must-visit whenever I'm in town on business. Love the cozy booths and knowledgeable servers.
Fantastic food, good drinks, and the service was good even when they were quite busy. Highly recommended restaurant!
Amazing food - Excellent Service! We did happy hour and dinner.  Will definitely - go back!

We stumbled across this restaurant while in Seattle to watch the Warriors game at Key Stadium, the final event there. The food was fabulous. Escargot, Cauliflower soup w/crab, Lamb Sliders, Mussels. All delish, the ambulance is great and the staff is the best. A must do :-D
Great salad! And great service. Such fantastic late night menu. Will be coming here again.

Staff was very nice and friendly and we even had amazing table service as well ad bar service. They seem like they really care, thanks for the great time! Ill be back most definitely i can tell you that!!haha

I'm. Or much of a French toast person, but Toulouse has the absolute best French toast I have ever had in all my 44 years! The service was prompt and courteous. The menu is a perfect balance of unique and traditional. And the decor! I couldn't stop staring at their wall treatment. I need to figure out how they did that!

I like coming here because the food is great, and the staff Are super friendly. But the blonde host girl Tea sure is fabulous. She does so much every time I come she's running around helping her co workers out and going above and beyond anything ive ever seen a host do at other restraunts. Plus she's beautiful and always warm and welcoming to everyone that comes in. She's just great. Keep it up Tea!

This is my favorite restaurant in Seattle, hands down. The servers are so friendly, accommodating, and awesomely personable. I ordered ~5 drinks at once and my server totally understood me and my love for beverages (juice, coffee, cocktail, etc.) The menu is very extensive as you will be bound to find a delicious, favorite dish (or 2)!

This place is the absolute bomb! I came here for the summer and this was one of my very favorite local eating spots! The ambience is amazing, but the manager, Rodney and the bartender Stephan deserve the highest accolades. I have been here three times in three weeks and would suggest that everyone go there. I felt wind and dined and like a princess. The bartender went out of his way so much to make me feel special that I actually went home and picked a fight with my husband because I have never had a man wait on me hand and foot the way he did. LOL! When I ran across the street to the store, I came back and found a beautiful glass of wine, dessert, and a complementary to go bag because he wanted me to try a certain dish that I wanted to order but never did. This hospitality went above and beyond any experience I have ever had in a restaurant and it will definitely keep me coming back for more!
Great food and atmosphere! Love this place!
Great food. Great atmosphere. Would go again~
Decor - 4 StarsService - 5 StarsVariety - 5 StarsFood Quality (Freshness and Flavor) - 5 StarsPortion sizes - 4 StarsValue - 5 StarsOverall Rating - 4.66
Great food, great drinks, and even better happy hour.
One of my all time favorites in town!
One of my favorite restaurants in the area. I often come here for dinner with my girlfriend. The place is clean, the service is fast and, of course, the food is very delicious. Highly recommend!
We love the breakfast happy hour!
Love this place. Never disappoints. Always great food, great drinks, great service. Good atmosphere, what's not to like?
It's time to treat yourself. Throw out your diet because this is so worth it.
Love this restaurant. It is very conveniently located. Best place if you want to go for brunch. Highly recommend it.
Always a treat with great service. Sliders and fried chicken bites, the best.
One of the best in Seattle . Great food
Love this place! great food and drinks!
Love this place! I went on my 21st birthday morning for their breakfast cocktails and they are everything you'd ever hope for.
Was worried when I saw their rating was "needs to improve". However, their food is delish. I suggest a tasting menu.
A Sunday brunch I didn't plan ahead ,no reservation , no problem , seated at great table within 20 minutes the food was great the selection was great , the service was great, definitely will return
Why even write a review? Over 3k! Obviously this place is good. What a money making machine as well as Pesos
Go for the brunch! Or the happy hour or the dinner. Its all amazing.
Amazing brunch I would definitely come here again.
everything here is excellent, but we go here for the cajun food, which is where this restaurant really shines!
Wow yum oh my god great stuff, staff is nice and fast. They have great options and I will def be back!
Great service great food and drinks. They brought us ice cream even after the kitchen was closed :)))
great food! this is my go to place hen i am in town i love the staff the food is great and so is the customer service!
We were a large party of 18. The food arrived together and on time. The service was terrific and food was delicious. We will be back.
Ate there 3 times in a day for the 2 days I was there...worth it! and will always go back.
Pretty cool! Good food for fair prices during happy hour. Long lines though.
I love the place! Excellent dishes very good portions and excellent service! For sure I will come again!
Crazy good
Fantastic breakfast and late night happy hour options!
My previous review was in error.
I've been here a couple of times now and I just have to say "WoW". That's all....just hella WoW.
The wait is worth it! The Beignets are a MUST!
Excellent service. Our waitress Magdelen was amazing. I would come back to this restaurant just for her service. We came from out of town and throughly enjoyed the restaurant.
Best authinic cajaun food in Seattle. Great ;location in the heat of queen anne. you have to get the mud pie desert. Its the best in the country !!!
Great food and fantastic atmosphere.
one of the best restaurants ive had in seattle this is amazing i came with my wife and we tried the traditional chowder and left extreemyl satisfied.
wowowowowowowowowowow this is the best food i have ever had in my life of 27 years i am extremly satisfied and i would like to come back here again and eat all this beautkufl tasty food.

This place is my fave Queen Anne Happy Hour spot. Their happy hour menu is extensive, with the best variety. I always get their cauliflower soup with crab and truffle. If you haven't tried that yet- you are missing out.
Love their happy hour. Good place for some soul food and very unique drinks/menu items that never dissapoint.

I don't even know where to start. The restaurant itself is beautiful, from the space to the music, low lighting and decor to the open lay out. Our server was soft spoken and kind and made several amazing suggestions for their late night menu. Her service was wonderful, timing and her personality were perfect for a great night out. I will definitely be going back. The chorizo mussels and the Serrano margarita were grade A, excellent! Thank you Toulouse Petit!
Service is great. Food is great. Atmosphere is great.I will only go there for brunch though.
Everything lovely and delicious! Close to Seattle Rep. Perfect for before the show!
Great Food, Great atmosphere! Fun to sit at the bar!
I highly recommend the cauliflower soup. It's filled with creaminess, truffle aromatics, and lots of chunck crab meat. I crave that soup!

4.5 so giving it a 5. Great service, very good food at a good price. Got there 5 minutes before the small dish happy hour ended. Waitress helped us order small dishes right away. Everything she recommended was very good. Would definitely go back again.
I'm trying to be objective, but i have nothing but rave reviews for this place. it was gorgeous, for starters. i'm glad we got to dinner early (right after work) it seemed to be filling up fast.
Excellent envrioment and food
Great addition to Seattle. Best happy hours in Seattle. I come here with my friends all the time for happy hours.

I love this place,  My favorite part about Toulouse is they serve breakfast till 3pm. Most people come here because of Food Network. I would recommend the Jambalaya. It's honestly the best thing I've ever eaten. My friends always orders the banana pancake and it's amazing as well. Overall this is a great place to visit.
Our absolute favorite Francais/New Orleans style restaurant in Seattle. If you haven't tried the cauliflower soup-- DO. I dream about it.

We came here as a family for breakfast and the food was really good. My kids had something to find off the menu and ate the whole thing without complaining. I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict and it was delicious!! The potatoes were flavored perfectly and I ate my whole dish! That was probably one of the best brunch's that I have had in a very long time. I would definitely recommend Toulouse Petit and don't be afraid to take the kids because the menu offers a large variety which is great for all ages.
Great food. Good atmosphere and vibe. one of my faves when I go into the city!
Fantastic!!! I only come during breakfast happy hour and have never been unsatisfied.
Don't skip on the brunch.
This restaurant is so good! Had breakfast here and it was fabulous! French press coffee and massive strips of bacon. Definitely recommend this place!
Love meeting here for brunch on the weekends!Good food and friendly service!

Delicious food, went there for lunch today. Had duck terrine, Pork cheeks, Toulouse Beet salad, Talgliatelle w/ mushrooms. Amazing lunch and wonderful service. Coffee from a coffee press, strong and rich. Arnold Palmer w/ just enough lemonade and more tea (not too sweet). Great place, huge awesome menu. Thanks!
The cocktails and happy hour are a must here! It can get pretty rowdy here so I don't recommend it for intimate talks unless you see they're slow.

Amazing. This place is "nicer" than most places I frequent but their happy hours are IMO the best in the city. I have had at least half of the breakfast happy hour menu and would definitely order each thing again. I definitely wish they didn't always try to push me to the bar for breakfast but I will tolerate it for such delicious food.

My boyfriend recommended me this place and now this is one of my favorite place for breakfast or brunch. I just love to come here and hangout with friends on my lazy weekend times. I have tried almost all the things, and believe me, if you are a food lover, you should defiantly give a try to this place. The staff is also very friendly.
Cute resturaunt. Great place to bring a date. Very good soul food. We need more of these in Seattle.
This food at this place is just too good.
Best Breakfast ever!!
This is the most fantastic food in Seattle. We loved it so much we went to dinner and then back for lunch. The service was great and the drinks are fun too.
AAA
love this place
The breakfast was excellent.
I highly recommend brunch here. They get busy so make reservations
The best brunch ever.

So beautiful! Went here for dinner and had the best service I have ever had! They messed up our oder and not only had it fixed before we new they had screwed it up but gave us the mistake entree for free and the waitress bought our cocktails! Always make reservations cause they are super busy! So worth it!
Ordered a grilled chicken burger and a lamb burger, slit with a co worker.... AMAZING!! Plus the fries are fantastic, I will be back!
I love the crab and asparagus scramble!
Absolutely amazing, especially for brunch.
great place, one of the best I had in my travel
Fantastic food. Nothing, really, for the vegan, but they were very willing to do what they could to accommodate. Ended up with a fantastic lunch.

Yum, yum, yum!!! This place is amaze! It has the yummiest food, the ambiance is completely sexy, the service is friendly, all a win! I love to bring dates here because the lighting is dim and the place just has a sexy feel to it. Brunch is cool too. The drinks are pretty good, I usually like it stiffer than they provide but they still get the job done. Parking is a beast however... I say it is worth finding a parking spot even if you have to walk several blocks.
Absolutely love this place !! Everything is yummy & I mean EVERYTHING !! That includes their desserts :)
i've had almost everything on their menu and it has always been fantastic! one of my favorite restaurants to go to with my friends or husband.

I greatly enjoy this place. The food is excellent, the service is very friendly & accommodating, and having been here a few times I've yet to have a dish i didn't enjoy. All of the friends I've had dine with me here greatly enjoyed it as well.
Good Staff. Good food. Great brunch. A short wait to get in but well worth it.
Excellent food, have been here couple of times for brunch, great food great ambience
I've been in here a handful of times, and they had me at shrimp and grits!! Great service and lovely atmosphere!! I highly suggest this place to any foodie or anyone with a taste bud in their mouth!!
Thank you for a Great Breakfast and Service. The food was hot and tasty.
Top notch food and drinks. We live in Tacoma and it's definitely worth the drive.
Add confit garlic to anything, or everything!

My friends and I have been going around town this past summer to different brunch places and this is absolutely our favorite EVER!!!!My roommate and I got there early and where placed on the waiting list while the rest of our group got there. Of course they only seat groups when majority of the group is there so we were bumped a few times which was fine because the hostess was so kind and light hearted about it, making us feel welcomed and not an inconvenience.When we were seated our waitress was very friendly and had very cool, tasteful tattoos that I was very well done; hey weren't tackey. The food came all at once so none of us had to wait for each others orders to arrive which was very impressive seeing that it was very busy and most restaurants will generally serve based on what comes out of the kitchen first. All of it was nice and hot and delicious. I had the Oyster and Bacon Benedict which was perfect. The eggs were poached but still had that delicious running yolk. The oysters where breaded and fried but not cooked all the way through giving it a very ocean-y flavor which I thought added an unique flavor to the entire dish. All the staff was friendly and had a smile on which I know from experience is a very hard thing to do on a Saturday morning during a rush. Definitely coming back here again.

Pork cheek confit, fried chicken po boy, spicy jambalaya- all plates our party LOVED. We went for lunch, right before the rush and the ambiance was great. Service was okay, but I never yearned for a drink so I can't complain. I will definitely be back on our next visit to try new dishes!
wish it wasnt so busy id eat here every day!!!
You can beat this - out favorite breakfast in Seattle!!

This place is a bizarre mixture of bros and tasteful people looking for genuinely good food, all elbowing each other to get on the waiting list first. The food is worth it, if you can handle rubbing elbows with fratboy rejects and their ilk.
g.u.m.b.o....... wow! best ever!
All the dishes we had were great, but the beignets were something special.
Can't put this place into words, except "GO THERE"
This is one of my go to spots for consistently good food and drinks and service!
Great place!
Great happy hours!
Everything I tried was AMAZING

Yowsa - how could I have not given this breakfast five stars?Heaping skillet with eggs, sausage, shrimp and an amazing Cajun gravy. Really delicious, really filling.Very cool decor, very friendly service.And the music is awesome.
Delicious food, excellent atmosphere, perfect dinner
I ordered the lamb sliders. The food was great! Love the setting with the candles and all. Definately Go here for lunch or brunch!

Open your mind and try new dishes, there's nothing that will disappoint. I have been enjoying this restaurant for almost 2 years now and have never had a bad experience. I also love watching sports here as the food is amazing, staff is great and the atmosphere is relaxed with a great vibe.
Awesome, simply awesome.
BEST HH ever! all the food is amazing and the prices are great.
The creme caramel french toast is a must eat! The breakfast happy hour is really fun and the interiors are just not what you would expect from the outside!
Breakfast Happy Hour. Who knew this existed? The Pork Hash is fantastic but the benedict with the veal sauce is pure heaven. French press coffee and Beignets are my favorite Sunday splurge.
Amazing.
I love hot food!
Wonderful food!! It's little bit pricy but worthy.

Food is AMAZING. One of the most diversified and unique menu's. Make a reservation if you plan on going on a weekend dinner otherwise wait isn't too bad. Make room for the beignets and the pressed coffee. Place can be a little dark but the ambiance is nice.
I'm not an expert...but this is the best jumbalaya I've ever had.
Amazing! Wonderful food, delicious food and beautiful atmosphere!
Great breakfast!
We go there at least once a week for great drinks and I pretty much always get the jumbalaya. Spicy and delicious. Once the buzz is on, then we usually head to Pesos to finish it off.
I was at Toulouse about a week ago and I would have to say, hands down the best happy hour in the city. Great food and drinks. Love this place. And the bartender Tyler is fabulous!

I love happy hours as much as Ron Burgundy loves gin and Toulouse Petit has (I don't know if it's self-proclaimed or what) the best happy hour in the nation! I'm inclined to agree. I've been here somewhere between five and ten times for happy hour and we have barely scratched the surface of the happy hour menu! The sides are the best! Everything is less than five bucks! I especially like the corn grits, the haricots verts with bacon (that's green beans) and the Brussels sprouts. We've tried the alligator and found it to be absolutely delicious, and the basics like several varieties of sliders. And let's not forget dessert! White chocolate bread pudding, apple crisp and pear tart. As a fan of biegnets from Cafe du Monde in New Orleans I was afraid to try an obvious impersonator, but Toulouse biegnets are stand-alone outstanding. I love this place!

Beautiful steaks and other items. Great service, and located right around the corner from a great dueling piano bar. These guys know how to do the restaurant business. I think this is one of the greatest restaurants in seattle.
Breakfast happy hour! I could never get bored of the menu. Great staff.
I Love this place! They are nice, and the food is really really good. $7 Happy hour is the best!!!
Yum yum yum. Wish it wasn't in Lower Queen Anne because I'd eat here more.

The food is always good and the manager Joe is so nice. My gf and I went here for dinner and Joe took great care of us getting us into the bar on a busy friday night. Their menu is amazing especially if you like spicy food! Awesome!
Amazing place. Delicious food. Wonderful atmosphere. A must for Seattle.
Awesome! Best brunch in town!
So Good!!!

I had one of my top meals in Seattle at this place on Friday. We ate on the bar side which serves the full menu. Good wine, pretty good service (the place was packed so I'm too critical) and just really awesome food. My lamb ragu was incredible and there are at least three or four other menu items I will go back and try. Great wine selection too. Definitely check this place out.

Went back again for breakfast happy hour. I fell in love all over agin! $6.00 and delish! Best deal in town. All real, fresh ingredients- very important to me. Pork cheek hash was out of this world, and my dining partner had the biscuit and gravy- were fantastic, a sexed up version of the diner classic. Oh-- and daytime drinking- (we were celebrating!) drinks were on special too- the Breakfast Milk Punch & Katie Mae were a wonderful addition to the best Thursday afternoon in my recent memory.

I have never written a review on Yelp before, but I had such a great time here last night I wanted to share it! This was my first time at Toulouse, a friend had asked me to go with her to an event there. Now I realize they don't normally have live music, but they did last night, and it was GREAT. Even better though was the food. My goodness. The best grits I've had in ten years, BBQ prawns, fried green tomatoes, and an AMAZING halibut dish.   Our service was attentive, fast but not rushed (and thats saying something because this place was packed), and the girl running the front door was right on with her menu suggestions!   I will be going back to Toulouse, and often. If you haven't been, you should go see for yourself.
Great cocktails at brunch and biscuits and gravy were great.

I have been several times now, and each time has been great!! The only con I can come up with is parking on Lower Queen Anne, during late night, or weekend brunch. Love the variety of the late night Happy Hour! There are also drink specials now! Hard to find great happy hour food & drink specials!

this place is good.. soo good.. that i have been houding my friends to meet me, just so that we can go here.went 2 weeks back during the happy hour.. was very very very impressed with their happy hour menu.. it was impressive.. large selections of items.. something for everyone.. even my finicky friend.. tried so many dishess.. the small sized is just right for the price $5.. which means you can try out many different dishes if you cant make up your mind which one to eat.. so this is what we hadoysters wrapped on bacon : pretty okCreole Shrimp ( i think) this was terrific... terrific.. this one i am going to have alwayslamb slider : good tooBeef sliders : goodone more shrimp dish.. but all of it was soo good.. even the atmosphere makes for good environment.waiting to go back again :)
I have had consistently great service and great food at this place. I love going here. Great place to stop being so damn uptight and enjoy it.
I tried their breakfast last week , I really like it, the best in queen annThanks

Attended a pre-opening party so can't comment too much on service or cost. But I did get a chance to sample almost all of the dishes and the short review: AWESOME. But before I dive into the food, I should mention the decor. The decor is amazing. All the tables were handmade and inlaid with intricate designs. Each table took at least 12 man hours to construct. All the metal work (lights, bottom of tables, partitions in the bathrooms, etc.) were all done and custom built on site. The plaster on the walls was made with many, many layers and then chipped away to reveal all the colors. Amazing. The man hours spent on this restaurant must have been insane. Now food. When I go to a restaurant to do a sampling like this, I usually have a few I like, maybe 1 or two that I love, and a few that are just so-so. Just about everything I had that night was amazingly good. I loved almost every single dish I tried. The dishes all have a New Orleans/Creole/Cajun flair. I had so many dishes that it's hard for me to remember all the goodness. Pork cheek: amazingly tender and terrific seasoning. Alligator: tastes like chicken. Really. And it's great with the mashed potatoes. Gumbo: had two servings. There were lots more, but just can't recall them off my head at the moment. What I do remember most fondly was the bananas fosters. That made me want to weep for happiness. It might have been the booze that I was drinking all night, but that and the other desserts were all amazing. I really can't wait to go back and get full size portions of their food.One other thing that needs to be mentioned is the bar. The bar area occupies the significant majority of the floor space. The liquor porn that's up on that wall is amazing. There's something like 40+ different vodkas (flavors and brands). Again, since I was at a tasting event I didn't see a menu. I left it up to bartender Miles Thomas (who also works at Tavern Law -- another one of my favorites) to pour me some libations. My favorite drink of the night had some gin and champagne in it. I didn't get to see everything that he poured, but I could drink that all night long.I can't wait for Toulouse to officially open. I'll be there often.

Disappointed Dining ExperienceI recently visited Tilikum Place Cafe and unfortunately, it was not a pleasant experience. The service was slow, and we had to wait nearly an hour for our food to arrive at the table. The extended wait time significantly impacted our overall enjoyment of the evening. The menu was also very limited however the food did taste really good. I hope the restaurant can improve its efficiency to provide a better dining experience for future patrons.
We got there at 9:25 am. 1/3 of the table was empty but they told us that we had to wait 30-40 min. We left. Very disappointed.
Their "famous" dutch babies are tasteless

So many empty tables and we were told it would be a 40 min wait. Ended up taking two hours. There were homeless people everywhere outside made for a very uncomfortable wait. Then the host had the AUDACITY to tell us he only had one table that would be for a reservation later so we would have to eat within an hour after our long wait. Horrible service and overpriced for eggs and toast that are masked by an instagrammable presentation.
Shitty food and shitty service.

Tilikum is an orca whale that was abused at SeaWorld. Why would you name your restaurant off of him? Do you care for innocent creatures? Anyways, tried the food here and hated it. I hated it as much as Tilikum hated his cage.
Sometimes the vibe and attitude of servers is a reflection of the owner. This place is probably the best negative example of this. I feel sorry for the staff.
For my sunday brunch i tried out this place. I ordered fried egg with toast and french toast. The egg was super oily and over fried and my friend didnt like what he ordered either

We were sat immediately when we got there and didn't see a waitress to order drinks for 21 mins. After ordered it took 10 mins to get them. We didn't get our appetizers until 50 mins after we sat down. Appetizers were the best dishes in the house though. Burrata and vegetable tart were amazing. Main courses came 45 mins later and were mediocre. The halibut was over cooked and the meatballs were over taken by the tomato sauce. Less sauce would have been better. The waitress was loud and would engage a table from 3 tables away.Then they started setting up(moving chairs, tables, and just being a distraction while we had dessert.)Overall experience was "how is this place booked out so far for decent food and the worst fine dining wait staff"?
Normally, they tell you that you need to wait a long time for a table but usually it doesn't take long. But after you get seated, service is kind of slow here.
Food was good! Service was great! But I think it was too hyped up.
Perfect way to start a Sunday! Sweet, savory, crispy and fluffy - what more could you ask for?
I didnt like this place much. I know it sounds weird but this place smells weird and i hate it and food was okay nothing too great
Mediocre food with mediocre service.

I wish I had better things to say but this place ... A place I was excited to experience was shockingly poor. First was. .. Service. .. Our lack there of. No ice in the water. ..coffee I ordered never showed up. .. Only saw the waiter when he delivered the bill. Second. ..food. bleck. I ordered the cured salmon scramble. Sounded great.. It was about 2 tablespoons of wet sludge.. my friends asked "is this a joke? " when it was put in the tale. ..Old fashioned garnish consisted of poorly sliced cantaloupe complete with rhind on one side. Lucky for me it was floating in the egg/salmon liquid so was inedible. Did i mention the "salad" aka too old bagged spring mix...so old it "made its own vinaigrette" type leaves. I won't be returning. I wish I could get my money back.
nothing fancy but ok food
Great restaurant to entertain clients. wonderful steaks and some of the best service in town. don't pass up the incredibly delectable lobster bisque. the desserts are as big as the city.
Lovely brunch.

The food here is great. The only problem is that for a place as beautiful as this and for food as good you would expect servers to be more attentive. I've gone here several times and had my water class remain empty or have servers act almost too casual. I like a more casual vibe but I also would like drinks in a timely manner and to take our dessert order, etc.

Tilikum Place Café is an absolute treasure in Seattle, offering a warm and inviting atmosphere paired with exceptional food. Known for its Dutch-inspired menu, this café is a must-visit for brunch enthusiasts or anyone seeking a relaxed yet elevated dining experience.
Always have a least one meal whenever I'm in Seattle. The staff is super friendly and the food is always solid!!!

Amazing German pancake! Only problem was that when we made a reservation, and split the pancake for the two of us. The waitress was obviously upset that we didn't spend alot of money. She repeatedly approached us asking us to order more food. So I reluctantly got a bloody merry. Ruined the whole vibe. But whatever.

Tilikum Place Cafe came highly recommended as a brunch spot during our visit to Seattle, and it certainly lived up to its reputation. Our server was a delight, the interior exuded comfort, and the food was simply scrumptious. The French onion soup was rich in flavor and featured a delightful cheese crust. I decided to try the savory Dutch baby, and it turned out to be an exceptionally delectable choice. I regret not ordering it for myself. The warm mini baguette and the light, delightful profiteroles with vanilla ice cream rounded off the meal perfectly. I'm pleased that we heeded the recommendation and made a reservation at Tilikum Place Cafe.

Amazing food, service, and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good I am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will make this a stop every time I'm in Seattle.

Astonishing. The food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. The service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course, you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffeine you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not regret it.

Good all around. It took us a little while to get seated, reservations are highly recommended. Once we got seated the service was excellent. The food is really good, I don't consider myself a foodie and the menu was a little more foodie than I would like but there was a special lamb bacon omelet that was tasty.

We came here for a local breakfast while staying nearby. We came both days and loved it! The biscuits and gravy are very southern and were our favorites! Best we've had on the west coast! We Would love to visit again. Our server was friendly and served us both days. Great experience!

I'm very foody. With regards to geek I become a food geek and I in a real sense have recorded every one of the unique places that I visit to have my number one dishes added to the rundown too.Service was incredible as well. Mindful and quick Tilikum is amazing!

We ordered takeout since they were booked. We got the savory Dutch babies and the house quiche. It was my first Dutch babies so I didn't know what to expect. I wish we could've gotten more toppings in it. The house quiche was very good, I liked it a lot more than the Dutch babies because of the crust and it had more flavors. My boyfriend liked the Dutch babies more because it's got a strong egg taste. For me, it was a bit too much flour.

This is my go-to spot on late nights after the kid's games. After their games the kids are hangry and tired. So, the fact that they know my kids and make them feel so welcome is great. The food is consistent and tasty and comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I get my favorite drink and we all have a great time. It's really quite a fun spot.
Stop eating something here for a while and it's truly good that I'm not satisfied with the taste, perhaps I'm looking for the taste I want.
Food was pretty good but the wait to be seated and for the food to be out was pretty long ..

Need a booking yet we were fortunate to get in because of a scratch-off. The best eggs Benny!! We likewise had the Dutch infant (stuffed flapjack) which was super filling. An incredible spot for Sunday early lunch!

Great spot for brunch. You have to try their Dutch Babies which they are known for. It takes about 20 min to make so I would advise you to decide before you get there if you want to order it. Then you can tell the server when they take your drink orders, that way it will come out hopefully closer to the time everyone else gets their food. Pro-tip....We had the sweet & savory Dutch Babies and loved both of them. When i was a kid my dad would make dutch babies for Sunday breakfast, and these were just as good as his. This is the second time I've been here & had good experiences both times. Take your friends fo sho.
Awesome place to have brunch!I love their Dutch Babies! The only minus is that you have to make a reservation in advance. But it is totally worth it!

You will need a reservation. This was an extraordinary meal, starting with a very helpful and delightful waitress who had worked at this business for over 8 years. She had terrific suggestions and, surprise, highlighted a chicken dish which was the locals' and her favorite. This was wonderful. We enjoyed a most memorable meal, including home made cookies (!). We out of town boys will return on our next trip to Seattle.
A friend turned me on to this joint, and the pancakes were awesome, this is a neat old-fashioned style, more laid back and relaxing atmosphere, well I'm hooked.
Yummy place for breakfast. Priced right. Service was great. Food was delicious.
I like it but customer service is great
Good food - but the service is lacking. Very much enjoyed the dishes I had here. Wait staff is very lazy, which takes away from an otherwise excellent dining experience.
This place has an amazing brunch menu at affordable prices. There is a wait depending on what you order but it is definitely worth the wait.
This place is awesome. Only thing you should do is put in a reservation for a table.
Highly Enjoyable. Great ambiance and location.

We had the lemon, blueberry and ricotta dutch baby and the sandwich/soup combo. We took the salmon sandwich and the onion soup. Everything was very delicious!! Still dreaming about that soup, it was the best onion soup I've ever had! And the dutch baby was so well balanced, sweet tangy creamy.

Amazing food, service and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good i am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will definitely make this a stop every time im in Seattle.

Really good all around. It took us a little while to get seated, reservations are highly recommended. Once we got seated the service was excellent. The food is really good, I don't consider myself a foodie and the menu was a little more foodie than I would like but there was a special of a lamb bacon omlette that was really tasty.

Amazing food, service and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good i am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will definitely make this a stop every time im in Seattle.
This cozy place brought us amazing experience with food and service. The price is surprisingly cheap for the amount of food we ordered and the great food quality. Will be back!
Not bad place at all I would definitely recommend it if u are looking for unique lunch or dinner
Breakfast menu was delicious, if your going later in the evening then you can enjoy more from their bar.
Great place! Really nice staff, my food was really good. I think the service was really great, my girlfriend was very impressed she told me she was impressed

This is my favorite brunch place in all of Seattle. The wait staff are friendly and the food is amazing. I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. Definitely make a reservation as it is a small place and is usually busy around normal lunch and dinner hours.

Excellent brunch with changing specials. Wonderful combination of flavors with every dish and a very good attention to detail with plating. Fresh squeezed orange juice and Bloody Mary's using what seemed like fresh tomato juice. French press coffee was good, but poor filters kept allowing grounds through. Would definitely go back.
Eggs Benny is always killer, order the dutch baby right away!(It's amazing, but takes a while to cook)
Make a reservation, it's worth it!

Besides the unusual location, this place is a fresh favorite. Such great, fresh and unique foods. My halibut special was astounding and the stew was outstanding! Everything we had was nicely prepared, nicely performed at adequate prices. We sat at the pub and our waiter/bar tender was incredibly careful. We intend to go back shortly.

Food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. Service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffein you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not repent it.

Astonishing. Food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. Service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffein you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not repent it.
I've eaten here three times with two of them being really good, the third just ok.  Might've been an off night. I still recommend it to anyone listening. Interesting plates and good service.
received from owner: "Your 12 ounce glass of fresh squeezed grapefruit juice contained the juice from 5 whole grape fruits."

We shared the chop salad which was excellent. We each had a Dutch baby -- savory for him and sweet for me. We would have rather each had a salad and split the Dutch baby. They didn't have a ton of flavor.

What a great experience! Our waiter was a wonderful guy that spent a good five minutes telling us the specials. He was very sweet and earnest, he wanted us to have a good breakfast. The food was delicious. I had the roast turkey sandwich and my friend had the chocolate dutch baby. The only down side was that my sandwich was cold.Great atmosphere would definitely recommend this place!

I love coming to this place ! All their menu are awesome ! I love how I can seat at the bar and look at all the fresh they prepare! Not only their foods are awesome , their drink are good too! If you are looking for a quite place with great food and drink , this is your place ! I would recommend you try everything on the menu !!!!!
best handmade pasta. not easy to get in for brunch though
Loved the food! You really can't go wrong here!
Good food, a tad more expensive than $$ but the quality and service was great
Went for dinner two nights ago. Very good service. Excellent hand-made pasta.

I went here 3 times. The first time I thought it was fantastic. We have the eggs benedict which was one of the best I've ever had. However the second time we went i was a bit disappointed with the time it took for our food to come out but at least the waitress gave us some free treats to hold us over. However the reason for the 4 stars is b/c the last time I ate here I felt like the food was too heavy and I had quite a stomach ache for hours. Maybe the breakfasts are too rich for me but I do love the staff and the ambiance is so nice.
Great food, nice breakfast as well.
Decent prices and portion sizes. Tasty dinner.
This place was awesome. Good food, cute atmosphere, very friendly waitstaff. Will come again.
Nice food .. need a little bit more quantity.
Great food, great service. Appetizers are delicious.

I have been wanting to stop and eat here for the longest time and finally had a chance the other night. I thought it was wonderful and the wait staff were helpful, nice and not so in our faces.Drinks : We all had different drinks and they were tasty !Appetizers: We had the pasta which we couldn't get enough of with their crunchy bread and butter. We also had their squash blossom's which were out of this world. Dinner : We each ordered something different and everyone enjoyed their meal which seemed to be cooked perfectly. Cookies and home made ice cream , what else can I say other than the place is cute, clean and they make very tasty meals and drinks. I would suggest that everyone try this little hidden gem.

If you're lucky enough to snag a reservation at this gem, you're in for an unforgettable experience. This brunch spot, with its breathtaking view of the Space Needle, perfectly combines delicious food, impeccable service, and a stunning atmosphere.The Dutch baby is a standout--fluffy, golden, and served with the perfect balance of sweetness and richness. It's the kind of dish that lingers in your memory long after the last bite. Every plate that came out looked like it was made with care and attention to detail.Despite being booked out months in advance and buzzing with activity, the service here is stellar. The staff is attentive, friendly, and makes you feel welcome, even amidst the hustle.The view of the Space Needle takes the experience to the next level--whether you're sipping coffee or enjoying a full meal, it's hard to beat the ambiance. Definitely worth planning ahead for this one!

Tilikum Place Restaurant : A Hidden Gem Worth GuardingIf I could keep this place a secret, I would--but Tilikum Place Café in Seattle deserves every bit of praise. After dining in over 40 countries, I can confidently say this might be the best restaurant I've ever been to.The food? Beyond Michelin-worthy. Every bite is crafted with passion, precision, and flavor that left me genuinely stunned. Some standout dishes for me were the hand-cut pasta, baked oysters, and the perfectly grilled lamb rack. For brunch, the eggs benedict and quiche were simply unforgettable--comforting classics elevated to a whole new level.The service was just as exceptional. Christie, my server, made phenomenal recommendations that elevated the entire meal. Her warm, attentive energy made me feel right at home. Lotta, the manager, has created an environment that's inviting, cozy, and effortlessly friendly. It's a place where you feel like you know everyone the moment you step in.And then there's Bo, the bartender--a true rockstar whose charisma and spot-on drink pairings added an extra sparkle to the experience. Ba, the owner, runs this café with a style and presence that every restaurant should aspire to emulate.What truly sets Tilikum Place Café apart is its atmosphere. Not only is the staff amazing, but watching the other customers laugh, converse, and enjoy their meals with the same joy I felt is a testament to the magic of this place.Tilikum Place Café & Restaurant is not just a meal; it's an experience. If you're in Seattle, it's a must-visit. You'll find the best of the city (and maybe the world) right here.
The ambiance is soooo beautiful!! Wonderful service and food was delicious! Definitely coming back. The butternut squash kale salad was BOMB!

I cannot express my adoration for this little brunch nook more. The staff is kind and friendly. We feel like family every time we visit, to a degree I can't recommend more. The food is good and the portions are huge and more than enough to share. The baked beans were amazing and savory Dutch is also very unique.Titikum Place Cafe is a must-visit gem! This was a great way to end our space needle sightseeing!
Super good food + great service!! Love the seasonal and variety in the menu, from week to week. Very cute + picturesque with the decor too.

I cannot express my adoration for this little brunch nook more. The staff are our beloved friends. We feel like family every time we visit, to a degree I can't recommend more. I almost always leave teary eyed from just how wonderfully welcoming they are. Every single one of them are amazing.That's just the service. The food? Phenomenal. They have a rotating menu that is always impeccable, always novel, always delicious. The chefs clearly are a well-oiled machine, because food always comes out quickly and perfectly.If you're visiting, you'll want to have a reservation, and for a good reason. The Tilikum Place Cafe is a reason alone to visit Seattle.
Everything was off the hook. Every bite was brilliant. The staff was amazing. I can't wait to go again

Friendly customer service. Amazing diner that served excellent breakfast meals. The food was cooked perfectly and has amazing food options. I can't tell how excellent the food was and I have lots of favorites food there especially the Baked egg, benedict, and toast. The meals were generous portions for the price and was extremely appetizing. Always enjoyed the food there. Would definitely dine in there again.

I recently tried Tilikum which was recommended to me by a friend and it did not disappoint. Even though I arrived about 10 minutes before my reservation time, I only had to wait for about 5-8 minutes. Looking at the long line of people waiting outside, I was so glad that I made a reservation. The food was incredibly fresh and had some unique and delicious flavor combinations. I also loved the consistently nice decor of the restaurant. The service was fantastic - fast, friendly, and very attentive to my needs. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

Excellent gem and great spot for breakfast food. Absolutely amazig service and friendly staff. She was extremely accomodating, friendly, and constantly to make sure our experience was going smoothly. The food was pleasantly good and they have great portions too. Absolutely satisfying. The Dutch Babies and Baked Eggs were my favorite food there. I highly recommend this place.

Went here for lunch and it was fantastic. The coffee really good. I got the warm bread and jam, the baked eggs, and one of the specials (wild rice cakes). Everything was delicious. Highly recommend! Get there early, they fill up quick any day of the week.

Although Tilikum Place Cafe was not originally on our itinerary, its reputation preceded it and we couldn't help but step in as we strolled towards the Space Needle. This turned out to be one of the most rewarding decisions we made that day!If you're planning a visit, take it from us - make a reservation. We were fortunate that a table became available due to a no-show, but it's clear that this place is popular for a reason.The standout item here has to be the Dutch babies. Available in classic, sweet, and savory varieties, these delightful treats are the restaurant's pièce de résistance. Note that they take 25-35 minutes to prepare, but they're worth every delicious moment of anticipation.Our choice was the savory option, an irresistible combination of pancetta, asparagus, spring garlic, and provolone. Served fresh from the oven, it was an indulgent medley of gooey, cheesy goodness enveloped by perfect dough. A hint of hot sauce, thoughtfully brought to our table without prompting, added just the right zing.Complementing our meal was the French onion soup - a sinfully decadent rendition, amplified with crouton, Gruyere, and bacon, and a distinct red wine flavor that made it one of the best I've ever tasted.What sets Tilikum Place Cafe apart, beyond its incredible food, is the ambiance and staff. The entire team is friendly and the space is warm and inviting, creating a comforting environment akin to dining at home with loved ones.Tilikum Place Cafe is more than a meal, it's a memorable dining experience that resonates long after you've savored the last bite. Highly recommend!
Great times here. We had such a blast can't wait to be back. One good thing in Seattle !

The food was absolutely delicious at a great price! We came as soon as they opened so we were easily able to get seats. I recommend having a reservation just in case though as it gets busy quickly. Just a warning, the sweet Dutch baby will stain your mouth and teeth dark purple from the berries! It's worth it though for the taste.
