Super friendly staff! And the savory dutch baby was delicious!! This is a popular spot, so you should call a day or two in advance to add your name to the cancellation waiting lists
The best brunch place ever. Love the food,  Ambiance and the service is the best ever. You have to try the german pancakes!
Adorable location, friendly service and good food and drink. Would definitely return.
Great food..Great service!!! Make a reservation and do not miss out on a great experience.

Awesome food, super friendly and knowledgeable staff, there was some waiting to get table but rest all went great. I ordered a quiche and blueberry dutch baby pancake. Latte was nice too. Not very spacious but enough for a brunch place in downtown.
We've probably been here five times. We love the food, the wine & the staff. It's a super welcoming place & the food is wonderful. Make sure you make a reservation.
The food was amazing . The service was very good and I received the food very fast .Everything was wonderful! Highly recommend

I've always had great food and service at Tilikum Place Cafe. The employees, especially the girls who are usually at the cash register, have always been exceptionally friendly and respectful, even when there's a huge rush! Let's remember that working in a busy and popular restaurant is not always easy, and we should keep our advice for people just trying to do their job and serve us food to ourselves.The dishes coming out of that kitchen looked amazing. Our food was great and the service was super good as well. Extensive menu and we already tried some of their food. The Baked eggs, Dutch Babies, Eggs Benedict were so great and really delicious. Can't wait to go back. I highly recommended this place. Must try.
The food was absolutely phenomenal and the service was amazing!

I came here with the family and everything was going great. When the manager came and introduced himself for no particular reason. He asked about our experience and we ended up striking a conversation. He even offered to buy us a desert on the house. I love when this happens because it means that management truly cares. I will be coming here more often.

This place is in walking distance of my place. I come here once a week. The food is always fresh and made to order. I have never not had something that wasn't delicious on the menu. The drinks are strong but delicious. If you want somewhere reliable and consistent, this is the place to be.
We love the restaurant so we figured we'd give it a shot. This place was a nice surprise when we were walking around downtown Seattle! The food is very good, and the staff is pretty good.

So far, this is one of the best restaurants I've been to for breakfast. Visited this place recently and it was a great dining experience. The ambiance of the place was really great too. Amazing food and I could still remember the great food I ordered TPC Breakfast Plate was a good meal. It tastes great and very delicious. A good portion at a reasonable price. Great customer service. The staff was so accommodating from the start to the end. I'll be back again for another course of a meal.

I went to Tilikum the other day and was very happy with the experience. It was my first time being in this place and it's my first time having their DUTCH BABIEEEES! It was so good and delicious, I love the savory one and will probably have it again in the near future.
Great food & great service. Wished I lived here so I could go more often. Make this a part of your trip.

Carbohydrate ParadiseWow.... what a wonderful establishment!I can honestly say that there is nothing I do not love about this restaurant. The service, food, and atmosphere was all grade A. I was just walking by and saw the food from the outside and decided to stop in for some breakfast. From the minute I walked in the door I was greeted by a adorable little lady that gave me the best seat in the house (at the bar next to the kitchen) with no wait time. I order the Dutch Baby Savory with no bacon and the French Press Coffee. The coffee was perfect not to strong not hot. And OMG the Dutch was filled with a perfectly cooked broccoli with creamy cheese and super fluffy bread. If you love carbs and a great cup of coffee you have to check this place out.

They serve the one and only onion soup I can not only tolerate but enjoy. It is perfect! Also, they have mastered the green salad. It's eye pleasing and delicious.If you really plan on trying this place out, call and reserve your table in advance! It's gets very crowded very soon. The space is nice, light and airy. Calm and relaxing atmosphere. Great experience.

One of my favorite little spots in Seattle. I love the warm Chicken salad for lunch. Every soup is delicious. Dinner is always perfect, service fantastic and romantic lighting. Convenient place to stop before a show at the key arena, play at the Rep or a PNB performance.

One of my favorite brunch places when I can get a reservation (which can be pretty tough when you are last minute or even a few days before a needed reservation) but when I can get in it's amazing. Always down for a dutch baby in both the sweet and savory version even though it takes longer to make than other meals but worth it. The ingredients that they use here are always fresh and taste amazing!
Older style service, kind of lax. Don't come here if you're trying to cut carbs haha. Everything is REALLY delicious. REALLLLLLY delicious. I loved the soup of the day (fish stew). Would recommend!
Great food and friendly staff. All my food was amazing i loves it all so much. My boyfriend got great food too. We were both super happy and will be back. Mmmmh im just thinking of the food now! Yum
Great local place, the broiled oysters are unbelievable.
Dutch babies are delicious. Make a reservation and all is well. Really delicious food and the specials are to die for.
I've been taking out of town guest to this place for for YEARS! Now I'm the "Out of town guest". It's still ALL THAT!,
Deeeeeelish! There was a wait, but worth it.
Good food. You will come back often.

I got the baked eggs (attempted to ask for just egg whites) but due to recommendation of our server it would be too dry if I did that. The baked eggs were nice n fluffy and it has the meat and veggies right in there. So good! But I have to warn you, the breadcrumbs somehow always kept tickling my throat so be careful and don't breathe it down like I did.
Dutch Baby... Need not say anything else.
Great Soy Latte and almond pastry.
Best homemade ketchup ever. Do recommend making a reservation because it's quite packed!!!

This place is awesome. French press coffee made at your table fresh! Had the purée lentil soup so good. Had a sweet Dutch pancake. Wow so good! And so much food. Enough for 2 to share. We also had the lamb and feta cheese Dutch pancake! Small cozy place. Very very busy we had to make reservation the day before and got there early and waited in line outside before it opened too but well worth it

A good brunch spot. Been around Seattle for a while so I feel like I am taking part of keeping 90's Seattle alive by eating here. Service is good even when it gets a bit cramped up in there. At times the brunch wait can be up to an hour-- but more power to them. Glad many like to go there and eat. Not there fault they are popular...can only seat so many folks at once. I have been treated like family and have become a regular. I like the fry up and the dutch baby.
The best brunch place in Seattle.
The staff were so friendly and eager to talk about menu. The space is very open, great spot to grab happy hour and socialize.

Had Sunday breakfast at Tilikum Place Cafe on a recent trip to Seattle. I would suggest making a reservation because it was completely full. The cafe is very cute and quiet with a great view of the Space Needle from my window seat. The Savory Dutch Baby (the Dutch Baby is reason we came!) was fantastic and absolutely worth the trip. We also has a Pork Belly Benedict special and Baked Eggs with French Press coffee - all fantastic! Great food, service, ambiance and no wait with a reservation. You won't be disappointed.
Make a reservation, the place gets packed.
This is one of the best brunch places in Downtown/Belltown/SLU.
Went for a hot drink and they took extra special care of us with a great beverage and very friendly service. Highly recommended, you will not be disappointed!
Love the eggs. They do the spice right
This place is great. I just moved to Seattle and was checking out new spots this week for lunch. Nice atmosphere. Will be coming back.
Loved the food here so much. Cant wait to go back!
Went there for an anniversary brunch. Amazing food, great Dutch Baby, excellent service. Will definitely return!
Thank you for making my birthday dinner so special. Everything we had was delicious. Thank you :)

This place always has a great menu and is such a cute little spot to sit and people watch out the window. The staff is always knowledgeable about the menu and where the food comes from, and they have a great drink menu in addition to the bartender always making up something fun & new!

I had the BEST brunch here, although it was a very long wait without a reservation (not actually sure if they even do them). The dutch baby was incredible, but I've never had one before so not sure how it stacks up. I recommend trying it, though!
Good place to enjoy Brunch, Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner, always full, better make reservations, long lines/ waits for a table, good customer service, definitely a good treat

Loved this place. Located in a cute neighborhood. The place gets busy but the service is good and the wait is worth it. Arrive early bc it gets packed. I had the bacon, cheese, broccoli skillet concoction (forgot the name, oops) and it was something worth the calories and time. All in all, what a cute breakfast cafe should be.
Absolutely delicious! The staff here is the bomb, I will be back so much more often!
Had a great dinner, awesomeJust had to let peopleTo know it's good to eat hereThe whole experience was awesome
Some of the best food ever, and very pleasant wait staff.

Great little place. They do take reservations, but we walked in and were assigned a table for 1 hour. Great breakfast! Fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade sausage and jam.Came back two years later and still AMAZING!
Wow I, a huge fan this place is amazing I will def be back. The staff is awesome and great people. Wow I just can't stop coming back. Yum

Love this place! The service staff are all lovely people and very efficient. The egg breakfast sandwich was great. The food is not greasy and well served. You can get in and be out within an hour if you are in a rush and the waiters accomodate you and your schedule. Great place.
Excellent food and service, but a little pricey!
Best food in Belltown! Some plates delicate, some plates bold. All are good.

This restaurant deserves your dollar. I've eaten dinner twice, and both meals were excellent. Last night, my wife and I shared both a squash tart and an order of calamari stuffed with chorizo with martinis...then a wonderful bowl of parsnip puree soup. Our main courses were a pork chop and a dish of braised rabbit with spinach and mushroom dumplings...but something went wrong. Somehow, the chef thought we wanted the rabbit loin wrapped with pancetta. When the error was discovered in the kitchen, the dish was sent out gratis, and the correct braised rabblt dish was immediately fired. We enjoyed the rabbit loin... and probably would order it again! A very brief wait provided an interlude, then we enjoyed our (correct) entrees.I tell this story because the test of a restaurant is how it addresses problems, and they did a wonderful job of turning a problem into a delightful experience.The Tilikum Cafe is a wonderful, relaxing bistro, and you ought to try them out!
Dinner service and food is outstanding - everything is made from fresh, seasonal ingredients so items change very so often.
Delicious!! My favorite place to eat when I am in Seattle.: )

Dropped by for brunch with a couple of friends. I had a chance to try everyones food and share some of mines. We had the eggs benedict, their fry up, quiche and dutch babies. All of the food was great. Make sure you have reservations because it gets pretty busy. Enjoy.
Amazing food. This is one place I want to return to again and again. Excellent food, friendly staff and easy parking.
This is a 5 star restaurant. The perfect spot and food is incredible. Food, service is amazing!
Used to come here all the time when I could walk. This place is great!

Sitting at the counter on a damp Seattle evening after 8 miles of sightseeing, hubby and I enjoyed a delicious meal in an inviting setting. Watching the chef work his magic was more exciting than some Cirque shows. Hubby had the chicken soup, which had lovely lime undertones. I had the grilled romaine salad with peaches, which was so good, I'm going to try to recreate it at home. Our main courses were the chicken, which understandably is a signature dish. The crusty skin, the herbs/spices, the juiciness of the meat, the mushroom sauce, all worked to create one of the best chicken dishes either of us have ever had. My pasta with hazelnut would have stood out except for how great the chicken was. We shared their signature dessert, profiteroles, served with vanilla ice cream and a caramel sauce flavored with my fav, cardamom. Hubs & I wish a restaurant like this would open in Las Vegas.
Attentive customer service, tasty food and an overall great experience.
wowowowowowowowowowow this is the best food i have ever had in my life of 27 years i am extremly satisfied and i would like to come back here again and eat all this beautkufl tasty food.
Love this place, the service is as good as the food.
loved it - loved the coffee, loved my breakfast, I had to wait but it was worth waiting for. Service could have been a little better but they were busy
My favorite place for lunch. Chic.Elegant.Timeless.Great food.A truly classic Seattle experience.
Dutch Baby!!! Worth the trip to Seattle.
Great food, not too loud.
Wonderful food and great service.
great food and great people
Had a wonderful steak and the atmosphere was extremely friendly. This is my third visit and will be back.
AWESOME ...... Loving it. Definitely the place to enjoy relaxingLove the REAL ATTITUDE ... Never change
Great food, great staff.

I read all the reviews and decided to give it a try, and my husband and I were not disappointed! We decided to "share" the beet salad, the pasta appetizer, the pork chop and a cheese plate (we selected only one cheese, but it was accompanied by all the amazing fixings.) Wow! The portions were appropriate, but if you're starving, order the pork chop. Every bite was delicious. While we are only visiting for a few days I would definitely return here anytimeA,
Loved everything we ordered there. The most aromatic quiche I have ever had!
So good!great service!
Excellent breakfasts, French press coffee and great service. Be sure to make a reservation.
Amazing brunch. Highly recommended.
love love love love that place, I love this little neighborhood, quite it , romantic, the food is absolute amazing like no other .
Great food and service!

I'm a big chicken when it comes to trying brand-new restaurants. I've got unreasonably high standards, and having been repeatedly disappointed by previous gambles on new places, I now prefer to wait until the reviews come in so I can have at least some assurance that I won't be wasting my money and calories. So my husband really had to twist my arm to get me to go to Tilikum Place Cafe for brunch this morning and, to be honest, the only reason I agreed to go is that I was starving and it's just one block away from our condo. "Be brave!" he said. "Uh-uh." "Cluck cluck cluck!" "Uh-uh." "It's right down the alley, you'll be eating in minutes!" Done!Well chalk one up for hubby. I was encouraged right away when I got what was possibly the best cappuccino of my life, served with a lump of raw sugar and a tiny little shortbread cookie. I felt even more optimistic when we split a tender, house-made orange cream scone. Then I knew everything was going to be okay when we got our main courses. I had a savory Dutch baby with delicata squash and goat cheese, served in the mini-cast iron skillet it was baked in, along with a pitcher of warm maple syrup, and my husband had baked eggs with spinach and bread crumbs. I'm not sure which was better. The eggs were tender and creamy and had those golden crunchy bread crumbs, but the Dutch baby was so light and right on the fence between savory and sweet. We also had a nice little baguette with butter and jam. If you're a quarterback, you're going to want to order more than we did, but for us it was the perfect amount of food, and incredibly our bill (for two people! in Belltown!) came to only $31. Our waitress was charming and attentive, and explained that the owner is also the chef, almost always a good thing in my experience. The food was easily as good as that at, say, Dahlia Lounge or Lola. I can't wait to go back for dinner. I think we're going to wear a groove in the alley between our condo and this place!
One of the worst dining non-experiences I've ever had.
I can't take food to go? Seriously? A tad arrogant me thinks.

Generally great place, delicious food. The waiter was a nice person, however the waitress' behavior was strange. In my opinion, she should not be in a position to support the customer, she shows up in a big place.
The portions were very small, too small for Italian food. So small that we had to go to McDonalds after because we were still hungry.

The food was good but the service made it not worth the trip. We were told it would be a 25-30 minute wait so we got some coffee and came back 20 minutes later and the host told us they already called our name 5 minutes ago so now we have to go all the way to the bottom of the list. It took us an hour just to get a table.

I'm not sure what the hype at List is about. It's crowded 24/7 with types of people who can't hang because they're usually about to head to Amber after getting hammered here.The gnocchi are boring flour balls that gets slathered in 3 sticks of butter with a bit of truffle oil. I wasn't very impressed by them even though everyone waxes poetic. The calamari I had was too chewy and hardly fried that it lacked texture or crisp. With the crowd nonsense, it takes a long time before your food is ready.The only thing they have going on is their HH wine selection.

(Google Media) It's a really great environment. Spicy Meatballs are delicious! If your home drinks menu includes one, it's second to none. Water is second to last(originalThe atmosphere of this place is good. Spicy Meatballs Delicious! If your home drinks menu includes one, it's second to none. Water is second to last.
Just okay. The truffle gnocchi was delectable and the happy hour specials were pretty impressive--but everything else ranged from 'meh' to 'fine.'

Our visit was not successful. I ended up drinking soft foods for over a week due to a broken tooth at this restaurant. The local manager was fine but the senior management had an uncaring attitude could not be flexible to my situation. I found this to be very unfortunate and the worst form of customer relation. My case did not require anything out of ordinary since it only required the chefs to make a customized meal for me. The facts here were that I could either be asked to pay an extra cost or be advised on the other best alternatives. I tried to suggest this to the management and this is where I realized that the middle level management was accommodative of my suggestions, however they could not be able to make a decision without the top management. The unfortunate bit is that the top management felt that since it was a case involving one person it was insignificant. The management should seriously consider better ways of dealing with customers who require special services.

This place is certainly a good value because of the half priced happy hour specials, but the food is just OK. The wait is usually long, and the experience is not really worth waiting for. Service is very efficient and sweet, and the dishes are served rapidly to keep the tables turning quickly.
The food is good but service not so much. We had to keep flagging down our waiter to get his attention.
It's good for happy hour
Most of their food is above average. BUT, YOU MUST TRY THEIR DESSERT! That is the only reason that I keep going back.
Tight little space but atmosphere was great. Food was delicious. Come early if you want a seat or a table. Expect to wait.

This place is a gem! Delicious food, a wonderful atmosphere, and perfect service make it a great spot. The place is nice and clean, enhancing the overall experience.The meal was fantastic, with very good service. The server was attentive and friendly throughout, providing excellent service. The Spicy Meatballs, Grilled Caesar Salad, and Lava Cake were all worth it. A culinary experience that was truly delightful in every way!

Came on a Monday for all day happy hour, great way to try the place for the first time since it's half price during happy hour.Good food, good service and I think the price is reasonable for what you are getting. The place is a bit dark though and the bartender is also the waiter.That's why it can be a little slow sometimes. But he is really friendly, efficient and attentive. Food was fantastic especially the truffle gnocchi. We also tried the salmon and meatballs, it was alright.

The food at List was definitely the highlight of our experience. The menu had a nice variety of dishes to choose from and everything we ordered was well prepared and delicious. However, the reason we went to List was for happy hour and unfortunately, the ambiance wasn't quite suited for it. The lighting was quite dim and the space felt a bit cramped, especially since we were a large group of 13 people. Not the convivial milieu we were expecting.Despite this, the servers were fantastic and really did their best to make us feel comfortable. They were very accommodating and attentive to our needs, even going so far as to gift us a complimentary bottle of wine. We appreciated their efforts and thought it was a really nice touch.Overall, I would recommend List to anyone who enjoys good food in a cozy atmosphere. However, I would caution against bringing a large group for happy hour as the space might be a bit cramped. That said, I would definitely come back to List if I was in the area, but perhaps with just one or two other people.

Upon arriving at "List," I was struck by the intimacy of the establishment, and I must admit that the bar area felt a bit cramped. However, the modern and trendy ambiance more than made up for any minor discomfort. The subdued red lighting created an air of sophistication and elegance, and the overall vibe was one of conviviality and warmth.Once seated, I ordered the rigatoni, which was a heavenly combination of creamy sauce and tantalizing spices. The dish was presented with an artistic flair that belied the skill and creativity of the chef.Next, I decided to sample the bacon-wrapped prawns, which were both intriguing and tasty. The combination of the smoky bacon and the succulent prawns was a flavor explosion in my mouth, and while the bacon may have slightly overpowered the prawns, the dish was nonetheless a unique and enjoyable experience.To accompany my meal, I ordered a red blend wine, which was simple and elegant, with subtle notes of fruit and spice that perfectly complemented the flavors of my entrees.In conclusion, despite the small and slightly crowded nature of the establishment, "List" is a must-visit for any discerning foodie. The modern and trendy ambiance, combined with the exceptional culinary creations and attentive service, makes this a dining experience that is not to be missed.

I've always came in here for dinner, but I decided to come in here for lunch one day. Boy was I surprised. The lunch items were surprisingly much different than the dinner selections but there were also a few from the dinner menu. The selection was great in terms of different combinations. The portions were a bit smaller but all in all the food was great.
really good food, and the aesthetic inside is phenomenal!

My wife loves to dine at List, we've been there several times and have never been disappointed us. The service was great, the food was always good and the inside looks intimate. Must try their Chilean sea bass, it was great, tasted so delicious, my favourite on the menu. My wife enjoyed eating their octopus salad, she loves the flavour. The tables were full packed but it doesn't feel crowded. I like how organized the area was. Overall, we had a great time in this place. Better to check it out.

We've been there twice and the food is still on point as well as the drinks. My girlfriend craving for seafood so we ordered bacon wrapped prawns, grilled Chilean and octopus salad with a bottle of wine; it was delicious, we honestly enjoyed it.The place used to be my girlfriends favorite, coz literally, she loves pink and I was black. The good thing is this place matched up. Love the ambiance, the customer kept coming to this place, it became quite popular now.

It is a cute little place with it's perks.If you manage to find parking somewhere near, you are having a good day. Because it's so small a place it gets crowded pretty quickly, especially during their happy hours which start from 4:30. Everything on menu is half price, which, I guess, is great. But I personally prefer a dining experience not involving wait and noise.Now, once you're in you will want to start with a cocktail. I really suggest you sticking with cocktails, because I never had a good wine here. It is cheap, but because it's cheap, it's whatever. The cocktails, on the other hand are elaborated and good.Food is very tasty! I honestly suggest you try everything. Don't have favorites, but all is good.
Fantastic prawn dishes... Wine for 2 is perfect. Happy Hour as well

Cold, but very dark restaurant. It has an eclectic variety of dishes, among which Mediterranean cuisine. Most dishes are done pretty well. There is no reservation, and food comes when it is ready, and not immediately.

One of my favorite places for good eats! Seriously, this place doesn't have a bad thing on the menu and I have tried almost everything. The gnocchi in truffle cream is heavenly and one of the many reasons why I come back,along with great cocktails!
Food was delicious. Happy Hour specials were great. Staff was extremely friendly. Will definitely go back when I'm in town.
It's is a nice spot to have some coffee and relax reading a book. On the other hand the quality of food leaves a bit to be desired. Other cafes in area offer better quality of food.
I found that the prices are quite high with any other party, this restaurant can't be cheap. Everything was very tasty.

tried this place last night and it was delicious!!! i had their calamari which was on point and also their desserts are pretty good as well. i will be coming back to this place a lot more now that i have discovered it and also good place to take a date.

The food was excellent and very well priced. Even without the happy hour deals the dishes range from 8 - 14 dollars; which are fantastic costs for this particular market. I 'd the happy hour wine and loved it very much. Happy hour costs stone! The staff is extremely friendly, particularly the owner Leo. We had an excellent time there, eating yummy food, drinking great wine and chatting up w/other patrons and staff. I 'll definetly go back and highly recommend it.
Great food. Great taste! I'm giving it 4 stars bc they are always busy and it can get a bit crowded. And the wait times are a bit long. But just means they must be doing something right.
This place has an amazing happy hour. The food is SO good, great service, great atmosphere.I'LL BE BACK.

Great prices and friendly wait staff. The food is hit and miss. We ordered calamari, seared tuna, burger, bacon prawns and mussels. The seared tuna had no seasoning on it, not even salt/pepper. Mussels were okay. Bacon prawns sat upon a kale salad that was so spicy I couldn't taste the kale. Calamari was good, nice seasoning and crispy. Burger and fries were your standard fare. We'll be back because the pricing is affordable but we'll see about what we order next time.

Sunday was half off day! Tried the gnocchi, mussels in a spicy tomato sauce, sea bass, and bacon wrapped prawns. The mussels were my favorite- so tender and juicy without a speck of sand. The prawns were a little disappointing, kind of overcooked. Service was great and friendly. Wait was around thirty minutes without reservations. Very young and hipster hangout. Bar area looked cool- the table was lit up with red lighting.
Great menu and very attentive and knowledgeable staff. I will definitely return here!
One of my FAVORITE HH menus in Seattle!
Good happy hour, good food, ok price, kind of loud though
Cool little hip lounge with cool little hip food served by cool little hip waitresses on cool little hip plates. The 2nd best octopus salad in Seattle.
This place is so cute and intimate. Went there for the first time last night with my boyfriend. The seared ahi tuna was to die for and the service was friendly and quick. Def going back soon.
Simply and completely unacceptable that something this good, does not exist in a cookbook. Ring me up I'm going home to dream with my happy soul.
Simply and completely unacceptable that something this good, does not exist in a cookbook. Ring me up I'm going home to dream with my happy soul.
Excellent food and service ! Cute little spot ! Been a couple times and will be back .

H     H    H    HHHH HHHH  H   HH     H  H H   H   H H   H   H HHHHHH  HHH  HHHH  HHHH    HH    H  H   H  H      H        HH    H H    H H      H        HH     H  HHHH   H   H  HHHH    H     H  H   H  H   H  H   H   HHHHH  H   H  H   H  HHH   H    H  H    H  H   H  H  H       H    H  HHHH   HHHH  H   HEven before you get to Seattle, you'll notice how expensive everything is starting with your search for a hotel. Thankfully List has an amazing Happy Hour with ridiculously cheap prices for exquisite eats...all food is half price!!!3:00-5:00pm AND 9:00-11:00pm, which we attended the later for a late dinner. Night time the interior is modern and chic with a red glow...though a bit too dark for my tastes. Thursday night the friendly staff quickly seated us, but I imagine Friday or Saturday this place will be crowded.$6 Glass of house red wine...can't beat that price!$10 HH Price...Handmade Gnocchi with black truffle cream...yum! $10 HH Price...Local fresh clams, herbed white wine broth...yum!$10 HH Price Columbia River steelhead(salmon), spicy cilantro pesto...yum! And this way better and bigger than the $32 salmon dinner I had a Lola!The food came out quickly which was amazing given the exceptional quality. Service was almost perfect until the very end of our meal. I know there is a labor shortage, so the bartender was helping bus for the one lone waitress. While clearing our table, she accidently splashed a bit of clam broth on my wife...opps! She gave a verbal apology. We didn't press the issue since everything was already so cheap, but it was bummer to end the evening...otherwise this place is great, and the BEST Happy Hour in Seattle!
One of the best happy hours in the area! Super fast service & perfect portion sizes to try everything... and yes, we tried one of almost everything!
Great prices for happy hour, my friends and I got our food quickly and it was all delicious and quick!
Great experience we loved this place. We went here late at night with six people they accommodated us everything was great food was great experience was great.
this is a hidden gem. great food, good vibe
Amazing happy hour and the food is sooo good!! The bartenders are great too!
Went for happy hour and got most items on the menu. More than happy with all of them.
This place has such a good happy hour and the food is yummy
The service is excellent. He keeps coming back to check our meal is okay. The truffle gnocchi is my favorite. I am satisfied with the dining experience.
The Pizzarosa was TO DIE FOR!!! I can't believe I found this place after recently moving from Seattle City!!! Thanks, guys!!!

This is my favorite Restaurant! The food is YUMMY super delicious, creamy and thick alfredo sauce. And the service is amazing!! The waiter/waitress does not forget about you. It is loud and fun place to hang out and eat!! IM A FAN YOU TOO!

I do not like spicy food at all, so I am always cautious when I go outside my comfort zone of restaurants I venture too. But the waitress reassured me that there were some great options on the menu and then proceeded to suggest some. The dish I ordered was very tasty the seasoning was great and not too spicy. If you like spicy or don't like spicy, this is a great place.
Nice food great taste so satisfying, I like this place, I'm sure I'll come back here again! It's highly recommended!
I 'm going to the best meal in this town. Ok, I liked the service. It's so informative and enjoyable. Definitely come back. I don't have any concerns at all. It's kind of cool
Great food and great ambiance!
Just go to the happy hour, order everything on the menu, get a bottle of wine and thank me later.
I love their Grilled Chilean bass. Super amazing, and the people are nice too. I would go back when I can. :)
The Ambiance, The food, the location! All legit!! The house music was more than legit!!

We absolutely loved this place. Small, cool atmosphere, and awesome small plates, seems that even the pickiest of eaters can find something here. The octopus salad and chicken with mushrooms were our favorite dishes. The beef tenderloin was awesome too, however it was served as a large piece and I wish it was cut. And the dessert was awesome. The hazelnut ice cream was incredible. Our server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Great food and an even greater value!
Wonderful location in Beltown

What a wonderful place to end the day. Went here on a Friday night.The food was amazing. The octopus salad was out of this world. I also recommend the amazing gnocchi.Our server was very pleasant, and our glass never got empty.We would eat here again.
amazing gnocchi! great atmosphere too.
Excellent drinks and food. Staff is super helpful! Will definitely be back again before returning home. Loved the drinks ambiance and decor

My gf and I were in Seattle for the first time this week from SoCal, and we stumbled across the place while walking exploring the city. The food was amazing! We went last Sunday night and didn't know that it was happy hour, which was a pleasant bonus. Literally everything we ordered was great, I wish this place was in my neighborhood. The gnocchi, sea bass, and the octopus salad were delicious. Great service,food, and even the bathrooms were dope. If I lived in Seattle, I would go here every week!
List is by far one of my favorites in Belltown!

This place is PERFECT for happy hour. The ambiance is dark only lit by candles during the night with music playing in the background. Their menu items are half off during happy hour. Trust me you will not be disappointed. We left on a full stomach we could barely finish our food we ordered so much because of the pricing being incredible. We also just wanted to try a little bit of everything. They serve Macrina bread which if you've never tried, is absolutely incredible. The flatbread is a must try. Thick and delicious. The clams are also served with a tasty broth that makes an incredible combination. Their desert cake is a MUST. warning it is very rich. Overall if pick this place again for good happy hour food.

This place is PERFECT for happy hour. The ambiance is dark only lit by candles during the night with music playing in the background. Their menu items are half off during happy hour. Trust me you will not be disappointed. We left on a full stomach we could barely finish our food we ordered so much because of the pricing being incredible. We also just wanted to try a little bit of everything. They serve Macrina bread which if you've never tried, is absolutely incredible. The flatbread is a must try. Thick and delicious. The clams are also served with a tasty broth that makes an incredible combination. Their desert cake is a MUST. warning it is very rich. Overall if pick this place again for good happy hour food.
Really popular, long waits. But definitely worth it! I've been here a couple times with my friends. I absolutely love the shrimp. Do die for. I used Instapark, no regrets.
Best happy hour, best service, great buzz, just go there.

This is my favorite restaurant I really like the place they giving very good service and fast the fish was good and dessert was absolutely perfect I definitely would come back again and I recommend this place to everyone
HAPPY HOUR is AMAZING!Got 2 entrees and dessert for 30 dollars

Absolutely delicious Italian! The food here is so good; no wonder it was so crowded on a Saturday. Although the menu seems a little unapproachable if you aren't accustomed to Italian cuisine, everything I had here had phenomenal flavor, and the service is very attentive. It's a little loud but nothing overwhelming.
Great food and good service. This is always a favorite with friends or people visiting from out of town. The variety allows for everyone to find something they love.
Best restaurant meal we've had in years. Reasonable prices and delicious food
Delicious food and wine. Went during happy hour and it was surprisingly affordable. The grilled octopus salad and cannelloni were awesome!

A friend and I tried List for the first time yesterday and were very satisfied with our experience there. The food was fantastic and very well priced. Even without the happy hour deals the dishes range from 8 - 14 dollars; which are great prices for this economy. I had the happy hour wine and enjoyed it very much. Happy hour prices rock! The staff is very friendly, especially the owner Leo. We had a great time there, eating delicious food, drinking good wine and chatting up w/other patrons and staff. I will definetly go back and highly recommend it.
It's pretty small; you'll have to be lucky to not wait for at least 10 minutes, but the food is worth it.
Amazing food, prices and staff! I would definitely recommend checking this place out!
I'm very satisfied with my natural beef shoulder tenderloin steak. It was perfectly grilled to medium rare and served with fries.List would be definitely on top of my list :)
Perfect joint for a date. Make sure to get the gnocchi.
great price for happy hour dishes!
Highly recommend all tapas and house wines. Tapas we're 1/2 price on Sunday and mondays
Great atmosphere, great service, food and drinks are awesome. We enjoyed our time here!

Ambient red lighting on the bar, definitely sets the mood for the place. One of the best happy hours I have ever been too, amazing deals on them. Regular pricing can be a bit high (which is why it is reserved for the weekends). I highly recommend coming here on a weekday, save a few bucks and enjoy a variety of tapas plates!
Awesome! Under $40 for my boyfriend and I on Monday! Three plates, beer and wine! :)
Really love this place.
Food is fresh and delicious. Why order just one thing when you order a little of everything during happy hour--Love half price appetizers!
Best happy hour in Seattle!

Best little date place around.. The lighting is fabulous and the food is outstanding. Great happy hour on food and drinks. We come to this place once every few months.I come for the gnocci, it's so popular sometimes they sale out, but I'm still gonna give them a 5. I love the staff, alwasys good service and I've been here 20 times or more.
Happy hour is awesome.List has great options.
Amazing happy hour!! Some of the best gnocchi I've had in the States.

i've been to this place many times and i absolutely love it. great customer service and many different food options. although its quiet a drive for me from kirkland but me and my husband take a trip down there every once in a while. this place was recommended to by my best friends and i would recommend this to all of your as well. A+++

When I sit down at List, I get this sense that whenever Ikea starts feeling insecure about the reputation of their quality, they'll compensate by sticking their crap inside restaurants that serve good food. So that if ever I purchase white, plastic chairs sturdy enough to brave a Bangladeshi child and gaudy, red, plastic-looking chandeliers for my home, it'll feel like I am eating at List. I guess the more I sit on that thought, I wouldn't be totally against it. I used to be anti-tapas, just because I always viewed them as calorie-ridden appetizers you eat before you indulge in a Five Guys Bacon Cheeseburger. List has changed my mind; tapas are a novel idea. Given the flavors in every dish, it's surprisingly filling and at a great price, too. All of the food here is prepared extremely well but the main stars for me go to the Spicy Meatballs, Chilean Sea Bass, and the Bacon-wrapped Prawns. Don't put me in the same room with those things at the same time; otherwise, what will ensue is a chapter of deleted expletives.The Chilean Sea Bass is an essential fatty acid heaven on top of kale and farro. Whatever sauce they use with which to cook the farro is something I don't want to figure out but I will forego any diet to have more of this dish. The Spicy Meatballs are perfect and there are no adjectives I can use that will make it sound any less inappropriate. Something along the lines of tender, well-seasoned, and has a great sauce. I could cradle them against my bosom and read poetry to them as I tuck them into bed at night. The Bacon-wrapped Prawns is self-explanatory. Like the Bible, you just pick it up and you know where the night's going. The gnocchi and the mushroom soup deserve an honorable mention, as well. Although I am not sure I can say the gnocchi is a must-have being that it's not unique to List and it's not that satisfying because you will definitely need to order something else to complement the dish. It's worth ordering a bottle of wine during happy hour. When you polish off half the bottle in under an hour, you'll get to stumble out of the restaurant like an idiot as I do on occasion.I enjoy their limited menu because it makes it easier on me. I feel like having or being given too many choices is more suited for children under the age of 10. Also with a limited menu, it makes it a no-brainer for the chefs in the back so you get your food quickly but also with an emphasis on consistency. I've been here twice and have had about six or seven different items, all of which have been a hit thus far. It's also a bonus when you're with somebody who knows what they're talking about, as well. This is a touchy-feely, close quarters type of restaurant. When you're there, particularly the bar area, it can start feeling as if you're on a date with everybody sitting there. The music is loud and then the people respond to that by being loud. Small prices to pay for a great meal whether or not it's happy hour.

I've been several times, and have yet to be disapponted by any aspect of the experience - the food has never been anything less than excellent, it's run by an Itallian family, who, it seems to me, love running a restaurant, making the service great (stop by once or so weekly and they'll actually remember your name), and it's never overcrowded or noisy, though reservations wouldn't be a bad idea. That said, it's not cheap, but you won't wind up paying $15-20 for an entree if you choose by price. It's one of my favorite local restaurants, if not my absolue top, and, having lived here my entire life, that might be saying something...I rated List 5 accross the board, simply put, because it is.
A bit on the louder side, but impressive food
These brothers dominate the restaurant business. So grateful they brought the Modern World Dining Experience to Seattle.
Amazing food! This is definately a must try!!
Love tapas, but the selection is rather limited in the Seattle area. This is the best place I've tried so far. I will be back.
We went to happy hour and found terrific food for very little cost. I can hardly wait to go back and I plan to tell all my friends. Great Place!

This is my favorite happy hour in all of Seattle! My boyfriend and I have been several times and are totally blown away by the ambiance, the courteous service, and amazing drinks and food. All day Sunday Happy Hour - So great! Chic and casual at the same time. Just found out they have a sister restaurant... so excited to check them out too! Order the gnocchi!
Have held business meetings here. I really like it!

This is by far the most satisfying happy hour place in WA. Their food is delicious, savory, and of high quality.Bacon wrapped florida prawns: Large prawns with bacon on top on bed of beans and kale. Everything about it was great. Highly recommend this one.Mussels: Soft and saucy. The mussels are cooked perfectly and the marinera-like sauce was great for dipping in.Grilled octopus salad: A must have! The octopus is so tender, I can't believe it was octopus! The salad is very citrusy, which I loved. It had quite the kick. Highly recommend this one, too, especially since this is hard to find elsewhere.Gnocchi: The little gnocchis were good, but what makes this dish great was the sauce! The black truffle sauce was very yummy. You'll want to lick the plate at the end.Desert: Ah, I tried just because it was the only dessert they had. I would skip it next time. Nothing too exciting about it. Very small, too. Overall, I do love this place. Great, simple dishes with bold flavors and great presentation.
We just had dinner at List- warm service, fabulous food and amazing wine! Our Server Jackie was just an absolute doll! Highly recommended this darling gem!
Awesome food! And a great happy hour! The staff is very friendly and wonderful people
Can not wait to go back! Great service, absolutely delicious food!
Good food this place is a gem I really like coming here on dates
Go during happy hour and a lot of the items on the menu are half off, both food and drink!
Great Service, Great Food. Will go back for sure.
This is my happy hour joint, git yer own.
Amazing happy hour!!!

My wife and i decided to give it a try while wandering downt the street and found ourselves beyond pleased!The happy hour is unbeatable. We ordered grilled seabass and roasted duck (each $6 / $7) and found ourselves amazed by the portions and used our bread to mop the plate. Ontop of this, our server was incredibly sweet and helpful.We found out (only after our meal!) that it is under the same ownership as both Barolo and Mama Melinas, which we also love.This is a must try! Particularly the happy hour!

a few friends and i stumbled upon this place for happy hour. it is amazing. the happy hour is from 4-630 and late nights on weeknights from 10-12. the food menu says that it is small plates but the dishes are anything but small. you can definately have a great meal for a reasonable price. italian flare. we got a wonderful bottle of wine for $14 and had a nice evening at this place. the atmosphere is fun with funky chandielers and a red bar. great quality and atmosphere for a cheap price. our server was friendly and took good care of us. it was pretty empty when we were there but when people find out about it its going to be packed. check it out...
Seriously meet the moon? I spend $15+ on a grilled cheese with tomato soup and fries and this is how many fries you provide? Terrible service... sandwich and soup seem fine.

We went in on Sunday the 24th at 1:30. They forgot to teach the service part of the service charge to their employees. The little Asian chick with the print romper was terrible! She sat people way out of order and, didn't apologize didn't seat us promptly and said "yeah I've got bigger tables to seat". She needs some training, or they need to hire an actual host.
The place is nice, the food is underwhelming, but fine. Parking is a bitch, and the clientele here are me-firster Seattle trash and entitled tourist scum. I will probably never be back.
The food is nothing wrong but tastes really so-so. Also over priced... Not a fan of it.
The food and drinks were good, but the portions were a bit smaller than expected. We enjoyed all that we ate and drank .
I only give it a 4 because the service was slow. Never came to ask if we needed anything. Food came out before mimosas. But the food was fantastic!
Awesome for brunch/dinner, the service and food is always incredible and definitely save room for a cinnamon roll!
Great service, very tasty food, we'll be back
food was great! we loved all our dishes. they were great accommodating our pup too!!!

Breakfast meal. The ambiance and decor were excellent. Low noise volume. Good selection of coffee, espresso, etc., and coffee was good.Food is rated a few points below/lower than another popular breakfast place and prices were a few dollars lower. Meet the Moon has a nice feature...large outside covered patio. I will try their lunch menu when the climate permits outside eating!

Awesome service! Yummy food! Super flavorful, with tons of options. They accommodate many food restrictions (Vegan, Vegetarian, Allergies)!! Have a full bar, with very innovative mimosa options! We left very satisfied.The service was good too which is rare these days. The interior is cute and clean too so I'd definitely return.

Huge quantities, warm service, and outstanding cuisine! Everything about the waffle breakfast sandwich combo! Also present are the grits! After tasting this delectable homemade food, I will never look at chain restaurant breakfast the same way!

You are erring if you choose to go elsewhere. The flavor of the espresso is fantastic, to start. The latte had been expertly made. The eggs Benedict were wonderful and comfortingly creamy. And there are a ton more options available. Excellent dining experience at a diner. Absolutely among my top 10.
The food was delicious, it was hard to decide what to order. We will for sure be back.

The cost and quantity sizes at this restaurant are excellent. The food is excellent and delicious. Every member of your group will be bale to select something from the extensive menu to suit their particular palate. The price is undoubtedly affordable. The Carne Asada Skillet and Avocado Toast were both excellent.The place is well-liked. Overall it is a good place to eat good food. I highly recommend it to all.

We had a wonderful brunch here. I had the farmhouse bloody mary and breakfast tacos with carne asada. My wife had a grapefruit bellini and a breakfast sandwich with chicken sausage. All the food was delicious. The service was a little slow due to how busy it was but our waiter Michael was fantastic.
Great food! Excellent service Worth the stop!

This restaurant is one of the excellent restaurant. Of all restaurants, I know I prefer it most. I will always get an opportunity to stop here. Whenever I feel like having a superb meal, this restaurant comes straightaway to my mind. Love the french toast, veggie Scramble, and Carne Asada Skillet. Great breakfast meals and options are pretty amazing. Great and food and a rich menu, courteous team, and great mood.

I love this spot in Leschi. It is right on the lake, and it a great spot for brunch or coffee. They have a nice little patio that is open in the summer, and the garage doors open up to make the entire spot feel bright and breezy. There is a great bar as well and the food is fantastic. I love the service here. They remember you, and even remember favorite drinks etc. This is the perfect spot for locals. Highly recommend the scones, or biscuits and gravy with fried chicken! If you are in the mood for a cocktail, the big negroni is perfect.
Delicious Wonderful service  Very flavorful food Love this spot , highly recommended

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner tonight. You could tell it was understaffed as there were only three waitresses, one of which working as the host, but everything was great and pretty speedy. Super romantic and all the food was delicious.
This is probably my favorite place for breakfast; I went with a big group and everything we ordered was so good. It's a small place but it's worth the wait. Clean and friendly service.

This charming restaurant called Meet the Moon is right by the water and is an all day eatery. Brunch/lunch stops at 4:00pm. Literally everything on the menu sounded phenomenal but I ended up going with their Salmon Corn Chowder, Carne Awadallah skillet and Biscuits & Gravy! BUT it wasn't just any gravy - it was mushroom gravy with two poached eggs. So with ordering 3 things we didn't have any room for dessert which is a pity because they're cinnamon rolls looked BOMB. Make sure you save some room for dessert (I know I will next time I'm there)! But I highly recommend the 3 above dishes I was more than happy to indulge in On the drinks side, if you're a cold brew fan you HAVE to try the cold brew tonic. It's supposed to be a "hit or miss" but me personally thought it was amazing! Our server even gave us free pastries after the meal. Highly recommend this spot IG @stephaniejltan For more foodie adventures
Amazing burger. Got the special fried chicken tacos. And the drinks are amazing. The staff was amazing. Great music.
Cute little place, we were sat by the window, breakfast options were great and the wait staff were friendly and helpful. Perfect spot for brunch and parking was easy.
This place was excellent. The wait is most definitely worth it. Go here and check it out.
Love it! All good food, drinks, and service. Been here a few times and it never disappoints.

I love this place. I have only been here once, but it's so good. Also, I didn't realize they were owned by the same group as Lot 3 and Purple. The breakfast is unique, it looks like a small family owned shop. So good!
overrated
Worst place I have ever visited.
The food is horrible.
Very slow service, the staff has horrible attitude - very rude

I had one of my worst exeperinces eating out when I visited this restaurant a few weeks ago. It wasn't the food, the food was good. Overpriced, but good. It wasn't our waiter, he was great. It was the hostess and even more the bartender/manager. The hostess was rude and insulted us when we pointed out that several parties had been seated out of turn ahead of us. But the manager/bartender is a complete horror show. Her name is A. Wallace and she's the bartender with a lot of tattoos. She was obnoxious, rude and belittled us in front of the restaurant for "having a bad attitude". Apparantly we were supposed to be happy about sitting around for nearly 2 hours waiting to be seated while we watched party after party who came after us be seated. We were supposed to be honored to have the hostess be snobby and insult us when we asked to be seated. This whole experience would have been different had the hostess just apologized for her error rather than get defensive, or if the manager had not inexplicably confronted us. She was just awful and should not be working with people in any capacity. If/when this restaruant fails, the owners can easily point to her as a big reasons why.

This resturant has some very serious service issues backed up by a very strong air of snobbery. As long as there are no issues that you bring up, you should enjoy your meal or you could end up with a terrible event like we did.I went to the Walrus and the Carpenter with family...party of 4. We had some delays in getting a seat due to an error made by the hostess. That error caused several other parties to get seated before us. When this error was brought up, the hostess quickly became very defensive informing us we "don't know the science of the restaurant business". After a few more words were said back and forth, the hostess offered to cover the first round of drinks. When we were seated, 2 glasses of Champagne where oddly placed on our table by the hostess with no interaction at all. We didn't order Champagne, and there were 4 people at our table not 2. If this was supposed to be our first round of drinks it made no sense at all. Our dinner itself was great. Our server was wonderful and the food was delicious. When the bill was brought...by the manager oddly enough...we noticed we were charged for all the drinks we ordered. We mentioned to her the issue with the hostess, as well as the offer she made and the oddly placed champagnes. I did not get the name of the manager, however she is the woman with the tattoos that I assume most every other negative review on yelp is about. She, like the hostess earlier, quickly became very defensive and rude. She mentioned that she would be willing to help us more, however she felt we were very negative. This situation with the manager was the strangest interaction I have ever had with anyone in a service position. She continued to school us, in front of the rest of the restaurant, on our attitude. She then banned us from ever returning to the resturant. During this mind wrecking event, I mentioned to the manager that this was just bizarre. That was my interaction with the manager, and that got me banned. That was it. No yelling, no foul language, nothing. My partner left the restaurant during this interaction without saying a word due to the absurdness of how we were being treated. It is sad that a beautiful restaurant with great food, and at least one great server, is doing the easiest thing to do right (the hiring of a good hostess and a service oriented manager) horribly wrong. Treat your customers well and they will spread the word about your great food. Treat them like this and you don't have to ban them because they will never return and they will spread the word about the horrible customer service. The owners really need to rethink their staffing and read the reviews on yelp. That manager is a Grimm Reaper in your restaurant, killing off your customers 4 at a time.
Have a sign that all races, genders and religions are welcome and then blast misogynistic rap music. Uhh...what the actual f*ck?? They are confused here.
Simply not that good.
Loud, crowded, overpriced and trying too hard to be cool.

Yet another over-hyped and over-priced restaurant from a Seattle "serial" restauranteur (why does one chef need so many restaurants???). The food is OK, but is neither worth the wait nor the over-the-top accolades.
I'm sure its good if you could actually get in - two to three hour waits. Maybe they could take reservations? That would be good.

With the Union Oyster House and the Grand Central Oyster Bar his normal stomping grounds, and gout just being something you live with in order to keep eating raw shellfish, I would consider my father a bit of an oyster expert. Some pretentious PNW restaurants no longer stoop so low as to serve cocktail sauce to accompany our pearls of the sea, but if a 70 year old man who has eaten more oysters then your entire wait and cook staff combined asks for some cocktail sauce, I don't care if you have to high tail it all the way up to Kings to steal some ketchup, but you should make it happen. And please save the lecture about the "right" way to eat a PNW oyster, being so "delicate" it requires only the most minimalist of accompaniment. Each trip my father makes out here from the last great seafood mecca of New England, I try to show him just how great the shellfish is in the PNW. Instead, you showed how out of control the snobby foodie culture has become in Seattle. While riding the great Ballard Ave bandwagon to success, you have forgotten you table manners. Respecting your elders falls much higher on the food chain than oysters.

As long time patrons of the Boat Street Café (we go back to when you were intimately located on Boat Street), my wife with our friends looked forward with full anticipation to wonderful dining experience last evening at The Walrus and the Carpenter - sadly we were disappointed. While we appreciate the need for table turns, Joe our waiter seemed distant, uninformed on the cuisine and clearly was pushing the course rate to free up the table ("Please don't take our plates yet."). Our primary culinary disappointments were resident with the overcooked grilled sardines, the undercooked (virtually raw and dripping with fat ) pork belly and bland cheese course (served with oiled (?) walnuts and celery slices) - we did send the pork belly back and our waiter and the kitchen staff agreed with our assessment. Our waiter did provide a free dessert course in consideration for the undercooked pork belly. On a positive culinary note the shigoku oysters, snow creek oysters and green olives were wonderful. All restaurants have off nights for service and cuisine, possibly this was so for The Walrus and the Carpenter.
Nice place i like to visit there . Really recommend good service yes sure .... Recommend again

Visiting from out of town I wanted to have as much seafood and oysters as possible while in Seattle. We tried all of the oysters and most of the seafood items on the menu. I had hoped to try some creamy oysters from Puget Sound, so I was a bit disappointed to find rather briny ones. We liked most of the other seafood dishes, including the crudo's, fried oysters, and the clams. We did not enjoy the sardines with walnuts, however. I thought the walnuts overpowered everything and the sardines didn't taste different from canned ones.The service was excellent and I am glad to have tried this restaurant, but I would not particularly recommend it as a special place to visit.
Not a great variety of food at all. Some things looked like they had been sitting out for a long time. Don't know what was up with the staff they working is slow. Expensive price.
Make sure to get there on time if you plan to go their happy hour, the first hour is 50% off and second hour is 25% off. Don't want to wait too long to miss the deal
Great food, but the service took away from the experience.

Food is spectacular and the oyster selection is unbeatable. I like the unusual side dish selections as well (radishes with cold unsalted butter - who would have thought!) However, I can't give this a top review for two reasons: 1. the prices were pretty steep. 2. the wait was unbelievable. However, the food is good enough that it's probably worth both the cost and the wait. Better solution: go on a weeknight!
love the vibe and the good food. i come back often
nice food, nice menue, nice ppl. the 16% charge is not necessary
The food is good, the wait isnot. The ambiance is good but the crowds are not. Why, oh why, won't you take reservations?!?
Upbeat and friendly, the food is also just out of this world. Prices are fair, and the patio is a great touch. I'll be back asap!

Absolutely delicious food and excellent service. You can't go wrong with the fried oysters. A definite must try, you won't be disappointed. Having never really rated raw oysters before I didn't know if I would like them, but once again I was wrong. The oysters were the star of the meal. We tried the halibut carpaccio tonight. It was light with spices that enhanced the natural flavors of the halibut. he staff were all courteous helpful and extremely nice you almost feel like you're part of the family. I will def come back here to try more!
Love the place. Enjoying a glass of fresh cocktail and some handcrafted small plates.
Delicious oysters, clams, sardines, etc. Great bottle of wine. None of which is a cheap date. A little hard to find and small so it can be crowded with a wait.
Great food and very friendly service.

The food here was really great.  If you like quality seafood and are willing to pay the price for it and willing to wait a little while for it, then give this a try. I will say that I can't give it the full 5 stars because it's on the expensive side and the atmosphere can be so crowded that it takes away from the experience and causes a bit of wait time. Staff was also very nice and drinks were made well.

What a joy to eat! Every clam was open and I found no grit in any single one. The clams were small, but tender and the broth was savory until every last drop. I finished it off with the complimentary sourdough bread.

Nice place if you can get a table! I've only successfully been here twice as they don't take reservations and it's sometimes a 90min wait. It can be a little frustrating. That said, the food is spectacular! The oysters are so fresh, and the waitstaff are super knowledgeable about all the varieties. Good variety of small plates too!
oysters are awesome. love the steak tare tare. usually get lucky without a wait but otherwise come early
so-so

A friend and I ate here during the last Restaurant Week and enjoyed a wonderful Prix Fix meal. The petite filet steak, theThe Walrus and the Carpenter potatoes, the cauliflower, the breads, the dessert everything we had was perfect! The service was excellent, and the atmosphere of wonderful, old elegance made us feel so special. We just honestly couldn't find anything bad to say.
A great place to eat and loved the atmosphere. You must definitely try this place out
Ok place, but seems like a place frequented by old, bald, fat white guys who think they are black. Very Strange.
Good food, drinks are a little pricy, but overall a very good experience, enjoyed the ambiance!!
We enjoyed our anniversary here and especially the steak tartare.
Always a bit of a wait, but well worth it. Just plan ahead. Oysters...best in the area.
Two words: Fried Oysters
Good food, good atmosphere...long wait.
Just visited this gem in Ballard for the first time on Saturday night and I know I'll be back as often as I can! Try the halibut - you wont' regret it!
Get there early for happy hour. Those tables fill up fast.
great food i love this place!
Great service and tasty oysters!
Awesome oysters! Get the steak tartare and scallop tartare :)
All around very nice. Oysters and sardines were wonderful?

This is one the best places in all of Seattle to have food and drinks the only problem is you better get there early because if you don't you might be an hour or two. I find that the service is always good and the place fills up quickly so if you are on a short time span don't try to go unless you have a few hours. The oysters are always so fresh and taste that I can't get enough of them when I'm drinking. One of there best kept secrets are the desserts you can't go wrong with any of them because I have had them all.
Great Oysters both raw and fried.
Been here a few times since they opened. Go for the oysters and booze. That's about all you need to know.

we started with a half dozen oysters. 2 each of the 3 smaller kinds: hama hama, kumamoto, kusshi. really good. horseradish is awesome.i'm not a foodie, but i play one when i'm on here rating these cool places like this. more on why i call this a 'cool place' at the end. looking back at what we had, we had a lot of dishes: anchovy tartine, bread pudding, lev, pamplemousse, salmon tartare, sauteed baby turnips, and speck. it was a couple of weeks ago...the ones that stand out the most for me at this point are the anchovy tartine and speck and the oysters and the bread pudding. i'm not a dessert guy typically. so the semi-sweet bread pudding was perfect for me. very, very tasty!we sat at the bar, and it's pretty entertaining to watch the cooks and the service from the bartender was good. it's one big room. well lit. high ceiling.so about my 'cool place' statement. they don't take reservations. so you have to go and put your name down on the list and take your chances. it could be a while. so being a very busy weekend night i figured i would try to game the system a bit.;.. i budgeted enough time to be able to drive there, put my name down on the list, go pick up my date, then arrive back by the time my name was ready to be called. i told the host that that was my plan and he was cool with it. he agreed that the amount of time that would pass between putting my name down and returning *might* be just right. but no guarantees. i was already pretty hungry on my first drive over and didn't want to get stuck waiting forever to get seated, so there would be a dual benefit: i don't get annoyed at our wait. she don't get annoyed at our wait. my plan worked pretty well. our wait wasn't too long and there was a serendipitous side benefit: the place has no designated parking AND it's harder to find than usual. Even though I had never been there, I totally knew exactly where to go!I guess I could explain how the place is situated, but that would ruin your fun of having to find this place when you decide to go...

Rocked the happy hour here the other day. 50% off oysters before 5. 25% off from 5-6. $1 off beer. There maybe other specials, but given that all I consumed was beer and oysters, I wouldn't know. If I'm lucky, Kumamoto oysters are on the menu. Those are my favorite. Fortunately, they get them pretty often. My only jib is that they would have a cocktail sauce to go with the oysters. They only provide a vinegar-based sauce and horseradish.I've recently tried their geoduck crudo and their fried brussel sprouts. I'd recommend both. Couldn't get enough. I really like bringing people here. It makes you seem like you're really in the know if you take them down the long hall way. Sure, if you come around from the backside it's right there. But come on! You're a Yelper. You are already in the know.

I really like this place, have been twice and the servers haven't made me crazy enough not to consider going again - close but not quite. The super cool zinc topped bar looks into the kitchen where hopefully the staff will start to be a little more interactive = take lessons from Harvest Vine. I like the lightness of the place, an interesting twist on a place in the back of a building, and it feels like you might smell the ocean from there because of it. Cool.
Welcome to Ballard. Finally more seafood in Ballard - just like old times - and good design to boot. I am liking it.
Excellent food and service. The food was delicious and great choices. Wait time was reasonable.

If you have NEVER experienced fresh oysters I would definitely EAT HERE! I would highly recommend making a reservation. This place is incredibly popular. A fantastic variety of fresh oysters My boyfriend and I had never had fresh ones like these. Honestly, we didn't know much about how many different kinds and flavors oysters can have! The menu has all the names of the different types and it can be daunting if you have little knowledge of oysters However, our server directed us to try her favorites and educated us about the sweet vs. brine-y.Every oyster we tried was shucked fresh and had been delivered that same day. The owners of the restaurant are very involved and hand pick different oysters on a daily basis! So, it is very likely there will be a different menu selection each time you visit!Atmosphere was super fun! All the tables are very close together and really made the dinner experience unique. One of my favorite items was the bread and butter ! The butter was so delicious with large rock salt in it! Highly recommended!!!

Wow wow wow. This oyster bar is top tier. They do not take reservations but we had no problem waiting with some drinks at The Barnacle while a table opened up! The food is decadent, the drinks are drool worthy, and the service is superb. This is a date night MUST if you're in Fremont!
Portions very small, but good.The sardines were out of this world and so surprisingly good.

The perfect happy hour spot. Delicious cocktails, tasty oysters, amazing steak tartare, and perfect grilled sardines. The best part though: the olive oil they used for the marinated olives and the sardines. I have never In my life tasted a more fragrant or delicious one.

Om! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!

We tried all of the oysters and they were all delicious! It was so fresh and the vinegar sauce that came with it compliment it really well. It is very strong so I would recommend dipping it with your fork to taste with the oysters before pouring it right on. I think it goes really well with the after taste of the oysters. So after swallowing the oysters will I get a taste of the vinegar. The baywater sweet was my favorite! Although it was the briniest on our menu, I thought it was a mild briny with a sweet aftertaste. You can't go wrong with any of the oysters though! We also ordered the clams and they were also delicious. Cooked perfectly, sweet, in a savory sauce. Service and staff were very friendly and prompt.

Every single course was exceptionally good- with a lot of flavour! The food portion size is a perfect balance. The atmosphere is also very peaceful n tranquil. Waiters can get overwhelming easily so you need to get their attention.Otherwise a lovely menu that is forever expanding. Go early as there sometimes can be a queue. Had the most amazing experience here! Everything from the service to the food was perfect from start to finish.
Consistently amazing food and service!

Oysters! If you love eating simple with a farm to table flare you will love eating here!! We love coming here for the variety of oysters offered and the presentation when they are served makes ordering around a must. The salads in the summer using both vegetables and fruits create pairings that you are not sure about until you enjoy that very first bite. Get there early cause there is a wait but everything about this place makes it worth it.
Even more delicious than expected! The menu items were so unique and tasty sounding I wanted to try everything on the menu!
Excellent service and tartare and oysters were great! I have never had a bad experience!
Really great place! Tartar is amazing.
Simply one of the best meals of my life.

The Walrus and the Carpenter is definitely a cool place to visit. We enjoyed everything we ordered of the items we ordered. Oysters were very fresh and tasted great. The scallops were perfectly cooked and well seasoned. And the drinks were very good.It was a challenge to get a reservation since this place is very busy and we had small children with us with is probably not the best idea as this is more of a tapas bar than a restaurant. I would recommend making the reservations in advance and not bringing small children if you can avoid it as this place isn't the best environment for children, at least in my opinion, but great for adults looking for good food and great drinks.I'll definitely be back.
Bar is so awesome for your long wait which will be well worth it!

The food and service is great here, the only gripe I had was having to wait for a seat, but totally worth it. The fried oysters, clam and steak tartare were probably the best of the many dishes we had. The food was reasonably priced for what it was. I would definitely come back and would try their happy hour.

One of my favorites in Ballard and worth the drive no matter where you are. I don't know how many dozens of oysters on the half shell we've had here over the years but it would probably be several hundred. A perfect place for a glass of wine and nibbles on sunny days after walking the streets in Ballard and I cannot recommend highly enough.A must do in Seattle and is always a hit with visiting guests.

Unique and awesome! It sort of reminds me of an old diner but is very modern and classy. This is a great spot for oysters and the staff are incredibly knowledgable on the food and cocktails. If you need a spot to impress a date this one will do the trick!
Worth the wait.The oyster selection is incredible... everything from sweet to briny! Don't forget to try the steak tartare or the smoked mackerel salad. Delish
Great experience! Service is top notch! Our meal was amazing! I highly recommend this location!
everything I've had has been very tasty and very well done
great oysters!
The food here is amazing, and the atmosphere is really great. Love the hip hop!

Heard the wait for this place was hours but worth it. Since they don't take reservations I made the drive over from the Eastside with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night. Arrived a little before 8pm and got a table right away. Very close seating but I cared about the food AND IT DIDN'T DISAPPOINT! Loved the endive salad! Best beef tartare I've ever had! And the bread and butter were totally worth the add on price. Oh and AMAZING OYSTERS!! (no surprise!) So glad I made it to this Seattle favorite! The bars within the building look darling too so if I go on a weekend I think the wait will be a fun one.
Superb! Must check out this great seafood place in Seattle.
Best oysters on the planet. Fabulous!
Soooooo delicious!!! Visiting from Denver and had such an amazing meal. Wonderful wait staff, and great food. The hype is true!
Educate yourself and eat tons of oysters!
We plan to eat here at least once a season. Simply the best!

With out a doubt, this is one of the best restaurants in Seattle. Arrive long before you intend to eat. They don't take reservations, but will put down your number and call when your table is open. They like to scare newbies away by saying it will take 2+ hours for a table. Usually it's much faster. The oysters are top notch. But the small plates are what set them apart from your standard oyster house. I have yet to have a bad dish. The food is creative, fresh and different.
Definitely a family favorite for good eats and fresh seafood! But the bread pudding for dessert is a DO-NOT-MISS!
Took forever to finally eat here but it was well with the wait. The Tatar (sp?) was amazing. One of the best meals I have ever had. Wish it wasn't so pricey or else I would eat here weekly!
Great food, great service, great vibes!!!
I ordered more oysters for dessert. Nuff said :-)

Definitely the place to go for amazing oysters in Seattle. We had such an awesome experience we just had to go back the next day! The atmosphere is bustling and lively. I really liked the open kitchen where you can see the staff at work. My water glass was always full and the service was excellent. We got there early thinking we'd beat the wait, but everyone else had the same idea. The nice thing is there is a great bar next door that serves nice wines and appetizers while you wait.The waitress at the Walrus and the Carpenter made great suggestions for wine and was one of the most knowledgeable people about wine that I've come across. We ordered the scallop tartare, olives, Dinah's cheese, cabbage salad, dried trout, sardines, and octopus. For dessert we had the bread pudding. My recommendations are the oysters, the sardines, and the padron peppers. The cabbage salad was excellent with the sardines. Check it out! You won't be disappointed.
there isn't enough good words to describe this place I had one of the best meals of my life there and its kinda cool that you can see right into the restaurant next door

I saw this place on Anthony Bordain's show "The Layover" when he filmed in Seattle. Hands down the best oysters I've ever had. If you are an oyster nut like I am, you have to try this place. However be prepared, it's a bit pricey. However, well worth it!
