I don't give five stars TOO often, so when I do you must know I mean it. I talk about The Walrus and the Carpenter to anyone who will listen. I've encouraged all of my fellow New Yorkers to go to Seattle simply for this restaurant, which is located in the Ballard neighborhood but could easily be mistaken for parts of hipster and "it"-scene Brooklyn.The local west coast oysters were shucked perfectly and were the freshest I've ever had. But I knew I was going to get good oysters, so I was equally thrilled by the other dishes and drinks on the menu. You can't go wrong with shishito peppers if they're on the menu toward the end of summer. And if you see the fennel salad on the menu, too, be sure to order it. I've been trying to recreate it in my own home for nearly a year now. Finally, save room for dessert. Fresh blueberry panna cotta melted in my mouth and was the perfect ending to a fantastic meal.
Love this place. Great drinks, oysters, and professional waitstaff!
yep. amazing. get here. 'nuff said.

I would gladly say this is one of my favorite restuarants in the entire world! I am so glad Seattle is finally freaking embracing raw seafood, fresh oysters, and fresh flavors. MOUTH GAZM! It helps, too, that the staff is friendly and the drinks are tasty. We have been there probably 6 or 7 times now, once with the kids, and even they dug the food. Innovative, fresh, and delicous. But, please dont go, I want to keep this secret all to myself!

While searching for a happy hour spot to go with my boyfriend, I kept entertaining the idea of The Walrus and the Carpenter. The two of us have never been self-proclaimed oyster connoisseurs, but we do have an affinity for all forms of seafood and shellfish, so we decided to give it a try. The location is hidden within Ballard, and while I don't think I'd want to be walking around there solo at night, the isolation does add to the charm. Lucky for us, we arrived around 5:30pm on a Tuesday (thirty minutes before happy hour ended) and only had to wait for five minutes. Still, it was surprisingly crowded. We ended up sitting at the bar, which I highly recommend if you're just casually going with a friend or date. As you can probably see from all the photos, the interior is intimate, yet bright and lively. Sitting at the bar truly added to this experience. I will admit, that type of dining environment isn't for everyone, and it isn't for every type of occasion, but for a post-work happy hour, it was perfectly light-hearted. My date & I decided to share a variety of plates: we started off with two of each oyster (one for each of us). As we were still there for happy hour, the oysters were less expensive (I believe 20% off, coming in around $1.50 per oyster). The oysters were tasty, but honestly, I probably don't know a superb oyster from a really good one. Those fried oysters, however, were to die for. You must order the fried oysters. The bartender suggested a Muscadet to pair with our meal, which ended up being a perfect addition; we ordered a pichet (about 55% of a bottle) that was happy hour priced. A lot of people have voted against ordering bread, but I'd actually suggest getting it. No, it isn't anything incredible, but it broke up our meal well and was used for soaking up the excess aioli from our fried oysters.
I love me some oysters & a great atmosphere!
2nd review ever!!!  This place is incredible!!!
really great. i literally wondered aloud how food could taste this good.
I loved my date here. My only complaint is that calling ahead an hour got us a 2 hour wait. But if you love French wine and local oysters,  cheeses this is a great spot.Albert
Memorable and downright awesome.

I try not to give five star reviews- I really do. To give a five star review is saying that the place couldn't do anything better. Everything was perfect. Period. That's damn near impossible to do! And yet, dammit, here I am doing just that.On several occasions- not just once- the place has nailed it across the board. Service, beverages, and the oysters- oh the oysters! Without a doubt the best selection and quality in the city.I do hope that someday they will be allowed to wipe out the parking lot that their patio sits in- wait! There IS room for improvement!- but other than that, I look forward to my next visit. You should too!
We basically ordered everything on the menu and it was delicious!
So yummy! Can't wait to go back. Great decor. Friendly staff.

Long overdue review.....It was a bit tricky to spot at first, but I am not giving less stars because of that. Sometimes the gems are hidden, and I'd have no problem climbing a broken ladder to eat here again (or maybe just to have a late cocktail.) The staff is professional and attentive. I wish I remembered our server's name. :( My friend and I ate here months ago and we really enjoyed ourselves. The oysters, the small plates, the cocktails, and dessert were all fantastic to say the least. My favorite dish was the pork crepinette with romesco (recommended by a friend) and of course the Oysters! They had Fernet so I was pleased! The open kitchen gives a homey vibe, and the intimate ambiance feels pretty dang good...not to mention, it's beautifully designed...simple and elegant. It's one of my new favorite spots in Seattle.

I hands down love this Oyster Bar in Ballard. We have not had oysters that fresh in a long time except maybe at the Brooklyn oyster bar downtown. My favorite oyster was a Pacific larger size that began with a T. We where able to get a seat up @ the bar to watch the clever shuckers and bartenders mixing up the love we where about to devour. Cool Decor.We can not wait to go back soon. Wonder if they will ever offer a oyster wine/stout/ or vodka "flight" in the near future? I am a big FAN of the Flight pairings but will just have to keep checking back in the meantime. We look forward to hanging out on the the deck out back with a group of our oyster loving friends to sample everything. everything on the menu.

Oysters, incredible food, cocktails, mustaches. What more does a man need? Service is impeccable. Fried oysters, smoked trout, mussels, and chantrelles were out of this world. Effingham oysters on the half-shell were expertly shucked and served with a ludicrous champagne mignonette and horseradish. All around a great experience. Can't wait to go back
